chapters.title: Chapter 1: Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, Heart of Woods Pet Beast Breeding Base!
chapters.content:
Chapter 1 - 1: Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, Heart of Woods Pet Beast Breeding Base!
Linzhou City.
The bus traveled down the road, with Su Ping sitting by the window, gazing out at the familiar yet magical world unfolding before him.
Having been in this world for so many years, Su Ping had adapted to it.
It was a world where humans and Pet Beasts coexisted, with a structure somewhat similar to the one before he crossed over.
However, in addition to the realms of humans, there were also wildernesses and domains occupied by Ferocious Beasts, serving as forbidden zones for humans.
And humans, upon reaching the age of 18, could undergo the awakening of a Beast Tamer.
They could awaken their Beast Taming Space as well as their innate Talent.
Then contract Pet Beasts and become Beast Tamers.
A month had passed since he had graduated from high school and completed the awakening.
And now, he was already considered a prospective Beast Tamer, with his own Beast Taming Space and Talent.
Thinking of this, Su Ping's view seemed to double, and his Talent along with that cramped, claustrophobic Beast Taming Space entered his perception.
[Pet Beast Home: The Beast Taming Space can take in uncontracted wild Pet Beasts, but their Level must not exceed one's own.]
A very ordinary Talent, though uncommon, its effect was also average.
But something else quickly appeared before Su Ping's eyes.
Compared to the seemingly lackluster Talent of Pet Beast Home, this other thing that emerged from his consciousness was what Su Ping had always been curious about.
This had also appeared in his mind after completing his awakening a month ago:
[Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas: Transformed from the world's Origin, a Catalog that can accommodate all Pet Beast forms. Illuminating, replenishing, and perfecting the Catalog will grant rewards from the world's Origin feedback!]
(Note: Only Pet Beasts that meet the conditions can be included in the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas.)
(Note: Pet Beasts have corresponding Evolutionary Bodies. The higher the quality of the pet and the more Pet Beasts there are, the faster the Catalog can be replenished and perfected.)
With a thought, Su Ping directly opened the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas.
Within this Catalog, all kinds of Pet Beasts were listed, but the Catalog was gray and white, obviously unlit. However, he had waited for a month already, and now he was in no hurry.
With that thought, Su Ping looked expectantly out the bus window.
As one of the few first-tier cities in the country, although it couldn't compare with the Magic Capital and the Imperial Capital, Linzhou City was bustling with activity.
Most importantly, it had a huge natural forest park, the Lingxi River, West Dragon Lake, and other places with abundant resources of wild Pet Beasts.
Even some Pet Beasts were unique to Linzhou.
And here in the suburbs, relatively secluded and quiet, a sign soon came into Su Ping's view:
'Heart of Woods Pet Beast Breeding Base'
"Passengers, please note that the Lingxi River station is approaching. Passengers getting off here, please prepare to disembark."
Listening to the bus stop announcement, Su Ping quickly stood up, walked down from the bus, and came before the grand estate.
Su Ping shook his head and sighed.
What a pity!
What a pity it was a world dominated by Controlling Beasts. Otherwise, with such a large piece of land on the outskirts of his city, if it were priced as in his previous life, such a big Pet Beast Breeding Base in Linzhou City could have allowed him to live comfortably for a lifetime.
In this world, all industries related to Controlling Beasts were the most important and expensive.
Of course, even now it wasn't bad. As long as one didn't touch those Advanced Level Controlling Beasts and resources, one could still live without worry about food and clothing.
But having come to this world, if he didn't experience its wonders, how could Su Ping be content?
With that thought, Su Ping took out his phone again and opened up the message left by his father, Su Anyong:
"Son, you've come of age now, and you've awakened your Talent to become a qualified prospective Beast Tamer. Since that's true, I can safely pass on the mantle to you!
Come back, come back to Heart of Woods, and together let's make it the best Forest Wolf breeding base in Jianghai Province, or even the whole country!"
So, Su Ping returned.
It's not that he fully believed his father's words. Mainly, he was interested in exploring his own Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas.
Over the month, he had encountered many Pet Beasts in Linzhou City, yet none met the requirements to be recorded in the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas to light up, complete, or perfect the Catalog.
In this world, becoming a Beast Tamer wasn't just about awakening your Talent or forming a contract with your first Pet Beast.
A true, qualified Beast Tamer had to be acknowledged by the Beast Master Association after participating in the triennial Beast Tamer assessment competition.
After graduation, talented Beast Tamer prospects could choose to continue their studies at higher education institutions or be invested in by some factions.
Of course, both of those paths were challenging.
And clearly, their family's breeding base was not among that list.
In fact, it was just a small-scale breeding base specializing in Forest Wolves.
It was somewhat noteworthy that, because of its location in the suburbs of Linzhou City, and because Su Ping's grandfather had indeed been prosperous—a Monarch Level Beast Tamer who had sacrificed himself to defend against Beast Tides—they had managed to hold on to this large breeding base and a sizeable rented plot nearby.
Shaking his head, Su Ping took out the key and unlocked the gate.
The breeding base was vast.
Beyond the several square kilometers of forest that provided a playground and rest area for the Forest Wolves, there were their living quarters, the constant temperature and humidity birthing rooms, testing labs, control rooms, Magic Potion workshops, medical rooms, and many other facilities that made up the estate.
Furthermore, at the back, the Lingxi River flowed by, originating from West Dragon Lake.
His father had always been clamoring to use such great resources to develop some Water Element Pet Beasts, but he'd forget all about it the next day.
Walking straight into the house, Su Ping gazed at the empty living room, and a vague, unpleasant premonition rose in his heart.
"Dad!"
"Su Anyong!"
"Where are you?!"
The empty living room echoed back Su Ping's voice.
Then, he approached the sofa and saw a piece of paper on the coffee table. Su Ping's mouth twitched rapidly as he quickly picked it up. Sure enough, the familiar handwriting of Su Anyong was clear:
"Son, your Second Granduncle mentioned introducing a stepmother to you. He wants me to go to Beihai City to check it out. You're an adult now, a real man!
So, it's time for you to take on the responsibilities at home. The future of Heart of Woods is in your hands! You grew up here; you should know how to operate things.
Don't worry about the rest. The feeder has enough food for the little ones for two months, and Old Sha is here to help you get settled during this time.
Oh, and you probably haven't formed a contract with your first Pet Beast, have you? I've been picky and have chosen one for you. It's in the hatching room.
Call me if there's anything, and as long as it's not about money, your dad will figure out a way for you. That's it.The latest_epɪ_sodes are on_the NoᴠᴇFɪre.nᴇt
—Loving father, Su Anyong."
Looking at the familiar handwriting, Su Ping was speechless.
Luckily, he had long since grown accustomed to his unreliable father's behavior.
Such a large breeding base, if he'd paid a bit more attention to it, wouldn't have ended up like this.
Nevertheless, Su Ping was quite intrigued. His unreliable father had actually remembered that he hadn't contracted his first Pet Beast! He wondered what kind of creature Su Anyong could have possibly picked out for him after such careful selection.
Moving quickly, Su Ping took only a couple of steps to reach the nearby constant temperature and humidity birthing and hatching room.
He looked at the little creature inside the box.

chapters.title: Chapter 2: The Mutant Poison Attribute Forest Wolf, Eye of Truth!
chapters.content:
Chapter 2 - 2: The Mutant Poison Attribute Forest Wolf, Eye of Truth!
This is a little wolf cub.
Su Ping wasn't surprised.
The Heart of Woods is mainly used for cultivating Forest Wolves.
However, Su Ping's brows quickly furrowed, as he could tell at a glance that this little wolf cub seemed to be no ordinary Forest Wolf.
Forest Wolves have the Racial Potential to reach the Elite Level.
On Blue Star, Pet Beasts, Beast Tamers, and resources are categorized as Ordinary, Elite, Commander, Monarch, Emperor, Saint, Legend, and Myth.
Moreover, each Pet Beast has corresponding Evolution methods and pathways that have been discovered by Beast Tamers.
Generally speaking, the Racial Potential detected in a Pet Beast before it evolves is its highest potential for natural growth.
In other words, without the means and resources to evolve a Pet Beast, the natural growth limit for a Forest Wolf would normally be the Elite Level.
But as the world is full of wonders, there are also some relatively rare occurrences, such as bloodline Mutation.
Generally, the fur of Forest Wolf cubs is mostly gray-yellow, only turning into a bluish-green color during the Growth Period or upon reaching adulthood.
But this little cub lying in the automatic feeder was completely different.
Its body was a lush green, and at first glance, it didn't even seem like a living creature, but more like a carving made of jade.
The round, pitch-black eyes looked at Su Ping, who was observing from outside the box, and made a WHINING sound.
Su Ping immediately felt amused and called his father right away.
"Hello, Su Ping? Are you back home?" came the hearty voice of his father, Su Anyong.
"Yeah, what's with this little wolf?"
Su Ping didn't bother to ask what his father was thinking, to just hand over the cultivation base to him like that. Nor did he care that his father had left without a word to find him a stepmother.
He was used to his father's ways all these years.Google seaʀᴄh NoᴠᴇFɪre.nᴇt
"HEH HEH, could I possibly cheat my own son? This little wolf has a mutated bloodline; its Wood Attribute bloodline has purified and gained a Poison Attribute. If it's trained this way, it might possess both Wood and Poison Attributes in the future. Someone offered twelve million, and I didn't sell. How could I? My good son has awakened as a Beast Tamer and needs his first Contracted Beast. How could a mere twelve million compare to a father's doting affection..."
Su Ping promptly hung up the phone, but his eyes had already lit up.
A Poison Attribute mutated Forest Wolf? This is indeed interesting.
While the Poison Attribute was not as rare and precious as those with Spirit, space, or time Attributes, it was still quite uncommon.
His father had actually been reliable for once!
Thinking this, Su Ping didn't hesitate. Most of his classmates from the same graduating class had already completed contracts with their first Contracted Beast; only he had still been indecisive.
The Forest Wolf was a creature he had been familiar with since he was young. A mutated Poison Attribute Forest Wolf was undoubtedly an excellent choice.
The Soul Contract slowly connected with the little wolf cub in front of him.
The cub, which was obviously just born not long ago, did not resist at all.
In less than ten minutes, Su Ping opened his eyes and looked at the little one in front of him.
At the same time, inside the incubator, through the glass cover, the little one also opened its eyes and looked at Su Ping.
The moment their gazes met, an indescribable sense of closeness seemed to emanate from deep within their souls.
A connection through a Soul Contract is the closest relationship possible.
And the moment Su Ping established the contract with the little wolf, its body visibly became a bit stronger.
This is the bond and connection between a Beast Tamer and their Pet Beast.
A Beast Tamer's spiritual power can feedback into the Pet Beast's improvement and growth; likewise, a Pet Beast's breakthrough and enhancement in Realm will also raise the Beast Tamer's Realm through the soul link.
The two are truly complementary to one another.
Su Ping reached out and took the little wolf from the constant temperature box. Its emerald green body was incredibly soft, yet it lacked the warmth of living creatures, feeling somewhat cool instead.
"Seeing as you're like this all over, let's call you Xiao Qing."
Su Ping was never good at naming. His Pet Beasts were unique to him, so whatever name they were given was just an identifier. Clearly, the little wolf in his arms was indifferent to its name, opening its milky-scented mouth as if to respond to Su Ping:
"AWOOO... WHIMPER WHIMPER WHIMPER..."
This call of the bloodline was slightly strange due to its undeveloped vocalization.
Su Ping smiled faintly.
However, at that moment, he suddenly paused.
In his mind, the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, which had not changed since his previous awakening, slowly opened without his control.
With the rustling sound of flipping pages, it quickly locked onto a particular image!
The creature in this picture was none other than an adult, a perfectly standard Forest Wolf.
At the same time, on the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, a line of text appeared before Su Ping's eyes.
[Catalog 'Forest Wolf' illuminated, current Catalog Level: 1, Origin Reward acquired: Eye of Truth]
[Eye of Truth (Beast Tamer Ability): Allows the user to see the specific Level, Skills, and Race of Pet Beasts and Ferocious Beasts through spiritual power.]
Huh?!
Su Ping hadn't even had time to react when he felt a surge of information being directly poured into his mind from the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas.
The next moment, Su Ping saw a line of text appear on Xiao Qing in his arms:
[Variant Forest Wolf (Contracted)]
[Attribute: Wood, Poison]
[Current Level: Ordinary First Rank]
[Racial Potential: Elite Tenth Stage]
[Skills: Sunlight Absorption (Beginner)]
Eye of Truth?
Isn't this one of the Talents that can be awakened after a Beast Tamer's awakening?
But the problem is, each Beast Tamer only has this one opportunity to awaken their inherent Talented Ability, right?
Isn't my Talent 'Pet Beast Home'?
Su Ping was not surprised by the illumination of the Forest Wolf in the Catalog due to the contract, but the reward for this illumination left him completely stunned.
Although it was true that the Eye of Truth wasn't considered an earth-shattering Beast Tamer Talent, in fact, Eye of Truth, alongside Telepathic Communication and Rapid Recovery, was one of the three most common Beast Tamer Talents, accounting for nearly fifty percent of all Talents.
But no matter how common, this was still given for free!
Beast Tamer Talents—these were genuine Abilities with no other means of acquisition.
Su Ping originally imagined that the rewards from the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas would at most be some special resources, possibly some special Pet Beast Evolution schemes, or other things.
But he truly did not expect that this first illuminated reward would bring him such a big surprise.
With that thought, Su Ping, while stroking Xiao Qing in his arms, couldn't wait to look at the illuminated 'Forest Wolf' entry in the Catalog.

chapters.title: Chapter 3 Forest Wolf Catalog, Magic Potion: ’Heart of Woods
chapters.content:
Chapter 3 - 3 Forest Wolf Catalog, Magic Potion: 'Heart of Woods
As Su Ping's gaze focused, the only illuminated pattern on the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas slowly enlarged, appearing before his eyes.
[Catalog: Forest Wolf]
[A wolf tribe proficient in using Wood Attributes, with extremely strong Life Force. An average adult Forest Wolf is of Elite Level, with Skills such as Sunlight Absorption, Vine Strangling, Self-Healing, and Accelerated Growth.]
[Current Catalog Level: 1 (300/500)]
Known Evolutionary Atlas, special cultivation:
[Not discovered yet]
Preferences, habits:
[Enjoys basking in the sun, playing in the woods, moving in groups, and has stronger combat ability in daylight or within forests.]
Record log:
[Encountered and made contact with a Forest Wolf of a Poison Attribute mutation lineage; intimacy met the requirements. Catalog Experience +300!]
[This Forest Wolf is a special mutant. For every day spent with it, Catalog Experience +5! Each day of companionship offers a certain chance of discovering the reasons for the bloodline mutation. Alternatively, a large amount of this Catalog's Experience can be consumed to analyze the mutation reason.]
[Daily, Catalog Experience can be gained based on the number of interactions with such creatures and their level. It can also be gained by enhancing the biological abilities of creatures that meet the intimacy standard, thereby perfecting the Catalog and upgrading its level.]
Looking at the Catalog of the Forest Wolf, which had analyzed it quite thoroughly, Su Ping blinked once more.
This Catalog can actually be upgraded.
And there are rewards for each upgrade?
Thinking of the Eye of Truth he had just discovered, Su Ping's eyes lit up.
It was clear in the Catalog's records that the more you interact with the creatures in the Catalog, and the higher their quality, the more Catalog Experience you obtain.
It's just unknown whether this interaction will count if they are not one's Contracted Beasts.
Moreover, the unlocking of the Forest Wolf Catalog happened after he established a Soul Contract with Xiao Qing.
Could it be that to illuminate the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas with its numerous Pet Beast Catalogs, one must contract each one individually?
That's obviously impossible.
After all, a Beast Tamer's Contracted Beast slots are limited.
Each Beast Tamer only gained one Pet Beast slot per Great Realm breakthrough.
In other words, Su Ping could only contract a second Pet Beast once he broke through to the Elite Level himself.
However, upon scrutinizing the Catalog again carefully, especially the text in the last line of the record, Su Ping's gaze locked on.
Intimacy!
Indeed, in the half-month since my graduation from Linzhou City, I've come into contact with quite a few Pet Beasts.
None could light up the Catalog, and the reason must be this so-called intimacy!
This means that as long as I frequently accompany these Pet Beasts—even if they aren't my Contracted Beasts—they can be included in the Catalog and count towards its upgrade requirements, provided their intimacy is high enough.
With this realization, he finally recognized that the Pet Beast Breeding Base his unreliable father left him might actually have some value and use!
Immediately, the idea of going on an adventure was cast to the winds from Su Ping's mind.
Adventure? What joy could it hold compared to the delight of cultivation here?
Recalling his understanding of the Forest Wolf and the Heart of Wood Cultivation Base over the years, Su Ping was invigorated.
Cradling Xiao Qing, he returned to the living quarters and rummaged through Su Anyong's room. After a long search, he finally found what he wanted to see.
It was an ancient book with yellowed pages.
In this era, such ancient books were obviously rare. However, according to his father, it was the Su Family heirloom and the key reason why the Heart of Wood Cultivation Base had persisted until today.
Previously, his father had put on a show, refusing to let Su Ping see it until he had turned eighteen, awakened his Talent, and become a prospective Beast Tamer.
Now, this thing was tossed under a cabinet, evidently not treasured or carefully preserved.
The book title was quite lengthy:
"Forest Wolf Breeding and Training Manual with the 'Heart of Woods' Magic Potion Recipe"
The origin of their family's Pet Beast Breeding Base lay within this.
According to his dad, this was also his grandfather's lifelong research.
Magic Potions were concoctions made from various resources combined according to a recipe, and the vast majority were for Pet Beasts to consume.
'Heart of Woods' was clearly the same.
The effects of Magic Potions varied: some accelerated Pet Beasts' growth, some enhanced their Realm, others restored their energy, some caused them to evolve, and some enabled them to learn a certain Skill.
Among these types of Magic Potions, those that could induce Evolution in Pet Beasts were undoubtedly the most precious—no need to elaborate on that.
Beyond that were Magic Potions that enabled Pet Beasts to learn Skills.
And the 'Heart of Woods' Magic Potion recipe from this ancient book was just that.
'Heart of Woods' was a Skill. Although not a 'Super-Rank' Skill with mighty effects comparable to forbidden spells from games in his previous world, it was still quite remarkable.
On Blue Star, Pet Beast Skills were generally divided into ordinary Skills and Super-Rank Skills.
Although 'Heart of Woods' was an ordinary Skill, it was an extremely rare ability, sometimes even more useful than certain offensive Super-Rank Skills!
Its effect was actually quite simple: all Wood Attribute Skills of the Pet Beast were passively enhanced. When injured or its energy was depleted, it could actively absorb nutrients from trees and plants for Rapid Recovery.
This ability, combined with a Forest Wolf's Skills, was an unmatched treasure if used in battle in a forest or on the plains!
Across the entire Blue Star, not many Wood Element Pet Beasts naturally possessed the 'Heart of Woods' Skill.
Were it not for the fact that his family's 'Heart of Woods' Magic Potion recipe had an exceedingly low chance of successful awakening—with only a few successes over decades—and was exclusively for Forest Wolf use, this recipe alone, regardless of its monetary value, might have contended for the top prize at the Breeder Association's annual Breeder Research Competition, achieving nationwide fame!
However, since it was the family heirloom, Su Ping, having already decided to run his family's Pet Beast Breeding Base well, naturally had to master it.
He quickly skipped over the information about Forest Wolf breeding, which he was already familiar with, and carefully read the 'Heart of Woods' recipe.ᴜᴘᴅᴀᴛᴇ ꜰʀᴏᴍ No(ᴠ)ᴇlFire.nᴇt
'Raw materials: three sections of hollow willow branches, one Wood Spirit herb, three drops of hundred-herb juice, one nectar-absorbing bee stinger.'
'Production method: The hollow willow branches must be pounded by hand for 30 minutes over fire until they become crushed. Then, 100ml of clear water and one drop of the hundred-herb juice are added. Continue to pound by hand for another 30 minutes until it becomes paste-like. After that, add another drop of the hundred-herb juice and one Wood Spirit herb. Continue to pound by hand for another 30 minutes until it becomes a pulp. Then, add the nectar-absorbing bee stinger. Finally, pound it into a concentrated liquid before cooling for over six hours to form a jelly-like state. Only then is it considered successfully made.'
'Effect: After consumption by a Forest Wolf, there is approximately a one percent chance of learning the rare Skill: Heart of Woods, and a chance to raise the Pet Beast's Level.'
'The better the innate Talents of the Forest Wolf, the higher the success rate.'
After reviewing the 'Heart of Woods' recipe from beginning to end, Su Ping let out a sigh.
Damn, no wonder such a rare and precious Skill Magic Potion recipe has been well preserved by our family, yet nobody knows or seems to care about it.
It's bad enough that it's only for Forest Wolves, but this success rate is just too low, isn't it?
Instead of spending time researching and trying this, wouldn't it be much better to directly contract a Pet Beast with Commander-level or Monarch-level Racial Potential?
But it's still better than nothing, I suppose.
Shaking his head, Su Ping was just about to stand up when he was suddenly taken aback.
At this moment, the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas in his mind started flipping pages on its own, and the Forest Wolf Catalog appeared before his eyes.
Feedback from a Catalog entry then emerged in Su Ping's mind:
[Discovery of a 'Forest Wolf' special cultivation method: 'Heart of Woods' Magic Potion.]
[Detected that the 'Heart of Woods' Magic Potion recipe is in an incomplete state. Do you wish to spend 285 Forest Wolf Catalog Experience to perfect the 'Heart of Woods' Magic Potion recipe?]
Su Ping couldn't help but open his mouth wide, his eyes revealing an incredulous surge of elation.

chapters.title: Chapter 4: The Perfect Recipe! Forest Wolf Breaks Through Racial Limits
chapters.content:
Chapter 4 - 4: The Perfect Recipe! Forest Wolf Breaks Through Racial Limits
The Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas actually has this effect?!
Su Ping could hardly believe it! But even with a disposition tempered by two lifetimes, his palm, gripping the ancient tome, couldn't help but tremble slightly from the intensity of his excitement.
Perfect the Magic Potion recipe!
Su Ping didn't even need to think before he immediately confirmed his choice in the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas's prompt!
It was clear that the Experience Points for the Forest Wolf Catalog were also very important. And each time it leveled up, it would give Su Ping, the owner of the Catalog, rewards beyond his imagination. For instance, after activating it, the Beast Tamer Talented Ability: Eye of Truth, was granted. However, Catalog Experience could be earned by spending time with the Forest Wolf, nurturing it, evolving it, and even discovering mutant species like Xiao Qing.
However, the Heart of Woods, as the primary legacy of their family's cultivation base, had an impact on the Forest Wolf that was nothing short of revolutionary.
In an instant, Su Ping saw that the Forest Wolf Catalog, which had been mostly illuminated, dimmed considerably. The next moment, a blank entry below the Forest Wolf Catalog changed. It was the "Known Evolutionary Atlas, Special Cultivation" entry. Previously, this entry was blank, but now, an addition appeared:
["Heart of Woods" Magic Potion production: Upon consumption by a Forest Wolf, it can awaken the treasured Skill "Heart of Woods." The effects of other Level upgrades are unknown. The production method is as follows...]
Seeing the change appear in the Forest Wolf Catalog, Su Ping let out a long breath, his eyes shining radiantly, filled with anticipation and excitement.
Indeed! This time, the Forest Wolf Catalog's description of the Heart of Woods Magic Potion made no mention of the *chance* to awaken the Skill "Heart of Woods."
The implication was obvious.
However, what gave Su Ping a bit of a headache was the recipe perfected by the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas. A new ingredient had been added to the recipe.
It wasn't that this new ingredient was particularly expensive. Even though his old man was unreliable, their family's large cultivation base didn't require rent and had likely amassed some savings over the years. The primary source of these savings, however, wasn't from selling well-cultivated Forest Wolves for a high price. Instead, it was purely from renting out a large vacant lot connected to their cultivation base to their neighbor, the Yun Tian Pet Beast Combat Resort.
The reason Su Ping looked troubled was because of this one addition to the perfected recipe. Its name was 'Wolf Tobacco'. At first glance, it seemed related to the Forest Wolf, but in reality, there was no connection. This was purely because when lit, the plant produced a dense smoke, like a beacon fire, and the smell...
Ironically, this Wolf Tobacco was extremely abundant, growing wild all over the place in some areas. Often, Fire-type Pet Beasts or Beast Tamers would ignore the law and engage in Pet Beast battles in forests, igniting wildfires. For the firefighters from the Safety Bureau responsible for extinguishing those fires, the most critical task was to have their own Pet Beasts take precautions against this Wolf Tobacco. In the history of Dragon Nation, there had been many cases where Water-type Pet Beasts, particularly those extinguishing wildfires, were choked to death by the noxious fumes erupting from burning Wolf Tobacco.ʀᴇᴀᴅ ʟᴀᴛᴇsᴛ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs ᴀᴛ NovᴇlFirenᴇt
Thinking of this, Su Ping silently mourned the brave little Pet Beast heroes who died extinguishing forest fires and protecting wild Pet Beasts. He also condemned the Beast Tamers who carelessly used Fire-type Pet Beasts for battles in forests.
It was precisely because this Wolf Tobacco was largely useless, had a terribly pungent smell, and its smoke could easily cause hallucinations when burned that Wolf Tobacco had such a bad reputation. Moreover, no one had discovered any other uses for it—though, perhaps someone had and simply hadn't made it public. Therefore, Su Ping was somewhat skeptical about whether this Wolf Tobacco could truly perfect the Heart of Woods Magic Potion.
However, trusting his Golden Finger and the undeniably real Eye of Truth he now possessed, Su Ping chose to believe.
Full of anticipation, he arrived at the door of another building in the base.
The Magic Potion Workshop.
This place, within the entire Heart of Wood Cultivation Base, had the most surveillance. After all, the resources needed for Magic Potions were extremely precious, and the auxiliary equipment for their creation was incredibly valuable. This was also the place his father had strictly forbidden him from approaching before he came of age. But now...
However, just as he was about to step into the workshop, a huge shadow suddenly appeared behind him. Xiao Qing, nestled in his arms, immediately tensed.
Su Ping whipped his head around. The next moment, a massive dark shadow pounced, knocking him onto the soft grass. A warm, damp sensation immediately spread across his cheek.
Su Ping didn't know whether to laugh or cry. He looked at the massive, cyan-blue wolf sprawled on top of him, enthusiastically licking his face to show affection, and quickly said, "Alright, alright..."
Struggling to his feet, Su Ping wiped the drool from his face. He then fondly stroked the soft fur under the chin of the giant wolf—who was nearly as tall as he was—and asked, "Old Sha, have there been any problems these past two days while Dad's been away? Are the little ones alright?"
"AWOOO..."
The giant Forest Wolf named Old Sha shook his head.
Old Sha was a Forest Wolf raised by Su Ping's grandfather and, strictly speaking, was of the same generation as his father. Although Old Sha hadn't formed a Soul Contract with his grandfather or father, over the years, he had become the Su Family's closest kin.
As a Pet Beast's strength increased, so did its intelligence. Old Sha was clearly no exception. He was the only Forest Wolf in the Heart of Wood Cultivation Base that had broken through his race limit and reached the Commander Level. He was also, over many years, the sole Wolf King of the Forest Wolves in the Heart of Wood Cultivation Base. With Old Sha around, the mischievous and lazy Forest Wolves would behave and listen obediently. This was the main reason Su Anyong had been able to save money by not hiring others for help, managing everything himself all these years.
Looking at Old Sha before him, Su Ping activated his Eye of Truth. Old Sha could sense Su Ping using an ability on him but didn't resist at all. It was precisely this trust that allowed Su Ping to see some of Old Sha's Abilities:
[Forest Wolf (Wild)]
[Current Level: Commander First Stage]
[Racial Potential: Elite Tenth Stage]
[Skills: Sunlight Absorption (Perfection), Vine Strangling (Proficient), Self-Healing (Proficiency), Accelerated Growth (Proficient), Wolf King Majesty (Beginner)]
Old Sha's panel was relatively normal. His Skill training levels were standard, except for Sunlight Absorption, which had astonishingly reached the Perfection Level. Clearly, Old Sha's ability to break through his race limit was related to this Perfection-Level Sunlight Absorption and his status as Wolf King. He must have had his own fortuitous encounters in his early years.
However, before Su Ping could dwell on it further, a new message appeared in the log of the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas's Forest Wolf Catalog:
[Discovered and interacted with a Forest Wolf that has surpassed its Racial Potential limit. Affinity requirements met. Catalog Level Experience +100!]
[This Forest Wolf is a powerful individual. For each subsequent day spent with it, Forest Wolf Catalog Experience +2!]
Su Ping was startled, then a smile touched his lips.
Indeed, returning to Heart of Woods to inherit the family business was an absolutely correct decision.

chapters.title: Chapter 5: Making Magic Potion, Yun Tian Pet Beast Resort
chapters.content:
Chapter 5 - 5: Making Magic Potion, Yun Tian Pet Beast Resort
Old Sha did not stop Su Ping from entering the Magic Potion Workshop.
When Su Anyong left, he had told him that from now on, this Heart of Woods Pet Beast Breeding Base would be under the command of this little master.
Old Sha, having watched Su Ping grow up, was the elder who doted on him the most.
The Magic Potion Workshop could be said to be the cleanest place in the entire estate, with spotless white walls, floors, and ceilings.
However, the smell of disinfectant in the air made him frown. Xiao Qing, perched on his shoulder and clinging to his collar, also sneezed several times due to the irritating smell.
After gently rubbing the somewhat uncomfortable Xiao Qing, Su Ping finally placed Xiao Qing into his own Beast Taming Space.
Inside the Beast Taming Space, a Beast Tamer's spiritual power provided comfort. This allowed a Pet Beast to remain in a comfortable state at all times and also accelerated its energy and injury recovery.
After all, Xiao Qing was still rather young.
Handling some equipment he had seen and learned about at school but never actually operated, Su Ping expertly opened the cold storage room.
As expected, given that these were ingredients for the Heart of Woods Magic Potion, even though his father was unreliable, he had definitely tried making it many times over the years. Consequently, there were still some ingredients left in the cold storage room, which made things much easier.
Su Ping's eyes lit up. Then, under Old Sha's astonished gaze, he quickly ran out of the Magic Potion Workshop and patted Old Sha, saying, "Old Sha, is there Wolf Tobacco growing near the Lingxi River behind our base?"
Old Sha nodded. Then, he watched as his young master sprinted towards the Lingxi River area behind the base.
Old Sha didn't dare to overthink it and quickly chased after him.
This little rascal had just returned; how could he already be such a handful?
Wolf Tobacco? Wasn't that stuff even smellier than the dung produced by those little creatures in the forest?
Old Sha's speed was much faster than Su Ping's.
While Su Ping was studying in Linzhou City—perhaps because he was a person with memories of two lives—he had been an undeniable top student in the meditation course among his peers.
After awakening his Beast Taming Space and Talent, he had now reached the Ordinary Fourth Stage Beast Tamer. However, his speed was still far behind Old Sha, who had reached the Commanding Rank.
Seeing Old Sha catch up, Su Ping deftly grabbed Old Sha's mane and flipped onto his back.
Their breeding base wasn't small, and it was still some distance to the banks of the Lingxi River across the entire grounds.
"AWOO..."
Ridden by the young master he had watched grow up, Old Sha felt a surge of excitement and let out a resounding howl.
In the suburbs, the sudden wolf howl was indeed extremely loud and piercing.
It seemed the Wolf King's howl had been sensed.
Instantly, from the vast woodlands of the base, a chorus of howls rose in response.
Obviously, even though it was on the outskirts of the city, the 'Heart of Woods Pet Beast Breeding Base' occupied a vast area, and there were people nearby.
Not far from the base was another enormous estate.
Above the main entrance of the estate, a huge signboard likewise stood: 'Yun Tian Pet Beast Combat Resort'.
However, compared to the Heart of Woods Pet Beast Breeding Base, this resort estate boasted a much finer environment.
Not only was it noticeably adorned with a rather beautiful garden and exquisitely maintained, but the estate also featured a row of small villas and an eight-story building towering among them.ʀᴇᴀᴅ ʟᴀᴛᴇsᴛ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs ᴀᴛ
At the topmost level of the central building, within the enormous living room that spanned two floors, a graceful figure stood before the window.
This was a woman appearing to be in her thirties. She was dressed in ordinary home attire, yet it could not conceal the potent allure and attractiveness women of that age possessed.
At that moment, however, the woman—whose poise and figure were outstanding—furrowed her brows slightly, her gaze fixed on something distant with displeasure.
The piercing wolf howls drew her attention, her gaze penetrating the distance, looking down upon the babbling Lingxi River miles away, as well as the Heart of Woods Pet Beast Breeding Base hidden by the forest.
And there was that figure, riding a wolf, rushing towards the riverbank.
The woman finally spoke, "Is this the young owner of the breeding base? Our little landlord?"
Not far behind the woman stood a man, his demeanor cautious and subservient.
If Su Ping were here, he would immediately recognize the man. This was the rich fool who had rented the large empty land from his family, the very same person who built what Su Ping and his father considered a somewhat foolish Pet Beast training ground and resort.
Now, facing the woman who stood commandingly before the window, he dared not even glance at her well-defined silhouette, let alone venture any closer.
In response to the woman's question, he wiped the sweat from his forehead before replying, "Yes, Chairwoman."
The woman turned her head to give him a look, "It's been two years, and you haven't made any progress with the task I gave you. How can you still face me?"
Facing the reprimand, the man dared not defend himself in the slightest, only bowing his head even lower.
Seeing her subordinate's dejected state, the woman didn't press the issue, merely pausing before saying, "Forget it. You said that Su Anyong has temporarily left Linzhou City, and now this Heart of Wood Cultivation Base, along with this large tract of land of ours, is under this youngster's control, right?"
"It should be. Old Su... Su Anyong said he was heading to Beihai City up north for a while and definitely won't be returning soon. Su Ping is making all the family decisions."
The woman nodded in satisfaction, her striking red lips revealing a faint smile, "If that's the case, our battle arena has been running low on Elite and Ordinary Level wolf-type training beasts recently, hasn't it?
"Moreover, in a few days, graduates from Linzhou City's schools will be looking for actual combat practice after training their Pet Beasts for a while. We'll likely be short on Low-level training beasts by then.
"In the next few days, find some time to invite this young man over. Discuss a collaboration for renting those Forest Wolves from their base."
"Yes, I understand, Chairwoman."
"Get to it, then."
After giving the order with a casual air, the woman paid no further attention to her subordinate's departure.
She, too, was aware that her subordinate was likely curious why Tianyun Group, a leading corporation in the entire Jianghai Province, would care about such an inconspicuous piece of land in the suburbs of Linzhou City. Although the land was indeed sizable and, after the urban planning changes in Linzhou City, not too far from the city center, it wasn't so critical as to warrant such attention from her, the chairwoman.
The door closed, leaving the woman alone in the vast living room, staring at the distant Lingxi River, lost in thought.
In the silent room, only the woman's solitary murmur could be heard,
"I wonder if the Qintian Monitor has received news and sent anyone yet. I need to find a way to speed things up.
"It's truly exciting. I wonder which predecessor's Secret Realm will appear here in the future..."

chapters.title: Chapter 6: Old Sha’s Grief and Rage, the Magic Potion is Complete!
chapters.content:
Chapter 6 - 6: Old Sha's Grief and Rage, the Magic Potion is Complete!
Heart of Woods Pet Beast Breeding Base, inside the manor.
The door to the Magic Potion Workshop swung open.
Old Sha's expression was fierce as he looked at the smoke-filled workshop.
Old Sha didn't know what his young master was up to.
But this process, as abhorrent as stewing shit, made Old Sha doubt for the first time whether it had been the right decision for Su Anyong to leave and entrust the family's Pet Beast Breeding Base to his young master.
Now was the most struggling and conflicted moment in his wolf life.
He feared that his young master would suffer from the fumes.
If he were to pass out or even be suffocated by the stench inside, Old Sha wouldn't be able to explain it to Su Anyong.
However, with the Magic Potion Workshop's door standing open, the overpowering stench was no longer just an assault on the nose. It also stung the eyes!
For canine-type Pet Beasts, their sense of smell is already the sharpest.
One can imagine, for Old Sha, a Commander Level being, standing in front of the door to the Magic Potion Workshop and enduring the pungent smell to check on Su Ping inside required an enormous amount of courage and deep loyalty.Google seaʀᴄh
Su Ping stood atop a footstand, holding a medicine pestle half a meter tall in his hand.
The cauldron below heated the entire interior to a constant high temperature of eighty degrees.
Fully equipped, he wore a gas mask and oxygen tank, peering into the billowing smoke of the medicine cauldron.
At this moment, Su Ping extolled Blue Star's technology.
If this were ancient times, the concoction of Magic Potions could only be done by oneself, and without this equipment, I would have reason to doubt that I could produce much of the perfect 'Heart of Woods' Magic Potion, even if I knew the formula.
The tremendous technological advancements of the new era are just wonderful.
It has not only yielded high-value mechanical-type Pet Beasts but also made life much easier for Beast Tamers and Breeders.
The various medicinal ingredients had already been thrown in.
The Wolf Tobacco had also been completely added.
Next came the final phase of the process.
The next moment, within the thick smoke, Su Ping twisted the temperature control of the cauldron, immediately raising the temperature to one hundred and twenty degrees.
The rapid stirring of the pestle made Su Ping's arms ache.
Fortunately, after officially becoming a Beast Tamer and advancing in rank, a Beast Tamer's physical body also receives a certain enhancement.
If it had been before, Su Ping definitely couldn't have sustained such high-intensity concoction.
With the sudden increase in temperature and rapid stirring, the previously pulp-like dark green slime below started to bubble. GURGLE. GURGLE.
An even more indescribable foul stench arose from it. The gas mask filtered out this smell, but the smoke had gradually dissipated. Through his gas mask, Su Ping observed the liquid at the bottom of the cauldron.
Finally, when Su Ping's arms had gone numb, the thick liquid fully formed. Su Ping then leaped down from the footstand and reached the outlet beneath the cauldron, taking out the Vessels he'd prepared beforehand.
Immediately, from the outlet valve, a dark green liquid resembling slightly diluted loquat syrup slowly flowed out.
Su Ping finally breathed a sigh of relief.
After closing the cauldron and activating the self-filtering function, Su Ping, holding the now sealed potion, stepped out of the workshop.
Through the gas mask, Su Ping saw Old Sha, who was wearing a look of silent complaint.
Is it really that exaggerated?
Su Ping belatedly took off his gas mask.
Then he instinctively sniffed. Within less than a tenth of a second, Su Ping quickly directed the nearby oxygen mask toward himself.
He rubbed the even more resentful Old Sha.
"Old Sha, I've wronged you, but don't worry. After eating this stuff tomorrow, you'll know the benefits!"
Looking at his young master's face, brimming with determination, Old Sha glanced again at the dark green 'essence' in the small bottle that Su Ping had painstakingly concocted over several hours.
His eyes were filled with complexity; he never imagined that one day, his young master, whom he had watched grow up, would attempt to poison him.
To feed him shit!?
And to do it right in front of him, no less.
Old Sha swallowed hard, and his massive wolf body emitted a crisp GULP.
Then, before Su Ping could react, Old Sha dashed off toward the forest of the base as if he were a puff of smoke, so fast that not even his shadow was visible.
Su Ping scratched his head and looked again at the modified 'Heart of Woods' Magic Potion in his hand.
Is it really that exaggerated?
A bit belatedly, he turned his head back to the still foul-smelling Magic Potion Workshop, and recalling the odor from earlier, he involuntarily shuddered.
Huh... Refreshing and mind-clearing!
Although this stuff is indeed a bit hard on the eyes, I still need to consume it.
But not now.
The Magic Potion formula required the concoction to cool and set into a gel after the final simmering to be considered fully complete.
After a busy day, Su Ping wasn't in the mood to ponder further. Once the bottle of Heart of Woods had returned to room temperature, he put it into a refrigeration box and then headed back to his own room.
Xiao Qing was still sleeping in the Beast Taming Space.
Since becoming his Contracted Beast, Su Ping's own Realm could greatly reflect on the Pet Beast itself, accelerating its growth.
And Xiao Qing was in a phase of rapid growth.
He opened his phone, and the first thing that appeared was a message alert from his class group.
Su Ping had just clicked in when a message appeared:
"Heard the class leader contracted a Crimson Fang Tiger with Racial Potential for Commander Level. Impressive! Looks like we'll be under the class leader's protection from now on! @Zhou Shuchen"
No sooner had this message been sent than a few seconds later, another message appeared:
"Not bad. I just got lucky. Director Zhang helped me find a connection, and the down payment was 2,000,000. Sigh, time to start paying off the loan. But it's worth it. The Crimson Fang Tiger has already mastered Flaming Pounce after just half a month since the contract—a talent that not any ordinary Pet Beast can match."
Despite a tone of self-deprecation, the underlying message was clearly one of pride.
It was none other than the class leader, Zhou Shuchen, who had even changed his profile picture to a crimson-hued young tiger.
Clearly, even though the world had changed, the same behavior endured within the class group.
Only now, the topic was about Contracted Beasts.
But frankly speaking, a Crimson Fang Tiger with Commander Level Racial Potential was indeed impressive.
A down payment of 2,000,000 wasn't expensive.
However, Zhou Shuchen's family was just an average household. Given the connection with Director Zhang, the figure for the loan was still unimaginably high.
This guy really had some guts.
Speaking of which, the class leader's talent was said to be the relatively rare 'Fire Element Affinity.' This talent was capable of providing a certain boost in combat power to fire Attribute Pet Beasts and was quite suitable for becoming a Combat Beast Tamer.
It's no wonder he and his family probably emptied their savings to secure him his first Contracted Beast, the Crimson Fang Tiger.
"In our class now, is Su Ping the only one left without a Contracted Beast?"
Someone suddenly asked.
"Su the Rich Kid has high standards. Previously, Director Zhang kindly recommended him a species with Commander Level Racial Potential, the Scythe Giant Centipede, yet he refused it."
Zhou Shuchen's Crimson Fang Tiger avatar flickered again.
Su Ping arched an eyebrow. During school, this 'fine' class leader had always been courteous with him—not overly friendly, but he had never offended him either.
After all, even though the Su family wasn't part of the so-called 'Beast Taming Elite,' they did have a minor heritage.
This class leader was the type who knew how to play his cards right.
Yet here he was, acting so passive-aggressively in the group chat after graduation. Was this his true nature revealing itself?

chapters.title: Chapter 7: Classmate Group, Xiao Qing’s First Promotion!
chapters.content:
Chapter 7 - 7: Classmate Group, Xiao Qing's First Promotion!
Su Ping's brow furrowed slightly as he looked at the chat group of his classmates.
But he didn't mind it much.
Follow current novᴇls on ɴoᴠel Fɪre.nᴇt
Upon graduation, in the special Beastmaster Society of Blue Star, those high-level Beast Taming Academies weren't places just anyone could aspire to. Either one had a uniquely unparalleled awakening of Beast Taming Talent, incredibly strong, and was specially recruited immediately upon becoming a Beast Tamer and contracting a Pet Beast. Besides that, the main requirement was to pass a professional Beast Tamer assessment. Only by passing and registering as a genuine professional Beast Tamer with the Beast Master Association could one have the opportunity. Therefore, for the vast majority, graduation at this stage was tantamount to stepping into society.
That Director Zhang was Zhang Guowei, the Dean of Studies at Linzhou City's Sixth Advanced Middle School, where Su Ping had studied. Teachers in such schools usually had some connections in society. For students with good Talent who had the chance to become combat Beast Tamers, he would act as a broker, selecting a good path for them. He would also receive a handsome compensation for himself.
Take Zhou Shuchen, for example. With his natural affinity for the Fire Element, Zhou Shuchen possessed an outstanding elemental combat Talent. Consequently, Zhang Guowei found him a connection with the Fire King Company. This secured him a Crimson Fang Tiger Pet Beast with Commander Level Racial Potential—something uncommon for ordinary people. Beyond the huge down payment and future loans, he would also have to work as an employee at the Fire King Company.
Indeed, after graduation, Director Zhang had also approached Su Ping, but Su Ping had refused.
Su Ping's Talent seemed rather ordinary.
What good is being able to carry a few more Pet Beasts?
Wild Pet Beasts are very difficult to align with their master's intent! And the environment in the Beast Taming Space can easily incite rebellion among wild Pet Beasts.
Even if you did carry dozens of wild Pet Beasts, what then? Aren't you afraid of being devoured upon their release?
As such, this Talent is often used for logistical purposes. And precisely because it's for logistical use, this Talent becomes particularly applicable, necessary for transportation, storage, and many similar tasks. After all, transporting Pet Beasts is extremely dangerous, especially wild ones.
Nonetheless, although the Su family was by no means wealthy—especially since their Pet Beast Breeding Base's livelihood depended on rental income, a rather tenuous existence in the Beastmaster Society—Su Anyong would certainly not stoop to selling his son in exchange for a Commander Level first Pet Beast. Xiao Qing, a rare bloodline mutant who had gained the Poison Type Attribute, was proof of this. Bloodline Mutations are more valuable than Racial Potential at the Elite or Commander Level. Racial Potential can be enhanced through Evolution and breakthroughs with advanced resources. However, changing a Pet Beast's Attribute, though possible by consuming certain resources or Magic Potions, comes with great danger. A single misstep could lead to the Pet Beast becoming crippled or even dying. Most importantly, Pet Beasts with rare Attribute Mutations generally have an upper limit in Racial Talent that is simply incomparable.
It wasn't hard to guess why Zhou Shuchen was currently so sarcastic towards him. Director Zhang had likely told Zhou Shuchen—who was young, idolized Zhang Guowei as a mentor and guiding light, and was also the class president—about Su Ping's rejection and perceived ingratitude. Clearly, this guy was probably sharing a common resentment. He's still just so young.
Su Ping shook his head, not angry but feeling somewhat sad for Zhou Shuchen. A Commander Level initial Pet Beast with such Racial Potential was indeed precious to them. However, with his Talent, Zhou Shuchen could have easily applied for an official loan at Linzhou's Beast Master Association branch. There was no need to pay a hefty sum of Money and also sign a contract to work for someone. However, the constraints of his vision, mindset, and understanding meant that Zhou, having been metaphorically 'sold' by Director Zhang, was probably still happily counting the money for his 'benefactor.' And usually, such people, once they gain a bit of power, can't help but get carried away.
"Wow, a Scythe Giant Centipede? That's a rather advanced Pet Beast with Commander Level Racial Potential! If I had this opportunity, I would never refuse it."
"But maybe Su Ping's family isn't lacking in Commander Level Pet Beasts with Racial Potential, right? It's normal if he doesn't want to owe Zhang Guowei anything."
"Owe favors? What could Director Zhang expect from you?"
"That's true..."
"@Su Ping, Bro Ping, have you contracted a Pet Beast yet?"
The messages in the group flashed quickly, and soon, someone directly tagged him.
Su Ping thought for a moment and decided not to lurk any longer. He replied, "Contracted one. A Forest Wolf from our family's Pet Beast Breeding Base!"
Before Li Shu, who was on good terms with Su Ping and had asked the initial question, could reply, the Crimson Fang Tiger avatar—which Su Ping had found somewhat annoying from its first appearance—flashed again: "Forest Wolf? Isn't that species' Racial Potential capped at Elite Level!? Su Ping, so you're taking over the family business too, HAHA! Congratulations, congratulations!"
The three exclamation marks conveyed this person's mockery and dismissal of the previous commenter.
Look at that, Young Master Su's family has such a substantial foundation, yet he only contracted a Forest Wolf.
Although, for ordinary students like them, a Forest Wolf with Racial Potential reaching Elite Peak was indeed a good choice. But in front of this Crimson Fang Tiger Beast Tamer, it was clearly a notch lower. During their school years, for reasons related to both family and personal Ability, Zhou, the class president, often couldn't compare to Su Ping. Even once, when romantic feelings first blossomed, the girl he pursued had rejected him because of Su Ping.
But Su Ping had no interest in wasting words on someone who got carried away with a little success; engaging in online arguments wasn't his style either.
However, suddenly, an avatar and name that had never appeared before sent a message: "@Su Ping, Su Ping, near your place, is there a Yuntian Pet Beast Battle Resort?"
"Yin Yin, the school beauty!!!"
"@Yin Yin, Yin's school belle, have you contracted a Pet Beast?"
"..."
As soon as this avatar, a cartoon fish, and the name appeared in the group, a flurry of replies instantly followed.
Yin Yin was the so-called school beauty of Sixth Middle School.
Su Ping had always found it rather amusing and pointless that a group of physically immature young girls would be judged as school beauties. Besides, aesthetic judgment is subjective; 'school beauty' is just a title.
However, this Yin Yin was indeed quite famous.
"@Yin Yin, that's right. It's right next door to my house."
"@Su Ping, I'm going to train in Pet Beast battling at the resort in a few days. When I do, I'd like to visit your place. I've never seen a Pet Beast Breeding Base before. Is that okay?"
Su Ping frowned slightly. However, before he could respond, the group had already erupted.
"Yin Yin, you're going to train in Pet Beast battling? Can we join you, please?"
"Yeah, our Xiao Hong recently advanced to Normal Second Rank and learned a Racial Skill! She's itching to try it out, HEE HEE!"
"Great idea, let's all go together!"
"Perfect! It's been over a month since graduation, and we haven't had a proper get-together yet..."
"..."
At this age, the allure of hormones was clearly boundless. And evidently, Su Ping's opinion didn't seem very important at that moment. After all, they were planning to visit the Yuntian Resort next door; his family's Pet Beast Breeding Base was just an incidental stop.
Shaking his head, Su Ping didn't bother to read or reply further. He even left the class group, tossed his phone aside, and checked on Xiao Qing, who was fast asleep. He could feel Xiao Qing's aura consolidating. Under his nourishment as a Beast Tamer, it seemed Xiao Qing would soon advance from Normal First Rank to Normal Second Rank.
Su Ping smiled with satisfaction and slowly closed his eyes. The earlier excitement subsided, and he drifted into a deep sleep.
「The next morning,」 Su Ping's eyes snapped open. He quickly dealt with breakfast and washing up, then glanced at the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas.
Sure enough, under the Forest Wolf Catalog, an additional log entry had appeared: "[After spending a day in close contact with two Forest Wolves, your Forest Wolf Catalog experience has increased by +7 points.]"
But that wasn't the most important thing. The most important thing was that overnight, the cooled Heart of Woods Magic Potion had been completed.

chapters.title: Chapter 8: Old Sha, Resigned to Death! Taking the Magic Potion!
chapters.content:
Chapter 8 - 8: Old Sha, Resigned to Death! Taking the Magic Potion!
The morning sun rose in the east, adding a few degrees of intense heat to the already high temperatures. A gentle breeze rustled through the forest, bringing a rare coolness to the summer morning.
Sitting in the wicker rocking chair where Su Anyong often lay, Xiao Qing, having grown larger, was still held in Su Ping's arms, excitedly watching everything in front of her.
In front of Su Ping was an extremely spectacular sight. Outside the forest, within the shadows cast by the canopy, before the manor's path, Forest Wolves of various sizes appeared before him. They behaved like well-trained domestic dogs, sitting on the ground, their green eyes intently fixed on Su Ping. At a rough count, there were over twenty of them.
Among them, seven adult Forest Wolves had reached Elite Level or above. One had reached Elite Ninth Order, making it the highest-level Forest Wolf in the base besides Old Sha. Fewer than twenty were still at Ordinary Level, most of them growing pups.
However, in today's Heart of Woods Pet Beast Breeding Base, the most valuable assets were actually these pups. Normally, those who came to purchase Pet Beasts would buy young ones to nurture as their first. Newly awakened Beast Tamers at the Ordinary Level could not contract with an Elite Level Forest Wolf. Furthermore, Beast Tamers who had advanced to Elite Level wouldn't usually buy an adult Forest Wolf, as its potential was limited and its development predictable. Therefore, these seven Elite Level Forest Wolves were largely kept as breeding stock.
In front of this wolf pack stood Old Sha, eyeing Su Ping with a wary and cautious look.
Clearly, from his apprehensive gaze, he was still thinking about Su Ping's threat yesterday to poison him and feed him feces.
Sure enough, after Old Sha had gathered all the Forest Wolves, Su Ping took out a bottle of dark green liquid. Su Ping slowly turned and looked at Old Sha.
"Old Sha!"
Old Sha shuddered, then, with a look full of deep resentment, turned his gaze to Su Ping. However, in the end, Old Sha didn't run away as he did yesterday.
There were rules within the Wolf Tribe. Old Sha possessed the authority of a Wolf King. He commanded the members of the Wolf Tribe, and his attitude reflected the pack's attitude towards Su Ping. Su Anyong had entrusted the Heart of Woods base to Su Ping, so Old Sha had to take the lead and let Su Ping become the 'king' these little ones would now obey. Therefore, at this time, even if his young master intended to harm him, Old Sha would not back down.
But when Su Ping actually took the vessel filled with dark green liquid from his pouch, Old Sha's body still trembled slightly. Then, under the curious gaze of all the Forest Wolves, he walked forward with somewhat trembling limbs.
Seeing Old Sha's pleading gaze, Su Ping was somewhat speechless.
Is all this fuss necessary? If Xiao Qing weren't so young, and if I didn't need to test the potion's effects on the other Forest Wolves first, would this be so troublesome?
Su Ping stroked the stiff fur on the temples of Old Sha, who had lowered his head, and then softly said, "Old Sha, you have to trust me! I'm doing this for your own good."
Old Sha glanced at Su Ping, then at the concoction. Although it had cooled, it still retained some of yesterday's smell after being unsealed. Old Sha looked back at Su Ping again.
Those green eyes clearly said:
I don't believe you one bit!
But in the end, he nodded.
After all, Old Sha was nearly two cycles older than this young master. Possessing wisdom not inferior to humans, he naturally knew what his young master was actually doing. He's making a Magic Potion. Su Anyong, when he was young, also tried a few times. I even ingested it, but the final effects... And the young master, having just graduated and suddenly taking over Heart of Woods, naturally has the ambition to try out his own ideas. So, after a night of deep thought, I know that even if I'm poisoned to death, I must protect the young master's pride. I can't let him be like that unreliable Su Anyong, just abandoning efforts and completely wasting the old man's life's work!
"AWOO..."
Thus, Old Sha closed his eyes and let out an extremely desolate howl. It lacked only tears welling up in the corners of his eyes.
With an air of heroic self-sacrifice, as if a loyal pet resigned to death at its master's command, this display made Su Ping utterly exasperated as he poured out the Magic Potion.
He decided not to waste any more words. He looked at Old Sha, who had his eyes closed and mouth wide open, as if bracing himself to be fed feces by his young master, and directly poured this dark green, jelly-like Magic Potion, which resembled herbal jelly, into Old Sha's mouth.
Then, Old Sha's long, steaming tongue lapped it up, swallowing it down his throat without even properly savoring the taste, gobbling it down as if it were a priceless treasure eaten in haste.
Old Sha opened his eyes and looked at the now-empty Magic Potion bottle, then at the young master eagerly watching him. His gaze suddenly lost its brightness, as if the world had turned gray in an instant. Afterward, he came to Su Ping's side and began to whimper softly.
Although it was wolf language, Su Ping could still roughly understand some of the meaning:
You must carry on the legacy of the Heart of Woods Pet Beast Breeding Base, and definitely grow and strengthen the breeding of the Forest Wolf! Do not let down the hard work and trust of your grandfather, and develop even more powerful evolutionary paths for the Forest Wolf! And, you must strive to become an even more incredible Beast Tamer, you stinky kid!!!!!
These sentiments, and more, were conveyed, as if he was delivering his last will and testament. It was also as if an elder on his deathbed faced his kin with his final, earnest teachings.
For a moment, under the sunlight that enveloped the area outside the woods, the atmosphere became incredibly solemn and poignant. Even the rest of the wolf pack lurking nearby, clueless about what was happening, let out mournful howls in response, as if they were bidding farewell to their Wolf King, their elder.
If Su Ping himself didn't know what was really going on, he might have been moved by the atmosphere.
But what the hell is going on here? I'm feeding him a Magic Potion, not poison!
Fortunately, Su Ping didn't have to wait long. Suddenly, the utterly serene expression on Old Sha's face, which seemed prepared for death, changed. The low whimpering stopped abruptly.
Su Ping's expression turned very serious as he observed Old Sha's reaction. In that instant, sparkling emerald specks of light appeared on Old Sha's originally bluish-gray fur, as if he were enveloped by a faint, verdant green glow.
Throughout the area outside the forest, the air seemed to become incredibly clear. Simultaneously, in the nearby woods and beneath Old Sha's feet, branches burst through the soil, growing at a visible pace. At the same time, a faint aura emanated, making Su Ping's eyes widen in shock.
The Forest Wolf pack behind him reacted even more intensely, trembling with fear and prostrating on the ground, not daring to gaze directly at their Wolf King's aura.
This process lasted only a minute.
The next moment, all the peculiar phenomena disappeared, replaced by a crisp and exceedingly jubilant Wolf Howl filled with indescribable joy!

chapters.title: Chapter 9: Old Sha’s Breakthrough! Poison Vine Strangulation!
chapters.content:
Chapter 9 - 9: Old Sha's Breakthrough! Poison Vine Strangulation!
Before Su Ping could react, he was once again enjoying the sensation of being tackled onto the soft grass.
Then came the lapping of a moist tongue.
In his current state, Old Sha bore no resemblance to his earlier readiness to face death.
Heh. Pet Beasts.
Disgustedly wiping the sticky saliva from his cheek where Old Sha had licked him, Su Ping finally used his Eye of Truth once more to look at the uncontrollably excited Old Sha:
[Forest Wolf (Wild)]
[Current Level: Commander Second Rank]
[Racial Potential: Elite Tenth Rank]
[Skills: Sunlight Absorption (Perfection), Vine Strangling (Proficient), Self-Healing (Proficiency), Rapid Growth (Proficient), Wolf King (Beginner), Heart of Woods (Beginner)]
[Heart of Woods (Beginner): Enhances the power, effectiveness, and casting speed of Wood Element abilities to a certain degree and allows for the absorption of Wood Element power for rapid self-recovery.]
Just as expected!
A thrill shot through Su Ping's eyes.
Not only did it get Heart of Woods, but its level also increased by another rank! Did the addition of Wolf Tobacco cause such a miraculous chemical reaction with the Heart of Woods Magic Potion?
Su Ping did not understand. The superficial knowledge of cultivation science he had learned at school clearly couldn't explain this.
But he knew one thing: the significance of what had just happened.
To put it bluntly, an ordinary Forest Wolf cub would, at most, fetch a price between 800,000 to 1,200,000 Gold.
However, a Forest Wolf that had awakened Heart of Woods could command a price at least three to five times higher!
If it had good aptitude, practiced its Skills diligently, and improved its Skill proficiency and level growth quickly, it could be worth even more.
It might even be comparable to some lower-tier Commander Level talent Pet Beast cubs.
The Heart of Woods Skill was incredibly powerful.
Such Skills that enhanced corresponding elemental power, though not so-called Super-Rank Skills, were often more practical than some Super-Rank Skills as passive abilities!
Even at the Beginner level, with the boost from Heart of Woods, Old Sha's strength had increased by thirty to fifty percent compared to before.
If they were to fight in places like jungles, mountain forests, or grasslands, it would be even more terrifying!
However, it was precisely because of how formidable it was that Skills like Heart of Woods were exceedingly rare and difficult to obtain.
But now, with the help of the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, this original Heart of Woods Magic Potion had undergone such a metamorphosis simply by adding one ingredient.
Su Ping's eyes blazed with excitement. However, at that very moment, a new prompt appeared in the log records at the bottom of the solely illuminated Forest Wolf Catalog entry on the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas:
[Successfully enabled the associated Pet Beast to acquire the Skill: Heart of Woods, and its rank was improved. Catalog Experience +30 points!]
Su Ping was startled and took another look at the now-lit Forest Wolf Catalog:
[Catalog: Forest Wolf]
[A special Wolf Tribe adept in using Wood Attribute, with extremely strong life force. Typical adult Forest Wolves are Elite Level, and their proficient Skills include: Sunlight Absorption, Vine Strangling, Self-Healing, Rapid Growth, etc.]
[Current Catalog Level: 1 (152/500)]
The experience had reached 152 points.
If it weren't for the 285 points spent previously on perfecting the Heart of Woods Magic Potion formula, I'd only be a bit more than a hundred points shy of upgrading the Catalog to Level 2! Looking at it this way, it seems increasing the Catalog Level isn't so difficult!
However...
Su Ping's gaze quickly moved past Old Sha, looking at the group of Forest Wolves that had become very docile.
Clearly, to quickly increase the Catalog Level, the more Forest Wolves, the better; and the more Forest Wolves with adequate intimacy with him, the better!
Old Sha had been like family to him for so many years. There was no need to say more.
Xiao Qing had formed a Soul Contract with him, binding them directly together, so naturally, the same applied.
But as for these more than twenty Forest Wolves, although he had brought Old Sha to feed them before and they were familiar, their intimacy was clearly still insufficient according to the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas's judgment!
Obviously, if he wanted to raise the Catalog Level quickly, the number of Forest Wolves with adequate intimacy was of paramount importance.
And how could he make their intimacy reach the standard?
Daily interactions, feeding, training.
All of these could work, but they obviously wouldn't meet the standard quickly.
Glancing at Old Sha, who was extremely excited and wagging its tail in a way Su Ping had never seen before, Su Ping instantly understood.
If I can help these little guys increase their strength and enhance their abilities—especially if they can do it effortlessly, as if lying down—then it will undoubtedly increase their intimacy with me by a lot!
Instantly, Su Ping solidified his decision.
I'll continue concocting Magic Potions! But before that, I need to see Old Sha's changes!
"Old Sha, use Vine Strangling on that tree!"
Old Sha's green eyes suddenly lit up with spirit. It had never dreamed that Su Ping could achieve something that even Su Ping's own grandfather hadn't managed, something Su Anyong had completely given up on!
It knew that its young master, whom it had watched grow up, would never harm it!
Immediately, Old Sha's gaze fixed on one of the huge trees in the forest.
The next moment, numerous dark green branches and vines either burst from the soil or condensed out of thin air.
They instantly entwined the giant tree that was being used as a practice target.
The vines were as thick as a bowl and extremely tough, even gleaming with a metallic luster.
Moreover, as they continued to entwine and constrict, Su Ping soon discovered extremely sharp barbs appearing on the vines, elevating their lethality by another significant measure!ɪꜰ ʏᴏᴜ ᴡᴀɴᴛ ᴛᴏ ʀᴇᴀᴅ ᴍᴏʀᴇ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs, ᴘʟᴇᴀsᴇ ᴠɪsɪᴛ NovᴇlFɪre.ɴet
After only a short entanglement, deep gashes that looked as if they were made by a saw appeared on the trunk of the towering tree in his small forest.
The speed of the attack and the power of the vines were incomparable to before!
He thought that even a Commander Level opponent of the same rank, if caught in this web of vines, would have its blood drained in an instant. It would suffer wounds all over, as if subjected to death by a thousand cuts.
Even Su Ping couldn't help but draw a sharp breath.
However, Xiao Qing, who had been quiet in his arms, suddenly became animated as well.
It stared intently at the entwining vines, as if it had suddenly understood something.
Xiao Qing formed a Soul Contract with me and advanced to Ordinary Second Rank in just a day. That speed isn't slow. But right now, it only has the basic Forest Wolf Skill, Sunlight Absorption.
It could sunbathe to reduce its need for food and conserve energy, allowing it to grow rapidly.
Yet, it has no combat abilities so far. I wasn't in a rush before, but now the situation seems a bit different, doesn't it?
Indeed, Xiao Qing lightly leaped from his embrace, landed in front of him, and then, opening its mouth slightly, let out an extremely tender cry:
"AWOOOOO..."
The next moment, several delicate vines, only as thick as woolen yarn, burst forth from the soil!
The difference was, aside from their thinness, these vines had a slightly different color—they were tinged with purple.
Su Ping blinked, looking incredulously at his Pet Beast.
It learned it just like that?
It's true that Forest Wolves typically learn their Racial Skills as they grow.
Vine Strangling was one of the Forest Wolf's primary combat techniques, so this was natural.
However, a Pet Beast's talent is judged by the speed at which it learns and masters Skills.
For example, just yesterday in the student group chat, the class monitor, Zhou Shuchen, had proudly stated that his newly contracted Crimson Fang Tiger mastered one of its primary combat Skills, Flaming Pounce, in just half a month.
This was indeed quite impressive.
But how could my Xiao Qing learn Vine Strangling just by watching Old Sha use it once?
Using the Eye of Truth, Su Ping looked at his Pet Beast with a touch of disbelief:
[Mutated Forest Wolf (Contracted)]
[Attribute: Wood, Poison]
[Current Level: Ordinary Second Rank]
[Racial Potential: Elite Tenth Rank]
[Skills: Sunlight Absorption (Beginner), Poison Vine Strangulation (Beginner)]
Wait a minute?
Su Ping was taken aback. This wasn't the regular Vine Strangling that common Forest Wolves mastered.
It's this so-called Poison Vine Strangulation?
Su Ping looked at Xiao Qing with a strange expression.
Could it be that Dad, who supposedly chose this Forest Wolf after meticulous selection—though it was probably just a stroke of luck—actually found a mutated Forest Wolf? Not only does it have the potential to master Poison Type abilities, but it's also exceptionally talented?

chapters.title: Chapter 10: First Battle, Rapid Promotion Plan!
chapters.content:
Chapter 10 - 10: First Battle, Rapid Promotion Plan!
Su Ping became interested. Xiao Qing was very young, but the Talent it had already displayed was enough to surprise even Su Ping! Originally, he thought he would have to wait for Xiao Qing to grow a little older and, after its Level increased, purchase some Poison Type resources for it to consume. Xiao Qing would then be able to master this mutated Poison Type Ability, but now it seemed he had greatly underestimated Xiao Qing's Talent!
"Well done!"
He rubbed Xiao Qing's proudly raised head, and his gaze shifted to the other Forest Wolves. It quickly fixated on the youngest of them all. This Forest Wolf was also the weakest among these ordinary ones, and its Level was only one rank higher than Xiao Qing's—merely a common Third Rank.
Before, Su Ping had not really considered Xiao Qing's combat ability at this time. But now, since Xiao Qing had comprehended a Skill, he wanted to see how effective and powerful Poison Vine Strangulation was.
He glanced at Old Sha and said, "Old Sha, let that little guy battle Xiao Qing!"
Only by growing in battle would one become more adept at using Skills. And Su Ping wanted to see just how potent the Poison Vine Strangulation that Xiao Qing had just learned truly was.
"AWOO!"
The tiny Forest Wolf singled out by Old Sha stepped forward cautiously, eyeing both Su Ping and the proud little wolf beside Su Ping's trouser leg. Obviously, this Little Forest Wolf, too, had been born recently, and its Talents were relatively average. Even now, though it was one rank higher than Xiao Qing, it hadn't comprehended the Skill Vine Strangling.
In the face of its opponent, Xiao Qing did not show the affection it had for Su Ping but displayed a hint of disdain, and a somewhat childish howl sounded.
The eyes of the Little Forest Wolf flashed fiercely, and it pounced straight at Xiao Qing. However, before it could get close, vines that appeared out of nowhere had already tightly wrapped it up. The delicate purple-green vines looked non-threatening, but having entered a tier, their strength far exceeded that of an ordinary human.
"WHINE..."
The Little Forest Wolf howled, struggling to break free, but Su Ping keenly noted that the Little Forest Wolf's power at this moment had significantly weakened compared to usual! And the wounds seemed swollen.
This poison is strong!
Through the soul connection, Su Ping signaled Xiao Qing to stop. The battered Little Forest Wolf was finally rescued from the Poison Vine Strangulation, but it seemed as though all its strength had been drained. It couldn't even stand.
Xiao Qing's Poison Vine Strangulation was mainly based on a toxin that paralyzed through the blood. If it were to face a life-and-death enemy in reality, the enemy might not even feel pain from the poison vines but would lose all Ability to resist and die.
Happy for Xiao Qing, Su Ping quickly scooped up the powerless Little Forest Wolf. He followed Old Sha to the medical room, administered an antidote, and only relaxed a little when he saw it starting to recover. The Little Forest Wolf's eyes opened. It gazed at Xiao Qing, who was perched triumphantly on Su Ping's shoulder, a hint of loss in its own eyes.
Su Ping stopped in his tracks, thought for a moment, and slowly squatted down, rubbing the similarly thirty-centimeter-tall Little Forest Wolf's head, smiling and said, "It's okay, you'll grow stronger too. As long as you're in Heart of Woods, I won't give up on any little guy! Keep it up!"
"AWOO!"
Before the Little Forest Wolf could speak, Xiao Qing, who was on Su Ping's shoulder, let out a jealous cry. It leaped lightly beside Su Ping and nipped at his trouser leg with its nascent sharp teeth.
Then, Xiao Qing looked at its defeated rival with a somewhat unfriendly gaze.
This guy actually thought of such a method to vie for our master's affection! How despicable!
Just as it bared its teeth, Su Ping gently tapped it on the head. When dealing with wolves and any other Pet Beast, besides fostering closeness, one must also make them aware of who the true master is. Xiao Qing felt a little aggrieved.
"Heart of Woods is one big family. From now on, you must not bully your companions; you should help and support each other! Understand?"
Xiao Qing hugged its head with its two immature paws but still let out an "AWOO," clearly responding.
Surprisingly, the frail Little Forest Wolf looked at Su Ping with some astonishment, then glanced at the slightly different Little Forest Wolf beside him, and a determined look appeared in its eyes. Afterward, it forced itself to stand up on its still-shaky legs and let out an equally immature howl.
"AWOO!" it howled, as if to prove that it wasn't as bad as it seemed.
"Good! Very spirited!"
Su Ping smiled with satisfaction, set it down on the ground, and then brought over some ointment to help soothe the wounds that were rapidly healing.
Old Sha, who was standing outside the medical room, watched Su Ping's silhouette in the morning sunlight as he crouched on the ground. Beside that silhouette were two equally small ones. One weak but resolute, the other proud but discontent, yet they showed no resistance toward Su Ping.
