Seeing this, a smile also flitted across Old Sha's eyes. It didn't understand how the medicine that the young master made could awaken the Skills and power of the Heart of Woods after it was consumed. It also didn't understand how the young master had the courage to make such claims. But at this moment, Su Ping's figure standing in the dawn's light truly made Old Sha believe that this young master, who had just become a Beast Tamer, might indeed make this little Pet Beast Breeding Base fundamentally different. Perhaps in the future, he might even become a greater Beast Tamer than his grandfather.
At that moment, Su Ping was also suddenly taken aback.
A new prompt appeared on the record log of the Forest Wolf Catalog in his mind:
[Encountered and interacted with a common Forest Wolf, intimacy met the requirement, Catalog Level experience +10!]
[This Forest Wolf has a common bloodline; subsequent daily interactions will yield Catalog Experience +1!]
The experience wasn't much; whether it was the experience gained for meeting the intimacy requirement or the Catalog Experience from daily interactions, both were modest. But this was enough to surprise and delight Su Ping.
Indeed, dealing with Pet Beasts was actually much simpler than interacting with people. Pet Beasts had sharper senses than humans; they could feel who had good intentions. Therefore, when dealing with Pet Beasts, only two words were needed: 'sincerity'!
Realizing this, Su Ping stood up and waved his hand, declaring, "Little guys, don't worry, starting now, our Heart of Woods initiates the Rapid Advancement Plan! Let every Forest Wolf awaken the Heart of Woods Skills! Starting with you and Xiao Qing!"
"AWOO..."
"AWOO..."
The two immature wolf howls sounded almost in celebration of their master's bold ambitions.
Only Old Sha, who had been smiling at the doorway, felt its expression slump.
Does this mean the young master is going to start making that... thing again?
it thought. Although Old Sha had now experienced the benefits of that concoction, its odor was just too memorable for a wolf.
What a daunting determination indeed.

chapters.title: Chapter 11: Renting Pet Beasts? The Path to Making Money!
chapters.content:
Chapter 11 - 11: Renting Pet Beasts? The Path to Making Money!
DING-DONG.
DING-DONG.
DING-DONG.
The doorbell at Heart of Woods's gate rang. Half a day passed, but not only did no one open the door, there wasn't even a footstep to be heard from within the compound.
A middle-aged man stood under the scorching sun before the motionless gate, occasionally catching a foul whiff from the yard, which made him grimace.
What on earth was this young master doing at home?
The visitor was none other than Manager Guan from the neighboring Yun Tian Pet Beast Training Center. The day before, his chairman had sent him to invite this young master over to discuss renting their Forest Wolves. Yet, Manager Guan had been standing at the gate all morning, assailed by nothing but strange odors drifting from the base, without a glimpse of anyone.
Before the chairwoman's arrival, his life had been comfortable; he could even drop by to chat and shoot the breeze with Su Anyong when he was free. But ever since this "queen" had arrived, Manager Guan dared not show a hint of negligence. Even though he'd been standing there all morning, as long as he was sure Su Ping was home, he couldn't return empty-handed. He knew the chairman's temper all too well.
Thus, Manager Guan stood there, ringing the doorbell for three solid hours. He'd had no lunch, not even a sip of water. Finally, as Manager Guan stared with mounting anticipation, hurried footsteps at last approached from the other side of the gate.
THUD.
The gate, a seeming barrier between two worlds, finally swung open for Manager Guan.
However, before Manager Guan, eyes welling with tears, could look at this young master whom he had seen a few times, a wave of stench so overpowering washed over him that he instinctively recoiled several steps. Braving the eye-watering odor, Manager Guan looked at a somewhat sheepish Su Ping.
Why wear a gas mask on such a hot day? What on earth have you been concocting in there, kid? Could it be some kind of biochemical weapon? Well, the smell is certainly potent enough.
"Uncle Guan? What brings you here?"
"What have you been up to, lad?" Manager Guan couldn't help but complain. "You took so long to open the door; I was about to call your dad."
Su Ping scratched his head.
What else could he be doing?
Of course, he was continuing his work on the Magic Potion. After seeing Xiao Qing's growth and improvement, as well as Little Ones' efforts, Su Ping, as their master, naturally couldn't slack off, could he?
The weakest Little Forest Wolf was named Little Ones.
Now, after toiling away for a good part of the day, he had just placed three new vials of Heart of Woods Magic Potion into the cooling box. He hadn't even removed his protective gear when he finally noticed the doorbell.
"Is there something you need?"
Given the overwhelming stench, Manager Guan had no desire to step inside for a proper chat with Su Ping and got straight to the point, "Lately, the training field is running short on training beasts. How are your Forest Wolves? The price is negotiable!"
As soon as business was mentioned, Manager Guan's expression turned serious.
"Uncle Guan, are you looking to rent or to buy?"
Su Ping trusted Manager Guan's words. The Dragon Country Beastmaster Association and official authorities had clear regulations: Beast Tamers were not permitted to engage in Pet Beast battles in public areas except under special circumstances. Damaging public facilities or the natural environment could lead to detention for 7-15 days, depending on the severity. If the circumstances were serious, the penalties could be increased accordingly. Battling at one's own home was an option, but Pet Beast battle Skills were incredibly varied and often destructive, so most ordinary people lacked the proper facilities. Consequently, Pet Beast training and battlegrounds were a fairly lucrative business, naturally requiring a supply of Pet Beasts for paid sparring sessions.
Manager Guan thought for a moment and said, "We're primarily looking to rent. Of course, if you have some of good quality, we could consider buying a few. Also, I don't know if your father mentioned it, but we at Yun Tian are interested in this piece of land..."
But Su Ping interjected directly, "Uncle Guan, I'm aware of that. However, such a significant matter can't be settled quickly. Let's discuss it another time. As for the Pet Beasts, renting is fine, but selling them probably isn't an option."
"Ah..." Manager Guan looked troubled. "Little Su, we are truly sincere. In this suburban area, besides Yun Tian, there are absolutely no other buyers who would offer such a large sum for this vacant land."
Su Ping merely smiled.
Looking at the young man before him, Manager Guan felt a sense of helplessness.
Why did this kid seem even harder to deal with than his wily old father?
"Alright, when you have some free time, let's sit down and discuss this properly. Yun Tian is genuinely sincere. For now, let's talk about renting the Forest Wolves. Your father has worked with us before. For an Ordinary Level Forest Wolf, the rental fee is 300 yuan per day. For them to participate in a Pet Beast battle, it's 500 yuan per battle, win or lose. As for Elite Level Forest Wolves, the minimum rental is 1,000 yuan a day, and the Pet Beast battle price is the same. Of course, every Forest Wolf will be insured..."
However, before Manager Guan could finish, Su Ping cut in again, "Uncle Guan, I'm truly busy today. How about this: in a couple of days, if you haven't sought me out, I'll come find you for such a good deal. I'll visit in person, how does that sound?"
Looking at Su Ping's smiling face, then at his fully equipped state, and smelling the persistent stench emanating from Heart of Woods, Manager Guan, who had waited for over three hours, could only nod.
Having wasted the entire morning and achieved nothing, Manager Guan could already imagine his chairman's fury upon his return.
However, Su Ping really didn't have the leisure to worry about others. After closing the gate, he returned to the living room, took a shower, and then, while stroking Xiao Qing, sank into thought.
Earning money!
That was indeed the most pressing issue.
The reason was simple: Heart of Woods did have some resources. There were a few leftover materials for making Magic Potions, but only enough for four doses. He had used them all up today. To continue producing the Heart of Woods Magic Potion, he needed to find a way to earn money.
Lao Guan had certainly been fair. The offered price was quite good. There was high demand for Ordinary and Elite Level sparring Pet Beasts, so the rates were decent. Su Ping was quite satisfied; after all, he needed to engage his Forest Wolves in Pet Beast battles to properly train them and solidify their foundations. Others paying to use his Pet Beasts meant he could get sparring partners for free and even earn money—no one would refuse such a good deal.
But it still wasn't enough!
The materials for a single dose of Heart of Woods Magic Potion, even at cost, would add up to at least two hundred thousand. If he relied solely on renting out Pet Beasts, it would take a very long time to gather enough for Magic Potions for the twenty-plus Forest Wolves he now had.
However, thinking of the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas in his mind, Su Ping clearly couldn't, and wouldn't, wait that long.
The issue was, how could he get his hands on such a large sum of money?
Indeed, the saying 'poverty for scholars, wealth for warriors' holds true. And in this world, when it comes to Controlling Beasts, every aspect involves spending money!
To cultivate outstanding Pet Beasts, countless resources were needed, flowing away like water.
How to get the money? Su Ping fell into deep thought.

chapters.title: Chapter 12 Pet Beast Fostering, Breeding, and Training Services!
chapters.content:
Chapter 12 - 12 Pet Beast Fostering, Breeding, and Training Services!
Pet Beast Breeding Bases generally have just one business model: selling newborn Pet Beasts.
The Forest Wolf, possessing decent combat strength and being a likable type of Pet Beast, has Elite Peak Racial Potential. Although not the highest, it's still quite good for ordinary people.The source of thɪs content is No(ᴠ)ᴇlFire.nᴇt
However, this path was not one Su Ping wanted to take.
Although his own family's business was precisely this, due to the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, Su Ping still preferred to raise these home-bred Pet Beasts himself. On one hand, having invested his feelings, he found it hard to part with them. On the other hand, he naturally wanted to rapidly improve the Level of the Forest Wolf Catalog.
Comparing the money from selling with the rewards from the Forest Wolf Catalog's World Origin, Su Ping knew which was more important.
After all, making money isn't limited to a single method.
Therefore, there was only one thing to do. Currently, Su Ping's biggest trump card was the perfected recipe for the Heart of Woods Magic Potion. Only this could bring him significant money in a short time.
Of course, Su Ping wouldn't be foolish enough to directly sell the Magic Potion. Given the public order standards of the Dragon Nation, and the countless absolute decrees by the Beast Master Association and the Breeder Association against such actions, robbery and plunder were unlikely to happen directly. However, the high replicability of Magic Potions indeed made them prone to drawing unwanted attention.
After all, this was a precious Magic Potion guaranteed to awaken the Heart of Woods. If he took it to the Breeder Competition, he could probably place in the top five, making Heart of Woods famous worldwide!
It was, however, too early for that; Su Ping preferred to make a fortune quietly.
So, instead of selling the Magic Potion, he could provide foster training. Though it seemed similar, with the end result still granting the precious Skill of Heart of Woods to the Pet Beast, easing into it by increasing the threshold could reduce a lot of unnecessary attention.
A batch of Heart of Woods Magic Potion cost just 200,000 in materials. But if he let wealthy Beast Tamers who had contracted Forest Wolves choose, two million, or even three to four million, wouldn't make them blink. They would even pay up more readily than anyone else!
This truly was an extremely profitable business. It was no wonder those recognized by the Breeder Association as Senior Breeders, or even Breeding Masters, were unimaginably wealthy. Large conglomerates and corporations were eager to support them.
If they managed to develop new Magic Potions or breeding methods, the profits—multiplying tenfold, or even dozens of times more—were indeed tempting.
Thinking of this, a determined glint flashed in Su Ping's eyes. Money was always paramount for beast taming. With money, he could quickly train all twenty-plus of his Forest Wolves, achieving a standard closeness Level with them, and then elevate the Level of the Forest Wolf Catalog even faster.
With money, he could buy Pet Beasts of other basic forms to light up the remaining Catalogs and thus gain rewards. He could even purchase incomplete Magic Potions for corresponding Pet Beasts and perfect them using Catalogue Experience, further training Pet Beasts. He could even achieve the Evolution of Xiao Qing and the rest of the Forest Wolves!
To accomplish all of this, money was undoubtedly needed!
After all, in the current situation, this was the only avenue to make money quickly. As for truly selling that large plot of land next door that his family rented out? Su Ping clearly hadn't considered it.
It was a legacy left by his grandfather. His unreliable father had never entertained the idea, so naturally, he wouldn't either.
With that in mind, Su Ping took out his phone and dialed a number while eating dinner.
「In the center of Linzhou City.」
Inside an office building, a middle-aged man sat behind a solitary desk. He was the editor-in-chief of the Linzhou City Beast Express. He had the typical build of men his age, and his plump cheeks hinted that he must have been quite a looker in his youth. It was just that time had left its marks, along with a shining bald spot. As the editor-in-chief of the largest beast taming network and print media in Linzhou, Li Senlin had a lot on his plate.
However, the ringing of his personal phone still caught his attention. Unsurprisingly, it was his son, Li Shu, who didn't bring him much peace of mind.
"Hello, Dad?"
"What is it? Did your Luozisong (Pine) break another plant pot again?" Li Senlin asked irritably.
"Dad! Piney is very well-behaved now, and it's clearly because your flowerpot is too small."
"Alright, cut the crap. If you have something important to say, say it quickly." Li Senlin's tone was somewhat fiery, which was unavoidable. There was still one advertising slot left for the week, and with the development of machinery and online self-media in recent years, it was normal for some local media to grow more slowly.
"Dad, I'm talking serious business! I'm here to introduce a client to you today!"
Li Senlin was stunned. He glanced suspiciously at his phone; it was indeed his son's number, and the voice was indeed his son's.
What on earth was his son talking about?
This unlucky kid! It's good enough he's not causing trouble, and now he's bringing me business?
"Hehe, I have a classmate who wants to place an ad with you. He's already sent me the deposit."
Actually introducing business?
Old Li raised an eyebrow. "Your classmate? What kind of ad? Listen here, the Linzhou Pet Beast Express caters to the whole of Linzhou City and mainly publicizes positive, uplifting Pet Beast news and advertisements. Those ads seeking high-quality Pet Beasts for breeding can't just be published willy-nilly!"
"It's not those. My buddy, Su Ping, wants to advertise his family's Pet Beast Breeding Base."
"Su Ping?" Before Old Li's eyes, an image of a handsome, composed young man, unlike his peers, slowly formed.
"Yes! His family has a Forest Wolf breeding base by Lingxi River."
Forest Wolf? A gleam couldn't help but appear in Old Li's eyes. Although he was an Elite Level Beast Tamer, he had only barely made the breakthrough. Due to his age, he hadn't passed the Beast Tamer exam back then. He wasn't really a Combat Beast Tamer, but his first Pet Beast was a Forest Wolf. Even now, it was one of his closest family members.
"Fine. It's rare for you to have a reliable friend. What's the ad?"
"I sent it to you, take a look yourself. I'll hang up now; I need to chat with Su Ping about a gathering at their place in a few days."
The call ended. Li Senlin finally saw the text message his son had sent earlier, and he saw his son's classmate's so-called advertisement.
Very soon, however, Li Senlin's expression became extremely strange.
[Heart of Woods Forest Wolf Breeding Base undertakes training and breeding services for Forest Wolves, with a chance to quickly cultivate the cherished Skill 'Heart of Woods' in Forest Wolves! Those interested can call: 138********, or visit to inquire. Heart of Woods Forest Wolf Breeding Base address: South side of Lingxi River Station, outskirts of Linzhou City.]
Looking at this advertisement, Li Senlin was silent for a good while. Not passing the Beast Tamer exam was his lifelong regret.
But, having a Forest Wolf as his first Pet Beast, he had a very special affection for them and naturally knew just how powerful and rare the Skill 'Heart of Woods' was for Forest Wolves. Yet, how many breeding bases specialized in this in the entire Jianghai Province? There were quite a few nationally renowned large-scale breeding bases! Even those breeding bases wouldn't dare to make such a claim!
Indeed, he had thought too highly.
Appearances are deceiving. With his son's character, could he really know any reliable people?
This kind of ad certainly attracted attention, but would anyone actually believe it?
However, after looking at the advertisement fee that was transferred along with the ad, Li Senlin shook his head.
Oh well, it's just an ad, and the kid didn't claim he could definitely help a Forest Wolf comprehend the Skill. Even if it did cause some trouble, it wouldn't have anything to do with them.
With that thought, Li Senlin didn't dwell on it further.
Meanwhile, on the other end, Su Ping finally hung up after an eager chat with Li Shu. The last bit of his money had been sent over as the advertising fee.
He just hoped the ad's effect wouldn't disappoint him.
With that thought in mind, he glanced at the already slightly darkened sky outside and finally perked up.
Those three bottles of the final Heart of Woods Magic Potion must have cooled down by now!
He would keep one bottle as a backup and for seed capital. The remaining two bottles would be for Little Ones and Xiao Qing to try!

chapters.title: Chapter 13: Methods of Cultivating Poison Type Mutations?
chapters.content:
Chapter 13 - 13: Methods of Cultivating Poison Type Mutations?
In the medical room, the fully recovered Little Ones excitedly watched the Magic Potion vessel in Su Ping's hand.
It recognized it. This was the thing that, after their king had consumed it, had instantly made him much stronger. The master of their king, standing right before it, truly hadn't deceived it!ɴᴇᴡ ɴᴏᴠᴇʟ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs ᴀʀᴇ ᴘᴜʙʟɪsʜᴇᴅ ᴏɴ NovᴇlFirᴇ.ɴet
Clearly, Little Ones was not as finicky or intelligent as Old Sha. Or rather, Little Ones, stimulated by Xiao Qing's contemptuous gaze earlier that morning, now craved power above all else.
Su Ping didn't hesitate. He took out the gel-like Heart of Woods Magic Potion and tossed the medicinal-scented, jelly-like substance directly into Little Ones' mouth.
Su Ping had to admit he did have some ulterior motives; otherwise, he wouldn't have let Little Ones try out the effects first.
And the result did not disappoint him.
A low growl sounded, and the scene from that morning reoccurred. However, unlike Old Sha's brief transformation, Little Ones' current change lasted for a full ten minutes.
Emerald starlight scattered, adhering to Little Ones' body.
Even Xiao Qing, looking at this previously insignificant rival, showed a trace of solemnity in its small eyes. It sensed a dangerous aura from this opponent it had once easily defeated!
Indeed, that was the case. The Wood Element Energy in the air began to condense. However, instead of Vine Strangling tendrils appearing, the slowly opening eyes of Little Ones revealed that its body had grown slightly larger.
This is... another Racial Skill of the Forest Wolf, Accelerated Growth?
The next moment, before Su Ping could get a good look at Little Ones' changes, the Forest Wolf Catalog provided feedback and a prompt:
[Associated Pet Beast successfully acquired Skills: Heart of Woods, Accelerated Growth. Level promoted. Catalogue Experience +10 points!]
The experience gained this time was much less. It was unclear if this was because Little Ones' Level was too low, or if the repeated use of the Magic Potion had caused the Forest Wolf data acquired by the Catalog to become repetitive.
However, Su Ping wasn't in the mood to care about that at the moment. His Eye of Truth looked at Little Ones as it was now:
[Forest Wolf (Wild)]
[Current Level: Ordinary Sixth Stage]
[Racial Potential: Elite Tenth Stage]
[Skills: Sunlight Absorption (Beginner), Accelerated Growth (Beginner), Heart of Woods (Beginner)]
Just as expected!
A look of joy appeared in Su Ping's eyes. Little Ones' Level had also advanced, and the degree of promotion was so significant that he hadn't even imagined that a single bottle of this Heart of Woods Magic Potion could directly elevate Little Ones from Ordinary Third Rank to Ordinary Sixth Stage.
As expected of a Magic Potion formula perfected by the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, and as expected of a Magic Potion made by me, the future Breeding Master!
Su Ping was very satisfied and pleased with himself.
Before he could properly indulge in his self-satisfaction, his sleeve was tugged.
As expected, it was Xiao Qing. Seeing this rival it hadn't taken seriously—whose strength and aura had surpassed its own in such a short time—Xiao Qing became restless.
"WHINE... WHINE..."
Looking at his own rather unimpressive Pet Beast, Su Ping laughed, "Don't worry, would you ever be shortchanged?"
He opened the vial of Heart of Woods Magic Potion he had prepared. Xiao Qing, facing the Magic Potion whose pungent odor Old Sha had desperately avoided, swallowed it in one gulp.
The same faint green glow lit up, enveloping Xiao Qing in twinkling points of light. However, Su Ping's breathing became somewhat rapid at this moment.
It would be a lie to say I wasn't nervous; otherwise, I wouldn't have chosen to let Little Ones have a small taste first.
But although Little Ones had succeeded, Xiao Qing was not like the other Forest Wolves. Xiao Qing's Poison Type bloodline mutation already set it distinctly apart from them. The Heart of Woods Magic Potion was primarily Wood Attribute, and whether it would cause any other reactions in Xiao Qing was still unknown.
Su Ping had long prepared for stomach lavage and had medical treatments ready in the medical room. He watched unblinkingly as Xiao Qing slowly began to change.
The same verdant specks of light covered Xiao Qing's body. Waves of power radiated from it.
Time ticked by. Beads of sweat began to form on Su Ping's forehead. Little Ones had taken ten minutes to consume and digest the Magic Potion. However, fifteen minutes had now passed for Xiao Qing. Yet, the verdant light spots on Xiao Qing not only showed no signs of fading, but their color gradually deepened. The original emerald green transformed into a darker, forest green. It somewhat resembled the original color of the Heart of Woods Magic Potion.
Su Ping grew restless. He kept his Eye of Truth almost constantly active, his gaze firmly locked on Xiao Qing. However, even the Eye of Truth could not completely analyze Xiao Qing's current condition. Fortunately, the life-monitoring instrument to the side showed Xiao Qing's vital signs remained perfectly stable, allowing Su Ping to breathe a small sigh of relief.
Finally, just when Su Ping was growing quite impatient, the dark green specks of light seemed to suddenly complete their settling. A howl, neither loud nor retaining the immature, whimpering quality of its previous cries, resounded in the medical room.
The light spots disappeared, and Xiao Qing reappeared before Su Ping.
However, this time, before Su Ping could properly use the Eye of Truth to examine Xiao Qing's changes, the Forest Wolf Catalog was a step ahead, providing the most unique feedback!
[Successfully enabled the associated Pet Beast to acquire the Skill: Mutated Poison Wood Heart. Its Level increased, Racial Limit raised. Catalogue Experience +50 points!]
[Preliminary analysis of the Poison Type Mutation in the Forest Wolf has been conducted. Consume 50,000 Experience Points from this Catalog to forcibly analyze the cause of the Forest Wolf's poison bloodline mutation and obtain the Cultivation method for this Mutation.]
Feeling the feedback from the Forest Wolf Catalog within the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, even Su Ping blinked, momentarily unable to process it all.
Isn't this a bit too much information to take in at once?
However, previous feedback from the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas had mentioned it was possible to analyze the cause of Xiao Qing's mutation. There was a certain chance of deciphering the bloodline mutation's cause by spending daily time with Xiao Qing to gain Experience Points. Su Ping hadn't expected this day to arrive so quickly.
Although the glaring cost of 50,000 Catalogue Experience Points is quite steep, it's still something to look forward to, isn't it? If I could master the Cultivation method for the Forest Wolf's Poison Type Mutation, then my future expertise in the Cultivation and research regarding the Heart of Woods might truly make me, as my unreliable old father said, easily number one in Jianghai Province, or even the entire Dragon Nation!
However, 50,000 Experience Points are still a long way off.
Suppressing his excitement, Su Ping was even more eager to observe Xiao Qing's changes after consuming the Heart of Woods Magic Potion.

chapters.title: Chapter 14 Mutated Skill: Heart of the Poison Wood!
chapters.content:
Chapter 14 - 14 Mutated Skill: Heart of the Poison Wood!
Mutated Skill.
This was something the school had taught as well. Some Pet Beasts, due to resources, growth environment, or even personality reasons, experience mutations in the skills they are supposed to awaken. These Mutated Skills can be strong or weak and cannot be generalized. And now, Xiao Qing was undoubtedly one such example.
Eye of Truth, upon inspecting Xiao Qing at this moment, had already provided Su Ping with feedback.
[Mutated Forest Wolf (Contracted)]
[Current Level: Ordinary Fourth Stage]
[Racial Potential: Commander Third Rank]
[Skills: Sunlight Absorption (Beginner), Poison Vine Strangulation (Beginner), Mutated Poison Wood Heart (Beginner)]
Even though he was prepared, Su Ping couldn't help but draw in a sharp breath. The breakthrough to an Ordinary Fourth Stage was not surprising. In fact, this breakthrough was actually one rank lower than Little One's breakthrough. However, that was clearly not the crux of the issue. The real key point lay in the leap in Racial Potential!
Forest Wolves had the Racial Potential for the Elite Tier! Even Old Sha might have had all sorts of opportunities in the past to break through his Racial Potential and become the Commander Level he was today. But when observed through the Eye of Truth, Old Sha's Racial Potential, in fact, had not increased. This meant that Old Sha's breakthrough and advancement were a result of personal fortune, not a transformation of the race. Even if Old Sha had offspring, it wouldn't affect the race.
But Xiao Qing at this moment was different. After consuming the Heart of Woods and somehow completing the mutation, its Racial Potential had improved even further! Even without Evolution, even without needing to consume precious resources and Magic Potions, as long as Xiao Qing grew normally and wasn't too lazy, then in the future, it could break through to Commander Level!
For a moment, Su Ping fell into deep thought.
Was the effect of the Heart of Woods so ridiculous?
Looking at it this way, if someone really did come to him for training, could he set his prices quite a bit higher?
However, Su Ping also understood that the effect of the Heart of Woods Magic Potion was one aspect, but Xiao Qing's incredible talent was another. Although there was no change in the skill level displayed on the panel, through the Soul Contract, he could clearly feel that Xiao Qing's Poison Vine Strangulation had greatly improved.
The gap in proficiency between each skill level was considerable. This was also the main reason why Beast Tamers and their Pet Beasts had to constantly practice and cultivate them. And certainly, the improvement in the might of the attack-oriented Poison Vine Strangulation was a primary direction for enhancement.
It was a pity that there was no suitable opponent to battle right now. Shaking his head, Su Ping finally turned the Eye of Truth towards Xiao Qing's main mutation: this rare and precious Mutated Skill!
[Mutated Poison Wood Heart (Beginner): A special Mutated Skill that combines the characteristics of the Poison Type with the Wood Element's Heart of Woods. It enhances the activation effect, power, and casting time of Poison Type and Wood Element skills. Additionally, it can absorb the essence of plant power to restore itself and can also use Poison System Resources to accelerate its own Realm and the Skill Proficiency improvement of this specific skill.]
Su Ping blinked, and the effect of the Eye of Truth vanished. Yet, he didn't snap back to reality for quite some time. Even though the school had said that Mutated Skills could either become more powerful and strange or weaker, without a doubt, Xiao Qing's "Mutated Poison Wood Heart" was clearly one of the mutations that had become more powerful. But Su Ping had never imagined it would be so powerful.
Other aspects aside, the fact that it could enhance the power of Poison Type skills—an effect analogous to the Heart of Woods' general enhancing properties for its own element—was already remarkable. However, the subsequent ability listed was what Su Ping truly hadn't anticipated.
Could it really speed up the improvement of one's Realm and Skill Proficiency by consuming Poison System Resources and related materials?
Although Su Ping had previously thought about making money to buy some Poison System Resources for Xiao Qing to consume and fully exploit its Poison Type abilities, there was a certain risk involved. Why are Poison Type Pet Beasts so rare? It's because often, the use of Poison Type Pet Beasts and Poison System Resources can be fatal to the pets if slightly overdosed.
However, now with this Mutated Poison Wood Heart, does it mean that Xiao Qing has gained an additional layer of insurance?
At this thought, Su Ping's eyes burst with an excited flame. He picked up Xiao Qing, still intoxicated by its newfound strength, and planted a kiss on the greenish wolf's head.
As expected, the price of a Pet Beast with a mutated bloodline far exceeds that of others, and this was precisely why. With Pet Beasts whose bloodlines have mutated, no one knows their limits, and they can sometimes give their owners unexpected and delightful surprises—like now, for instance.
Thinking of this, Su Ping longed even more for the Forest Wolf Catalog's mutation that requires a whopping 50,000 points of Catalog Experience—the reason behind the Forest Wolf's poison bloodline mutation.
All of a sudden, Su Ping, feeling somewhat worn out from making three batches of Heart of Woods Magic Potions, seemed to have regained his energy. He directly took Little One, who had returned to its normal size after retracting the 'Accelerated Growth' skill, and headed outside the manor's forest.ɴᴇᴡ ɴᴏᴠᴇʟ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs ᴀʀᴇ ᴘᴜʙʟɪsʜᴇᴅ ᴏɴ NovᴇlFirenᴇt
Putting other affairs aside for the moment, he decided to properly train Xiao Qing in combat and practice its skills. And he would ensure the other twenty-plus Forest Wolves bonded with him to the required level; once they did, upgrading the Forest Wolf Catalog would become much faster!
Speaking of which, the Forest Wolf Catalog had already reached (222/500) Experience Points after the breakthroughs of Xiao Qing and Little One. It was a big step closer to reaching Forest Wolf Catalog LV: 2!
Watching the wolf pack lounging lazily under the twilight sun, led by Old Sha, Su Ping's spirits lifted, and he called out to the wolves, "For Heart of Woods to become the world's number one Pet Beast Breeding Base! For me to become the top Breeding Master in Dragon Nation! Forest Wolves, give me your love tackle!"
"AWOO..."
"AWOO..."
The only ones to respond were Xiao Qing and Little One; the rest, including Old Sha, looked at their young master with a gaze usually reserved for the mentally challenged.
Laughing, Su Ping didn't mind and pulled out some tree fruit from the Beast Taming Space that he had prepared earlier. The Forest Wolves had their main meals provided automatically by a feeder. However, these little ones liked the dessert after dinner, which was clearly Su Ping's whim.
Unsurprisingly, the quick-to-adapt Forest Wolves, seeing the several large tubs of snacks and fruits, promptly came running over, shamelessly ready to sit in rows and share the treats.

chapters.title: Chapter 15: The Beast Tamer Who Scoops Poop, The First Customer!
chapters.content:
Chapter 15 - 15: The Beast Tamer Who Scoops Poop, The First Customer!
The clear sky stretched endlessly, and the boundless sunlight poured down. The midday sun penetrated the leaves, creating dappled traces on the ground.
The Forest Wolves were either chasing and playing with each other or lazing under the trees, basking in the sun without becoming overly hot.
There were some exceptions, however, namely Xiao Qing and Little Ones.
In the sunlit jungle, the two little ones were truly using Skills to battle and practice.
After all, improving Skill Proficiency Levels was one of the main ways to enhance strength.
As for Old Sha, he watched over the two little ones to prevent any accidents.
The entire Heart of Woods Pet Beast Breeding Base seemed exceptionally light-hearted.
There was only one person, and he was the only human in this Pet Beast Breeding Base.
At the moment, Su Ping was not only unrelaxed but also quite speechless.
Under the scorching sun, he held a pair of specially made tweezers. The heat caused beads of sweat to form at his temples.
Despite this, he still wore a mask, crouched to one side with tweezers in hand and a bamboo basket on his back.
An indescribable stench wafted from in front of him.
Although it was not as overpowering as when making a Magic Potion, it was definitely enough to make people cover their noses and keep their distance.Thᴇ link to the origɪn of this information rᴇsts ɪn No(ᴠ)ᴇlFire.nᴇt
After picking up a pile of wolf feces that looked like wood shavings and tossing it into the bamboo basket, Su Ping sighed behind his mask.
It wasn't because of the foul stench of the wolf feces. After all, he had grown accustomed to it after so many days, and the results weren't bad.
He didn't know why the Forest Wolves bonded faster with him when he smelled of their feces, but a few days of experimentation had proven it true.
He was extremely grateful that his own Pet Beast Breeding Base was a haven for Forest Wolves, which were pack creatures.
Within a wolf pack, there is a Wolf King, whose dominance over the pack is unquestionable.
And since Old Sha, as the Wolf King, had a relationship with him akin to family, the other Forest Wolves naturally followed suit under Old Sha's influential and authoritative rule.
Added to that was the Su Family's recorded knowledge of Forest Wolf habits.
Over these past few days, all the Forest Wolves, except for the few at the Elite Level, had reached the standard intimacy level with him, and the Forest Wolf Catalog had included them.
Although these ordinary Forest Wolves, with no particular highlights, contributed very limited experience to his Forest Wolf Catalog, the time spent with them and the experience gained in the past few days had also reached just over four hundred.
Approximately, in a few more days, or after reaching the standard intimacy level with those few Elite Level wolves, I can probably upgrade the Forest Wolf Catalog to LV2.
He sighed purely because he was somewhat distressed about his family's money.
Li Shu was right. Who even looks at local news these days? The effect of local media advertising is just too poor.
After so many days, only a few people had called to inquire.
And as soon as they heard it was a Pet Beast Breeding Base with no reputation, run by someone who didn't even have a Junior Breeder certificate, the conversations decisively ended.
So, Su Ping felt he had been hasty.
The advertisement was pointless. If it weren't for that last sliver of hope, I would have used up the last bottle of Magic Potion and called it quits.
Fortunately, however, besides the Forest Wolf Catalog, he hadn't been without other gains these past few days.
The most direct improvement, among others, was the advancement in his Realm.
The advancement in a Beast Tamer's Realm mainly depended on feedback from improving Contracted Beasts, using special resources, and the most common foundation: meditation.
This aspect, besides one's natural Beast Taming Talent, was also a test of a Beast Tamer's Ability.
And Su Ping had much to say in this regard.
His meditation progress had always been the best among the six. He didn't know if it was due to his two lifetimes of experience or the hidden effects of the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas.
Moreover, from his knowledge of Controlling Beasts, he knew that after contracting a soul-bound Pet Beast, the effects and progress of meditation would be much faster.
Looking back now, it indeed seems so.
In just a few days of meditation, Su Ping had advanced from an Ordinary Fourth Stage to an Ordinary Fifth Stage.
Xiao Qing had also made some progress. Although it didn't advance a Level, its strength had improved considerably.
Shaking his head, he placed this batch of wolf feces in the forest. Forest Wolf feces promoted plant growth, making them a sort of low-cost special resource.
It was precisely because of this that the plants in his forest grew so well.
When I become wealthy in the future, should I consider Cultivating some Plant-based Pet Beasts? After all, the Forest Wolves provide such good conditions right here.
Su Ping pondered with wry amusement amidst his struggles.
Unfortunately, as soon as this thought emerged, Su Ping sighed.
It's the same problem again—no money!
Endowed with dragon-slaying skills but unrecognized, the frustrated Su Ping, a great Beast Tamer, finished cleaning up the mess. He had no mood to play with these "silly dogs" and headed straight toward the manor.
However, just as he arrived, he heard a DING-DONG, DING-DONG sound from the door.
It was urgent yet prolonged, clearly being pressed continuously.
Is it Manager Guan again? Or perhaps one of my classmates, who, except for Li Shu, hasn't bothered to keep in touch?
Su Ping didn't bother guessing and went straight to the door.
"I'm coming, I'm coming! Stop pressing it!"
When the door opened, the person who appeared before him made Su Ping pause.
It was a woman who looked to be in her twenties, slightly older than him, wearing sunglasses. Even so, Su Ping could still make out her snow-white complexion and the suppressed anger on her cheeks.
Of course, there was also the way she instinctively covered her delicate nose.
"You are...?"
Before Su Ping could finish his question, the woman had already started berating him.
"What kind of Pet Beast Breeding Base is this? How do you even do business? I've been pressing this doorbell for nearly an hour! I can't believe I actually found this godforsaken place..."
Faced with the woman's anger, undoubtedly built up from pressing the doorbell under the scorching sun for so long, Su Ping quickly interrupted her.
"Um, are you here to train your Pet Beast's Skills?"
"Duh! Why else would I come to this godforsaken corner?"
With that, the woman took off her sunglasses, revealing a face that even Su Ping found quite stunning.
What a beautiful young lady.
Too bad,
Su Ping thought with regret.
Such a pretty young lady, but her brain doesn't seem to work too well.
"I'm sorry, I was just taking care of the Pet Beasts. Have you been waiting long? Did no one respond when you rang the doorbell?"
"What do you think? Did you think I was lying?"
Su Ping quickly waved his hands. He could understand the frustration of waiting a long time for someone to open the door, but...
Su Ping looked conflicted, unsure how to put it.
Instead, it was the young lady before him who, looking suspiciously at this man reeking of wolf feces and his expression, asked, "What is it?"
Su Ping pursed his lips before finally saying, "If you were really in a hurry, you could have called the number on the signboard or the advertisement."
The woman opened her mouth, then looked up at the phone number on the signboard and fell into an awkward silence.
At that moment, Su Ping felt somewhat certain.
This might be my first, and only, walk-in customer... and her brain might not be working too well.

chapters.title: Chapter 16: A Wager? The Terrifying Profits of Pet Beast Cultivation!
chapters.content:
Chapter 16 - 16: A Wager? The Terrifying Profits of Pet Beast Cultivation!
Under the sunlight, the entrance of the Heart of Woods was extremely quiet.ʀᴇᴀᴅ ʟᴀᴛᴇsᴛ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs ᴀᴛ ɴovᴇl(F)ɪre.ɴet
Only the sound of two or three chirping cicadas could be heard.
In the end, Su Ping broke the silence, "Please come in and take a seat."
The girl's slightly flushed face finally looked a bit better as she entered the reception room.
Su Ping took the fastest bath of his life before stepping through the door.
This time, the girl's eyes lit up.
Despite a poor first impression, Su Ping's reappearance surprised her.
He had a handsome appearance, infused with a sense of steadiness uncommon for his age.
Compared to the unbearably arrogant, so-called campus heartthrobs and young elites at the Magic Capital Beast Taming Academy, he was far more pleasant to look at.
Even on the street, he was the type of person she would glance at several times.
But obviously, she wasn't here to admire handsome men.
Although the sight of the handsome young man had somewhat soothed the impatience brought on by her long wait, she still said with a cold expression, "Enough, can your facility cultivate the Forest Wolf's 'Heart of Woods' skill? Call out your Breeder; I'll talk to him."
Su Ping sat down directly. "Let me introduce myself. I am Su Ping, the owner and Beast Tamer of the Heart of Woods Pet Beast Breeding Base."
The girl was stunned for a moment. Then, her eyebrows knitted slightly, her expression turned cold, and she even revealed a hint of mockery, "Does that also include being a janitor and a poop scooper?"
Without waiting for Su Ping's response, she stood up and said, "Never mind, I'll take my leave."
He had anticipated all of this. In a world where people judge by appearance, it was unfair to an excellent Breeder and genius Beast Tamer like himself.
But there was no helping it; a penny can stump a hero, as the saying goes.
Having finally encountered a customer who didn't seem to have all her wits about her, Su Ping couldn't just let her walk away.
"You don't believe me?"
If the young man before her hadn't been so pleasing to the eye, she obviously wouldn't have looked back. After hearing his words, the woman turned around. "Judging by your age, you must have just graduated, right? Do you even know what the Heart of Woods skill is?"
Before Su Ping could respond, she continued, "Heart of Woods is a passive, amplifying skill. It's a Sub-Rank Skill of the Super-Rank Skill 'Heart of Elements,' which only Wood Element Elemental Type Pet Beasts have a chance to comprehend on their own.
Other Wood Element Pet Beasts, let alone Forest Wolves—even Plant-based Pet Beasts with Racial Potential like the Life Ancient Tree that have reached Monarch Level rarely possess it.
Although Linzhou is the birthplace of Forest Wolf breeding, when it comes to cultivating the Heart of Woods, I didn't hold out much hope to begin with. Sorry for the disturbance."
After speaking, the woman shook her head, a self-deprecating, almost amused smile on her face.
However, Su Ping looked at the woman, his expression unwavering, still calm and confidently composed. He said calmly, "Why not give it a try?"
The woman was taken aback. She glanced at this young Beast Tamer who had clearly just graduated.
Meeting her scrutinizing gaze, Su Ping smiled slightly. "If you're willing to give it a try, as long as the Heart of Woods isn't cultivated, you won't have to spend a single penny on any preliminary fees or material costs!"
At this statement, the woman was truly shocked.
Typically, for Pet Beast Breeding Bases, especially those that specialize in skill Cultivation, there are two crucial conditions.
First and foremost, the Pet Beast's safety must be guaranteed.
Generally, this isn't a major concern, because when a Pet Beast is in danger, its Beast Tamer can sense it and stop the Cultivation at any time.
Moreover, contracts usually include a clause stating that if a Pet Beast dies, not only will the breeding base be shut down, but the Breeder might even face prison time.
Therefore, not just anyone can become a Breeder. Without a certificate from the Breeder Association, it was understandable that people wouldn't trust Su Ping.
Secondly, before Cultivation, regardless of success or failure, the client Beast Tamer has to bear certain costs.
After all, even those few Breeding Masters cannot guarantee success every time.
A breeding base isn't a charity; expecting to pay only upon success is unrealistic.
Yet, the young man before her dared to make such a statement.
Is he planning to use me as a guinea pig?
Yet, at this moment, she hesitated. There was an inexplicably convincing and steady aura about the young man before her.
And she did indeed have a compelling reason for her Pet Beast to comprehend the Heart of Woods.
Of course, perhaps it was also because her way of thinking wasn't quite the same as an ordinary person's?
Besides, she didn't believe that someone running such a large breeding base wouldn't understand the consequences of causing trouble.
Thus, her interest was piqued.
"Qin Xiaoxue!"
Su Ping, surprised by the pale hand extended towards him, reached out and shook it gently.
Qin Xiaoxue, however, remained direct. "Since you're the one who made the offer, don't say I'm taking advantage of you. If it's not successful, and Woodhead doesn't learn Heart of Woods after the Cultivation, you won't get a single penny!
If you succeed, besides the agreed-upon price, I'll grant you one request, whatever it may be. How about that wager?"
Su Ping's reply was equally straightforward.
He immediately printed out the contract.
Qin Xiaoxue might have seemed scatterbrained, but she was meticulous when it came to reading contracts.
She pointed to a section. "I just said, on top of the price to be paid, I can agree to one of your conditions. But here, the Cultivation fee is only three million five hundred thousand!"
Su Ping just smiled. "You're the first person to trust me. If it fails, the materials are free, and I don't need any other conditions from you."
Su Ping, having lived two lives, was worldly-wise. He could tell that this Miss Qin before him was likely no ordinary person.
Indeed, not many would bat an eye at such a Cultivation price.
But right now, he just needed money and didn't want to deal with unnecessary complications.
This price was already making his conscience prickle.
A cost of two hundred thousand for nearly twenty times the profit.
While for a Beast Tamer who could easily afford this price, it was absolutely a bargain, Su Ping, conducting this kind of business for the first time, still felt somewhat uncomfortable.
After all, becoming a qualified, cold-hearted capitalist also required a certain talent.
Qin Xiaoxue looked at Su Ping with a complicated expression. Her promise, in truth, was of a value that couldn't be measured by a mere three million five hundred thousand, let alone thirty-five million.
However, this very young Beast Tamer had left an extraordinarily unusual impression on her.
Consequently, Qin Xiaoxue found herself irrationally harboring an unrealistic fantasy.
Could he really do it?

chapters.title: Chapter 17: The Top Match Forest Wolf! Linzhou Has Such a Breeder?
chapters.content:
Chapter 17 - 17: The Top Match Forest Wolf! Linzhou Has Such a Breeder?
Su Ping's father, his family's unreliable old man, had once told him: "Women will only hinder your future in Controlling Beasts. But rich women are different; they'll buy you a better Pet Beast."
Su Ping acknowledged the truth in his father's words.
As for Qin Xiaoxue before him, Su Ping believed in his judgment. Her background was likely anything but ordinary.
However, after seeing the Forest Wolf she called 'Woodhead,' Su Ping knew he regretted it.
He regretted having refused Qin Xiaoxue's offer to name a condition, just to show off.
Forest Wolves differed from one another.
For instance, the one following them.
This was an adult Forest Wolf as tall as Su Ping's chest—a giant.
Uncommonly majestic, its eyes were filled with disdain and arrogance for everything around it.
The Eye of Truth gave Su Ping the most direct understanding.
[Forest Wolf (Contracted - Others)]
[Current Level: Elite Tenth Stage]
[Racial Potential: Elite Tenth Stage]
[Skills: Sunlight Absorption (Proficient), Vine Strangling (Proficient), Self-Healing (Beginner), Accelerated Growth (Proficient), Armor of Wood (Proficient), Wood Spike (Proficient), Forest Concealment Technique (Beginner)]
Not only had this Forest Wolf mastered all its Racial Skills, but it also possessed three additional ones.
Especially the Forest Concealment Technique. While its rarity didn't match Heart of Woods, it wasn't far off.
What kind of luxury, top-tier Forest Wolf is this?
Thɪs NovᴇlFirᴇ.ɴet
The cost of raising such a beast could probably buy several Commander Level Pet Beast cubs.
That's just too wasteful!
However, Su Ping also understood something. This Miss Qin before him was by no means fixated on just the Forest Wolf; rather, she had already prepared which Evolutionary path the Forest Wolf would take.
Su Ping shook his head, showed Qin Xiaoxue around his breeding facility, and explained the final details, "The Cultivation will take about five days. During this time, as the Pet Beast's owner, you may only see it once a day. If you're worried, you can stay next door. If you sense through the Soul Contract that Woodhead is in any danger, you can come over immediately."
Listening to Su Ping's detailed arrangements, Qin Xiaoxue nodded. She always believed in trusting those she employed and not using those she distrusted.
After signing the contract and settling all arrangements, she instructed 'Woodhead' to behave and then left directly.
Seeing the mechanical sports car summoned and then vanishing in a flash, Su Ping felt a tinge of envy.
But looking at the proud 'Woodhead' beside him, Su Ping revealed a hint of a smile.
For him, simply administering a Magic Potion to the Pet Beast would be considered completing the Cultivation.
However, now that he finally had a test subject, Su Ping naturally wanted to experiment. For example, could he incorporate a Forest Wolf contracted by someone else into his own Forest Wolf Catalog?
Although it didn't mean much; after all, raising Experience Points would mainly depend on nurturing it in the future.
But there was no harm in trying.
Seeing Su Ping's beaming smile, Woodhead lifted its proud head and glanced with disdain at this weak human Beast Tamer trusted by its owner.
As Su Ping extended his hand, it instinctively tried to evade. However, without it noticing, a majestic wolf exuding Wolf King Majesty suddenly appeared beside Su Ping. Woodhead shuddered and didn't dare to dodge again.
"Good boy! Behave!" Su Ping said.
「...」
Qin Xiaoxue, who had left, obviously didn't know that her Pet Beast had become someone's test subject.
Now, that extremely mobile mechanical sports car, even slightly levitating due to magnetic suspension, had left the suburbs of Linzhou City and arrived at the city center.
It stopped in front of a central building.
This building was located in the best area of Linzhou, yet no one dared to poke their nose into its affairs.
This was because, atop the building, a golden Divine Dragon coiled and hovered.
To one side were five large characters:
Beast Master Association!
Next to these large characters was a line of smaller print:
Jianghai Province Branch.
Having put the sports car back into her Beast Taming Space, Qin Xiaoxue's face turned ice cold. She rode the elevator to the top floor, arrived in front of an office, and kicked the door open.
BANG!
Behind the large desk in the spacious office sat a very well-maintained old man. He was startled by the dull thud of the door being kicked open, so much that the tea in his cup spilled out.
Looking at the spilled tea leaves, the old man winced. His gaze, filled with unrestrained icy killing intent, fixed on the newcomer. However, it softened in an instant, and he coughed a few times, "Xiao Xue, why are you back? Didn't you go to Shuhua City?"
Qin Xiaoxue sneered and sat down on the sofa opposite him, crossed her legs, and said nothing, just watching the old man.
Faced with his granddaughter's murderous gaze, the old man's eyelids began to flutter rapidly.
Finally, as the old man grew restless, Qin Xiaoxue spoke, "Qin Erlong, you're quite something now, helping outsiders scam your own granddaughter?!"
The old man blinked. Seeing Qin Xiaoxue suddenly stand up and fiercely slap her hand against his desk, spilling more tea from the cup, he quickly said before he had time to fret, "What happened?"
"Tell me! What benefits did that damn Wolf Den Breeding Facility give you? They took three million from me, not only failed to teach Woodhead 'Accelerated Casting,' but also made my Woodhead have diarrhea for three days! Qin Erlong, if you don't give me an explanation today, I'll go back to the Magic Capital and have the old madam see justice done!"
Seeing his granddaughter's fury, and as if he thought of something even more terrifying, the old man quickly said, his voice filled with righteous indignation, "What? That Old Liu! How is he managing his duties as Vice President of the Breeder Association, recommending such unreliable people? Xiao Xue, you wait! Watch your grandfather get justice for you! I'll have that damn Wolf Den Breeding Facility shut down!"
With that, the old man immediately reached for the phone, clearly about to make a call.
But Qin Xiaoxue snatched it directly from him, saying, "You old coot, do you take me for some spoiled brat who bullies people? We signed a contract before the Cultivation. Your granddaughter isn't someone who can't afford to lose or welch on a deal.
"What's the point of calling them now? If word gets back to the Magic Capital, do you want me to become a laughingstock?"
The old man wore a bitter expression and said helplessly, "Then what do we do now? The Evolution path for the 'Crown Wolf Emperor' you want to cultivate requires the Forest Wolf to master eight Skills just to begin. Now..."
Qin Xiaoxue hummed proudly, "On my way back, I found another breeding facility. They claim they can help my Woodhead cultivate 'Heart of Woods.' Don't worry about that for now. You introduced the last one, so you should at least offer some compensation for my emotional distress, right?"
The old man's eyelids began to twitch wildly. Sure enough, Qin Xiaoxue immediately noticed the fragrance of the tea in his cup.
Just the scent was enough to clear her head and soothe her heart.
"Tsk, tea from the Spiritual Ancient Tea Tree!"
The old man chuckled awkwardly and hastily tried to put away the nearby jade box. However, facing his granddaughter's icy stare, he reluctantly offered it.
"Hmph, that's more like it. I'll let it go this time."
After his granddaughter left, satisfied with her shakedown, the old man breathed a sigh of relief. Then, his brows furrowed slightly once more.
What did my dear granddaughter just say?
She found a breeding facility that could help a Forest Wolf comprehend Heart of Woods?
Isn't that utter nonsense?
After giving it some thought, the old man still picked up the phone.
Is there really such a breeding facility and Breeder in Linzhou? Why haven't I heard of it before?
My granddaughter, so hot-tempered yet actually a bit straightforward and simple... she hasn't been tricked, has she?

chapters.title: Chapter 18 Catalog Upgrade! Forest Wolf LV2!
chapters.content:
Chapter 18 - 18 Catalog Upgrade! Forest Wolf LV2!
"Uncle Guan, I've really been quite busy these past few days. In a couple of days, I'll definitely come by personally," Su Ping said helplessly in the reception room to an even more helpless Manager Guan.
"Xiao Ping, look at this. How many days has it been? It's summer vacation now, and aside from students like you graduating, quite a few Beast Tamers from various places have also returned to Linzhou. Business has been good lately, and we're really running short of Low-level Pet Beasts. How about this? I'll take the initiative and increase the previous price by twenty percent. How's that for a deal?"
If this had been before, Manager Guan's offer would have really tempted Su Ping. After all, aside from the money, it would also allow his Pet Beasts to gain real battle experience, which was beneficial no matter what.
But these days, he simply didn't have the time. He had devoted all his energy to Woodhead.
This was, after all, a deal worth several million.
How much could leasing Pet Beasts possibly earn him?
Seeing Su Ping's steadfast attitude, Manager Guan felt helpless.
Was he really here for something as trivial as leasing Pet Beasts?
Tianyun Group's influence in Jianghai Province was significant.
Leasing some Low-level Pet Beasts shouldn't be a problem, right?
The reason he was maintaining this relationship with Su Ping was to butter him up for the subsequent purchase of this land deed.
Alas, this kid seemed to be more troublesome than Su Anyong.
Manager Guan had a premonition that it would be quite difficult for his company's chairman to achieve his goal smoothly.
Shaking his head, Manager Guan could only leave in resignation.
However, just as he stepped out of the Heart of Woods, Manager Guan saw a woman wearing sunglasses also coming in. Manager Guan nodded in recognition, realizing it was a guest who had been staying at their place these past few days, and he didn't think much of it.
The person who had arrived was none other than Qin Xiaoxue.
Qin Xiaoxue, despite her carefree personality, was not actually foolish. To leave her Pet Beast so far away, she, as the owner, wouldn't be able to respond in time if something happened. Besides, it was merely a matter of a few days.
And it must be said that the rural area around Lingxi River, although not as convenient as the city center, possessed a kind of bucolic beauty that's hard to come by.
"I didn't expect your small patch of land to be so in demand, is it?" Qin Xiaoxue said to Su Ping with a laugh.
Indeed, Qin Xiaoxue had been visiting frequently these past few days. Although she would only see Woodhead once a day, strictly adhering to the requirements, she spent quite a long time lingering in the Heart of Woods. Su Ping had grown somewhat familiar with this mysterious young lady of esteemed background. However, today he really wasn't in the mood to entertain her properly.
The reason was simple: in the days he spent on Cultivation, aside from his time with Woodhead, Su Ping had not been idle with the other Forest Wolves at all!
Since the moment Su Ping had activated the Forest Wolf Catalog and taken full control over the Heart of Woods, so many days had passed. And as of today, all of his Forest Wolves, except for one last one, had reached the required intimacy level and had been added to the Forest Wolf Catalog. At the same time, the Experience Points on the Forest Wolf Catalog were at 499/500!
In other words, if he spent one more day with these Forest Wolves, the Forest Wolf Catalog would be able to level up to LV2! Alternatively, if that last one—the highest-Level one apart from Old Sha, the one that had reached Elite Ninth Order—managed to achieve the required intimacy Level, then Su Ping, who had been longing and yearning for this day, could finally fulfill his desires.
At this moment, how could he possibly care about Qin Xiaoxue?
If it weren't for the fact that he'd known Uncle Guan for many years, that Uncle Guan had a good relationship with his father, and that he needed to give him some face, Su Ping wouldn't have even spared ten minutes to deal with him.
"I'm busy today. Just take a look at your Woodhead and then head back," Su Ping said, waving his hand dismissively. Then, without paying further attention to Qin Xiaoxue, he dashed toward the forest.
Looking doubtfully at Su Ping, who seemed even more hurried than herself, Qin Xiaoxue wasn't bothered. She glanced at Woodhead through the monitor. These past few days, Woodhead had been frolicking in the woods with the Wolf Pack, showing no intention of training—just eating and drinking. Not only had it not been mistreated, but Qin Xiaoxue even felt the little fellow might have gained a few pounds.
Perhaps it was just her imagination?
Shaking her head, Qin Xiaoxue didn't bother further. She had previously signed a contract with Su Ping, so if he failed to fulfill it, it was his loss. All she needed to ensure was that her Woodhead hadn't sustained any injuries.
With Su Ping gone, there was clearly no point for her to stay, so after looking for a while, she went back to the adjacent Yuntian Resort. Compared to Su Ping's Beast Taming base, the resort's environment and scenery were much nicer. When she had nothing better to do, Qin Xiaoxue indeed liked to take a few extra rounds there.
However, she had never visited the main building—a huge structure occupying a large area, which also housed the main Pet Beast battle arena. Today, with nothing particular to do, Qin Xiaoxue casually walked towards it.
In the main building's arena, there were public battle spaces where Beast Tamers of various strengths were engaging in Pet Beast battles. However, to Qin Xiaoxue, they all seemed rather amateurish. Most were either graduates who hadn't undergone systematic Beast Taming and combat training or prospective Beast Tamers who had not passed professional assessments. Compared to the battles at the Magic Capital Advanced Beast-Taming Academy, these were far inferior.ɴᴇᴡ ɴᴏᴠᴇʟ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs ᴀʀᴇ ᴘᴜʙʟɪsʜᴇᴅ ᴏɴ
Qin Xiaoxue had no interest in such fights.
However, just as she was about to leave the building, she paused, her peripheral vision, behind sunglasses, glancing towards the side. The middle-aged man who had just been with Su Ping was now servilely following a woman. The woman was exceptionally beautiful, and even Qin Xiaoxue had to admit that she exuded something known as feminine charm. Most importantly, the woman's aura... Qin Xiaoxue thought for a moment and found a comparison: it was somewhat similar to the aura her father exuded.
Seemingly noticing Qin Xiaoxue's scrutiny, the woman turned her head and glanced over, then didn't give it another thought. Qin Xiaoxue, however, furrowed her brows tighter after seeing the woman's face; she suddenly felt a sense of familiarity.
But before she could take a closer look, the woman entered a private elevator. After the woman went in, the middle-aged man, standing at the elevator entrance, whispered, "Chairwoman, Su Ping still disagrees and shows no intention of relenting."
As the elevator closed, the voice disappeared as well.
Qin Xiaoxue stopped in her tracks and removed her sunglasses, her deep black eyebrows furrowing even tighter.
Chairwoman? Did that man's visit to Su Ping have something to do with her?
And that woman... she looked so familiar!
Remembering the man's words, Qin Xiaoxue pondered for a moment before taking out her phone.
Meanwhile, Su Ping, obviously oblivious to these events and in no mind to concern himself with them, rode atop the last Elite Ninth Order Forest Wolf, affectionately feeding it the canned meat he had made according to the "Breeding Manual"—a favorite of the Forest Wolves.
Finally, under Su Ping's meticulous care, a message appeared in the Forest Wolf Catalog of the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas in his mind:
[Adult Forest Wolf discovered, intimacy level meets requirements, Catalog Experience +15!]
[This Forest Wolf is an adult. Subsequently, each day spent with it will yield +1 Catalog Experience for the Forest Wolf Catalog!]
[Forest Wolf Catalog Experience Points: 514/500! Experience Points meet the Catalog upgrade requirements. Would you like to upgrade?]

chapters.title: Chapter 19: Connect and Share! A New Cultivation Business?
chapters.content:
Chapter 19 - 19: Connect and Share! A New Cultivation Business?
"Yes!" Su Ping responded instantly, feeling the prompts from within the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas without a second thought.
In that moment, the Forest Wolf Catalog within the Atlas, which unfolded in his mind, suddenly magnified. The catalog, already filled with white light, flared brilliantly.
A change slowly emerged from the top of this Forest Wolf Catalog; a hint of green seemed to spread from its uppermost edge. On this card-like Forest Wolf Catalog, the overall color transformed. The card, with its previous white base, slowly turned green—a world of difference compared to before.
At this moment, Su Ping felt an extremely special sensation. He seemed to gain an instinctive familiarity with the Forest Wolf, understanding the meaning behind its cries and the significance of its subtle movements. Even more so, after the Forest Wolf Catalog upgraded to LV2, the Forest Wolf before him seemed to regard him with greater affection and goodwill.
Su Ping instantly understood.
Could it be that leveling up the corresponding Pet Beast Compendiums within the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas enhances the Pet Beast's affection toward me while also deepening my understanding of them? If that's the case, it could save a lot of effort.
However, these were clearly just perks, minor matters at best.
The most important thing is what I gain from the Forest Wolf Catalog in the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas after it upgrades to LV2!
[Catalog 'Forest Wolf' level up, current catalog level: 2, awarded with Origin reward: Bonding Share (Forest Wolf)]
Sure enough, as the catalog in the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas completely transformed into a green-backed card, feedback from the Atlas emerged in Su Ping's mind.
However, this time, the reward left Su Ping slightly startled. He had originally assumed that the reward for illuminating the Forest Wolf Catalog for the first time—a Beast Tamer talent like Eye of Truth—would be similar to the rewards for catalog level-ups. To his surprise, this Bonding Share was something he had never even heard of.
Could it be an unheard-of talented ability?
Su Ping's brow furrowed slightly.
Fortunately, as if sensing Su Ping's confusion, the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas immediately provided him with direct feedback:
[Bonding Share (Forest Wolf): An ability birthed from the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas. Allows the Tamer to bond and share with Forest Wolves included in the Catalog, provided their affinity meets the criteria. The bonded Forest Wolves share experience gained from skill training, usage, and enhancement.]
[Note 1: The Master of the Catalog may cancel the bonding at any time. Forest Wolves too far from the Beast Tamer cannot be bonded.]
[Note 2: The current Beast Tamer level can bond with up to 15 Forest Wolves simultaneously.]
[Note 3: If bonded Forest Wolves do not possess the corresponding skills, they cannot gain shared experience effects.]
Looking at this ability, and the almost instinctual understanding that came with it, Su Ping was momentarily dumbfounded.
This ability, although it seems only applicable to Forest Wolves, has a heaven-defying effect! Compared to the Eye of Truth, which can only be used for observation, its practicality is much broader—even terrifying. What does this mean?
Actually, it was quite simple. From the feedback of the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas and Su Ping's dawning realization, he understood he could have 15 Forest Wolves bond and share. Then, these 15 Forest Wolves could simultaneously train the 'Vine Strangling' skill.
Generally, the speed at which each Forest Wolf improved in such training would depend on its own talent and aptitude. However, with this connection, the skill training speed for each Forest Wolf effectively increased fifteenfold.
And if there were extremely hardworking ones, like a little one, or one with exceptionally high talent, like my own Pet Beast Xiao Qing, the effect would be even more astounding!
The levels of skill cultivation are divided into Beginner, Proficiency, Proficient, Perfection, and Divine Perfection. Almost every skill level upgrade brings an unimaginable enhancement to a Pet Beast's combat capabilities. Even the significant hurdle from Proficient to Perfection, if it were a Forest Wolf's main combat skill like 'Vine Strangling,' the improvement could be more terrifying than the difference between several realms!
Indeed, the level of some skills is linked to a Pet Beast's evolution and the upper limit of its racial potential. Take Old Sha, for example; it's very likely he reached the Commander Level and comprehended Wolf King Majesty only by cultivating Sunlight Absorption to Perfection, thereby breaking through his race limit.
As for the final level, Divine Perfection? That level of skill cultivation can't be forced. Some Pet Beasts can only reach that realm by bringing their skills to their peak and then experiencing a serendipitous moment of epiphany.
And now, with this ability, could I one day bring all the skills of all my Forest Wolves to the Perfection realm?! If that were the case, it would be truly terrifying.
Previously, Su Ping had decided to walk a special Beast Taming path no one had ever trodden. With the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, he could properly cultivate a group of Pet Beasts, so he never intended to sell any Pet Beast he personally raised. Now, this idea seemed to be drawing closer and closer to reality in his imagination.
The only slight disappointment is that if some Forest Wolves have unique skills that the other little ones haven't learned, they can't acquire them through this method. Otherwise, if Old Sha knew Wolf King Majesty, it would mean all bonded and shared Forest Wolves would also know Wolf King Majesty. And if it were like Woodhead, with skills such as Forest Concealment Technique, Armor of Wood, Wood Spike, and so on, once connected with Woodhead, wouldn't I be able to directly teach all my Forest Wolves these three skills? That would be somewhat too overpowered. Even as it is now, it's already quite exaggerated.
Feeling this ability, besides wondering if all the regular skills of his Forest Wolf Pet Beasts could achieve a grand slam under these circumstances, another idea occurred to Su Ping.nᴇt
Could my Heart of Woods Forest Wolf Pet Beast Breeding Base perhaps start another cultivation business? A business focusing on skill level cultivation! For essential combat skills of a Forest Wolf like Vine Strangling, if we can upgrade them from Beginner to Proficiency in a short time, charging 100,000 or 200,000 for one wouldn't be too much, would it? If it's a one-stop service, first develop the Heart of Woods skill, then cultivate it from entry-level to Proficiency, and even up to Proficient, asking for several hundred thousand or even a million would be reasonable, right? Too expensive? If you find it expensive, train them yourself! That's the price for Beast Taming and Pet Beast cultivation!
Thinking this, Su Ping's lips curled into an enthusiastic smile.

chapters.title: Chapter 20 Skill Upgrade, The Terrifying Link Effect!
chapters.content:
Chapter 20 - 20 Skill Upgrade, The Terrifying Link Effect!
[Catalog: Forest Wolf]
[A special Wolf Tribe proficient in the Wood Attribute, with extraordinary Life Force. Adult Forest Wolves are generally of Elite Level, skilled in Skills such as Sunlight Absorption, Vine Strangling, Self-Healing, and Accelerated Growth.]
[Current Catalog Level: 2 (14/2000)]
Known Evolutionary Atlas, Special Cultivation:
[Heart of Woods Magic Potion: Upon consuming this Magic Potion, a Forest Wolf can awaken the Skill 'Heart of Woods,' and its rank will receive a certain boost...]
Likes, Habits:
[Enjoys sunbathing, playing in the forest, prefers group actions, and has stronger combat capabilities in daylight or within forests.]
Record Logs:
[[...]]
The Catalog Level needed to be raised; the next level-up required a full two thousand Experience Points. Clearly, this was not something that could be reached in just three or five days.
Glancing at the changes in the Catalog, Su Ping's mind was hardly on this matter. He shouted directly, "Gather!"
Over time, the wolf pack had become familiar with his commands. Before long, including Old Sha and Woodhead, close to thirty Forest Wolves of various sizes had gathered. Including Xiao Qing in Su Ping's arms, they were all present and accounted for.
Given that the Shared Connection ability was so remarkable, Su Ping naturally wanted to make good use of it. However, at present, he could only connect with fifteen wolves at a time. Clearly, these fifteen needed to be carefully selected.
His own Xiao Qing and Old Sha were certainly necessary. He also wanted to experiment whether Xiao Qing's Mutated Skills, Poison Vine Strangulation and Heart of the Poison Wood, could achieve a shared effect through the connection. As for the others, naturally, those with higher Talent should be chosen.
However, the main Skills to be trained were not Vine Strangling or Accelerated Growth, the Forest Wolves' two main combat Skills. Instead, it was the seemingly less useful Sunlight Absorption. But in fact, this Skill was one of the main growth Skills for Forest Wolves. Its significance was extraordinary.
Soon, Su Ping had chosen the fifteen wolves with the best Talent, including Xiao Qing, Little One, and Old Sha. The method to train the Sunlight Absorption Skill was even simpler: fifteen Forest Wolves of various sizes basking in the blazing sun together! Then, they absorbed the Light Power from the sun.
The Forest Wolves' Sunlight Absorption ability was very practical. It could accelerate a Forest Wolf's growth and reduce its need for food and water.
Bask in the sun to improve?
The fifteen connected Forest Wolves, including Old Sha, were puzzled. But they did not resist Su Ping's command in the slightest; all chose to obey.
However, a Forest Wolf standing by was somewhat baffled. Woodhead watched its Forest Wolf companions lying uniformly on the grass, basking in the sun, then looked at the stern-faced Su Ping. This top-tier Forest Wolf, born with a silver spoon in its mouth, looked skeptically at Su Ping.
Could it be that our master was really deceived by this guy? Could such a training method be effective? Could it help *me* become stronger? Was this Breeder really reliable? Although, it had to be said, living here with him was quite comfortable, happy, and satisfying.
However, such skepticism lasted only two hours before suddenly, a light shone forth. It was the mutated wolf, Xiao Qing, who had leveled up! She had advanced from an ordinary Fourth Rank to an ordinary Fifth Rank. Once again, she had reached the same Level as Su Ping.
But that wasn't all. Not only had her Level increased, but in just that short time, the sunlight converging on Xiao Qing's body had also become even more dazzling. Under the noontime sun, she shone like a glittering emerald. She was dazzling beyond compare!
Her Level has increased? How is that possible?
Woodhead was green with envy.
In such a short time, this mutated little wolf's Sunlight Absorption reached the Proficient Level? Although it felt this Skill wasn't very useful, only adding some endurance during daylight battles, Skill improvement, especially at later stages, was transformative! So this is how Forest Wolves grow?
As a Forest Wolf that had reached the peak Racial Potential of its kind, Woodhead was confused. In the past, its master had trained it through battles and Magic Potions. It had never experienced this before.
Could it be that this seemingly unreliable and weak human Beast Tamer was actually a genius?
Woodhead's limited thinking ability and meager wisdom plunged it into doubt regarding its life as a wolf and its master, Qin Xiaoxue. However, when it looked at Su Ping, its eyes grew brighter and brighter.
It understood that its future was definitely not limited to being just a Forest Wolf. Not to mention, Qin Xiaoxue's second Pet Beast—which Su Ping had never seen—was naturally growing with a Racial Potential far surpassing its own. But its current foundation would greatly influence its future development. This human could really make it far stronger!
And for some reason, Woodhead felt that Su Ping looked particularly agreeable today.
Ignoring Woodhead, who was off to one side, Su Ping looked at the changing Xiao Qing with undisguisable excitement!
It really worked! The Skill cultivation effect of Shared Connection was like a Skill cultivation accelerator! Although progressing from the Beginner to the Proficient Level for a Skill was something most Pet Beasts could achieve through natural growth and some practice, how long had it taken Xiao Qing?! Indeed, this ability had great potential!
Su Ping clenched his fist. Sure enough, in less than an hour, starting with Little One, several other Forest Wolves who were only at the Beginner Level of Sunlight Absorption had breakthroughs. Moreover, this breakthrough in ability was accompanied by a certain increase in their own Levels.
In less than half a day, under the enhancement of Shared Connection, Su Ping's wolf pack had significantly improved.
If he could maintain this rate of improvement, and especially as his own Realm continually increased, the more wolves that could share the connection, the easier it would be for all the Pet Beasts in his wolf pack to reach the Perfection Level in their Skills! And Su Ping believed that this day would not be too far off!
As he was contemplating this, the Forest Wolf Catalog provided feedback once more:
[Discovered adult Forest Wolf, intimacy has met the requirements, Catalog Level Experience +15!]
[This is an adult individual. For every subsequent day spent with it, Forest Wolf Catalog Experience +1!]
Su Ping was stunned. The intimacy of his entire wolf pack had already reached the standard. With Old Sha's help, these wolves had become like his closest kin. The only one whose intimacy hadn't met the requirement was Woodhead, who was off to one side.
