Sure enough, when Su Ping looked over at Woodhead, the sense of closeness that emanated from it made him smile with satisfaction.
Indeed, even a Pet Beast contracted to someone else could meet the requirements. If that's the case, the Skill training business he had been contemplating could actually be launched!
However, he had been delaying Qin Xiaoxue for so many days and had not given Woodhead the last bottle of the Heart of Woods Magic Potion.
Wasn't it all for today?
Once Woodhead's intimacy reached the standard, it could take the Magic Potion, which would at least slightly increase his Catalog Level Experience.
With that in mind, what was there to hesitate about?
Su Ping quickly went into the room and took out the 'Heart of Woods' Magic Potion from the refrigerator. Under Woodhead's surprised and expectant gaze, he slowly opened it.

chapters.title: Chapter 21: Qin Xiaoxue Deceived? Cultivation Successful!
chapters.content:
Chapter 21 - 21: Qin Xiaoxue Deceived? Cultivation Successful!
Beast Master Association Headquarters.Thᴇ link to the origɪn of this information rᴇsts ɪn NovᴇlFɪre.ɴet
It was still the same office. Only this time, there were several more people inside.
Qin Xiaoxue, who had rushed back from the suburbs, pushed open the door. Her eyebrows quickly arched slightly as she surveyed the room. Besides her grandfather, there were two other individuals—familiar, yet she didn't know them well.
"Xiao Xue is back." Qin Erlong smiled and stood up. Qin Xiaoxue nodded, her expression indifferent and cold as she glanced at the other two people present.
One was a balding old man who appeared to be around the same age as Qin Erlong. The other was a man in his thirties with an eager-to-please smile. It was this man who spoke up as Qin Xiaoxue sat down, his tone respectful.
"Miss Qin, I am truly sorry. Regarding the incident last time, I, Sun Chaoju, representing the Wolf Den Cultivation Base, apologize to you. I've brought your cultivation fee. Furthermore, if you wouldn't mind, Wolf Den is prepared to offer Miss Qin a second, complimentary attempt at cultivating 'Accelerated Spellcasting.'"
Qin Xiaoxue frowned slightly and looked towards Qin Erlong.
The old man—her grandfather—hurriedly waved his hand. "This wasn't my idea. Old Liu heard about the incident and called Sun Chaoju over. Knowing you'd be here soon, he rushed him over."
The balding old man also smiled and said, "Xiao Xue, this one's on me. Last time, your grandfather didn't specify who required the cultivation, and you didn't mention me or your grandfather when you visited. It's understandable that Xiao Sun might have made an oversight! But rest assured, this time I'll personally guarantee it. There definitely won't be any problems, if..."
Cutting off the balding old man with an impatient glance, Qin Xiaoxue turned to her grandfather. "The matter I asked you about on the phone, is there any news?"
The balding old man looked embarrassed but said no more.
Qin Erlong coughed lightly. "Correct. It's Dong Muyun, the chairman of Tianyun Group. Her background is quite formidable. Why are you asking about her?"
Qin Xiaoxue's eyebrows knitted together, but she didn't answer her grandfather.
The Tianyun Group? They're influential not just in Linzhou City, but throughout Jianghai Province, even across the Dragon Nation. A personage of such status... what involvement could she have with that brat?
Though Qin Xiaoxue often seemed unreserved, the environment she had grown up in was an undeniable factor. However, with others present, it wasn't appropriate for her to press further.
Frowning, she looked at Sun Chaoju, who was still wearing that fawning smile, and said impatiently, "Keep your money. It was clearly stated in the contract we signed, and I'm not short of that amount. As for continuing cultivation at your facility? Let's forget it. I've found a cultivation base to cultivate my Woodhead, so there's no need for you to trouble yourselves."
The balding old man quickly interjected with a laugh, "Xiao Xue, are you referring to the Heart of Wood Cultivation Base on the outskirts of the city? Your grandfather mentioned it to us. Indeed, that cultivation base has been around for a long time and, in its early days, did cultivate under the banner of 'Heart of Woods.' However, over decades, only a few successful cases have emerged, and those were cubs already under contract. They have never actually succeeded in cultivating 'Heart of Woods.' Xiao Xue, don't let some charlatans deceive you!"
Qin Xiaoxue first glared at her grandfather, then looked at the beaming, bald old man and frowned slightly. "Do I look like someone who is easily fooled?"
The old man's smile froze, his expression turning awkward again.
Qin Erlong then chimed in, "Xiao Xue, how can you speak to your Grandpa Liu like that? Isn't Grandpa Liu just looking out for you?"
Looking out for me? Ultimately, it's all because of my status.
Thinking of this, Qin Xiaoxue felt a wave of revulsion. Dealing with these businesspeople and bigwigs, who treated Pet Beast cultivation purely as a business transaction and a networking opportunity, was truly tedious.
If she could, Qin Xiaoxue found herself actually missing the scent of wolf dung on Su Ping—pungent, yes, but somehow comforting. At least, that boy seemed to genuinely enjoy and feel passionately about Pet Beast cultivation.
Besides, how could she not know if she was being deceived? Not to mention, seeing the several pounds Woodhead had gained over the past few days was evidence enough; she estimated that the kid must have also spent quite a bit on food costs. The contract was clear: if the cultivation failed, all the materials for 'Heart of Woods' and the cultivation fee wouldn't cost her a single cent. What could she possibly be cheated out of?
It was this man before her, actually. If he hadn't learned her identity, her three million cultivation fee would have been truly swindled by this scoundrel.
However, she didn't feel the need to explain anything to them. After all, Su Ping hadn't finished the cultivation yet, and her Woodhead hadn't learned 'Heart of Woods,' so she naturally had no concrete proof to offer.
But her silence seemed to embolden the two men. Sun Chaoju quickly added, "Yes, Miss Qin, I've looked into it as well. The previous owner of the Heart of Wood Cultivation Base left Linzhou. Now, it's just run by a young kid who recently graduated. A kid fresh out of school, what could he possibly know? He probably doesn't even understand the basics of cultivation."
Qin Xiaoxue's brow furrowed again. "I also graduated only a few years ago. Mr. Sun, you seem to be underestimating people."
Sun Chaoju's face was a mask of fawning flattery. "How could Miss Qin be compared to ordinary people? You're a top student from Magic Capital Academy and President Qin's granddaughter..."
"Exactly, Xiao Xue," Old Liu interjected. "If anyone can cultivate 'Heart of Woods' in a Forest Wolf, then, setting other considerations aside, if they have more than a thirty percent chance of success, I will personally issue them a Junior Breeder certificate. If it's over fifty percent, I'll personally grant them an Intermediate Breeder certificate. And if the success rate is even higher, then, believe me, they'll definitely be a prime candidate to represent Linzhou at the next Breeder's Conference..."
"Alright, if there's nothing else, I'll be leaving first. As for the matter I asked you about on the phone, tell me when you find something out."
Signaling her grandfather, Qin Xiaoxue decisively cut off the others and stood up impatiently. However, at that very moment, a clear chime sounded. It wasn't a call, but a text message notification on her phone. Few people had her private number, so anyone messaging her was undoubtedly someone she knew well. Yet, as Qin Xiaoxue pulled out her phone, she froze, a flicker of surprise on her face.
"What's wrong, Xiao Xue?"
Seeing his granddaughter suddenly stop, Qin Erlong felt a twinge of helplessness. His granddaughter excelled in every aspect—talent, intellect, and appearance were all top-tier. Her only flaw was her fiery temper and her bluntness, often disregarding others' feelings. In short, she had little interest in, or perhaps disdain for, navigating social complexities. Just like her grandmother.
But in response to Qin Erlong's question, Qin Xiaoxue's expression became incredibly complex and peculiar. She glanced at President Liu of the Breeder Association and Sun Chaoju from the Wolf Den Cultivation Base—who was supposedly a certified Intermediate Breeder—then said, somewhat incredulously, "Su Ping said that Woodhead's training and cultivation are complete and successful. He asked me to come and take a look."
As soon as she spoke, silence fell upon the entire office.
"That's impossible!"

chapters.title: Chapter 22 There’s No Such Thing as Impossible!
chapters.content:
Chapter 22 - 22 There's No Such Thing as Impossible!
"This is impossible!"
The speaker was none other than Sun Chaoju, head of the Wolf Den base and an Intermediate Breeder personally recognized by the Breeder Association.
However, as soon as the words left his mouth, he felt Qin Xiaoxue's icy stare and quickly tried to explain, "Miss Qin, please don't misunderstand. It's just that, how could a student who has just graduated possibly..."
"Why couldn't it be possible?"
It seemed that after receiving a text message, Qin Xiaoxue, who had been slightly anxious, relaxed a great deal. She huffed, "In the Dragon Nation, the current Master of the Divine Dragon was also nineteen when he discovered the special evolutionary path of the Yellow Scaled Snake, leading to the True Dragon Blessing we have today!"
Sun Chaoju opened his mouth but couldn't find anything else to say.
If she's comparing this unknown kid with the Legendary Divine Dragon, what more is there to say?
The bald President Liu asked doubtfully, "Xiao Xue, within the soul connection, haven't you felt anything abnormal with your Pet Beast?"
Looking at the three people before her—even her own grandfather—all wearing expressions of disbelief, Qin Xiaoxue grew impatient. She had no intention of wasting time bickering with these old men; she just wanted to see how much her beloved Pet Beast, Woodhead, had improved in strength after mastering the Heart of Woods.
"If you don't believe it, just come with me and see for yourself." The three people present had clearly been waiting for exactly this.
Taking the Beast Master Association's flyer, it only took twenty minutes to travel from the Linzhou City Center directly to the suburbs.
Looking over the Lingxi River territory, Qin Erlong nodded. "Say what you will, the environment is still quite nice. It seems that recent development here has been good."The most update n0vels are published on Novᴇ(l)Fɪre .ɴᴇt
Qin Xiaoxue wasn't in the mood to listen to her grandfather's work guidance. She quickly walked to the gate and rang the doorbell, calling out as she did, "Su Ping! Hurry up and open the door, I'm here!"
No sooner had her words fallen than the gate opened.
Su Ping's voice came from the intercom, "Come in. It's in the guest room!"
Qin Erlong and President Liu said nothing, following behind their granddaughter, who seemed almost ready to take flight.
Only Sun Chaoju looked around disdainfully.
The place is indeed not small, but can this Cultivation base even be called a Cultivation base? It's a bit too shabby, isn't it?
He still couldn't believe that an unknown nobody could cultivate a Forest Wolf with a rare Skill like the Heart of Woods. Having studied the Cultivation of Forest Wolves for many years, Sun Chaoju understood all too well what this Skill meant for a Forest Wolf!
At this thought, Sun Chaoju's spirits lifted, ready for action.
Just now, Qin Xiaoxue showed me no respect at all, and she even used this unknown whippersnapper as an example, comparing him to the Master of the Divine Dragon? Wait until I expose this kid's deception.
Sun Chaoju prided himself on his research on the Forest Wolf; in Linzhou City, he believed few could compare. He not only possessed a secret technique to cultivate the Rapid Casting Skill in Forest Wolves but could also increase their Racial Skill learning speed. He had even set a record for the fastest improvement: a Forest Wolf's Sunlight Absorption Skill upgraded from Beginner to Proficiency in just half a month.
It was precisely because of such secret techniques that the Wolf Den had gained a certain reputation in Jianghai Province.
He previously had no idea that Miss Qin had visited their Wolf Den in disguise for Cultivation. Otherwise, wouldn't he have worshipped her like an ancestor? However, it seems a bit late now to start cozying up to her. Since that's the case, I can only make Miss Qin realize that our Wolf Den is the best Forest Wolf Cultivation base in all of Linzhou! I have to make Miss Qin believe in our Wolf Den again. But what method did this kid use to deceive people? Does he have some kind of simulation Ability, allowing other Pet Beasts to temporarily possess a certain Skill, like the Mirror Heaven Reflection Talent among Beast Tamers? That could achieve a similar effect. Or perhaps some forbidden method was used, like overdrawing the Forest Wolf's Life Force and then forcing it to master the Heart of Woods through training. All these are possibilities.
Finally, under Sun Chaoju's eager anticipation, the four of them pushed open the main doors. As soon as they stepped inside, not just the others, but Qin Xiaoxue too couldn't help but widen her eyes in amazement.
What am I seeing? Nobody understands Woodhead's character better than I do. Or rather, most Pet Beasts from the Wolf Tribe are like that: proud and aloof, looking down on everyone except their master and their own kind. Even Breeders, in Woodhead's eyes, are just servants there to serve it. But now... Woodhead is like the most obedient pug, squatting on the ground, affectionately licking Su Ping's outstretched palm! That's right! Am I seeing things? Is that... sycophancy... from my Woodhead?
"You're here... Huh? Who are these people?" Su Ping asked, wiping his damp palm on Woodhead's temple fur before turning to see Qin Xiaoxue and the others who had entered.
Qin Xiaoxue clearly had no intention of introducing them to Su Ping; her eyes glowed as she stared at Woodhead. During the past few days of Cultivation, to ensure Woodhead's intimacy with Su Ping reached the required level, Su Ping had strictly limited Qin Xiaoxue's contact with her Pet Beast, as its owner. She had missed Woodhead terribly.
Now, she threw her arms around Woodhead's neck and nuzzled it.
"AWOO!" Woodhead also let out an excited howl.
Meeting Su Ping's inquiring gaze, Qin Erlong coughed lightly. "Hello, Student Su. I am this girl's grandfather. I heard you were cultivating my granddaughter's Pet Beast? I didn't expect Linzhou to have such a young and promising Breeder, so I came to take a look."
Su Ping was startled, then quickly nodded.
That's more like it! No matter how rich the family is, it's normal for them to come and confirm the spending of several million on Cultivation fees.
Realizing he was dealing with the financiers, Su Ping's face instantly wreathed in smiles as he nodded again.
However, Su Ping's gaze soon shifted to another person present, his expression somewhat strange.
Following Su Ping's gaze, Qin Erlong couldn't help but turn his head. Sure enough, the other two beside him were staring intently at the sole massive Forest Wolf in the room. Sun Chaoju, in particular, had streaks of data flickering in his pupils; clearly, his Talent as a Beast Tamer was one of the more common ones: the Eye of Truth.
And at that moment, reflected in the eyes of the Wolf Den's head, an Intermediate Breeder, the huge words 'Heart of Woods (Beginner)' emanating from Woodhead were blindingly bright.
Was the Cultivation really successful?
"How is this possible!?"
This time, the exclamation, even louder than Sun Chaoju's earlier one, came not from the Intermediate Breeder but from Vice President Liu of the Breeder Association, who was staring fixedly at Woodhead.

chapters.title: Chapter 23: Su Ping, Genius Breeder!
chapters.content:
Chapter 23 - 23: Su Ping, Genius Breeder!
Su Ping looked at the two with a skeptical expression.
In his heart, he was actually somewhat apprehensive, understanding the significance of the Heart of Woods skill. The saying 'possessing a treasure invites trouble' could very well be true. Although the Dragon Nation took this matter very seriously, it might still not withstand those who harbored ill intentions. If he weren't truly in need of money, he wouldn't have wanted to stand out this much. However, he had long thought of a way to deal with this, and this skeptical and disdainful look was part of his plan.
"What's so impossible?"
Hearing Su Ping's words and seeing the young man's disdainful look, which seemed to say 'country bumpkin who hasn't seen the world,' Vice President Liu could only force a dry laugh before speaking, "Student Su, did you cultivate this Forest Wolf yourself?"
Su Ping frowned instantly, put on a disdainful look as if unwilling to answer, and directly turned to Qin Xiaoxue. "Who are all these people?"
Qin Xiaoxue had already sensed the progress and changes in Woodhead through the Soul Contract, and at this moment, she completely believed in Su Ping's abilities.
This kid was actually a Genius Breeder! However, it seemed that this Genius Breeder was not in a very good mood at the moment.
Qin Xiaoxue frowned and also turned to look at Sun Chaoju and Vice President Liu.
These two guys had swindled her out of millions previously and had been constantly questioning her ability to recognize talent! Now that they were here, they started asking all sorts of questions again. In the end, weren't they just incompetent and envious of the capable? No wonder the Breeder Association in Jianghai Province hadn't achieved any significant results over the years, causing Jianghai Province to lose face in this aspect throughout the Dragon Nation. This bunch of good-for-nothings bore undeniable responsibility!
Still, since it involved the old man, it wouldn't be good for her to drive them away directly, so she could only snort softly.
However, having witnessed this scene, both Qin Erlong and Vice President Liu were completely convinced.
Did this young man truly cultivate it by himself?! Geniuses, after all, tend to have a degree of pride and distinct personalities.
The value of a Genius Breeder is, many times, even more crucial than that of a genius Beast Tamer. After all, a genius Beast Tamer might only affect their own combat power, but a Genius Breeder could potentially cultivate many top-tier Pet Beasts and Beast Tamers. The importance was clear to all.For a moment, even Vice President Liu, who had not been very convinced before, started looking at Su Ping differently. At this moment, there was only one person among those present who still had the same demeanor.
It was none other than Sun Chaoju. His eyes were still bloodshot as he stared at the huge Forest Wolf, Woodhead,
trying to figure out how Su Ping had managed it by relying on his own understanding of Forest Wolves, just by observing Woodhead.
However, from its external appearance and the feedback from his Eye of Truth, he could not see how. Thus, a thought unconsciously crossed his mind.Follow current novels on ɴoᴠel Fɪre.nᴇt
In an instant, a flash of white light shone throughout the guest room. Everyone's gaze suddenly fixed on it. The reason was simple: that flash of white light was the glow of summoning a Pet Beast. And what appeared before their eyes was a huge azure python. In its triangular eyes, there was nothing but cold indifference.
Commander-level Pet Beast: Cloud-Patterned Tree Python!
At once, the atmosphere in the guest room turned icy cold. However, the one who felt even colder was not Su Ping, not Qin Xiaoxue, but Sun Chaoju himself. He felt as if needles were pricking all over his body, causing him to shiver involuntarily. Soon after, he saw Qin Erlong and Vice President Liu looking at him with rather unkind expressions.
Indeed, Vice President Liu took good care of him. After all, Sun Chaoju had once worked under him as a researcher, nominally sharing a master-disciple relationship, and had shown his respect with gifts every year. But at this moment, Su Ping's talent had won his approval.
If this truly were a rare Genius Breeder, cultivating him properly could mean that, for the next few decades, he might represent Linzhou City, or even Jianghai Province, at the Breeder Conference. This would be a tremendous benefit. It was widely known that both the Beast Master Association and the Breeder Association allocated resources based on achievements or, one might say, political performance in this field. Therefore, if someone wanted to snuff out a genius over the cultivation method of the Heart of Woods, others aside, Qin Erlong and Vice President Liu would be the first to stand up and strike down such an attempt with thunderous fury! This was why, over the years, the Dragon Nation had seen a continual emergence of talent. This was also why Su Ping dared to use his cultivation abilities to make money, as a replacement for the Heart of Woods Magic Potions, after the situation had eased slightly. The official attitude towards geniuses, unless in exceptional circumstances, never involved suppression.
Sun Chaoju snapped back to reality under the sharp gazes of the two elders and hurriedly, almost subconsciously, explained, "President, Teacher, I just wanted to test if Miss Qin's Pet Beast's life potential and combat capabilities were affected. This was to prevent her from being deceived by this kid and the Pet Beast being left with some irreparable underlying issues. That would be terrible."
The bald Vice President Liu said indifferently, "Breeder Sun, if there were anything wrong, wouldn't I be able to see it? Or are you suggesting that your abilities have surpassed both mine and Old Qin's?"
Sun Chaoju's body stiffened, and he quickly withdrew his Cloud-Patterned Tree Python. Su Ping licked his lips subconsciously.
He had no interest in or concern for this person who had jumped out. All his attention at this moment was focused on the title Sun Chaoju had used, specifically the two words: 'President?' In this world, in the current Dragon Nation, only a few individuals could be addressed as 'President'! And any of those individuals represented a level that Su Ping found difficult to interact with at his current stage.
Su Ping glanced at Qin Xiaoxue.
He regretted it again. Showing off is detrimental! It's too detrimental! Why did I have to show off before? Why did I reject the conditions promised by that top wealthy lady? However, I need to manage my expression! I've recently presented myself to Qin Xiaoxue as a Breeder who takes great pleasure in Pet Beasts. And in front of these people, I've maintained the proud attitude of a genius. I can't go back to the wealthy lady to renegotiate now.
Though he felt surprise and regret internally, Su Ping's face remained extremely calm, as if he were indifferent to everything that had just happened. Once the situation calmed down, he said faintly, "Are you finished? My job here is done. If you need anything else, you can say so now. If not, you can pay."
Looking at the POS machine Su Ping brought out, Qin Xiaoxue nodded and promptly took out her card, swiping it. The next moment, Su Ping received a notification on his phone:
[Your account has received 5,000,000 yuan. The payment was verified as an operating expense, and tax amounting to 550,000 yuan was deducted, resulting in an actual credit of 4,450,000 yuan. Your current account balance is: 4,451,562 yuan.]
Finally, I have money!
Su Ping was thrilled, but soon he hesitated. "Miss Qin, you've overpaid."
Qin Xiaoxue was unconcerned about such a minor detail. "Just call me by my name, or Sister Qin is fine. Typing 350 requires changing the keypad three times; this is more convenient. Besides, you have material costs too! Relax~"
Looking at this reasoning, so financially extravagant it left Su Ping speechless, what else could he say? Meanwhile, Sun Chaoju, who was standing to the side, saw Qin Xiaoxue finally smile and hurriedly tried to make amends for his earlier actions: "Su Xiao is truly formidable. However, Miss Qin, although the cultivation for its skills is complete, I've observed that your Forest Wolf's skill levels seem somewhat low. To be frank, our Wolf Den Pet Beast Breeding Base only includes 'Accelerated Spellcasting' incidentally. Our main service is helping Pet Beasts quickly enhance their Skill Proficiency Levels. To strengthen your Pet Beast's combat capabilities, if Miss Qin isn't in a hurry, you could come to our Wolf Den to enhance its skill levels."
Qin Xiaoxue was indeed taken aback by these words.
True, although she had meticulously cultivated her Woodhead, focusing primarily on combat, because it had learned so many skills, its skill levels had improved relatively slowly. This was indeed an aspect Qin Xiaoxue cared about.
Perceiving Qin Xiaoxue's interest, Sun Chaoju quickly continued, "You can rest assured, Miss Qin. I have absolute confidence in this area. Even if I can't guarantee an improvement in its Skill Proficiency Level within these few months, the progress will definitely be much faster! And please don't worry; consider it compensation for last time. This time, it's all free!"
Qin Xiaoxue pondered for a moment, then instead of addressing Sun Chaoju, she turned to Su Ping. "Does your Heart of Woods offer this cultivation service?"
Su Ping smiled and then nodded. As Sun Chaoju's eyes bulged, Su Ping spoke slowly, "We do offer them, but it's not free, and it's actually quite expensive!"
At that, Sun Chaoju, whose complexion had just started to improve slightly, immediately darkened again.

chapters.title: Chapter 24 Another Bet? Crazy Bet!
chapters.content:
Chapter 24 - 24 Another Bet? Crazy Bet!
Is this kid deliberately opposing me? Why is he so annoying at every turn?
Sun Chaoju's face looked somewhat displeased.
However, since Qin Xiaoxue had asked personally, it couldn't be considered Su Ping stealing business. Moreover, if anyone was to be accused of stealing business, it should be Sun Chaoju.
Yet, before Sun Chaoju could ponder further, Qin Xiaoxue had already nodded directly, "No problem, name your price!"
Su Ping did not hold back. He was indeed in dire need of money right now. Apart from cultivating the current Forest Wolf pack, he also had to train his own Xiao Qing.
Xiao Qing, unlike other Forest Wolves, required rare Poison Type resources.
Moreover, he needed to continue expanding the scale of his Pet Beast Breeding Base, all of which entailed considerable expenses.
"Let me make it clear," Su Ping began after receiving Qin Xiaoxue's affirmative answer, "I will only be responsible for cultivating the Racial Skills of the Forest Wolves, as well as the Wood Heart Skill I personally cultivated. I won't take care of other skills!"
He then stated his terms, "To advance a skill from Beginner to Proficient Level, it's 200,000 for each Racial Skill. To advance from Proficient Level to Proficient, it's 800,000 per attempt. As for reaching Perfection Level, I haven't decided yet. It also depends on the specific skill."
Upon hearing this, everyone was slightly startled.ᴛʜɪs ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀ ɪs ᴜᴘᴅᴀᴛᴇ ʙʏ ɴovel(ꜰ)ɪre.nᴇt
Even the bald old man, who had been silent until now, paused and said, "Young Su, this isn't how skill level cultivation fees are calculated. It should be based on time. After all, Pet Beasts have varying aptitudes. If you charge by level of cultivation..."
He didn't finish his sentence. If charged by level, and the skill never materialized, would the Beast Tamer keep their Pet Beast indefinitely at your cultivation base? Clearly, this was impossible.
And Sun Chaoju, seemingly having found a weak point, said, "Young Brother Su must not have undertaken this kind of cultivation before. But that's normal. Achieving what you have is already quite impressive. You have a bright future ahead. However, everyone has their own specialty, and it seems there's still much for you to learn in this area!"
Su Ping snorted lightly, "This senior shouldn't compare me to those mediocre Breeders. If I say I can do it, I most certainly can! Unless this senior would like to put it to the test?!"
Vice President Liu frowned slightly, but Sun Chaoju, on the other hand, seemed to be instantly energized. "Oh? I won't speak of anything else, but I, Sun Chaoju, do have some insights into the cultivation of Forest Wolf skill levels. Currently, most of Woodhead's skills have reached the Proficient Level, with only Self-Healing still at the Beginner Level! If Miss Qin trusts me, I am confident I can elevate Woodhead's Self-Healing to Proficient Level within a month! Are you challenging me to a bet, young brother?"
As he spoke, a confident look truly appeared on his face.
However, the others were a different matter. If Sun Chaoju had looked at Woodhead at that moment—standing to the side, being petted by its master—he would have seen in the Forest Wolf's eyes a gaze that seemed to view him as a fool.
A month? From Beginner to Proficient Level?
The problem was, just this morning, Woodhead had seen with its own eyes that little Forest Wolf elevate its Sunlight Absorption—a Forest Wolf Racial Skill—to the Proficient Level in just two hours! Although the initial progress of Sunlight Absorption might be relatively simple compared to Self-Healing, the difference was still significant!
Su Ping smiled too. He truly loved betting. The previous bet with Qin Xiaoxue had ended with him forgoing a large portion of the rewards due to his swagger. But now, with an offer landing right at his doorstep, why not grab it?
Besides, this was the result Su Ping had intentionally guided things towards! He had just heard this guy claim his base had a cultivation method for 'Accelerated Spellcasting.' Accelerated Casting, as the name implies, speeds up the casting time of skills and is considered a quite practical skill.
With the Shared Connection, Su Ping didn't need to worry about having too many skills causing the Forest Wolf's skill levels to be too low. Naturally, forming complete effect combinations with skills couldn't be better!
And he could guess that the man before him probably had a greedy eye on his Wood Heart Skill!
Thinking of this, Su Ping's mind stirred, but a disdainful smirk touched the corner of his mouth. "One month? Don't even mention a month. If I can't get the Self-Healing skill to Proficient Level within half a month, then I'll consider it my loss!"
A greedy light flickered in Sun Chaoju's eyes. Without waiting for others to speak, and just as Su Ping began, he responded decisively, "Good! If Brother Su is so confident, then let it be half a month. How about this: if Brother Su can't do it within half a month, we'll make the cultivation method of the Wood Heart Skill the stake. What do you say?"
As soon as these words came out, Su Ping sneered inwardly, his face remaining calm. Even Qin Xiaoxue, Qin Erlong, and Vice President Liu furrowed their brows.
This Sun Chaoju's behavior is quite unseemly, isn't it?
Seeming to sense the displeasure in their eyes, Sun Chaoju hurriedly added, "Of course, if you can do it, I'm willing to accept the loss! If Brother Su has any demands, just say the word!"
Su Ping's expression remained unchanged. "Alright, this half-month, if I haven't raised Self-Healing to Proficient Level, it's my loss! The question is, what can you put up? Could it possibly be the cultivation method of that 'Accelerated Spellcasting' the senior just mentioned? Never mind how much value your cultivation method has; even if it has some, it's far from comparable to the Wood Heart Skill, right?"
If it were any other Forest Wolf, Su Ping wouldn't dare make such a boast, but Woodhead was different. At this very moment, Woodhead's bond with him had reached the required standard. They could now share skill experience through the Forest Wolf Catalog. Increasing its level wouldn't be difficult at all.
Upon hearing these words, Qin Xiaoxue glanced at Su Ping. In this moment, he looked exactly as he had a few days earlier when he stopped her in this guest room.
Something stirred in Qin Xiaoxue's mind, as if she understood something, and she followed with a cold snort, "Exactly. I've already experienced what that 'Accelerated Spellcasting' of yours is. Besides, you can only get one Beginner Level skill to the next level in a month, while Su Ping has chosen to do it in half a month. The difficulty is clearly not on the same level. Such an unequal contest and bet might as well not happen."
Vice President Liu nodded in agreement.
However, Sun Chaoju's eyes narrowed, his mind racing. Although he was a bit uncertain, a thought emerged—
Is this young man bluffing with this kind of reasoning and method, merely seeking a way out!?
Yet, thinking of the Wood Heart Skill cultivation method, greed flashed in Sun Chaoju's eyes.
The Wood Heart Skill! What massive benefits could he rake in if he controlled the cultivation method that could grant this Ability to the Forest Wolf?
With this in mind, Sun Chaoju gritted his teeth, determined to make this youngster agree.
Thus, before everyone's gaze, Sun Chaoju plainly said, "In addition to the cultivation method for Accelerated Casting, I have another stake! It is the incomplete cultivation method for Evolution into the Wanmu Wolf!"
In an instant, it wasn't just the others; even Su Ping could only think one thing:
Has this guy lost his mind?

chapters.title: Chapter 25: Forest Wolf’s Evolution: Wanmu Wolf!
chapters.content:
Chapter 25: Chapter 25: Forest Wolf’s Evolution: Wanmu Wolf!
In the world of Beast Tamers, what is the most precious and valuable thing? Pet Beasts and everything related to them. If one were to discuss what holds the highest value, the evolutionary path of cultivation would undoubtedly be among them.
Apart from some high-level Pet Beast Races that possess great innate Racial Potential, for anyone walking the path of a professional Beast Tamer, Evolution is a necessity. The Forest Wolf is undoubtedly one such Pet Beast.
However, obtaining the methods of Evolution is actually very difficult for ordinary people. Even though some evolutionary methods are public, the resources required are extremely difficult to obtain.
Officials indeed encourage Beast Tamers to explore discovered evolutionary channels and Cultivation methods, but people often have selfish interests. However, such cases are a minority. After all, discovering a Pet Beast’s evolutionary path is not something an ordinary Breeder can achieve. The development of a new evolutionary Cultivation path often requires a large number of experiments and a frightening amount of financial support.
Evolutionary paths are so precious, and at this moment, Sun Chaoju actually proposed such a gamble. Feeling everyone’s surprised attention, Sun Chaoju also felt a bit smug as he looked towards Su Ping.
However, people quickly came to their senses, and this time, Qin Erlong finally spoke:
"To what degree is it incomplete? And what type of Evolutionary Body is the Wanmu Wolf?"
This person indeed had broad knowledge and immediately pinpointed the key issue.
As expected, when directly asked about the issue, Sun Chaoju scratched his head:
"It’s a pure Wood Element Evolutionary Body of the Wolf Tribe. As for its other Abilities... I only accidentally achieved Evolution once. After that Evolution, the Wanmu Wolf died three days later. Despite many subsequent attempts, I only succeeded one more time, but it also died after just two days."
Suddenly, everyone present understood. Qin Xiaoxue, standing to the side, snorted disdainfully:
"This counts as an incomplete evolutionary path? It’s clearly just a research direction."
Sun Chaoju felt helpless. If this thing were truly so precious, he wouldn’t have offered it as a bet. Over this period, all the funds the Wolf Den had saved up for years had been poured into this without yielding any clear results. Even if not used as a bet, Sun Chaoju wanted to sell it or let his teacher’s Breeder Association collaborate on the research.
Qin Erlong and Vice President Liu didn’t show much reaction. The latter asked:ᴛʜɪs ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀ ɪs ᴜᴘᴅᴀᴛᴇ ʙʏ N(o)vᴇl(F)ire.nᴇt
"Why did it die?"
Sun Chaoju, after all, was an Intermediate Level Breeder, not someone who only talked without substance. He quickly said:
"Teacher, as you know, the Wood Element Attribute is relatively special. Most plants belong to this Attribute, and very few animal-class Pet Beasts possess it. The reason is that although the Wood Element has compatibility with the Life Series, awakening it is extremely difficult. Moreover, most Life Series creatures are primarily healing-type Pet Beasts, which doesn’t fit the expectations the majority of people have for the Forest Wolf. Most evolutionary forms of the Forest Wolf aim to suppress the Wood Element’s progression towards the Life Series or attempt to derive other Attributes. The Wanmu Wolf, however, goes a step further by significantly strengthening the Wood Element! This enhances its Wood Element Abilities, but when these Abilities intensify, the evolved Wanmu Wolf’s body undergoes fibrosis, its organs suffer severe failure, and it dies, transforming into a withered plant-like body."
With these words, Vice President Liu nodded as well, falling into thought. Then, he finally turned to Su Ping:
"Su Ping, you’ve heard it. Although this is an incomplete method of Evolution, the defects are very apparent. The method of Cultivation and Evolution is probably difficult, if not impossible. You need to consider this carefully."
What more was there for Su Ping to consider? In truth, during this brief period, he hadn’t really heard what these individuals were saying; all his attention and Spirit were on the Wanmu Wolf. Defects? An incomplete evolutionary method? To others, these might be critically important, perhaps even rendering the method valueless. But for Su Ping, with his Forest Wolf Catalog, he could even analyze the reasons behind Xiao Qing’s mutated Poison Type bloodline, let alone an already proposed evolutionary method! As long as the Forest Wolf Catalog contained sufficient experience, Su Ping was absolutely confident that the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas could complete the Wanmu Wolf’s evolutionary path!
Evolution! This is indeed the most exhilarating step in Pet Beast Cultivation.
However, facing everyone’s probing gazes, Su Ping pretended to ponder for a while before nodding:
"I can try. Perhaps I could perfect the Wanmu Wolf’s Evolution method!"
His face showed the unique confidence of a young Beast Tamer, radiant as the rising Sun in the early morning. He seemed entirely unconcerned about the possibility of losing the bet; instead, his focus was already on cultivating the Forest Wolf’s Evolutionary Body: the Wanmu Wolf.
Such confidence made the few onlookers sigh, and Vice President Liu even candidly laughed:
"Hahaha, young Su, if you can achieve this, never mind anything else! If you qualify as a Senior Breeder, I’ll personally handle your application. And if, one day, you wish to take the Master Breeder proficiency certification, I’ll vouch for you and contact the examiners at the Breeder Association headquarters!"
Perfecting and developing a new evolutionary path is the mark of a Senior Breeder. In all of Jianghai Province, there are very few Senior Breeders! One can imagine the weight of his promise.
However, Qin Xiaoxue clearly wasn’t buying it, snorting dismissively:
"Didn’t someone just say that if Su Ping could cultivate the Heart of Woods, he would be given Intermediate Breeder certification?"
Su Ping was taken aback. The balding Vice President Liu, looking somewhat embarrassed, touched his nose and quickly said:
"Young Su, what do you reckon your chances are of cultivating the Heart of Woods?"
Su Ping, seeing everyone’s eyes turning to him with tension, felt somewhat reassured. He thought this was a chance to reveal some of his Abilities. After considering, he said:
"Probably about sixty to seventy percent."
The moment these words were spoken, the others might not have reacted much, but Sun Chaoju’s breath once again grew rapid. No one would doubt Su Ping; the best proof was right beside them! A sixty to seventy percent chance of success in Cultivation was more than enough.
Vice President Liu made a decisive comment:
"Young Su, there are still procedures to follow, but don’t worry. Since it was I, Old Liu, who personally made a promise in front of Miss Qin, I certainly won’t renege on it. Give me your personal information later. Once I’ve handled the procedures, I’ll personally deliver the certificate to you tomorrow! Then, you’ll be an Intermediate Breeder registered with the Breeder Association!"
The certification for a Breeder is much simpler than for a Beast Tamer, yet there are far fewer certified Breeders. Su Ping had no intention of refusing. During the days Qin Xiaoxue was absent, he had learned how challenging breeding work could be without fame or official endorsement.
Anything that could make money for himself was a good thing!
However, compared to these matters, all of Su Ping’s thoughts were now tied up with the Forest Wolf’s Evolutionary Body. He nodded, exchanged a few more words of pleasantries with them, officially confirmed the bet, and then saw them off.

chapters.title: Chapter 26: Ancient Spirit-Nurturing Tea! Forest of Myriad Forms Meditation Method!
chapters.content:
Chapter 26: Chapter 26: Ancient Spirit-Nurturing Tea! Forest of Myriad Forms Meditation Method!
The scent of tea lingered.
At this moment, in the reception room, only Qin Xiaoxue and Su Ping remained.
After the previous three people left, Woodhead, excited to be allowed to stay at Heart of Woods, had already run out to play.
As Su Ping inhaled the tea’s fragrance, he wondered if it was his imagination, but his mind felt many times clearer than usual. Even the circulation of his spiritual power seemed brisker.
This tea is extraordinary!
Su Ping affirmed internally as he gazed at the brewed tea.
Although, after realizing the young lady’s identity, it seemed normal for her to casually produce such a thing.
However, Su Ping hadn’t asked Qin Xiaoxue about the identities of the individuals from earlier. He understood the art of currying favor with the wealthy.
Having missed the previous chance, he was quite content with the current situation.
It was Qin Xiaoxue who asked somewhat nervously, "Su Ping, are you confident?"
Su Ping waved his hand. "Don’t worry, what’s this tea? Just wait and see, Sister Qin. Providing Woodhead with Accelerated Casting for his cultivation will be a piece of cake."
Su Ping himself wasn’t concerned, so Qin Xiaoxue breathed a sigh of relief. If possible, she certainly hoped for Su Ping to win. "It’s good you’re confident, but Accelerated Casting won’t be necessary; having Heart of Woods is enough. As for this tea, my grandfather got it from a Spirit-Nourishing Ancient Tea Tree. After brewing, it enhances meditation effects and the speed of learning the Meditation Method. It’s even beneficial for future cultivation, so drink more! If it’s not enough, I have more."
Enhancing meditation effects and the speed of cultivation?
Su Ping’s eyebrows raised sharply. "Meditation Method? What’s that?"
He, of course, knew what meditation was, but this was the first time he’d heard of a Meditation Method.
Qin Xiaoxue blinked. "The Meditation Method is a special meditation technique that greatly enhances the effectiveness of meditation. It also makes it more convenient for Beast Tamers to control their Pet Beasts to some extent. However, it’s normal for you not to have access to it. Genuine Meditation Methods are seldom circulated in the market. Only Advanced Tamer Academies, the Beast Master Association, and some major powers or inherited families possess them. And even if you come across one, it’s hard to cultivate. The reason is simple: to practice the Meditation Method, a Beast Tamer may even require a specific kind of Pet Beast to assist! Without exposure from a young age, few Beast Tamers meet the requirements."
At this point, Qin Xiaoxue lowered her voice slightly. "For example, the Forest of Myriad Forms Meditation Method that I practice is one such method. It’s also one from the collection of the Magic Capital Advanced Beast-Taming Academy."
The Forest of Myriad Forms Meditation Method? The Magic Capital Advanced Beast-Taming Academy?
Su Ping’s mind stirred.Follow current novels on ɴovel(ꜰ)ɪre.nᴇt
Half a month ago, he wouldn’t have even known such things existed, let alone come into contact with them.
Seeing Su Ping deep in thought, Qin Xiaoxue smiled slightly. "Of course, don’t think too much. Although the Meditation Method is precious, in reality, the foundation of a Beast Tamer mainly lies in their Pet Beasts. Some with good spiritual Talent don’t need the Meditation Method to improve rapidly and can control stronger Pet Beasts. Moreover, with your Talent, these opportunities are not out of reach in the future. However, if you do wish to join the Magic Capital Advanced Beast-Taming Academy and have a chance to practice advanced Meditation Methods from the academy..."
At this point, Qin Xiaoxue lowered her voice. "Remember, when choosing your second Pet Beast, either pick a Plant Type or an Undead Type. As for specific Pet Beasts, I’ll compile a list and send it to you for consideration. Remember not to tell anyone!"
Is this exclusive information?
Su Ping was taken aback.
But... joining the Magic Capital Advanced Beast-Taming Academy?
Su Ping hadn’t really considered it. With the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas and the Heart of Wood Cultivation Base, he felt he didn’t need anything else.
That can wait until later.
As for the second Pet Beast, Su Ping had indeed considered a few. In his view, the most important aspect was not high Racial Potential. On the contrary, a species that was common and numerous would be even better.
Seeing Su Ping’s demeanor, Qin Xiaoxue did not say more on this topic.
Picking up the teacup, Su Ping took a sip. He felt a warm yet refreshing sensation that made his entire brain incredibly clear and extremely comfortable.
「Meanwhile, on the other side, after Qin Erlong and his two companions left, they split into two groups.」
Qin Erlong returned to the Beast Master Association, while Sun Chaoju and his teacher, Vice President Liu, went to the Breeder Association.
In Sun Chaoju’s car, he glanced at Vice President Liu, who was resting with his eyes closed, and then asked, "Teacher, what do you think of that Su Ping?"
Vice President Liu slowly opened his eyes, gave his student a sidelong look, and said coldly, "I know what little scheme you’re up to. Since Su Ping agreed to the bet, let it be. But as for other tactics, keep them all above board. Even if you lose, honor the bet and accept your loss. If you win, you are to deliver the Accelerated Casting cultivation method to Su Ping as well."
At these words, Sun Chaoju was startled. "Teacher, I..."
Before he could finish speaking, Vice President Liu interrupted. "It’s only because you’re my student that I’m willing to say this much. Since Su Ping has managed to gain Miss Qin’s attention, and even her friendship, he has great potential. Besides, making friends with a highly talented Breeder is a good thing. We are all from Jianghai Province, so don’t be so narrow-minded. If that kid really manages to develop the evolution method for the Wanmu Wolf and enters the Breeder Competition, then as the initial discoverer, even if you’re not the primary research Breeder, your name will still be mentioned."
Upon hearing this, Sun Chaoju’s eyes lit up, but he quickly looked at the elder with surprise. "Teacher, do you really think that Su Ping could accomplish such a feat?"
"Who knows? But I do know that it’s much better to befriend a talented young person than to make an enemy. We live in a society governed by law now. Why can’t things be settled amicably?"
Listening to his teacher’s life experience, Sun Chaoju nodded, but he still said with some doubt, "Teacher, after all, even though President Qin is only half a level higher than you, you don’t need to be so deferential towards Miss Qin..."
How exactly Sun Chaoju thought he was being deferential towards Miss Qin, he didn’t say, but Vice President Liu understood his meaning. He just looked at his student, then sighed and shook his head. "You don’t understand."
Sun Chaoju didn’t know what he didn’t understand, but he didn’t press further. He knew that even if he asked, his teacher wouldn’t tell him.
Dealing with cryptic people is frustrating, but one must always consider who they are.
「At this moment, Qin Erlong, having returned to his office, began to contemplate.」
It was the first time he had seen his granddaughter place such trust in a stranger of the opposite sex.
This sparked a peculiar thought in Qin Erlong’s mind.
Could it be possible that my granddaughter has taken a liking to Su Ping?
The thought made Qin Erlong involuntarily gasp.
If that’s the case, then that would be... excellent! Come to think of it, this Su Ping fellow might be a tad arrogant, but for someone his age, such achievements and youthful spirit are to be expected. Plus, with his aptitude, even if his Beast Taming Talent is a bit lacking, it’s not a major issue. His looks are even comparable to mine when I was young! And though his family background is ordinary, if my granddaughter likes him, none of that matters.
Thinking of this, Qin Erlong also became enthusiastic. He was incredibly eager to marry off his granddaughter to a good family soon, saving his old bones the trouble she caused. That damn Magic Capital Advanced Beast-Taming Academy, insisting on a summer break just so this little troublemaker could come and torment an old man like me! Now that she might have a new target for her antics, Qin Erlong was thrilled.
With that thought, the elder took out his phone and dialed a special number.
After three rings, a voice on the other end answered the call. "It’s rare for you, Qin Erlong, to call me at this time. Has something happened to Xiao Xue?"
"Wife, our Xiao Xue might be in love!"
"Hmm?"
"A youngster, just graduated from a basic Beast Taming school, cultivated a rare Heart of Woods for our girl. Now they’re getting along splendidly!"
"Hmm? Heart of Woods? That’s interesting. Tell me more about it."

chapters.title: Chapter 27: Ordinary Seventh Rank, The Arrival of the Gathering!
chapters.content:
Chapter 27: Chapter 27: Ordinary Seventh Rank, The Arrival of the Gathering!
The effects of the Spirit-Nurturing Ancient Tea really didn’t deceive him.
Su Ping only felt an unprecedented boiling and excitement in his spiritual power.
The smoothness of the meditation took Su Ping by surprise.
Just a few days ago, he had just broken through to the average Fifth Rank.
However, after repeatedly brewing that small pot of Spirit-Nurturing Ancient Tea several times, Su Ping found that his Spiritual Realm had directly broken through to another level.
He had reached the average Sixth Rank.
Even more so, this was just the beginning!
As Qin Xiaoxue had said, the effect of the Spirit-Nurturing Ancient Tea was to enhance meditation. After breaking through and beginning to meditate again, Su Ping could even feel that just after such a brief period of meditation, he had an inkling once more!
His spiritual power was about to boil over again.
For a Beast Tamer, there’s no such thing as a void in the Realm from breaking through too quickly; after all, a Beast Tamer’s main combat power is tied to their Pet Beasts.
Su Ping naturally wanted to seize this opportunity to fully grasp it.
Sure enough, with Su Ping’s meditation, his Realm broke through another level in the span of just one afternoon.
What’s most important is that Su Ping could even feel that this was actually still not the end.
However, allowing for some sedimentation, in the future, his meditation results might be several times better than at other times, and at the same time, future meditation practice would be much smoother.The latest_epɪ_sodes are on_the NovᴇlFɪre.ɴet
But now, Su Ping was actually already content!
He had risen from the average Fifth Rank to the average Seventh Rank.
This was just a little over a month after graduation. At such a speed, Su Ping believed that in the entire No. 6 High School, there was probably no one who could compare to him.
However, after meeting Qin Xiaoxue and being exposed to a broader world, comparing myself to my schoolmates from No. 6 High School seems quite uninteresting, right?
Shaking his head, Su Ping got up and glanced out the window at the gradually darkening sky, ripples once again spreading in his heart.
He looked at the account balance on his phone with a sense of unreality.
Is it time to readjust my mindset?
Su Ping suddenly wondered.
This time, encountering Qin Xiaoxue was my lucky chance, which allowed me to come into contact with those two individuals who were clearly major figures in Linzhou City. And there was even that special wager. All these were the results of my abilities, but were those two figures not coveting me because of Qin Xiaoxue’s connections? Or looking at the situation, whether it was the Dragon Nation as a whole or in parts such as Jianghai Province and Linzhou City, for someone like me who showed potential and ability, was nurturing still the main focus? If that were the case, I could confidently display my abilities. If that led to gaining more benefits and resources, strengthening myself, why not do so?
But everything should be done in moderation.
Su Ping knew that it was enough to continue cultivating the Forest Wolf; after all, if one had to say, that was also a skill passed down through his family.
However, if he was too hasty in cultivating other Pet Beasts and inadvertently discovered some other Cultivation methods or perfected some rare Evolution paths, that would be too conspicuous.
Steady progress is key! Only until my power is beyond any doubt.
This was the principle Su Ping set for himself. He took a slight breath. Connected in spirit, Su Ping could feel the change after his own breakthrough from the average Fifth Rank to the average Seventh Rank.
Sure enough, influenced by its master, Xiao Qing’s Realm had also received some feedback and improved.
Xiao Qing, who had just this morning reached the Proficient Level with the Sunlight Absorption Skill and had risen to the average Fifth Rank, had grown another size bigger. Its aura had also improved, reaching the average Sixth Rank.
Now Xiao Qing was already the size of an adult wolfhound.
The growth in size of a Pet Beast mainly depends on the advancement in its Realm.
And through various means to accelerate the Realm advancement of the Pet Beast, naturally, its size will also increase.
However, with Xiao Qing’s current size, it clearly could not be held in his arms as it was a few days ago.
Nevertheless, the current Xiao Qing’s battle power had also become more evident.
Su Ping smiled with satisfaction and soon took the equally eager Xiao Qing to the edge of the forest.
There was only half a month left for Woodhead’s training and the bet with Sun Chaoju.
Fifteen days to help Woodhead’s Self-Healing Skill break through to the Proficient Level would be a challenge for any ordinary Breeder, but it wouldn’t even affect Su Ping’s original training plan.
However, Su Ping was not one to slack off; he might disregard his opponent strategically, but tactically, he still paid close attention.
So, there at the forest’s edge, at his command, the Forest Wolves from within the Dark Forest swiftly gathered, their green eyes in the dark night making for an eerie sight.
"Starting now, I will be drafting a training plan that calls for the little guys who most want to get stronger to participate!"
At Su Ping’s command, almost all the Forest Wolves stood out, ready to try their luck.
Su Ping smiled slightly. "Don’t worry, all you little guys will participate tonight. We’ll just divide into two groups. One group will use Vine Strangling on the other to inflict injuries, while the other group will continuously use the Self-Healing Skill!"
His orders were conveyed to all the Forest Wolves through Old Sha.
Very quickly, the group of fewer than thirty Forest Wolves was divided into two groups, but just as Su Ping was about to initiate the skill-sharing link, he paused for a moment.
Because he then realized that the limit of fifteen Forest Wolves he could connect with had increased to seventeen!
So, the advancement of my own Realm also affected the number of Pet Beasts I could connect with?
Su Ping let out a sigh of relief. An extra Forest Wolf in the connection meant that the skill level advancement would be twice as fast compared to before.
Now, for Woodhead to improve the Skill Proficiency of Self-Healing, it would be seventeen times faster than practicing alone!
This terrifying concept was enough to allow all of Su Ping’s Pet Beasts to truly ’make up for lack of natural ability with diligence’ through sheer numbers!
In the ensuing night, among the twenty-seven Forest Wolves, the two groups were distinct: seventeen to be hit and ten to do the hitting. They began the practice of the ’Self-Healing’ Skill in the depth of the night.
Regrettably, Little Ones and his own Xiao Qing, as they had not yet grasped the Self-Healing Skill, couldn’t join in the connection and had to join the attacking side instead.
Nevertheless, Su Ping didn’t mind, confident that with Xiao Qing’s Talent, mastering Self-Healing was just a matter of time.
After giving some instructions, he left Old Sha in charge as the supervisor, making sure there were no irrecoverable casualties, and that training would continue until after twelve o’clock before ending.
A balance between work and rest was the method for improvement. Furthermore, daytime was the best time to train Forest Wolves; with the Sunlight Absorption ability, they could rapidly recover Energy and stamina.
And each night, after such a training session, Su Ping could go to Uncle Guan’s place the next day to discuss the Pet Beast rental business.
Thinking this, Su Ping sent a message to Uncle Guan, agreeing to meet the next morning to talk about the Pet Beast rental matters.
Only through real combat could the fighting power of these little guys be improved.
And to have a place where they could unleash their combat abilities freely while also making some extra money, why not?
Relaxed, Su Ping returned to his room, but just as he lay down contentedly, his phone pinged with a notification.
It was a private message, and it came from Li Shu.
After leaving the group, the only schoolmate from No. 6 High School he was still in good contact with was Li Shu, with whom he got along well.
The content of the message was simple:
"Bro Ping, tomorrow’s the reunion! I’m gonna be there too. Are you ready to roll out the red carpet for me!?"

chapters.title: Chapter 28: Renting Out Pet Beasts, Trash Forest Wolf?
chapters.content:
Chapter 28: Chapter 28: Renting Out Pet Beasts, Trash Forest Wolf?
「Yuntian Resort for Pet Beast Battles.」
It had to be said, compared to his own territory, this neighbor’s decorations here were truly admirable. There were even specially constructed roads, with shuttle buses circulating to pick up and drop off guests. The service was quite thorough. No wonder they were always trying to buy this place. Indeed, the construction investment wasn’t small.Follow current novels on NovᴇlFɪre.ɴet
However, it was clear Su Ping was not in the mood to appreciate the scenery outside the window. He yawned.
Manager Guan, seated opposite him by the coffee table, smiled and glanced at him, "Xiao Ping, didn’t sleep well last night?"
Manager Guan clearly didn’t need to ask; the slightly dark circles under Su Ping’s eyes had already given him away.
It wasn’t because he was restless about Li Shu and his classmates visiting.
Rather, it was because he had truly completed Cultivation for the first time and earned so much money.
Then, determined not to waste the effects of the Nurturing Ancient Tea, he had spent almost half the night in meditation.
Afterward, he was up until dawn selecting Poison System resources for Xiao Qing and purchasing materials for the Heart of Woods Magic Potion.
As a result, his Realm had improved slightly, but he hadn’t advanced to the next Level.
Of the more than four million he had earned, only a few tens of thousands remained.
However, the thought of the resources about to be delivered to his doorstep lifted Su Ping’s spirits.
In addition to the materials for twenty Heart of Woods Magic Potions, he had also purchased four Poison System resources: Heartbane Fruit, Monkshood Wolf Poison, Oleander in Crimson, and Devil’s Willow Leaf.
These four were all herbal Poison System resources, and Devil’s Willow Leaf was even an Elite Level Poison System resource.
It had been confirmed that Xiao Qing’s Heart of the Poison Wood could grow by consuming Poison System resources. Naturally, Su Ping wouldn’t be stingy with his Soul Contracted Beast.
Manager Guan, seeing Su Ping wasn’t in the best condition, didn’t waste any more words and handed him the contract, saying, "Xiao Ping, take a look. We at Yun Tian are really sincere about this! For your Forest Wolves, as long as they’re Ordinary Level, we guarantee five hundred a day per wolf—the same price for one battle. Elite Level ones are one thousand two hundred, also the same price per battle. Plus, professional recuperation and treatment facilities are available for free use, along with comprehensive accident insurance. You can rest assured!"
Su Ping nodded, read through it thoroughly from start to finish, and then nodded again, "No problem. But Uncle Guan, I have one condition: I must be able to interrupt the rental at any time. After all, I get busy sometimes..."
"No problem at all!" Manager Guan smiled and waved his hand. This Pet Beast rental was just a pretext; the real goal was to get Su Ping to visit Yun Tian more often and build a closer relationship.
So, Manager Guan cleared his throat and said, "Xiao Ping, as you’ve seen, I, your Uncle Guan, am truly sincere. I know a bit about your Heart of Woods’ situation. Forest Wolves are a foundational Pet Beast in Linzhou City, so there are many cultivation bases. Your dad has never cared about this aspect, but I know how Heart of Woods is doing. As the young manager of such a large cultivation base, life must not be easy for you, right? We at Yun Tian are genuinely interested in this land! What about this number?"
As he finished speaking, Manager Guan didn’t wait for Su Ping to respond and handed over a note. It had a string of zeros on it. It had to be said, the offer was indeed very sincere.
But Su Ping still said helplessly, "Uncle Guan, this land was left by my grandfather. You know my dad. Even though he can be unreliable, he takes this matter very seriously. If I dared to do such a thing behind his back, he’d break my legs. And I really don’t need the money right now."
"Don’t worry. When your dad comes back, I’ll talk to him. How about that?"
"Uncle Guan, please don’t put me in a difficult position... How about this, let me take you to see my Forest Wolves. I’m renting out sixteen: ten Ordinary Level and six Elite Level..."
Without giving him a chance to respond, Su Ping hastily got up and led Manager Guan out the door.
When they arrived at the open space in front of the main building, a figure stood there, face dark with frustration, tugging on a rope. Surrounding her were seventeen Forest Wolves.
Qin Xiaoxue finally saw Su Ping arrive, albeit late, and seemed to breathe a sigh of relief.
Who had ever made her do something like this in her entire life?
Only this brat would treat her, the esteemed Miss Qin, like a servant girl!
Especially with so many people casting curious glances her way.
So embarrassing!
But, surprisingly, despite being surrounded by this wolf pack and feeling embarrassed by the curious onlookers, Qin Xiaoxue had to admit it. The reason was simple: among the seventeen Forest Wolves, besides the sixteen Su Ping was renting out, one was her own Woodhead. And in just one night, even though Woodhead’s Self-Healing Level hadn’t improved, the feedback from their soul connection clearly told her that Woodhead had made great progress!
This brat really had some skill!
However, Qin Xiaoxue’s gaze toward Su Ping flickered thoughtfully.
Although she had a straightforward and fiery temper, she wasn’t actually foolish.
If the Yuntian Resort was backed by the Tianyun Group, that would be truly terrifying.
With the Tianyun Group as its backer, and even its chairman personally involved with Su Ping, could it all really be just about renting these dozen or so Forest Wolves?
Don’t be ridiculous.
That was clearly impossible.
Remembering their conversation that day, Qin Xiaoxue felt she had to remind Su Ping later not to be sold and still help the buyer count the money.
And, as expected, Manager Guan merely glanced at them, nodded, and then said straightforwardly, "You take these little guys to the training grounds first and wait to see if any Beast Tamers will choose them. I’ll transfer the money to you personally this evening. However, think over that matter carefully. Even if not for anything else, consider it for your own future."
After Manager Guan left, Su Ping waved his hand and, with a visibly upset Qin Xiaoxue and the seventeen Forest Wolves, including Woodhead, headed towards the training grounds at the back.
Qin Xiaoxue watched the guy in front of her, who showed no intention of helping, and her anger flared.
Is this brat really treating me like a servant girl?
But before she could speak, a voice came from nearby, "Isn’t that Su Ping? I was thinking of checking on Su the Young Master later, but here we bump into each other. What a coincidence, huh?"
Su Ping frowned. A group of people was rapidly approaching from not far away, having just stepped off a shuttle bus. The speaker was none other than Zhou Shuchen, the class president of Class Six-Two, whom he hadn’t seen in over a month.
Su Ping had never particularly liked this guy, but he’d never found him this obnoxious before.
However, Su Ping couldn’t be bothered with him and quickly spotted Li Shu waving from the crowd.
He’d heard from Li Shu yesterday that he was coming today; he just hadn’t expected him so early.
But just then, Zhou Shuchen’s next words made Su Ping freeze, "I heard everything just now. Since when did Su the Young Master become so destitute? Having to rent out these trashy Forest Wolves to make a small buck?"

chapters.title: Chapter 29: The Life Ancient Tree, Qin Xiaoxue’s Anger!
chapters.content:
Chapter 29: Chapter 29: The Life Ancient Tree, Qin Xiaoxue’s Anger!
A simple sentence instantly turned the atmosphere icy cold.
The source of this chill was definitely not just Su Ping; even more, it was Qin Xiaoxue, who already harbored grievances.
Trash Forest Wolves?
she thought.
Among these Forest Wolves is my, Miss Qin’s, own Woodhead! Besides, Forest Wolves are not trash!
Thus, the corners of Miss Qin’s mouth curled up, revealing a smile Su Ping had never seen on her cheeks before.
Although she wore sunglasses, her beauty, hard for ordinary people to match, could still be discerned.
In Linzhou City, that might be fine. However, at the Magic Capital Advanced Beast-Taming Academy, things were different. Unless it was a newcomer who had just enrolled, everyone else would definitely flee as far as possible upon seeing such a smile.
Because this signified that the young lady was truly angry.
Seemingly sensing the fluctuations in its master’s emotions, Woodhead’s body was instantly clad in wooden armor. In the next moment, the massive Forest Wolf had appeared before Zhou Shuchen. Its extended wood spike claws were only half an inch from his heart.
An indifferent voice came through the cold atmosphere, "How are you serving as class president? Didn’t Teacher Yang tell you when you enrolled that there are no truly weak Pet Beasts, only Beast Tamers who haven’t found the right development and training path?"
Zhou Shuchen looked at the enormous wolf, whose eyes were filled with cold, murderous intent, and he instinctively backed away, almost falling to the ground. He looked at Su Ping, saying, "Su Ping, have you gone mad..."
However, just then, a figure quickly descended from the bus, looking at Qin Xiaoxue, who had made the move, "Who are you? Don’t you know you can’t let Pet Beasts attack people at will? Do you have any respect for the Beast Master Association at all?"
This was a forceful voice, belonging to a man in his thirties.
Upon seeing this figure, Su Ping was slightly startled. The figure was none other than Director Zhang of No. 6 Middle School, Zhang Guowei.
By his side stood an equally unfamiliar young man with an arrogant demeanor. Yet, looking at the Forest Wolf and Qin Xiaoxue, he also showed surprise.
Qin Xiaoxue’s gaze shifted. She glanced at the self-righteous Zhang Guowei, then smiled again.
Then, a glow arose, and a figure Su Ping had never seen before appeared by her side.
Looking at this figure, Su Ping was stunned, as were Zhang Guowei, Zhou Shuchen, and everyone else who had gotten off the bus.
It was a massive tree that stood three meters tall. The tree was a lush green, surrounded by an endless aura of life, yet there was an indescribable sense of eeriness about it. On its trunk, an ancient and bizarre face gazed calmly at the people before it.
A Monarch-level Species with Racial Potential in the special Plant System category: the Life Ancient Tree!
No, something is amiss,
Su Ping thought, looking at the Life Ancient Tree and instinctively feeling something was wrong.
This is definitely not an ordinary Life Ancient Tree! Previously, I couldn’t have articulated what was amiss. However, after contracting with Xiao Qing and gaining a deeper understanding of such Pet Beasts, I sense it. This Life Ancient Tree is different from common Life Ancient Trees; it’s a mutated one! There are additional scents and auras emanating from it. A bloodline and species mutation! This is a Monarch-level Pet Beast; what value has its mutation reached?
Not only Su Ping, but everyone else was dumbfounded. Some connoisseurs in the crowd had even started to back away, not daring to watch any longer.
In any era, many individuals are worlds apart from ordinary people. Even an average Pet Beast with Monarch Racial Potential was beyond the imagination of any common Beast Tamer, let alone a mutated one.
Commander and Monarch: seemingly only one level of difference, but it was as vast as the chasm between clouds and mud!
After seeing the Life Ancient Tree, Zhang Guowei was also stunned.
What on earth is this?
he wondered.
"Now you tell the Beast Master Association to come and deal with this. Let’s see if they dare!" Qin Xiaoxue approached with graceful steps, her tone describable by only one word: unrestrained!
However, she quickly added, "The Beast Master Association has long-established regulations. All Pet Beasts in the Dragon Nation’s Beastmaster Society, as long as they are not Ferocious Beasts with a strong desire to kill and attack humans, are entitled to basic rights!
"Furthermore, Pet Beasts that reach a certain level of intelligence and have Innate deficiencies must not be provoked or insulted face-to-face by any Beast Tamers. Otherwise, those Beast Tamers will bear the consequences themselves! Do I really need to spell these things out for you? Let alone the fact I haven’t even acted; even if these Forest Wolves killed you, you’d deserve it. Utterly clueless!"
Zhang Guowei’s complexion turned extremely ugly, while Zhou Shuchen’s face became ashen. He was merely a recently graduated student. Despite having a starting point that his ordinary peers could hardly imagine, he had become arrogant in the spur of the moment, oblivious to the dangers and terrors of the outside world.
It was naturally impossible for Zhang Guowei to go to the Beast Master Association or any security department. It didn’t matter whether what Qin Xiaoxue said was true. Even if it were false, the moment the Life Ancient Tree appeared, he understood that for some people, right or wrong held no meaning.
At this moment, Su Ping finally spoke up, "Forget it. Let him learn his lesson, and that’ll be the end of it."
Looking at Su Ping, Qin Xiaoxue could tell that these people knew him, and this ignorant fool was mostly targeting Su Ping alone.
Qin Xiaoxue harrumphed coldly, and the gigantic Life Ancient Tree slowly disappeared. She rejoined the wolf pack with Woodhead.
Su Ping’s demeanor remained unchanged. Facing Zhang Guowei’s complex gaze, he even smiled and said, "Director Zhang, everyone, I’ll take the Forest Wolves to the Pet Beast battling venue first. Once you’ve settled into your rooms, come find me to hang out! I’ll be around."ɪꜰ ʏᴏᴜ ᴡᴀɴᴛ ᴛᴏ ʀᴇᴀᴅ ᴍᴏʀᴇ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs, ᴘʟᴇᴀsᴇ ᴠɪsɪᴛ NovᴇlFɪre.nᴇt
Everyone watched as the duo passed by them, heading toward the huge venue ahead.
Su Ping bore no anger. Even though he had withdrawn from the group and had no intention of forming deep associations with his old classmates and teachers, there was no need for him to adopt an arrogant, vindictive attitude and ignore them.
On the contrary, Qin Xiaoxue’s expression was still somewhat sour.
However, before the two could get far, rapid footsteps approached.
"Foster father, wait for me~"
As expected, Su Ping turned his head. It was none other than the thick-browed Li Shu, who hurried over, hugging Su Ping tightly, his eyes fixated on Qin Xiaoxue.
His Pet Beast was also of the Plant System, just a Luozisong (Pine) with Elite Level Racial Potential, worlds apart from the Life Ancient Tree. But clearly, Su Ping’s relatively good relationship with him was thanks to Li Shu’s unparalleled knack for hitting it off with people.
"Hello, beautiful lady! My name is Li Shu—Li as in ’pear blossoms,’ Shu as in ’a pear tree of blossoms overwhelms the begonias’! I am Bro Ping’s sworn son. I’m skilled in the Six Arts of a Gentleman, so if you need anything, feel free to seek me out."
Qin Xiaoxue looked at this thick-browed fellow with suspicion.
The Six Arts of a Gentleman? And I should seek him out if needed? Could he be a Breeder with special skills? But then again, for someone to have a good relationship with a Genius Breeder like Su Ping, and to be friends with a hidden dragon like him in such a small pond, he surely must possess remarkable traits, right?
With that in mind, she belatedly nodded her head.
However, this ’Six Arts of a Gentleman’ is unfamiliar. It seems different from specialized Beast Tamer paths like Breeders, Mechanists, and Necromancers? Yet, it must represent some impressive ability, I presume.
Black lines had already appeared on Su Ping’s forehead.
The Six Arts of a Gentleman: Unshakable Composure, Scornful Amusement, The ’It’s a Classic!’ Takedown, Provoking Fury, Ironic ’Devotion,’ and Stunning into Silence.
Proclaimed as the ultimate arsenal of the keyboard warrior, mastering even one art allows dominance in cyber surfing, ensuring invincibility. With these six skills in hand, one could roam unmatched!
Of course, Qin Xiaoxue, a ’normie’ Beast Tamer, had no clue about this. If she really sought out Li Shu in the future and realized she had been played, Miss Qin, not known for her good temper, would make things difficult. Su Ping would also have a hard time explaining. With no other choice, he covered his face in resignation and said, "Don’t mind him. Sometimes, like you, his mind isn’t quite right."
Qin Xiaoxue nodded. "I see."
Then, after three seconds, she realized what he had implied and glared at Su Ping, "What do you mean by that, you jerk?"
"..."

chapters.title: Chapter 30: Pet Beast Battle, Zhou Shuchen’s Challenge! (First one, please vote)
chapters.content:
Chapter 30: Chapter 30: Pet Beast Battle, Zhou Shuchen’s Challenge! (First one, please vote)
Previously, Su Ping wasn’t sure whether Yun Tian’s Pet Beast Combat Resort would be profitable. But upon seeing numerous Beast Tamers constantly coming in and out of the vast venue, he realized his vision had been too narrow.
My perspective was too limited.
All business involving Pet Beasts is extremely expensive. The same applies to charging for Pet Beast battles.
Fighting with friends naturally doesn’t incur extra costs. Yun Tian even waives these basic arena usage fees, as long as no significant damage is caused.
However, after a battle, treatments and the recovery of strength and energy are always necessary, aren’t they? Otherwise, how could anyone enjoy themselves to the fullest?
This is where the major expenses come into play. If one chooses to practice with Pet Beasts provided by Yun Tian, it costs even more.
Even for combat, if one wishes to fight to their heart’s content, spending several thousand to tens of thousands in a day is quite normal.
Pet Beasts represent the largest consumer group in this world.
This is also normal, as a Beast Tamer’s main combat power relies on their Pet Beasts. These pets are key to their personal advancement to transcendent power and social mobility. If they were so easy to obtain, it would indeed be unreasonable.
And this vast venue is just one of the combat training facilities in Yun Tian’s resort. Even so, this facility includes arena battles, virtual simulation fights, open-air combat, and various simulated terrain battles.
No wonder business is booming; Yun Tian has really invested heavily.
Looking at all this, Su Ping was brimming with enthusiasm. However, he still followed them to a separate training ground.
This was an open-air training area, and also the territory where Su Ping had settled his Forest Wolves. Even if it was a rental arrangement, not all of his Forest Wolves would be chosen to leave. Su Ping needed a space where he could train while waiting for battles.
Qin Xiaoxue also watched Su Ping with great interest as he stood before the Forest Wolves. She was genuinely intrigued by him and even more curious about how he trained his Pet Beasts.
Just then, her phone rang. Qin Xiaoxue’s eyebrows immediately furrowed. After a short while, she said to Su Ping, "Su Ping, I have some business in Linzhou City. I’ll be back soon!"
Su Ping didn’t mind and nodded.
Meanwhile, Li Shu, who had watched Qin Xiaoxue leave, finally breathed a sigh of relief. He then rushed over to Su Ping, winking and nudging him. "Bro Ping, Brother Ping, foster dad, when will you pass on your unparalleled techniques to me?"
"What unparalleled techniques?"
"Your secrets to wooing women, of course!" Li Shu was almost jumping up and down. "No wonder you weren’t interested in Yin Yin, even though she clearly likes you! Turns out you already knew such a top-tier beauty!"
Su Ping looked at him skeptically.
We’ve barely interacted, or perhaps that earlier display wasn’t meant for him. Otherwise, Zhou Shuchen and the previously mentioned Sun Chaoju would serve as examples.
"Besides, when has Yin Yin ever been interested in me? Stop spreading such nonsense..."
Before Su Ping could finish, a voice came from behind him, "Exactly! Li Shu, stop spreading rumors!"
Li Shu turned his head. Sure enough, Zhou Shuchen and the other students, who had just paid the deposit, were approaching. Among them was Yin Yin, whose face seemed to turn a little red, apparently having overheard the conversation.Follow current novels on
