While this Pet Beast wasn’t particularly noted for its combat prowess, one of its attributes was especially noteworthy: It was a rare space-attribute Pet Beast!
Staring at the information about Dong Muyun on the screen, Su Ping fell into deep thought.

chapters.title: Chapter 40 The Future of the Heart of Woods, The Figure in the Night (Three Updates)
chapters.content:
Chapter 40: Chapter 40 The Future of the Heart of Woods, The Figure in the Night (Three Updates)
DING DONG...
The doorbell rang.
Su Ping frowned. Since someone had arrived without prior notice, he could only drag his exhausted body to open the door.
Two familiar figures arrived as dusk settled.
It was none other than the Zhang Family Brothers, the twins he’d met during the day.
"It’s you guys, please come in!"
Although still very tired, Su Ping mustered his energy and led the visiting guests into the living room.
"I don’t have much to offer for drinks. Please make do with this."
Su Ping got two bottles of Coke.
He did have some tea and a drink-making machine, but he truly lacked the energy to properly host them at the moment.
Clearly, the brothers hadn’t come for such trivial matters. After a quick ’thank you’ from the older brother, Zhang Wen, he promptly asked,
"Um..."
"Just call me Su Ping."
Zhang Wen then blurted out,
"Su Ping, what specific services do you offer for Forest Wolf training? You do have a business license and all that, right?"
Although Jin Cheng, who seemed quite knowledgeable, had given Su Ping extremely high praise during the day, the brothers still needed to see for themselves before they could be certain.
After all, Pet Beast Cultivation is no small matter.
Besides the huge expense, what’s most important is that it could affect their future!
So, the caution displayed by the Zhang Family Brothers was understandable.
Su Ping simply smiled,
"Don’t worry. If your Pet Beast dies due to my Cultivation methods, you won’t need to sue me. I’ll turn myself in."
With that, Su Ping’s expression turned a bit more serious,
"However, the Cultivation I offer here is different from other places. The skill I cultivate is the Wood Element’s rare skill, ’Heart of Woods.’ You should understand the value and significance of the Heart of Woods.
"Therefore, the cost for successfully cultivating this skill in one Pet Beast is 4,000,000. If it’s not successful, the materials fee is 1,000,000. Aside from that, I also offer skill level enhancement Cultivation, but I don’t have time to take on that service at the moment.
"In a while, if you come back, I’ll also offer Cultivation for the Forest Wolf’s Accelerated Casting, but I haven’t decided on the specific pricing yet. If you’re the first to try it out then, I’ll give you a discount."
Su Ping said this as if he were offering them a great bargain.
That’s right, Su Ping raised his prices!
Having experienced the recent events, Su Ping had gained a deeper understanding of his own abilities!
Just consider the Heart of Woods skill! Sun Chaoju dared to openly ask for 3,000,000 for Accelerated Casting, non-refundable whether successful or not. Compared to him, I’m much more conscientious.
For the service this ability warranted, the price was actually a bit low.
If it really succeeds, its value is beyond monetary measure.
This is the value of knowledge in the Beastmaster Society!
Besides, things are different now than they were a few days ago!
The current Su Ping is a genuine Intermediate Level Breeder officially registered with the Breeder Association!
With this price, who knows how it might change in the future.
However, it was clear that the Zhang Family Brothers standing before him were not fools with deep pockets like Qin Xiaoxue. Even though it was apparent that their family wasn’t short of money, they certainly weren’t the sort to casually throw away millions.
The two exchanged a troubled look. After a moment of contemplation, the elder brother, Zhang Wen, spoke up,
"Su Ping, can’t you give us a little discount?"
The recently graduated young man was clearly not skilled at haggling; his cheeks even flushed a bit after he spoke.
But Su Ping shook his head,
"Sorry, but I also bear risks."
Seeing Su Ping’s firm stance, the brothers said,
"How about this, can we discuss it with our family and give you an answer in a few days?"
Su Ping smiled,
"Of course. I wouldn’t dream of forcing a sale."
Relieved, the brothers left.
Meanwhile, Su Ping sank into thought. It wasn’t about the discount. In fact, even if the two of them paid outright, Su Ping wouldn’t be able to cultivate the Heart of Woods for their Forest Wolf yet.
The resources and materials he had purchased were still in transit and would take some time to arrive.
Su Ping was deep in contemplation. He had never thought of just being satisfied with the status quo. Becoming a Breeder was naturally a goal, but not primarily for making money. After all, no matter how amazing a Breeder or how respected a Breeding Master, they couldn’t compare to a true high-level Beast Tamer.
Only mastering extraordinary taming powers was Su Ping’s true pursuit and dream.
His Cultivation ability was a means to indirectly enhance his own strength.
The appearance of the Zhang Family Brothers was neither the first nor would it be the last. It was foreseeable that as his abilities and reputation grew, there would be an endless stream of customers. He didn’t want to lose the time he had to train his own Pet Beasts.
Tʜe source of this ᴄontent ɪs NoᴠᴇFɪre.nᴇt
So, should he find some assistants in the future or, like other Pet Beast Breeding Bases, set up a complete assembly line?
Blinking, Su Ping decided it would be necessary in the future.
It wasn’t just about the money. At a Pet Beast Breeding Base, he would have the chance to interact with many Pet Beasts at any time. This could help the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas level up faster, thereby accelerating his own strength improvement.
As for money, it would be earned regardless.
His Cultivation skills were certainly much stronger than those of the deceiving Breeders on the market, right?
Shaking his head, Su Ping dragged his tired body and called the Forest Wolves back to him.
Their Self-Healing training couldn’t stop.
However, the Forest Wolves that had fought during the day were allowed to rest properly. Only those few that hadn’t participated would join today’s training.
After arranging all this, Su Ping resumed pondering the issues he had been considering.
However, after only a short while, Su Ping, who hadn’t rested well to begin with, succumbed to his exhaustion and slowly drifted into a deep sleep.
In front of the woods, some of the Forest Wolves rested, while others spontaneously joined the training.
Thus, the rest of the vast Heart of Woods Pet Beast Breeding Base was deserted.
And at that moment, just behind the Heart of Woods’ forest, at the boundary adjoining Yuntian Resort and the banks of the Lingxi River, a faint ripple slowly materialized in the darkness of the night.
This was a unique spatial fluctuation.
Then, from within this subtle ripple, a tiny figure appeared seemingly out of nowhere. It tilted its head, looking around with some confusion.
However, it quickly concealed its form and vanished once more.
Not long after, Old Sha, who had been watching the Forest Wolves train in front of the woods, seemed to stiffen. He looked towards the Lingxi River, sniffed the air, and a puzzled expression crossed his face.

chapters.title: Chapter 41: Exile, A Never-Ending Stream of Visitors! (Four Updates)
chapters.content:
Chapter 41: Chapter 41: Exile, A Never-Ending Stream of Visitors! (Four Updates)
An alluring yet indifferent gaze overlooked the building below, where the figure stood as if she rightfully belonged high above.
However, her unusually cold expression, even more so than on other days, made it clear that this queen-like presence was not in a good mood.
Indeed, this was the case.
Dong Muyun glanced at Manager Guan, who stood there constantly wiping sweat from his brow, and her red lips parted as she said indifferently, "You offered that price, and the kid still disagreed? And now, he might have sensed something, to the point that he has even stopped the rentals?"
Her voice was calm, yet it made the beads of sweat on Manager Guan’s forehead grow more profuse. He quickly said, "It’s not necessarily that he has sensed anything. Su Ping isn’t short of money now. He has become an Intermediate Breeder and, in this short period, seems to have invented the cultivation technique for the Forest Wolf’s Heart of Woods. It’s now registered with the Breeder Association."
As he said this, Manager Guan even felt a touch of admiration. He had been here for several years and had considerable contact with the Su Family father and son. He naturally knew what the Heart of Woods had been like before.
And now, Su Ping had inexplicably become an Intermediate Breeder. Moreover, since that morning, a constant stream of people had been coming and going. With a little inquiry, he discovered that this kid was really about to take off!
However, it was clear that these words made Dong Muyun slowly turn her head and look at him calmly. "Manager Guan Qianshan," she stated, "from now on, you will no longer be the manager of Yuntian Resort. The company has a construction and development plan for an aquatic Pet Beast breeding base on Crescent Island. You are to go there and supervise the work."
Her placid words made Manager Guan’s face turn pale.Follow current ɴᴏᴠᴇʟs on Novᴇ(l)Fɪre .ɴᴇt
Crescent Island was a small island in Jianghai Province, undoubtedly a desolate place.
Is this banishment?
he thought.However, having come to report, he was mentally prepared. Instead, he suddenly felt much more relaxed and nodded. "Yes!"
Manager Guan had a very good relationship with the Su Family father and son. He could guess that the chairman’s persistent desire to buy the land deed was for other reasons. This feeling had always made Manager Guan feel guilty, as if he were deceiving a child. Now, being suddenly banished, he felt an unprecedented sense of relief in his heart.
"Take the bus while it’s still running and hand over your duties to the new manager today," Dong Muyun said.
Watching him leave, Dong Muyun’s impassive gaze showed no change.
Tianyun was a small kingdom, and she was its sole queen.
With a thought, a light flashed in the spacious living room. A silver, strange fish, about the size of a dolphin, appeared in the air.
"KREE... KREE..."
A peculiar cry sounded. Only then did Dong Muyun reveal a hint of a smile, but it vanished quickly, and her brow furrowed. "The spatial fluctuations are becoming more intense? To the point that even some high-level Pet Beasts can faintly sense it?"
The silver, strange fish nodded, as if it understood.
Dong Muyun’s eyes shifted slightly, sweeping across the land beneath her feet. "Is it going to appear so soon? Months ahead of predictions. What happened?"
However, looking at the distant Heart of Woods base, Dong Muyun’s expression gradually calmed. "An Intermediate Breeder? Interesting. It seems I’ll have to find time to personally meet this young friend in a few days."
***
Su Ping was obviously unaware that his decision not to continue renting Pet Beasts that day had led to Manager Guan being directly banished from his position.
It wasn’t that he was lazy. Though tired, his efforts were indeed bearing fruit.
Besides the three Pet Beasts whose skill levels had a breakthrough during combat, Su Ping had another pleasant surprise when he woke up that morning: Little Ones and Xiao Qing had both undergone changes.
Little Ones had grasped the Forest Wolf’s primary combat skill: Vine Strangling.
And Xiao Qing, much to Su Ping’s relief, had grasped Self-Healing.
Such progress demonstrated the necessity of actual combat experience for Pet Beasts.
Alas, since waking up—no, since being jolted awake by a phone call that morning—he hadn’t had a moment’s peace. He was now beginning to understand why Vice President Liu had said what he did upon leaving.
The calls included Junior Breeders also skilled with Forest Wolves and curious Intermediate Breeders. There were also Forest Wolf Beast Tamers wanting to consult about cultivation services, and representatives from companies or studios wanting to recruit him, with compensation and benefits open to discussion. Some even made offers to purchase the Heart of Woods cultivation method at unimaginable prices. Finally, a journalist from a media outlet came wanting an interview.
There was no way around it. As an eighteen-year-old Intermediate Breeder, even a little publicity about him was sure to attract considerable attention.
How could the media not be interested in such a perfect news story?
Su Ping decisively silenced his phone.
Then, he finally understood why the certificate badge of an Intermediate Breeder had made Jin Cheng so envious the day before. For the first time, he realized that such a high-profit business could attract so many incessant inquiries.
This was especially true after he saw that the still-in-training Woodhead and Little Ones had also awakened the Heart of Woods.
It’s as if these people have no use for money!
It made Su Ping quite embarrassed to raise the price again to five million, but this barely reduced the number of inquiries.
Although most were just inquiries, and not many actually paid a deposit, when people asked, he couldn’t just ignore them, could he?
Perhaps some might wonder: why spend so much money cultivating a Forest Wolf? With just a little more, one could try to buy a Pet Beast with greater Racial Potential.
The issue wasn’t so simple. Not everyone is born with money and opportunities. Many people’s first contracted Pet Beast was a Forest Wolf. Later, they might have become successful and had higher-level choices, but the contract was already completed. Such cases were not rare. Moreover, as one of Linzhou City’s original Pet Beasts, the Forest Wolf had many developed evolution paths, and its cultivation potential was not low either.
In such a rush, Su Ping couldn’t even personally supervise Pet Beast training, let alone find time to take Pet Beasts for rental battles.
Finally, after a busy day sending off the last two inquiring Beast Tamers, Su Ping stood at his own gate and let out a long sigh of relief.
However, he soon noticed a distinct figure standing not far away at the bus stop.
It was Manager Guan.
Su Ping was just about to speak.
After all, I promised him yesterday,
he thought,
and now I’m not going. I should at least explain.
But before he could open his mouth, he saw Manager Guan, suitcase in hand, boarding the bus.
Su Ping frowned slightly, watching the bus recede into the distance, lost in thought.
Soon, however, he shook his head. Before he could dwell on it further, another private car drove up nearby.
Then, the car door opened. "Excuse me, is this Breeder Su’s cultivation base?"
For the first time, Su Ping felt so overwhelmed.
And for the first time in his life, he thought,
Making money is truly not for humans! It’s just too agonizing.

chapters.title: Chapter 42 The Fallen Pine and Li Shu, Resources Delivered! (First Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 42: Chapter 42 The Fallen Pine and Li Shu, Resources Delivered! (First Update)
「Afternoon.」
Su Ping was doing the work he was most familiar with. Wearing a mask and holding tweezers, with a wooden basket on his back, he continued to sort through the Forest Wolf droppings before him, which resembled wood shavings.
Only this time, he wasn’t the only one subjected to this torment. Beside him, Li Shu looked aggrieved and indignant.
"Bro Ping, is this how you introduce me to the work and life of a Breeder?"
Su Ping glanced at him. "If you’re not willing, then get lost! There are plenty of Junior Breeders out there eager to be apprentices."
Deflated, Li Shu returned to diligently scooping poop. After giving him a look, Su Ping nodded in satisfaction.
Although Li Shu was a bit unpredictable, he was reliable and enthusiastic in his work.
A good assistant indeed. That’s right, an assistant.
It had been two days since Li Shu had come to deliver Su Ping’s Intermediate Breeder certificate. In those two days, Su Ping felt he had received more phone calls than in his entire life. This was the influence of the Breeder Association’s backing. Now, Su Ping was beginning to understand the power of such official organizations.
As a result, Su Ping had switched his original phone number to serve as the Heart of Woods reception line. He then applied for a new one and sent the new number to people he knew, finally getting some peace.
Although many inquiries came by phone, most did not follow up after hearing the price. The Beast Tamers with real intentions to pay for Cultivation were those who personally visited. Li Shu was responsible for receiving them, handling guests in the morning and learning basic Cultivation for interacting with Forest Wolves from Su Ping in the afternoon.
As for Su Ping, he had pleaded for mercy, asking Vice President Liu to take down the promotional advertisement. He also wrote the Cultivation prices and a new Rule at the entrance: Only one Forest Wolf will be accepted for Cultivation per week. If interested, please schedule an appointment.
Finally, the world became completely quiet.
Money can never be enough,
Su Ping mused.
The purpose of making money is to cultivate Pet Beasts better; priorities should not be confused.
Otherwise, Su Ping wouldn’t have the time to leisurely scoop poop with Li Shu here.
As for returning to Yuntian Resort to rent Pet Beasts, Su Ping hadn’t gone again. After speaking with Qin Xiaoxue, Su Ping had become much more cautious about Yuntian Resort. Moreover, as he had said that day, renting so many Pet Beasts in a row meant he had to constantly watch over them at Yun Tian, which was both worrisome and exhausting. Although battles greatly improved the Pet Beasts, doing it occasionally was fine; however, daily battles were too much. The Forest Wolves might withstand it, but Su Ping couldn’t.
Li Shu glanced at Su Ping, sincere admiration flashing in his eyes.
Li Shu might appear frivolous, but he wasn’t dumb. This became clear when he talked to his father, Li Senlin, via video chat that night. Upon mentioning Su Ping’s Intermediate Breeder certificate, Li Senlin reacted as if he had seen a ghost. Even his father had shamelessly tried to use Li Shu’s connection to see if he could interview Su Ping, but regrettably, he was politely declined.
What did it mean for a peer to so drastically alter his father’s opinion of his friendships?
Although his own Talent was average, in a society so closely intertwined with Pet Beasts, everyone wanted to become a professional Beast Tamer or find a profession where they could rely entirely on Pet Beasts for a living. Besides passion, it also represented a promising future. Therefore, he was also thick-skinned in his desire to stay here longer.
Being able to learn a little more from Su Ping would be good.
Su Ping himself didn’t really care; in fact, he was quite happy to have Li Shu stay. The reason was pretty simple. For example, right then, Su Ping wasn’t carrying much Forest Wolf dung, but Li Shu’s basket was piled high with it.
And right then, the two of them stood before a particular item.
It was a small pine tree, only about one meter tall. The vibrant green leaves swayed gently, as if welcoming their master’s arrival. This was the Luozisong (Pine), a Plant-based Pet Beast with Elite Tier Racial Potential. Its main combat Skill was the Pine Cone Cannon; it could condense pine cones on its branches and shoot them out with great power, making it a stationary artillery-type Pet Beast.
"Do you know why I had you shovel poop?" Su Ping asked.
"First, getting the scent of Forest Wolf dung on you can greatly reduce their aggression towards you, or even eliminate their hostility. With me around, you can get closer to other wild Forest Wolves.
"Second, some Plant Type Pet Beasts absorb Forest Wolf dung extremely well, which can accelerate their growth. The Luozisong is one of them.
"That’s all. If we were outside, forget about shoveling it for free; you’d have to pay me a thousand Gold just for the privilege of touching it!"
Li Shu’s eyes lit up, and he instantly straightened. "My fault! I didn’t appreciate your painstaking efforts, adoptive father! I deserve to die! From now on, adoptive father, you can leave the Forest Wolves’ daily poop to me! If the Luozisong doesn’t use it all up, I will!"
Watching Li Shu thump his chest and make promises, Su Ping glanced sideways at the guy. But he was too lazy to contradict this show-off’s antics; instead, he turned his gaze to the Luozisong in front of him.
He had agreed to let Li Shu stay at the Heart of Woods for a while, not only because he had a good relationship with Li Shu, but also because Li Shu had indirectly done him a great favor by leading to Qin Xiaoxue’s arrival. After all, without Qin Xiaoxue, it would have been difficult for Heart of Woods to secure its first round of start-up capital, let alone the subsequent acquaintance with Vice President Liu and that special wager.
Besides these reasons, there was another main one: this Luozisong.
Within the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, there were countless Pet Beast Compendiums waiting to be illuminated and activated. Although the Luozisong wasn’t his Pet Beast, as long as he reached the intimacy threshold with one, he could activate its compendium entry. Upgrading was one aspect, but just by activating it, he could receive corresponding rewards. Su Ping naturally wouldn’t miss out on the Origin rewards of the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas.
Therefore, Su Ping also wanted to use the time Li Shu was here to try and bond with the Luozisong, hoping to increase its intimacy to the required level, light up the Luozisong’s Pet Beast Compendium entry, and obtain a reward.
To prepare for this, Su Ping had even consulted abundant information on the Cultivation requirements and details for the Luozisong, but hadn’t found anything particularly useful. He then asked Qin Xiaoxue for some tips on cultivating Plant-based Pet Beasts, which gave him a bit more confidence.
Forest Wolf dung was a fertilizer that the majority of Pet Beasts in the Plant System desperately needed. Unfortunately, the fertilizing Magic Potion formulas for these Plant-based Pet Beasts were also hard to come by; even with money, Su Ping found them difficult to collect. Su Ping could only use the most basic method: mixing quality soil with the Forest Wolf dung and applying it around the Luozisong.
But before Su Ping had a chance to get closer to the Luozisong in front of him, to communicate feelings and experience the relatively tender expressions of a Plant-based Pet Beast, his phone suddenly chimed with a DING-DONG sound.
He took it out and saw a message appear:
[The item you purchased has been delivered. Please come outside to receive it promptly, thank you!]
A hint of joy flashed in Su Ping’s eyes.
The materials he had purchased for millions of Gold had finally arrived! Could the Heart of Woods Cultivation for the other Forest Wolves, and Xiao Qing’s intake of Poison System resources, finally begin?

chapters.title: Chapter 43: Xiao Qing’s Poison Type Cultivation! (Part 2)
chapters.content:
Chapter 43: Chapter 43: Xiao Qing’s Poison Type Cultivation! (Part 2)
"Thank you for choosing Fei Kong Express Logistics. Courier Wang Hao, employee ID 95,841, and his Pet Beast courier, Gaga, greet you."
"Gaga!"
"Please check your delivery items. If everything is correct, you may sign for it."
After inspecting the materials from the Giant Feathered Sparrow named Gaga and from the courier’s Space Ring, Su Ping verified that everything was correct before signing for the package.
Inside were less than twenty sets of materials for the Heart of Woods Magic Potion, as well as the four portions of Poison System Resources.
It cost Su Ping over four million, all the money he had earned from Qin Xiaoxue.
Li Shu was still fertilizing the Luozisong pines, so Su Ping didn’t ask for his help.
When dealing with goods worth millions, one could never be too careful.
Besides, even if Su Ping had asked Li Shu, knowing what these materials were, Li Shu would likely have been reluctant to handle them.
Su Ping took Xiao Qing, who was still in training, and immediately headed to the medical room without stopping.
He could hardly wait.
Compared to crafting new Magic Potions to cultivate other Forest Wolves to obtain the Heart of Woods skill, his own soul-bonded Pet Beast was naturally more important.
Moreover, Su Ping had been eager to test Xiao Qing’s tolerance for these Poison System Resources.
"AWOOO!"
Xiao Qing was quite excited too.
The little creature could sense its master’s excitement; moreover, it was here that it had comprehended the Heart of the Poison Wood.
This place held special significance in Xiao Qing’s heart.
After turning on the Life Detector to monitor Xiao Qing’s vital signs, Su Ping put on a gas mask before carefully opening a small wooden box he had brought.
Although these Poison System Resources had been processed, Beast Tamers were more vulnerable than Pet Beasts at this stage. It was always better to err on the side of caution.
It was a special type of plant.
With dark green branches and leaves, it had three dark purple flowers.
The flowers were still vibrant, yet they emitted no pungent smell. Instead, they possessed an indescribable, seductive beauty.
Yet, such a beautiful plant had an unfitting name: Wolfsbane Aconite.
The name was ferocious, but it was actually the cheapest among the three Poison System Resources he had purchased.
It was a purely plant-based Poison System Resource, unrelated to Poison Type Pet Beasts.
Therefore, it had relatively low value and could only be helpful to some common Poison Type Pet Beasts.
But that was enough.
Xiao Qing’s reaction confirmed that Su Ping’s decision was correct.
Upon seeing the plant, Xiao Qing’s deep eyes fixed on it, its entire attention captured.
As a carnivore, its desire for such a plant was a call from its bloodline and genes.
However, Pet Beasts do not know self-restraint, but Su Ping did. He put on specially-made gloves. He wouldn’t give the entire Wolfsbane Aconite directly to Xiao Qing to swallow.
Instead, he plucked a single purple flower and handed it to Xiao Qing.
Xiao Qing swallowed it in one bite. Without even chewing, it gulped down the flower.
Su Ping was somewhat speechless.
Then, the Pet Beast and its master just stared at each other. After a full ten minutes, watching his master’s eyes behind the gas mask turn almost red from staring, Xiao Qing tilted its head and uttered, "AWOOO."
Su Ping’s eyelid twitched. He quickly glanced at the Life Detector; all readings were normal, and not even its heart rate or pulse had risen in the slightest.
Not strong enough?
Clearly, the ingestion of this Wolfsbane Aconite seemed to have no significant effect on Xiao Qing.
So, Su Ping picked another flower from the Wolfsbane Aconite.
It was the same swift process, the same familiar GULP, and the same familiar ten minutes of a staring contest.
"AWOOO..."
Xiao Qing opened its mouth again, sticking out its tongue and licking its lips; the implication was clear.
Looking at the remaining flower and leaves of the Wolfsbane Aconite, Su Ping fell into doubt.
Could I have actually bought a fake?
That made no sense—the Beast Master Association cracked down hard on such things!
However, Su Ping soon narrowed his eyes.
"Xiao Qing, open your mouth."
"AWOO?"
Xiao Qing opened its mouth and looked doubtfully at its master. Su Ping took a closer look and, sure enough, its normally pink tongue now had some faint purple coloration. Other than that, there were no changes.
This time, Su Ping gritted his teeth, prepared an antidote and stomach lavage equipment, and then placed the entire remaining Wolfsbane Aconite in front of Xiao Qing.The source of this content ɪs NovᴇlFir(e).nᴇt
GULP.
It swallowed it in one bite.
Su Ping’s heart tensed.
Poison System Resources were not like other resources. If other resources didn’t work, they generally didn’t pose much of a life-threatening risk, but Poison System Resources were different. Su Ping even had to provide identification when purchasing these items.
Sure enough!
This time, within five minutes, Su Ping saw on the Life Detector that Xiao Qing’s pulse and heartbeat began to accelerate.
Su Ping held his breath, intently watching Xiao Qing’s condition and the Life Detector.
Xiao Qing, which had seemed spirited before, suddenly drooped, slumping onto the table. Purple, vein-like markings even surfaced on its body. However, the traces were very faint.
This purple, appearing on Xiao Qing’s originally emerald-green fur, looked particularly striking. However, these purple, vein-like markings lasted only a few minutes before disappearing again.
Afterward, Xiao Qing reopened its eyes and stood up.
Su Ping, however, furrowed his brows slightly.
He was, of course, relieved that Xiao Qing’s life was not in danger, but now, there was no improvement in its Realm or Skills. Even his guess that the Heart of the Poison Wood’s effects might improve didn’t pan out; there was no change whatsoever.
This left Su Ping slightly disappointed.
But this was also normal. After all, the Wolfsbane Aconite was the most basic of Poison System Resources and not very valuable.
And now that Xiao Qing had reached the Ordinary Sixth Stage, it would have been unreasonable for it to advance so easily. The Heart of the Poison Wood’s effect was powerful, and Xiao Qing’s mutated Poison Type bloodline was remarkable, but there was no reason for such rapid improvement.
However, just as this thought surfaced, Su Ping was surprised to find that the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas had suddenly reacted. On the Forest Wolf’s emerald-green card, beneath the log entries, a new record slowly appeared:
[The effectiveness of Poison Type cultivation for Pet Beasts with mutated Poison Type bloodlines has marginally improved; analysis requirements have been somewhat reduced.]
[Further analysis into the reasons for the Forest Wolf’s Poison Type mutation is now possible. By expending 49,990 Experience Points from this Catalog, you can forcibly determine the cause of the Forest Wolf’s Poison Type bloodline mutation and obtain the mutation cultivation method.]

chapters.title: Chapter 44: Proficient Level Poison Vine Strangulation! Xiao Qing’s Improvement! (Three Updates)
chapters.content:
Chapter 44: Chapter 44: Proficient Level Poison Vine Strangulation! Xiao Qing’s Improvement! (Three Updates)
Hmm?
Su Ping raised his eyebrows as he felt the feedback from the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas regarding Xiao Qing’s recent changes. Although he hadn’t seen any progress in Xiao Qing through the Eye of Truth, the display from the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas indicated Xiao Qing’s condition.
Not to mention anything else, just the fact that the Experience Points needed to analyze Xiao Qing’s bloodline mutation had decreased is already tremendous news. Even though it’s just a reduction of a mere ten Experience Points, isn’t this just the beginning? Could it be that as long as I correspondingly enhance Xiao Qing’s Poison Type bloodline and help it ingest Poison System Resources, the Experience Points required for analysis will continue to decrease? Compared to the Poison System Resources that can be purchased with money, the Experience Points from the Catalog are undoubtedly more precious.
Over the past few days, even though no other Forest Wolf had reached the required affinity for a significant rise in Catalog Experience, through daily training and the continuous improvement of these little ones, Su Ping’s Forest Wolf Catalog Experience had risen to over one hundred, nearing two hundred. Although it was still far from two thousand, Experience Points were not solely used for upgrading the Catalog.
What I’m concerned about is perfecting the other Cultivation methods and the Evolution method for the ’Wanmu Wolf’ that Sun Chaoju is soon to lose to me. That incomplete Evolution Cultivation method will undoubtedly require a large consumption of Experience Points to supplement. I need to be prepared.
Su Ping resolved.
After patting Xiao Qing’s head, which was still somewhat confused, Su Ping began to worry anew.
Mutated Pet Beasts were indeed excellent, possessing Abilities and development different from other Pet Beasts; Xiao Qing, for instance, could break through its race limit. But there was a downside: the uncertainty in their future Evolution.
It’s true that Breeders can change some materials during the Cultivation and Evolution process based on the mutant Attributes. However, such Breeders are exceedingly rare and valuable. My current status is entirely due to the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas. When it comes to Cultivation and Evolution, I’m still a beginner.
With this in mind, Su Ping’s gaze hardened.
The power of the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas is undisputed. Perhaps, as the Catalog improves, it might be possible to develop a perfect Evolutionary Form for Mutated Pet Beasts like Xiao Qing. But for now, that isn’t possible. What I need to do now is improve my Breeder ability and truly become an elite Breeder! That way, I can find the perfect method for Xiao Qing’s future Evolution!
With that thought, Su Ping’s spirits lifted suddenly.
Time waits for no one. However, these things can’t be accomplished overnight.
For now, the most important thing was to take Xiao Qing for a test.
He led Xiao Qing, who had regained its spirit, out of the woods. This time, Su Ping didn’t pick one of the Little Ones as a test subject but directly found a Forest Wolf that had reached the Elite Tier.
"San Ha, come here!"
Su Ping was casual with naming these Forest Wolves. As long as they could be recognized, it was barely acceptable.
The Forest Wolf called San Ha trotted over proudly and energetically. Then, under the resentful gaze of San Ha, Xiao Qing’s purple vines swiftly wrapped around it. The serrated barbs painfully pierced San Ha’s unresisting fur.
Su Ping naturally understood his own Pet Beasts better than the other Forest Wolves. Quickly, he noticed something.Google seaʀᴄh ɴovel(ꜰ)ɪre.nᴇt
Although there were no improvements in Xiao Qing’s tier, realm, or skill level, I can sense from San Ha’s reaction that the toxicity of Xiao Qing’s Poison Vine Strangulation has increased. As for how much and to what extent, more extensive testing will be required to determine that.
However, just as he was about to stop the fight, the purple vines around San Ha suddenly darkened dramatically, and their texture acquired an indescribably different feel. What was previously as thin as a finger, in a split second, thickened to the girth of a baby’s wrist!
"AROOO!"
San Ha, who had only been somewhat resentful and discontented, suddenly let out a scream of agony. Clearly, while the Poison Vine Strangulation had caused it some discomfort, this sudden change brought an indescribable pain, even a sense of threat!
Su Ping reacted instantly, his Eye of Truth locking onto Xiao Qing. Sure enough, at this moment, Xiao Qing’s Poison Vine Strangulation had unexpectedly advanced from Beginner to the Proficient Level!
Although the shared connection ability means the skill levels of my Pet Beasts increase rapidly, Xiao Qing’s improvement is indeed beyond my expectations. Currently, Xiao Qing hasn’t even fully mastered all of its Racial Skills, with Accelerated Growth still to be comprehended, yet Sunlight Absorption and Poison Vine Strangulation have already reached the Proficient Level. Of course, this is also due to Xiao Qing’s outstanding innate Talent.
At the same time, I’ve also confirmed one thing: the ’Vine Strangling’ practiced by the Forest Wolves can be shared and utilized alongside Xiao Qing’s ’Poison Vine Strangulation’. Apart from recently comprehending Self-Healing, what’s left to learn is Heart of the Poison Wood. However, this ability is a semi-passive skill, and currently, with only Woodhead, Old Sha, Little One, and Xiao Qing linked together, the shared training effect is relatively average. Of course, that problem is no longer an issue now! All the materials I bought for the Heart of Woods Magic Potion were for this very moment, weren’t they? Moreover, I also want to test the other effects and uses of the Magic Potion.
Instantly, Su Ping waved his hand, instructing Xiao Qing and Woodhead to continue their prior training, one acting as the attacking party while the other focused on practicing the ’Self-Healing’ skill.
Meanwhile, he called out in a loud voice, "Old Sha!"
"AWOO!"
Old Sha, who hadn’t heard the young master call him individually for a long time, immediately perked up his ears like the most loyal of butlers, stiffening his neck in anticipation of the young master’s command.
"Come on, it’s time to pull weeds!"
Instantly, Old Sha’s perked ears drooped.
"AWOOO..."
His voice became listless.
He knew all too well what ’pulling weeds’ entailed!
Luckily, this time, aside from master and servant, there was another helper...
「Eventually, night fell.」
Li Shu, after a busy day, returned to his room. His father, Li Senlin, initiated a video call.
"Son, how is it going, learning with Su Ping? I tell you, you’ve encountered such an outstanding and formidable classmate. Study hard with him; don’t fear hardship or fatigue! It’s a rare opportunity, and his willingness to teach you is a blessing for our family. But we also can’t neglect courtesy. When I come to pick you up, I’ll bring some gifts for Su Ping. What does that little guy like..."
Watching his father’s earnest expectation, Li Shu pressed his lips together.
He didn’t know how to break it to his dad.
Even at this moment, Li Shu’s eyes were filled with deep confusion.
A Breeder, an Intermediate Level Breeder registered with the Breeder Association, was, by his father’s description and his own understanding, a truly respected person. In his imagination, such a Breeder’s day should revolve around Pet Beasts, casually instructing them so they would learn various amazing Skills, improving at speeds countless times faster than those under the care of Beast Tamers—talents admired by many. But today, after a day at Heart of Woods, he understood Su Ping’s routine all too well. What had he done today, tagging along with Su Ping? Or rather, from his perspective, what had Su Ping done all day? To put it simply: scooping poop, cutting grass, watching Pet Beasts spar. Is this what a Breeder’s day really is? How astonishing and disillusioning.

chapters.title: Chapter 45: Wood’s Breakthrough! The Bet is Settled! (Four More)
chapters.content:
Chapter 45: Chapter 45: Wood’s Breakthrough! The Bet is Settled! (Four More)
In front of Su Ping were more than ten vessels.
Contained within these vessels were all items of an inky green hue.
Even Su Ping couldn’t help but feel a thrill of excitement at the sight of these more than ten bottles of Heart of Woods Magic Potion.
These items had a cost price of several million already. If calculated by profit, their total value would soar into the tens of millions.
Su Ping had never encountered such a large sum of money in his past or present life. And now, it was laid out right before his eyes.
However, Su Ping wasn’t in a hurry to administer it all to his Forest Wolves.
He wanted to perfect his understanding of cultivation. The Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas provided direct answers, but it didn’t explain the reasoning or the process to him. Now, Su Ping aimed to reverse-engineer this process and reasoning step by step, based on these answers. These Magic Potions could offer him some assistance in this endeavor.
Su Ping stored several bottles in the freezer for preservation. These would serve as his reserves and start-up capital for cultivating other Pet Beasts. He still left out more than ten bottles.
Su Ping then immediately opened two bottles, reserving them for upcoming experiments. The cost of experimenting with just these two bottles was already substantial.
Su Ping took a spoon and carefully scooped out one-tenth from one of the bottles. From the other, he directly poured out half.
This was Su Ping’s first time cultivating Pet Beasts, so he had no prior experience. However, after becoming an Intermediate Breeder and gaining some understanding of various Pet Beast Breeding Bases, he came to realize something.
Pet Beasts weren’t cultivated so easily. With individuals like Woodhead and Qin Xiaoxue, it was one thing, but what if people with ulterior motives appeared? What if they allowed their Pet Beasts to interact with his, only to steal cultivation methods and techniques through communication with the beasts? This wasn’t baseless speculation; it was a distinct possibility.
Therefore, even with a Magic Potion like Heart of Woods, it was best not to feed it all at once, as that would allow the Pet Beast to achieve instant comprehension. Instead, administering it in batches and pairing it with some unusual training would serve two purposes: it would extend the duration, making the cultivation time seem more reasonable, and it would also prevent the cultivation methods from being easily leaked.
Nevertheless, Su Ping wanted to test if administering it in batches would affect the potion’s efficacy.
He called over two Forest Wolves. Administering one-tenth of the Magic Potion to one of them directly yielded no additional effects.
Su Ping then found another Forest Wolf and gave it half of the Heart of Woods Magic Potion.
This time, there was a difference. The Forest Wolf’s body began to glow faintly, but the effect ultimately disappeared. Evidently, it had failed to achieve comprehension.
Su Ping wasn’t disheartened. So far, it seemed there was at least some effect. He could take his time experimenting over the next few days.
With that thought, Su Ping took out paper and pen and quickly began recording the changes in the Forest Wolves before him.
Li Shu, who had been taking care of the Luozisong, finally couldn’t resist asking, "Bro Ping, what is this...?"
Su Ping glanced at him.
Earlier, while Su Ping was making the Magic Potion, this fellow had been trying to bond with the Forest Wolves—a necessary step for a Junior Breeder. If possible, helping a classmate—who could be considered his only good friend—avoid a few detours while he was assisting wasn’t a big deal. However, the Heart of Woods Magic Potion represented not only the knowledge passed down through the Su Family for many years but also unimaginable wealth and temptation. Su Ping didn’t want to use such things to test people’s hearts; it was meaningless. He wasn’t the type to test others anyway.
So, he simply answered vaguely, "It’s a special food for Forest Wolves that can accelerate their growth."
Strictly speaking, he wasn’t lying.
Li Shu nodded without asking further and even said in agreement, "So that’s it! I was just thinking, only Forest Wolves would like this kind of smell!"
As soon as Li Shu said this, Su Ping was momentarily stunned. A flash of insight, a peculiar idea, inexplicably crossed his mind again.The most update n0vels are published on
Su Ping blinked. He seemed to have suddenly understood something that wasn’t particularly profound. Why had the addition of Wolf Tobacco to his family’s Heart of Woods Magic Potion resulted in such a qualitative change? Although the perfected recipe was recreated based on the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, the fact that adding just this one ingredient could achieve such an effect meant Wolf Tobacco’s impact was absolutely extraordinary. So, was it possible that Wolf Tobacco inherently had some effect on Forest Wolves?
Su Ping suddenly felt invigorated. The joy of Pet Beast cultivation lay in discovering a new direction, a new possibility, and then trying, experimenting, and perfecting it—this was the normal development path for a Pet Beast Breeder.
Although testing this possibility seemed somewhat inhumane to his little companions, Su Ping believed that for their master to become a truly great Breeder, they would be willing to make that small sacrifice!
At that moment, Su Ping looked towards the eagerly attentive pack of Forest Wolves, his eyes shimmering with a faint, eerie green glow.
In that instant, Su Ping seemed even more wolf-like than the pack itself.
All the wolves, including Old Sha, instinctively tucked their tails and shied away from their young master’s gaze.
However, just then, a clear whimper sounded. The source of this whimper wasn’t any of Su Ping’s Forest Wolves, but rather the most special one in the entire pack.
Woodhead!
Miss Qin’s treasured pet, now fully integrated into Su Ping’s wolf pack—a top-tier Forest Wolf.
But at this very moment, Qin Xiaoxue’s cherished pet trembled, enveloped in a gentle halo of white light.
Woodhead still had some injuries on his body. His bluish-gray fur was extremely disheveled, with traces of blood underneath. An onlooker might think Su Ping was abusing the poor creature. However, in truth, Woodhead’s injuries were the lightest compared to the other sixteen Forest Wolves in the pack.
Especially under the envelopment of that gentle white halo, the previously scabbed scars were visibly healing at an astonishing speed. This rate of recovery was comparable to that of an Elite Level professional healing-type Pet Beast.
Clearly, Woodhead was not in this state because of his injuries.
Su Ping, who was extremely familiar with Forest Wolves, immediately understood what was happening.
Sure enough, as the soft glow disappeared, the injuries on Woodhead’s body had mostly healed.
Such self-healing ability and effect certainly couldn’t be accomplished by entry-level Self-Healing, not even for Woodhead, who was a top-tier Elite Level Forest Wolf!
There was only one possibility left!
And indeed, under the observation of the Eye of Truth, Woodhead’s Skills section now showed the ’Self-Healing’ skill, with its level having evolved from Beginner to ’Proficient’!
His gamble had paid off!

chapters.title: Chapter 46 The Research and Discovery of Wolf Smoke Grass (First Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 46: Chapter 46 The Research and Discovery of Wolf Smoke Grass (First Update)
The growth of the tree was complete, but Su Ping did not hurry to find Qin Xiaoxue and have her call Sun Chaoju and Vice President Liu to fulfill the wager. A full fifteen days, half a month, remained, and there indeed was no need to rush.
Though he was eager to obtain the accelerated growth and the evolution methods for the Wanmu Wolf, meals must be eaten one bite at a time. Besides, even if he obtained these now, with the current experience of the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, he would be unable to fully document them.
As for Su Ping’s current schedule, it was quite packed. These were tasks he had set for himself, and the past days had been extremely fulfilling.
In the morning, he would take Li Shu to feed the Forest Wolves, clean up after them, and start planning the day’s training for the wolves. Those whose training was most outstanding were rewarded with a portion of the Heart of Woods Magic Potion.
That’s right, a portion. Previously, of two Forest Wolves, one consumed one-tenth of the Magic Potion with no change, while the other, after taking half, was given the other half by Su Ping the next day and then had an epiphany.
If half was effective, Su Ping later tried a quarter, which also worked. Directly consuming the Heart of Woods Magic Potion was too conspicuous, so feeding it in batches yielded even better results.
During the day, when the sunlight was plentiful and with the effect of Sunlight Absorption, the pack of Forest Wolves recovered their physical strength extremely well. Hence, the training effect was even better.
Not to mention, in just a few days, aside from the lack of unexpected Skill Level breakthroughs, several Forest Wolves experienced substantial improvements in Level and Realm. Even one young Forest Wolf that had been stuck at Common Tenth Level achieved a promotion to the adult Elite Tier.
The Cultivation of Pet Beasts is not solely dependent on the Race’s Racial Potential limits! While the Forest Wolf’s race limit is Elite Tenth Stage, this is the cap for Forest Wolf evolution, not the Level every Forest Wolf can reach! Some lazy Forest Wolves, without battle or training to improve themselves, would be considered quite fortunate if they could naturally break through to the Elite Level.
After the training for the Forest Wolves was arranged, Li Shu would act as the receptionist in the morning, while Su Ping was responsible for another matter: building a good relationship with Li Shu’s Luozisong. In Li Shu’s words, Bro Ping treated his Luozisong better than he treated him. Not only did Su Ping cultivate it personally, but he would occasionally use some low-level spirit spring water to water the Luozisong. As a result, in these few days, the Luozisong had "plumped" up a little.
Come afternoon, Su Ping conducted experiments on the theory Li Shu had mentioned a few days ago. He also cultivated new Forest Wolves.
That’s right, after the Breeder Association’s advertisements were officially registered and published, the business for Heart of Woods suddenly boomed. Even though Su Ping had raised his prices and limited the Cultivation to once a week, there were still people lining up. It was just one Forest Wolf, and indeed, it did not require much intensive Cultivation. If anything could be considered a bit of a waste of time, it might be Su Ping’s need to foster the Forest Wolf’s Affinity towards him during the process. Besides increasing the experience for the Forest Wolf’s entry in the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas,
Who knows? It could turn into a returning customer.
Plus, he could make money on the side. Why not?
All these were fine, but what deserved special mention was Su Ping’s experiment. This was, indeed, quite an inhumane experiment.
The subjects were two of his own Forest Wolves, both at Ordinary Level. These two were also special among the pack, as they had each consumed only one-tenth of the Heart of Woods Magic Potion. Su Ping had never thought much about Wolf Tobacco before, but its addition had greatly amplified the Heart of Woods’ effects.
This indicated that this highly reproductive yet pungent special plant might have uses unknown to me?
And so, these two little fellows had become Su Ping’s test subjects. That’s right, under Su Ping’s orders and Old Sha’s pitying, watchful gaze, they had been coming to the Lingxi River over the past few days.
What for? It was simple!
Eating grass! One ate grass while the other basked in the sun.
Also, every morning, Su Ping had been taking out one-tenth of the Heart of Woods Magic Potion to give to the two little ones. This was to ensure their changes wouldn’t be affected by external factors.
However, over the course of these days, Su Ping had not noticed any changes. He looked at his journal. On it, a simple line was written: [Investigating the effect of Wolf Tobacco on Forest Wolves consuming the Heart of Woods Magic Potion to deduce Wolf Tobacco’s unknown properties.]
This was already the sixth day of the experiment. For these six days, this was how Su Ping had spent his time.
He watched one Forest Wolf lazily soaking up the sun, while the other begrudgingly chewed on the abundant Wolf Tobacco on the ground. Clearly, from this little fellow’s infuriated gaze, one could tell that it was extremely discontented.
Why can’t I finish all this damned Wolf Tobacco?
Su Ping paid no attention to the little one’s resentment, glanced at his journal, then looked over at Old Sha, who was extremely alert on the other side, and smiled, "Don’t worry, although the Heart of Woods is on the outskirts of Linzhou City, the Beast Master Association and the military’s Beast Tamer Corps regularly patrol the city’s outskirts to drive out wild Pet Beasts. There’s no danger."
Strangely enough, lately, whenever Su Ping brought the two little ones here, Old Sha would always follow. Even if Su Ping had told it to properly oversee the Forest Wolves’ training, Old Sha refused. From Old Sha’s stubbornness and certain behaviors, Su Ping understood the creature was actually worried about his safety, fearing enemies might be nearby.
Of course, this was Su Ping’s speculation; although he had a full understanding of Forest Wolves, he couldn’t completely comprehend a Pet Beast’s thoughts without the Telepathic Communication Talent, especially a wild Pet Beast without a Soul Contract. However, Su Ping didn’t mind; Old Sha was one of his own. How could he force it against its will? Besides, it was a gesture of goodwill from Old Sha, and now, the training Forest Wolves were working very hard. Even without Old Sha’s supervision, he didn’t need to worry too much.
Yet, looking at Old Sha at this moment, Su Ping couldn’t help feeling worried. Old Sha had lived for over forty years; it was indeed very old.
Just as his spirits sank, Su Ping’s gaze suddenly shifted.
It wasn’t that an enemy had appeared, but one of the Forest Wolves had unexpectedly changed!
Halos of light enveloped it, with specks of light adhering to it. The next moment, a piercing Wolf Howl, though immature, rang out, filled with indescribable joy!
Su Ping shot to his feet and rushed to its side, staring in disbelief. The other Forest Wolf, which was still lazily sunbathing, perked up its ears, blinked, and with great confusion in its small eyes, looked at its companion that had suddenly transformed.
The sixth day! Su Ping clenched his fists. The sixth day!
This meant that this Little Forest Wolf had, in effect, only consumed six-tenths of the Magic Potion—just a little over half.
Yet under these circumstances, the Little Forest Wolf actually managed to complete its comprehension so many days ahead of schedule. Could it be that Wolf Tobacco truly possesses effects unknown to me?
And at this moment, abruptly, in Su Ping’s mind, the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas’s entry for the Forest Wolf once again slowly turned open.

chapters.title: Chapter 47: Side Effects of the Wolf Smoke Herb, the Value of the Laboratory! (Second Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 47: Chapter 47: Side Effects of the Wolf Smoke Herb, the Value of the Laboratory! (Second Update)
At the very bottom of the Catalog, above the previously recorded logs, a new entry appeared:
[Discovery of the partial effects and applications of Wolf Tobacco on the Forest Wolf, Forest Wolf Catalog Experience Points +100. Fully understanding and excavating the specific effects and uses of Wolf Tobacco can yield additional experience points.]
As expected!
A look of unimaginable joy surfaced in Su Ping’s eyes as he firmly fixated on the Forest Wolf that had completed its comprehension.
But soon, a slight frown creased Su Ping’s forehead.
As the light faded, the small Forest Wolf appeared before Su Ping’s eyes.
And the Eye of Truth quickly assessed the status of the young wolf:
[Forest Wolf (Wild - Weak)]Google seaʀᴄh NovᴇlFirᴇ.ɴet
[Current Level: Common Seventh Rank]
[Racial Potential: Elite Tenth Stage]
[Skills: Sunlight Absorption (Beginner), Accelerated Growth (Beginner), Vine Strangling (Proficient), Self-Healing (Beginner), Heart of Woods (Beginner)]
Indeed, from the feedback of the Eye of Truth, it seemed there was no change or difference in the young wolf; even the Heart of Woods skill had already appeared on this little fellow.
The pervasive scent of grass and trees further confirmed this.
The state of weakness was nothing much.
However, the biggest issue was that, prior to this, to ensure the experiment would not be affected, Su Ping had specifically chosen two wolves of the same level and realm for cultivation.
And the realm of these two wolves was Common Eighth Rank!
This meant that while the Wolf Tobacco had indeed further enhanced the Forest Wolf’s affinity with the Heart of Woods, it had caused a decrease in its own level realm.
What was the principle behind this?
Su Ping frowned, but for the moment, he couldn’t figure it out. It was then he truly felt what it meant to be ’lacking knowledge only when it’s needed.’
Still, he quickly made a mark on the young wolf and wrote down this research discovery in his notebook as a record.
Afterward, without wasting any more time, Su Ping took out a sickle from his Beast Taming Space and continued harvesting the vast expanse of Wolf Tobacco.
Before, Su Ping hadn’t been sure and therefore hadn’t tried anything more complex.
But now it seemed that the effects of the Wolf Tobacco definitely held a mystery beyond his imagination.
He needed to extract the essence directly and begin live experiments.
However, while he had some refining equipment at home, he was still missing certain items. For instance, his home cauldron, though generally sufficient, would be too cumbersome for extracting essence from Wolf Tobacco. The process would be too demanding in terms of both time and labor.
There were also some instruments needed for observation and recording.
Thinking of this, Su Ping, who had just harvested a large amount of Wolf Tobacco, also felt a bit of a headache.
Some materials and resources were widely available online and in the real world, but when it came to precision instruments only used by Breeders, he really didn’t know where to buy them.
Luckily, Su Ping now had some connections.
"Hey, Su Ping? It’s rare for you to call me. Could it be that you’ve finished your bet with Xiao Sun?"
Probably no one in Linzhou knew more about this area than Vice President Liu.
Meeting Vice President Liu’s hearty laughter on the other end, Su Ping played coy for a moment: "You’ll know about that in a couple of days. Old Liu, I wanted to ask, where can I buy equipment for extracting material essence and cultivation instruments for observing materials? I have some new ideas and want to give them a try."
"Haha, I guessed as much. Su Ping, do you know what the most important thing for a Breeder is?"
Perhaps because Su Ping was being coy, Vice President Liu didn’t answer directly but instead asked a question in return.
"What?" Su Ping asked obligingly.
"It’s naturally the laboratory! With your ability, you could certainly come to our Breeder Association and apply to rent a private laboratory. Of course, if you’d prefer to buy your own equipment, that’s also an option. Our Breeder Association sells it."
Having said that, Old Liu went straight to the point: "The instrument you mentioned for extracting material essence? Our Breeder Association has three types, each with its own strengths and effects. We also have the other equipment you need. I’ll send the details directly to you. After you take a look, you can place the order right away."
At this point, Vice President Liu seemed very straightforward: "When you’ve placed your order, give me the order number, and I’ll use my authority to give you the maximum discount."
Su Ping revealed a smile: "Then I must thank you. I’ll come to see you when I have time!"
"When will that be? I’ll adjust my schedule," came the chuckling voice of Vice President Liu, causing Su Ping to falter in his speech.
He pursed his lips, about to speak, when he heard laughter from the other end of the phone: "Hahaha, just joking with you, kid. However, if you have time, you could come over at the end of the month. I’ll be teaching a class at the Breeder Association that is only accessible to wolf-type Pet Beast Breeders.
"I don’t know if it will be of any use or help to you, but no matter how talented a Breeder is, it’s best not to always work in isolation."
This time, Su Ping’s eyes truly lit up. Even though he had the help of the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, it was like being handed an advanced-level math Olympiad problem along with its solution. While he now knew the answer and could replicate it for an identical problem, the underlying problem-solving methodology, the ability to draw parallels, or to extrapolate from it, was entirely beyond him.
A book is invaluable at the right time, and he certainly wouldn’t miss such an opportunity.
Excitedly hanging up the phone, Su Ping then opened the website address Old Liu had sent, which only member Breeders of the Breeder Association were qualified to use for purchasing.
However, upon looking, Su Ping was stunned.
He seemed to understand why, when he asked Old Liu about purchasing equipment, Old Liu had bluntly told him that he could go to the Breeder Association to apply for a laboratory rental first.
Because the things in front of him were just too damn outrageous:
[Automated Polymer Mechanical Core Compression Extraction Machine: An integrated machine controlled by a Mechanical Core, capable of compressing all types of resources except Elemental Type, extracting the essence according to its needs, and condensing it into...]
There was a long, convoluted description, of which Su Ping understood little. What he did see clearly was the string of zeros trailing after the price of this large machine, which resembled a cross between a large toilet and a washing machine, connected to a computer screen.
At this moment, Su Ping fell into deep thought.
Old Liu just said he could give me a discount within his authority. So, how big could his discount be?
Could he discount three hundred million down to one million? Hmm, even ten million would be acceptable!
Clearly, if this were a dream, Su Ping’s thoughts might have a chance of becoming reality.
Unfortunately, this was real life.
And that was just the cost of purchasing one machine, not including usage costs and the purchase of other machines.
Instantly, Breeder Su, who just moments ago had felt his funds were sufficient, gazed at the innumerable stalks of Wolf Tobacco crammed into his tiny Beast Taming Space and roared at the heavens:
I need customers! I need to make money! I need to build my own lab!

chapters.title: Chapter 48 Pine Nuts Intimacy Meets the Standard! (Third Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 48: Chapter 48 Pine Nuts Intimacy Meets the Standard! (Third Update)
The urge to make money didn’t last long.
After all, the decision made a few days ago to cultivate a maximum of one Pet Beast each week shouldn’t change so quickly—it wasn’t a good habit.
And besides, it was just for researching Wolf Tobacco. Su Ping thought there was no need to use such high-quality equipment!
What was wrong with his own medicine stove? It couldn’t isolate smells, and without a gas mask, one could easily be overcome by the fumes. It lacked an automatic stirring feature, requiring manual grinding with a pestle. It didn’t have a decomposition function and could only process materials into liquids or powders. It just...
Forget it, even Su Ping himself was having a hard time continuing this list.
However, as long as his determination didn’t falter, there were always more solutions than difficulties.
He had no reason to stop researching Wolf Tobacco just like that. Using basic experimental facilities was also an option.
After all, although he didn’t have high-quality equipment, he had people!
So, after bringing back the slightly weakened Little Forest Wolf, Old Sha, and another Forest Wolf from the banks of the Lingxi River behind the forest, Su Ping found Li Shu, who was training Songzi.
After all, it wasn’t a technically difficult operation. He just needed to control the temperature, wear a gas mask, and continuously work the medicine stove. At most, he just needed to add some water in the middle and heat this big bundle of Wolf Tobacco until it completely condensed into liquid. That was all there was to it.
There was no technical difficulty.
But without a doubt, this was a necessary step on the path of a Breeder.
Yes. All these words were what Su Ping said to Li Shu.ɴᴇᴡ ɴᴏᴠᴇʟ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs ᴀʀᴇ ᴘᴜʙʟɪsʜᴇᴅ ᴏɴ NovᴇlFir(e).nᴇt
Then, meeting Su Ping’s trusting gaze, Li Shu fastened his gas mask and nodded with resolve.
It wasn’t easy! Having been at Su Ping’s place for a week now, he could finally participate in work relevant to a Breeder’s job. Although Li Shu could see that Wolf Tobacco wasn’t commonly found in the city, it was widespread in the uninhabited areas outside it. These herbs were clearly brought back by Su Ping deliberately to train him. He absolutely couldn’t betray his adoptive father’s trust!
"Go for it!"
After teaching Li Shu how to use the heating medicine stove, Su Ping called Old Sha, who wore a special wolf-dog gas mask, to watch for any issues. Only then did he fully relax.
Su Ping then went to Songzi.
Even though its master was gone, Songzi, the Luozisong, knew that Su Ping, who stood before it, was its master’s best friend. It was also thanks to this very person that it had been able to grow so robustly during this time. Its Realm had even broken through to ordinary Third Rank.
Plant-type Pet Beasts generally lacked strong mobility but offered many functional uses.
If it weren’t for the fact that Songzi, the Luozisong, was difficult to cultivate and required a large area, making it hard to grow in large numbers, Su Ping would have considered choosing it as his second Pet Beast.
However, while he couldn’t choose it, this couldn’t hide his fondness for this type of Pet Beast.
The small Songzi swayed gently. Though it had no face, the slight trembling of its trunk and branches clearly signified an interesting soul nestled within.
During this past week, Su Ping had spared no effort in cultivating this little Songzi. Furthermore, before he returned to the Heart of Woods, Su Ping, while spending time with Li Shu, had interacted with this little guy on multiple occasions.
However, since it was not a wolf-dog type Pet Beast, even with guidance from Old Sha, the Wolf King, and after such a long time, there wasn’t even a hint that the intimacy level had been reached.
This made Su Ping a bit helpless.
Now, he was well-acquainted with the nature of Forest Wolves. After his Forest Wolf Catalog reached LV2, and with Old Sha’s guidance, even the Forest Wolves brought to him for Cultivation reached the required intimacy level in two or three days at most, some even in a single day.
However, this little Songzi had truly taken a long time.
From this, Su Ping could infer, albeit with some difficulty, that getting wild Pet Beasts to reach the required intimacy level in the future—and thus light up new entries in the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas—would be considerably more challenging.
But today, Su Ping came with a confident heart.
Because today, Su Ping had something extra in his hands.
It flickered with wisps of refreshing fragrance, but in reality, it had no physical form.
This thing, if called a treasure, indeed was one, but if not, it wouldn’t be of much use to other Pet Beasts or human Beast Tamers.
The Life Ancient Tree was Qin Xiaoxue’s second Pet Beast.
However, that day, when Qin Xiaoxue saw Xiao Qing, who was also a Mutated Pet Beast, she answered Su Ping’s questions and satisfied his curiosity. This answered his question about the nature of the mutation of Qin Xiaoxue’s Life Ancient Tree and the direction it had taken.
Death!
Right, although Su Ping had previously realized that Qin Xiaoxue’s Mutated Pet Beast was definitely not mediocre, he had not imagined that the Life Ancient Tree was a Mutated Pet Beast with both Life and Death Attributes coexisting.
The challenge of cultivating such Mutated Pet Beasts with completely opposite Attributes was unimaginable. It was vastly more complex than the Forest Wolf by countless degrees.
Qin Xiaoxue, however, was not stingy and had shared some of her Cultivation insights with him.
The Life Ancient Tree could not be handled carelessly; its Life and Death Attributes always needed to be balanced. However, since the Life Ancient Tree was a mutation, its essential Attribute was still predominantly Life, so its Death Attribute was more suppressed.
Therefore, to maintain this balance, Qin Xiaoxue’s Life Ancient Tree needed to expel some Life Energy periodically to foster some Death Energy. Only under these circumstances could the Attribute balance of the Mutated Life Ancient Tree be prevented from collapsing.
Yes, the cluster of Energy Su Ping held was precisely the Life Force expelled by the Life Ancient Tree.
This Energy normally had no significant effect beyond healing injuries, but for Plant-type creatures, it was an excellent thing. It could not only expedite the growth of Plant-type Pet Beasts but could also enhance their potential and intelligence.
After all, the Life Ancient Tree remained a powerful Pet Beast with the Racial Potential of the Monarch Level! If this Energy didn’t dissipate over time, Su Ping would indeed be reluctant to use it on little Songzi. And now, this was the trump card Su Ping was using to coax this little Songzi aboard his ’pirate ship’!
As expected, when Su Ping took out this pale green Energy, he could vividly feel little Songzi’s excitement, its branches waving even more swiftly.
Su Ping couldn’t help but roll his eyes at this little fellow.
All Pet Beasts behaved the same way, not showing any interest unless they saw advantages to be gained.
The Life Energy slowly merged into little Songzi’s body.
A faint green glow emanated from its body, slowly blooming. Then, as Songzi trembled, a fruit appeared on its branches.
Next, the fruit shot out like a cannonball and burst open in the air!
This surge of Life Energy had actually helped the little fellow comprehend its most powerful combat Skill: Pine Cone Bomb.
Although its power was negligible for now, there was great potential for future development.
And not surprisingly, almost immediately after this anomaly vanished, the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas in Su Ping’s mind opened slowly.
A brand-new page, one he had never seen before, appeared before Su Ping’s eyes!
The intimacy level of Songzi, the Luozisong, had been reached!

chapters.title: Chapter 49: The Activation of the Falling Pine Catalog - A New Talent! (Four Updates)
chapters.content:
Chapter 49: Chapter 49: The Activation of the Falling Pine Catalog - A New Talent! (Four Updates)
As expected!
Sensing the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas in his mind, Su Ping’s attention also locked onto one particular section.
This unfamiliar Catalog was no longer the Forest Wolf that Su Ping was most familiar with, but rather a tall pine tree. Atop the pine tree hung pinecones, but they were bright red, as if they were about to explode at any moment.
Although undoubtedly a Wood Element Pet Beast, the Luozisong primarily featured wide-ranging offensive abilities. The might of a mature Luozisong could be discerned from this particular Catalog entry.
And almost in the next moment, this originally grey-black Catalog slowly started to be rendered from the top down like a drop of water, gradually revealing a sheen. It was like when he had first made a contract with Xiao Qing, lighting up the Forest Wolf Catalog.
Although it was only a simple Level 1, as long as it could be lit up, one could receive the fundamental reward from the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas.
Indeed, that was exactly what happened.
[Catalog ’Luozisong’ illuminated, current Catalog Level: 1, fundamental reward obtained: Telepathic Communication]
[Telepathic Communication (Beast Tamer ability): Allows one to concentrate and use spiritual power to comprehend the meaning of a Pet Beast’s words through mind sensing and to communicate with it.]
Indeed!
Su Ping’s eyes brightened; the reward for lighting up a Catalog was still so potent.
This talent skill was as commonplace as Eye of Truth, an ability countless Beast Tamers awakened to. However, it must be said, regardless of how mediocre this talent skill might seem, it was indeed handy!
There’s no need to elaborate on the effects of Eye of Truth, but with Telepathic Communication, I can communicate more directly and intuitively with my Pet Beasts.
No longer will I need to rely solely on my understanding of a Pet Beast to infer the meaning behind its words.
The convenience this brings to my cultivation work is unimaginable.
Moreover, Jin Cheng had actually mentioned before that for ordinary Breeders, the most suitable talent wasn’t anything convoluted, but this simple Telepathic Communication.
Communication is the bridge. And communication is also the first step in cultivating Pet Beasts.
Undoubtedly, with such a talent, the help it will provide me is beyond imagination.
Without hurrying to test the effects of this ability, Su Ping had already merged his consciousness with the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, and the newly illuminated Luozisong Catalog appeared completely before his eyes.
[Catalog: Luozisong]
[A Wood Attribute plant-type Pet Beast, cumbersome to move, but possesses a ranged attack ability rarely found in Pet Beasts of the same level. Racial Skills: Photosynthesis, Pinecone Cannon, Pine Needle Defense, etc.]
[Current Catalog Level: 1 (5/500)]
Known Evolutionary Atlas, special Cultivation:
[None discovered yet]
Preferences, habits:
[High adaptability to living environments, low demands for sunlight and water sources, but correspondingly slower natural growth rate. A high-quality air spirit spring can somewhat accelerate its growth.]
Record Log:
[Encountered and interacted with a common Luozisong, intimacy met the requirement, Catalogue Experience +5!]
[Subsequently, each day spent with it, Catalogue Experience +0.5!]
[Daily, Catalogue Experience is gained based on the number of such creatures one interacts with, their level, and by enhancing the Biological Abilities of creatures that meet the intimacy requirement. This obtained experience allows one to perfect the Catalog and raise its level.]
The distribution of the Forest Wolf Catalog was identical to this. However, the entries in its Record Log were much shorter, and the Catalogue Experience gained was pitifully scarce, but this was enough.
Given the current situation, I hadn’t intended to cultivate this Luozisong to prominence. Merely activating it to receive the fundamental reward from the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas is sufficient.
At this thought, Su Ping opened his eyes in satisfaction. He looked at the Luozisong in front of him, which was even more excited.
The Luozisong’s body was constantly swaying, "RUSTLE RUSTLE (new... skills... cannonball... happy...)"
This time, amidst the Luozisong’s swaying and the involuntary RUSTLE RUSTLE sound it made, Su Ping seemed to grasp the meaning behind its words. However, this perception was still exceedingly faint. He didn’t know whether it was because he had just acquired the Telepathic Communication talent, or whether the young Luozisong’s Mental Fluctuation was simply too weak to be caught.
Su Ping was like a child who had received an amusing toy, suddenly becoming greatly intrigued. He went nonstop to the Forest Wolf’s training area to continue his attempts.
Su Ping, engrossed in his experimentation, achieved a deeper understanding with the Forest Wolf through Telepathic Communication.Thɪs
Meanwhile, Li Shu, standing beside the furnace, was on the verge of a breakdown.
When he learned the function of the furnace from Su Ping and what he was to do next, Li Shu was excited.
Because before bedtime, during my routine video call check with Dad, I can proudly say that today I finally wasn’t doing customer service, scooping poop, or mowing grass!
Instead, like a real Breeder, I’m trying my hand at making medicinal herbs, food, or other assorted items for Pet Beasts!
Anyway, this is a small step on a Breeder’s path of growth, but a giant leap in the significance of my life!
And when he started pounding the medicine with the pestle while controlling the temperature, after five minutes, Li Shu felt something was slightly off, but it was generally acceptable.
Thirty minutes later, he was still pounding. Apart from some soreness in his neck and arms, it was still bearable overall.
An hour later, Li Shu, whose arms were trembling from controlling the temperature and wielding the pestle, had lost all anticipation and even secretly hoped it would be over soon.
Two and a half hours later, his arms were swollen, and his body was drenched in sweat as if he had been fished out of water. The boiling steam made his head dizzy, and the awful smell of the crushed Wolf Tobacco, which even a gas mask couldn’t completely block, was overpowering.
The immense torture, both physical and mental, finally defeated Li Shu, and he fell into a phase of doubting life itself.
If the life of a Breeder is like this, then maybe I should consider giving up.
Is this even humanly doable?
This work isn’t meant for humans, is it? It’s definitely for some kind of strength-based, pack-animal Pet Beast, like those mountain-hauling donkeys!
Li Shu thought, filled with doubt.
Obviously, if this task were so easy, Su Ping wouldn’t be drooling over those three hundred million worth of equipment sent by Vice President Liu.
Although a Beast Tamer’s rank progression does enhance the body and improve endurance, it mainly centers around the enhancement of one’s spiritual power and the Beast Taming Space. Those with strong physical strength were indeed a minority. And Li Shu, who was merely an ordinary Second Rank Beast Tamer, obviously wasn’t up to the task.
However, even with reluctance, seeing the stinking liquid that was starting to thicken in the furnace after heating, Li Shu could only forcibly continue brandishing the pestle and embark on the final phase that was even more torturous than the labor of a load-bearing donkey.

chapters.title: Chapter 50 Old Sha’s Warning, The Arrival of a Strange Pet Beast? (First Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 50: Chapter 50 Old Sha’s Warning, The Arrival of a Strange Pet Beast? (First Update)
Li Shu had run away.
Of course, officially, he was just going back to rest for a while. After all, he had been with Su Ping for over a week, and it was time to return home.
Su Ping felt somewhat regretful; such good help was truly hard to find.
But this was also normal.
How was it easy to become a Breeder? If he hadn’t grown up with the Forest Wolves at his family’s Cultivation base and possessed a cheat-like ability, wanting to become a Breeder would have been an extremely difficult feat.
When Li Shu’s father, Li Senlin, arrived, he was extremely courteous and even wanted to give Su Ping a hefty red envelope, which Su Ping declined.Thɪs NovᴇlFirᴇ.ɴet
He had a good relationship with Li Shu. Since Li Shu had helped him for so many days, and even though Su Ping had also helped upgrade Luozisong’s Level and even taught it the Pinecone Bomb Skill, he had also gained what he wanted. This was already enough, which made Li Senlin quite embarrassed.
Li Shu’s departure didn’t affect Su Ping too much.
Although he now needed to answer the phone and receive customers himself, the busiest period had already passed. Those Pet Beasts confirmed for Cultivation had their deposits paid, and they had started queuing for Cultivation.
The Heart of Woods, after an initial few days of disarray, had barely managed to get on the right track.
However, Su Ping did acknowledge Li Shu’s efforts.
No wonder the kid was exhausted. A large bundle of Wolf Tobacco had been stirred for an entire afternoon. After several hours of refinement, it had transformed into this bucket of dark green liquid, emitting an indescribably foul and peculiar smell. Even Su Ping, when faced with this concoction, wanted to keep his distance.
Nevertheless, an experiment was still an experiment. Despite feeling repulsed, Su Ping carried it out.
Having witnessed the effects of this Wolf Tobacco—and not just its benefits—Su Ping naturally couldn’t use his own Forest Wolves as test subjects. Instead, he directly bought several mice for experimentation.
