If such a passive Ability, especially one acquired later through Cultivation, could level up so easily, Old Sha wouldn’t have struggled for over forty years just to barely break his race limit, failing even to achieve Evolution.
Then, this advancement must have occurred during the current evolutionary stage.
Without a second thought, Su Ping didn’t even greet Old Sha. He rushed to the video recorder and played back the night’s footage at eight times speed to see what had transpired.
The recording began from when he left the previous evening.
During the night, Old Sha seemed to have acclimated to this lifestyle. The discomfort from the first two days was gone. Instead, he had thoroughly immersed himself in what could be described as a plant-like state, resembling a lethargic, cold-blooded animal that moved only when necessary. Therefore, there were no unusual changes that night.
And just as expected, when the sun gradually rose on the horizon and sunlight poured down, Old Sha began performing Sunlight Absorption as usual. However, over the past few days, Old Sha had reached a critical threshold in the Wanmu Wolf’s second stage.
As he continuously absorbed sunlight, Old Sha’s luminescence intensified. Under the radiant light, a distinctive breathing rhythm emerged from him. With each inhale and exhale, the sunlight bathing his body seemed to fuse completely with Old Sha.
Then, Su Ping’s eyes suddenly narrowed.
He focused on the high-definition video footage. Under the concentrated sunlight, as that unique breathing rhythm began, the grass and flowers in the surrounding meadow also seemed to be affected. Wisps of faint green light, like motes following the dazzling sunlight, slowly merged into Old Sha’s body as Su Ping watched intently.
Subsequently, a touch of vibrant green essence emanated outwards, and Old Sha’s body appeared as if suddenly draped in a green blanket. Together with the sunlight, he entered an extremely peculiar state.
This state persisted for about three minutes before gradually fading, resulting in the scene Su Ping had just witnessed.

chapters.title: Chapter 81: The Chemical Reaction of the Heart of Woods!
chapters.content:
Chapter 81: Chapter 81: The Chemical Reaction of the Heart of Woods!
Photosynthesis + Sunlight Absorption could strengthen the effect of Heart of Woods and even accelerate its upgrade?
Finally, Su Ping, dragging his slippers and wearing pajamas, squatted beside the camera on the lawn. After watching the footage over and over, he reached such a conclusion.
Although, to him, the conclusion seemed somewhat unreliable, and he wasn’t even sure why, he felt both excited and scared. The excitement stemmed from having a new direction and more specialized insights into the research of Pet Beasts. The fear arose because what he initially thought to be a near-certain evolutionary Cultivation now had an unexpected twist. For now, this twist didn’t seem to have a significant impact; it could even be considered a good thing. An upgrade in skill Level is, of course, a good thing, but what lay ahead was not so certain.
Su Ping took a deep breath and subconsciously licked the corner of his mouth. Suppressing the tension and anticipation in his heart, he actually wanted to conduct thorough experiments now, but it was Old Sha who was evolving. The first thing he needed to ensure was always Old Sha’s safety. As for the experiment, there was plenty of time in the future. Moreover, he could feel that the effects of Heart of Woods did not have a significant impact on Old Sha’s Evolution.
Perhaps just more remarkable?
Now that Old Sha had mastered Photosynthesis, it naturally indicated that he had entered the Third Rank of the Wanmu Wolf’s Evolution. At this stage, there was no rush to think about anything else. The most important thing at the moment was to find a way to boost Old Sha’s Photosynthesis Level. The rest could be dealt with slowly later on.Tʜe source of this ᴄontent ɪs NovᴇlFɪre.ɴet
With this in mind, Su Ping hastily made a call to Lao Guan.
Soon after, Lao Guan came running over, spotting his young boss still in pajamas and slippers, his hair a mess like a bird’s nest.
He sighed with resignation, "Boss, it’s nine o’clock. There might be visitors for a tour. Couldn’t you pay a bit more attention to your image?"
"Mm-hmm, next time for sure, Uncle Guan, did you bring the stuff?" Su Ping replied.
Lao Guan, speechless, took out a plastic bag and then brought over a large bucket, handing it to Su Ping. Su Ping took it eagerly and nodded in satisfaction after a quick glance. These were the two resources he had purchased a few days ago: Sunflower Smile Seeds and Sunlight Spring Water. Both were resources listed in the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas as necessary for the optimal Evolution of the Wanmu Wolf.
Su Ping ignored Lao Guan and rushed over to Old Sha with the items.
Through the tempered glass, Guan Qianshan shook his head after a brief look but still showed a smile at the corner of his mouth. He finally understood how this kid managed to revitalize Heart of Woods and achieve so much in just a month. This little fellow truly loved Pet Beast Cultivation; he was a diligent and gifted talent indeed.
Why hadn’t I noticed this before?
However, Guan Qianshan knew Cultivation was not for outsiders to watch, and he had no interest in observing further. Seeing such hard work from this young man, he thought,
Maybe that vision I described to him could truly be realized by this youth’s hands? If that’s the case, then I, too, must work hard! At the very least, I need to ensure there are no issues with logistics. Otherwise, people might think I’m just here to fool a child.
With this thought, Guan Qianshan, a man in his forties, suddenly felt an inexplicable surge of energy he identified as ’drive’. Su Ping’s presence always seemed to inspire those around him.
"Old Sha, time for some seeds!"
Su Ping, holding the big pack of Sunflower Smile Seeds, sat down directly on the grass in front of Old Sha, seemingly unconcerned about his appearance.
Sunflower Smile is an Ordinary Level Plant Type Pet Beast that can absorb sunlight. It’s a common Resource Type Pet Beast that produces these sunflower seeds. They can replenish sunlight Energy, supply calcium, and the trace elements needed by both Pet Beasts and human Beast Tamers. It was a comparatively luxurious snack.
Sitting together with Old Sha, Su Ping tossed him a seed, then put one in his own mouth. Master and servant, man and wolf, sat on the lawn under the sun, cracking sunflower seeds. CRACK. CRACK. The sound was crisp and clear.
However, Su Ping was not idle. He opened the notebook he had brought along, started a new page from the back, and commenced writing:
’The effects of Photosynthesis mainly include: converting solar energy into chemical energy, and inorganic matter into organic matter.’
’Photosynthesis is divided into light and dark reactions.’
’It involves light absorption, electron transfer, photophosphorylation, carbon assimilation, and more.’
’It is known that the overall equation for the light and dark reactions of Photosynthesis is: CO₂+6H₂O→C₆H₁₂O₆[(CH₂O)ₙ]+6O₂.’
’After mastering the Skill, the Forest Wolf can undergo Photosynthesis within its body through the use of Skills to react...’
’The Sunlight Absorption Skill is unique to the Forest Wolf, which enhances the sunbathing process by further absorbing trace elements from the sunlight, such as the known Vitamin D, etc...’
’The Wood Heart Skill can forcibly absorb organic Energy Material from other plant life, through Photosynthesis and Sunlight Absorption...’
’...’
Lines of text, incomprehensible to others, filled the page as Su Ping scribbled quickly, the research directions in his mind seemingly clarifying all at once.
Although the Beastmaster Society of Blue Star is different from my previous world, Earth, and some physical, chemical, and biological knowledge doesn’t directly apply, it can often serve as a direct reference.
He focused on deconstructing the biological formula for Photosynthesis, integrating it with the Skills used on Plant Type Pet Beasts, and from there, deducing the specific effects of Heart of Woods on Photosynthesis and Sunlight Absorption.
While thinking, his other hand didn’t stop moving. CLICK. He cracked open a refreshingly fragrant sunflower seed, then tossed another big handful to the expectant Old Sha. Old Sha caught them all in one gulp and swallowed them without even cracking the shells. Su Ping ignored the still hopeful Old Sha and, while chewing on the seeds, plunged back into his thoughts.
The effect of the photochemical reactions is indeed like that. Especially in this world, where Pet Beasts can awaken the Ability of Photosynthesis through resources and bloodlines. If I could take this Ability back to my previous world... wouldn’t it be really possible to use CO₂, carbon dioxide, to quickly make flour, and in large quantities at that? Of course, in essence, this technology could also be achieved in a laboratory, and whether or not it’s significantly useful is a matter of perspective.
Now, what I need to do is analyze, on this basis, the enhancement effect of Heart of Woods. And ultimately, under the formulas of these three Skills, what kind of chemical reaction will there be! And what kind of changes and differences would such a chemical reaction undergo if placed in this Pet Beast World?
Thinking this, Su Ping scooped up another handful of seeds and passed them to Old Sha. He then spat out the seed husks and continued to work through formulas in his small notebook.
「Shortly after」
Outside the tempered glass fence, Guan Qianshan led guests to the Heart of Wood Cultivation Base, smiling as he introduced, "Heart of Wood was a Cultivation base with some reputation even before. The founder, Mr. Su Zhongguang, was a Monarch Level Beast Tamer. And now, Breeder Su Ping, despite his young age, has already become an Intermediate Level Breeder and is highly regarded by the Breeder Association.
"It is also for this reason that our Heart of Wood’s Cultivation team has been booked for the next two months. However, Breeder Su is planning to speed up the Cultivation process so, if you choose to cultivate the ’Wood Heart Skill,’ booking now means the latest you might come for Cultivation is one month later."
Guan Qianshan spoke eloquently, while the guests, looking through the tempered glass, stared curiously at the scene on the other side. Guan Qianshan had a bad feeling.
Sure enough, the young boss whom I warned to pay attention to his image three hours ago is now wearing blue pajamas with a cartoon image of a Q version Forest Wolf on them, sitting right there on the grass under the sun, cracking seeds and busily writing something. Who would find such an image reliable? It seems likely this deal is about to fall through.
Just as he was about to speak up and provide an explanation, the customer spoke first, "Is that Breeder Su? Truly diligent! Look at him, still in his pajamas, so devoted to the Cultivation work that he neglects sleep and food. No wonder he has such remarkable achievements at such a young age! It’s truly admirable."
With that, the customer turned and said, "With such a Breeder here, it’s no wonder Heart of Wood has been receiving such great reviews recently! I’ll bring my daughter’s Little Forest Wolf over in a few days. Where do I pay the deposit?"
Guan Qianshan looked bewildered at the admiring customer before he belatedly realized and quickly responded, "Oh, oh, please follow me. Choosing Heart of Wood is a decision you definitely won’t regret! Our Breeder Su is just such an outstanding and dedicated Breeder who doesn’t sweat the small stuff!"

chapters.title: Chapter 82: The Ultimate Formula, Paper Doll’s Accelerated Casting!
chapters.content:
Chapter 82: Chapter 82: The Ultimate Formula, Paper Doll’s Accelerated Casting!
The words Guan Qianshan spoke that morning, he had initially hesitated to fully believe, but by evening, he couldn’t agree with them more.
All day, Su Ping hadn’t even left his seat on the grass. A few puzzled Forest Wolves lingered nearby, apparently collaborating with Su Ping on some experiment. He hadn’t even eaten, just shared some melon seeds with Old Sha. The rest of the time was spent scribbling, drawing, and smudging in that peculiar notebook.
He didn’t know what magic lay within those pages, but he knew the adage, "Where there’s a will, there’s a way."
At this moment, Su Ping perfectly embodied this.
In just one day, he had filled ten pages of the notebook. Those ten pages were filled with speculation and formulaic calculations based on Sunlight Absorption, Photosynthesis, and the effects of Heart of Woods.
Actually, the principle was very simple once explained. Heart of Woods harnessed natural life energy from the Wood Element within plants; this natural life energy, although not belonging to any known substance from Su Ping’s previous life, was still an organic energy body. Photosynthesis helped plants convert sunlight energy at an upper level. Sunlight Absorption, then, at the very highest level, enabled Pet Beasts to obtain more sunlight for more efficient energy absorption.
So what about Heart of Woods?
Heart of Woods, being at the lowest level, could restore this power to itself, rejuvenating its energy and healing injuries.ɪꜰ ʏᴏᴜ ᴡᴀɴᴛ ᴛᴏ ʀᴇᴀᴅ ᴍᴏʀᴇ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs, ᴘʟᴇᴀsᴇ ᴠɪsɪᴛ
Thus, Su Ping’s deduction was quite simple.
Could these three skills form a perfect closed-loop cycle under such conditions? When energy was depleted, Sunlight Absorption drew in sunlight, Photosynthesis converted it, and Heart of Woods utilized the sunlight. This, in turn, would make the stronger Forest Wolf body’s use of Sunlight Absorption even more potent.
However, applying this formula presented many paradoxes. To put it in layman’s terms, if translated into an online game, it meant the less health one had, the higher the damage one dealt; the higher the damage, the more health restored; and the more health restored, the higher the maximum health limit.
So, less health equals more health?
Although the meaning was slightly different, the expression of the effect was roughly the same.
This conclusion seemed like utter nonsense to Su Ping, no matter how he looked at it. And it certainly wasn’t reflected in Old Sha. The energy conversion between Sunlight Absorption, Photosynthesis, and Heart of Woods couldn’t unify, like three pipes of different thicknesses that simply couldn’t be connected.
Forcing a connection would only result in leakage.
But looking at the dense notes in the notebook, and the final, extremely simple formula:
’X=Y=Z=X2=Y2=Z2’
’X+Y+Z=?’
If calculated mathematically, the result would be 0. But obviously, Pet Beast cultivation wasn’t a math problem, nor could it be reduced to simple numerical logic.
However, this formula provided Su Ping with an answer—a very, very simple one: once the pipes were all of the same thickness, the results would naturally become evident.
And what specifically caused the variance in the pipes’ thickness? The answer to this question was even simpler: the skill level.
Currently, among Old Sha’s skill levels, Sunlight Absorption had reached Perfection, Heart of Woods was at Proficient Level, and Photosynthesis, like Heart of Woods, was also at Proficient Level. In other words, perhaps the final answer to Su Ping’s formula would be revealed when Photosynthesis, Heart of Woods, and Sunlight Absorption all reached Perfection Level simultaneously.
That’s right; in just one day, Photosynthesis, like Heart of Woods, had broken through to Proficient Level. After munching on quite a few Smiling Sunflower Seeds and taking a moderate bath in Sunlight Spring water, this improvement was achieved. This showed that, putting other aspects aside, the evolution of the Wanmu Wolf, which the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas had perfected, was definitely not an issue.
As for when Old Sha would accumulate energy to its peak and complete its evolution, Su Ping had no clue.
Thus, Su Ping didn’t mind at all the resources needed by the Wanmu Wolf and poured them into Old Sha desperately. During the day, he even set up several mirrors around Old Sha to concentrate the sunlight even more, allowing Sunlight Absorption to gather more plentiful solar energy.
However, Su Ping wasn’t in a rush to use the Sun Crystal on Old Sha. The first use of these two advanced resources yielded the best effect; one shouldn’t be hasty. Having just advanced to Proficient Level, Mastery and Perfection were two thresholds. It would undoubtedly be best to use these Lungs of Nature and the Sun Crystal when stuck at these thresholds.
Indeed, Su Ping’s thinking was correct. After several more days of nurturing Old Sha under such conditions—bathed in rotating sunshine, with an ample supply of Smiling Sunflower Seeds and Sunlight Spring water—Photosynthesis showed no improvement.
Therefore, without hesitation this time, Su Ping placed the newly purchased Lungs of Nature at Old Sha’s mouth and nose. The Lungs of Nature was a verdant green leaf that looked ordinary, but its effects were quite remarkable. This time, almost immediately after the Lungs of Nature took effect, Photosynthesis, under Su Ping’s observation, broke through from Proficient Level to Mastery Level.
As the effectiveness of Photosynthesis improved, every single hair on Old Sha’s body moved gently with each breath. From a distance, when still, it almost seemed to transform into a luminous plant organism shimmering under the sunlight.
Utterly extraordinary!
But obviously, this still wasn’t enough! Old Sha’s Sunlight Absorption was at Perfection. Therefore, no matter what, Photosynthesis also had to reach Perfection Level.
Fortunately, according to Su Ping’s inquiries, the feedback from Old Sha suggested there was no rush for energy accumulation. At least, under the current circumstances, Old Sha didn’t seem to feel that special, imminent sensation of evolving.
So, using the Sun Crystal could wait until Old Sha had settled slightly and adapted to Photosynthesis at the Mastery Level; attempting the breakthrough then wouldn’t be too late. Moreover, on regular days, Su Ping could also determine the exact timing for using the Sun Crystal based on Old Sha’s condition. But today, Su Ping really didn’t have the time.
「It had been a week since Old Sha had begun the Third Rank of cultivation, advancing from the Second Rank.」
During this week, apart from continuing to supervise the training of the Forest Wolf pack and keeping records for Old Sha, there was also another, most important matter. The training of Accelerated Casting for the little Paperman had finally started in the first half of the night.
The cultivation of Accelerated Casting wasn’t very resource-consuming, especially when the creature in training was of a low level; it mostly needed Ordinary Level resources and some energy-restoring Magic Potions. But, in the first half of every night, the little Paperman would use the Jinge Technique under Su Ping’s special training. Initially, it cast it only about twenty times in a row, but over the past few days, the little Paperman tonight had continuously cast the Jinge Technique fifty times in the first half of the night!
And today was the last day of cultivating Accelerated Casting for the little Paperman!

chapters.title: Chapter 83: Cultivation Complete! Little Paper Man’s Intimacy Meets the Standard!
chapters.content:
Chapter 83: Chapter 83: Cultivation Complete! Little Paper Man’s Intimacy Meets the Standard!
"Remember, today’s goal is sixty repetitions—and it must be completed before midnight! You’re only halfway there; it’s not time to rest yet!"
Su Ping’s voice echoed throughout the underground training room of this side chamber.
This basement had never been much for decoration. Though once neat and clean, it had taken on the style of a post-war reconstruction site after the cultivation of Accelerated Spellcasting for the little Paperman began.
But Su Ping clearly didn’t care.
Compared to the cost of Pet Beast cultivation, the expense of remodeling was hardly worth mentioning.
And right now, undoubtedly, was the most crucial moment!
Amidst a series of cries from the little Paperman, a brilliant golden light flashed from his hands in an instant!
"Don’t worry!"
"For the glory of a Swordsman!"
"I must..."
"I will definitely do it!"
It was an incredibly dazzling blade light.
It was hard to imagine that such a massive blade light could burst forth from what was called a ’sword,’ made purely of stiff paper and just over ten centimeters long.
It was so powerful that it left a deep gash on the thick, reinforced concrete wall before them.
Even though Su Ping had seen it almost every day for the past few days, he couldn’t help but feel amazed every time this blade light appeared.
This power is truly terrifying!
Is this what the Perfection Level Jinge Technique looks like?
Moreover, it wasn’t just sharp; this sword-drawing strike, the little Paperman’s own creation, was also surprisingly fast.
Paired with the Sword Qi and blade light that surged from the Perfection Level Jinge Technique, it could inflict great damage from a distance.
After all, for the Paperman, a Pet Beast dubbed the ’shame of the Necromancy System,’ its only somewhat noteworthy advantage was perhaps that its speed was slightly faster than ordinary Pet Beasts of the same rank.ᴛʜɪs ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀ ɪs ᴜᴘᴅᴀᴛᴇ ʙʏ NovᴇlFir(e).nᴇt
"Huff... huff..."
The little Paperman gasped heavily, his ’poker face’ finally returning to an anime-style expression.
At this moment, due to the rapid and large consumption of Energy, his face showed distinct signs of strain, with thick beads of sweat appearing on one side.
Given that Papermen are Undead Pet Beasts belonging to the Necromancy System, they shouldn’t exhibit physiological reactions like sweating from physical exertion—where the hell is this sweat coming from?
Su Ping inwardly scoffed.
But he didn’t say much.
As long as it wasn’t that bizarre ’Ace of Diamonds’ poker face, it was fine.
However, Su Ping also noticed that the little Paperman had reached his limit.
Normally, a common Ninth Rank Paperman, using its Racial Skill ’Paper Body Folding,’ could use it up to twenty times at most.
But the little Paperman before him had used the Jinge Technique thirty times—and at Perfection Level, no less—which was quite impressive.
Indeed, over the past few days of training, by continually consuming ordinary Necromantic resources, the little Paperman had progressed and broken through his previous Level.
He had reached the common Ninth Rank.
Originally, back when he began the cultivation plan for Accelerated Spellcasting, Su Ping had considered having the little Paperman switch to practicing the ’Paper Body Folding’ ability.
Paper Body Folding was considered the Paperman’s primary offensive ability, but its weakness as an offensive skill was almost unparalleled in the entire Pet Beast World.
Perhaps only the utterly non-combat, caterpillar-like Insect-type Beasts could compare.
The effect of Paper Body Folding was quite interesting: it allowed the Paperman to freely change its body shape and control its form.
For example, if possible, the Paperman could instantly expand upon reaching an enemy’s side, enveloping the enemy in a paper cage.
Of course, it went without saying how little restraining power a paper cage actually possessed.
It could also wrap around the weak points of animal-type Pet Beasts, suffocating or strangling them.
Still, the power remained limited.
All in all, the Paperman’s Paper Body Folding was extremely flexible and seemed to offer great versatility, but its actual power was incredibly weak due to the Paperman’s low Racial Potential.
But no matter what, it’s still somewhat better than practicing the Jinge Technique to the max level, right?
Su Ping thought.
However, the little Paperman had a persistent devotion to Swordsmanship.
The little fellow would rather modify the slash of his sword-drawing style—part of the Jinge Technique—into a thrust than practice any other Skills.
So Su Ping didn’t insist further.
Looking at the little Paperman panting from exhaustion, Su Ping directly took out the Necromantic resource Soul-Settling Paper and the energy-recovering Magic Potion he had prepared earlier, and handed them to him.
The little Paperman took them. "Teacher..." he cried, "I will never forget your kindness for all eternity!"
In no time at all, he skillfully swallowed the Soul-Settling Paper and the Magic Potion. His originally weak expression instantly became as fierce and determined as a warrior with a drawn sword, fully revitalized.
"A Swordsman... never gives up!" he declared.
WHOOSH!
The blade light from the Jinge Technique he had just retracted flashed out again. Without any prompting from Su Ping, the practice of the Jinge Technique resumed once more!
"A true Swordsman... must be relentless!"
WHOOSH!
"To become an Expert, one must learn to endure solitude and loneliness!"
WHOOSH!
"Because an Expert is forged from solitude and loneliness!"
WHOOSH!
The Jinge Technique’s sharp edges cut swiftly through the air, striking fiercely upon the sturdy metallic wall.
It was as if the little guy was encouraging himself. Each time he executed a sword strike, his body wavered because the Magic Potion couldn’t fully restore his energy.
But still, the little Paperman remained steadfast, delivering every slash.
Such willpower and conviction... perhaps it isn’t so bad if this little Paperman, so determined to become an expert Swordsman, is a bit overly dramatic,
Su Ping suddenly thought.
It was under this sort of intense pressure, pushing himself to the brink of exhaustion, that the little Paperman actually completed sixty repetitions of the Jinge Technique just after eleven o’clock, before midnight.
Su Ping looked directly at the little Paperman, who had collapsed limply onto the ground, utterly spent, his eyes depicted as swirling spirals of exhaustion.
And at that very moment, an eerie fluctuation emanated from the little Paperman.
The next moment, the little Paperman seemed somewhat bewildered.
However, Su Ping understood what was happening.
Just as expected, within the Eye of Truth, feedback from the little Paperman slowly revealed the words "Accelerated Spellcasting"!
[Accelerated Spellcasting (Beginner): Allows casting speed to increase, but accordingly, consumes a bit more Energy.]
The little Paperman’s eyes snapped open, and he looked around himself in astonishment. "What is this?!" he exclaimed.
"This is the new ability I’ve been teaching you. Feel it out, understand it, and get used to applying it properly!"
"Huh?" the little Paperman uttered, puzzled, blinking his slow-motion eyes, seeming to have instantly regained his spirit.
However, at that very moment, the change Su Ping had long awaited finally occurred!
Upon the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, an unfamiliar Catalog slowly lit up!
Naturally, Su Ping understood: the intimacy level with the little Paperman had finally reached the required standard.

chapters.title: Chapter 84 Origami Man Record Activated, Evolution Imminent?
chapters.content:
Chapter 84: Chapter 84 Origami Man Record Activated, Evolution Imminent?
On this Catalog entry, it was identical to the previous ones for the Forest Wolf and Luozisong, except that against the overall gray-white background, there was this similarly gray-white Paperman.
However, the Paperman depicted was in the common form of a paper figure; its pale paper body, coupled with the chilling atmosphere, made it seem more like a quintessential Paperman.
In contrast, the little Paperman, with a folded conical hat on its head and dressed as a Swordsman, didn’t evoke this sense of cold terror. Instead, it possessed an indescribable cuteness stemming from this very contrast.
But Su Ping wasn’t concerned with these details right now. The goal he had striven for over many days was finally achieved, and he couldn’t help but breathe a sigh of relief.
Subsequently, his attention slowly focused on the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas.
Sure enough, as soon as the Paperman’s Catalog entry fully lit up, the following information appeared piece by piece:
[Catalog ’Paperman’ illuminated. Current Catalog Level: 1. Origin Reward: Rapid Recovery.]
[Rapid Recovery (Beast Tamer Ability): Expends spiritual power to quickly restore the injuries, Energy, and stamina of Pet Beasts within the Beast Taming Space.]
Indeed, this didn’t surprise Su Ping in the slightest.Tʜe source of this ᴄontent ɪs NovᴇlFirenᴇt
The reward for illuminating the Paperman’s Catalog entry to Lv. 1 was, as expected, another Beast Tamer Talent.
Truth be told, just based on these Talents alone, Su Ping had already far surpassed other Beast Tamers.
Others might have only one Beast Tamer Talent, but Su Ping now possessed a full four.
Apart from Pet Beast Home, Su Ping now finally possessed all three of what were known as the three great basic Beast Tamer Talents!
Although such low-level Beast Tamer Talents didn’t provide a significant boost, it was, as they say, better to have them than not.
Take the current situation, for example. Previously, restoring the little Paperman’s energy and stamina would have required healing Magic Potions and other resources. But now, with the Talents of Pet Beast Home and Rapid Recovery, Su Ping could bring the little Paperman into the Beast Taming Space and use Rapid Recovery, saving some of those costs.
Of course, that was about the extent of it. Although Rapid Recovery could heal some injuries, it was limited to minor surface wounds. Severed limbs or severe internal injuries still required high-level healing-type Pet Beasts.
However, Su Ping was neither discouraged nor disappointed. On the contrary, he was quite looking forward to what might come next.
Now that he has acquired what are called the three fundamental Beast Tamer Talents, is it possible that illuminating new Catalog entries will grant him other Talents?
Other Talents were one thing. However, abilities like Zhou Shuchen’s Fire Element Affinity were powerful Talents capable of permanently enhancing a Pet Beast’s combat capabilities.
Otherwise, Zhou Shuchen, who had always felt inferior, wouldn’t have become so arrogant after contracting the Crimson Fang Tiger. Such a Talent naturally made one material for a professional combat-type Beast Tamer.
He just wasn’t sure if, as he suspected, every new Pet Beast Catalog entry he illuminated would allow him to comprehend a new Talent.
However, if that were the case, with the unimaginable number of basic Pet Beast types, wouldn’t his future Talents also be unimaginable?
Although it felt unlikely, Su Ping couldn’t help but harbor fond hopes for such a future prospect.
Of course, thoughts aside, Su Ping quickly turned his attention to the Paperman’s Catalog entry that had just illuminated:
[Catalog: Paperman]
[A special low-level Necromancy Series Pet Beast with a frail body and strong malleability. It seems to possess quite impressive potential, though it requires specific development! Racial Skills: Paper Body Folding, Paper Body Joint, etc.]
[Current Catalog Level: 1 (352/500)]
Known Evolutionary Pathways, Special Cultivation:
[Secret Method for Cultivating Accelerated Casting: Can cultivate the skill ’Accelerated Spellcasting’.]
Preferences, Habits:
[Prefers cool, shaded places. Enjoys eating paper-based food.]
Recording Log:
[Discovered and made contact with a special variant Paperman; intimacy requirement met. Catalog Experience +352!]
[Subsequently, for each day spent with it, Catalog Experience +5! Each day spent together offers a chance to discover the reason for the special mutation. Alternatively, a certain amount of this Catalog’s Experience can be consumed to analyze the reason for the mutation.]
[Obtain Catalog Experience daily based on the number of creatures of this type cohabited with, their Level, and by enhancing the abilities of creatures whose intimacy meets the standard. This also serves to complete the Catalog and raise its Level.]
Looking at this Catalog entry for the Paperman, Su Ping’s brow furrowed slightly.
He looked again at the little Paperman before him.
In fact, he wasn’t the least bit interested in the reasons for the little Paperman’s mutation. Because Su Ping knew that, compared to Xiao Qing, the reasons for the little Paperman’s mutation probably weren’t that hard to guess, but they were definitely difficult to replicate! The little Paperman’s mutation was definitely linked in some unimaginable way to that Secret Realm. And who knew if such an opportunity still existed within that Secret Realm! That particular Sword Soul Mark alone was already puzzling enough for him.
The reason for his frown was another matter entirely.
This Paperman’s Racial Skill... there’s another one? Paper Body Folding allows it to freely transform its body shape; if Su Ping had such a paper Pet Beast, he could even fold it into the shape of a paper airplane. And this Paper Body Joint?
His understanding of the Paperman species as Pet Beasts was really not too extensive.
However, the little Paperman’s connection to this Secret Realm had given Su Ping some ideas, and through their interaction over this period, Su Ping had genuinely grown fond of the little Paperman.
Since that was the case, Su Ping needed to start planning early.
Compared to the Forest Wolf, Su Ping’s knowledge of the Paperman was far too limited. This wasn’t just in terms of Skill effects and corresponding Cultivation, but more importantly, its potential for future Evolution. In this regard, Su Ping needed to prepare well in advance.
Speaking of which, a few days ago, he had asked Sun Chaoju if there was an Intermediate Level Breeder in Linzhou City specializing in Papermen. However, he had been so busy recently with Old Sha’s evolution to the Third Rank that he hadn’t found the time to ask again. He needed to find time to inquire once more, but now was clearly not the right moment.
Currently, Old Sha was in the mid-to-late phase of the Third Rank, and Photosynthesis had even advanced to Mastery Level, just one step away from reaching Perfection Level. Once Perfection Level was reached, Old Sha’s energy accumulation would allow it to begin evolving.
During this phase, let alone being distracted by consulting other Breeders about the cultivation and evolution of other Pet Beasts, Su Ping wouldn’t even want to leave Heart of Woods if possible.
As it turned out, Su Ping’s perseverance was crucial. After another five full days, he finally perceived, with Old Sha’s feedback, that Photosynthesis had reached the peak of Mastery Level. With just a little more effort, it could cross the threshold into Perfection Level!
In other words, Old Sha had reached the point where evolution was imminent!

chapters.title: Chapter 85 Photosynthesis (Perfection)
chapters.content:
Chapter 85: Chapter 85 Photosynthesis (Perfection)
Su Ping’s eyes were bloodshot. Over the past few days, he had slept for less than ten hours in total. Today, he had barely closed his eyes when he was awakened again. Old Sha’s condition became increasingly peculiar as the effectiveness of its Photosynthesis continued to climb. Under such circumstances, even with the recording capabilities of a camera, Su Ping couldn’t fully trust it. This was true even though the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas contained perfect cultivation Secret Techniques and Magic Potion formulas without any flaws.
But this was Evolution! And it was a particularly dangerous Evolution, not the kind where one could still be at peace if it failed.
Therefore, he had to watch it personally, ensuring Old Sha wouldn’t encounter any problems before he could rest assured. This was especially true at this crucial juncture.
However, aside from the first awakening of Photosynthesis, and the two subsequent Level advancements that brought it to the Mastery Level, Old Sha’s Heart of Woods hadn’t experienced any more special changes. This allowed Su Ping to breathe a slight sigh of relief.
Previous calculations indicated that the Heart of Woods had indeed formed a very special supply relationship with Photosynthesis and Sunlight Absorption. Based on the experience Su Ping had accumulated these past few days, he suspected some mysterious changes might be hidden within. But at this critical point in the Evolution, he really didn’t want any unexpected problems to emerge.
"Old Sha, how do you feel?"
Su Ping had spent these past few days with Old Sha under the sunlight, and compared to before, he even seemed slightly darker. However, Su Ping clearly didn’t have the leisure to care about that at this moment.
A low sound emanated from Old Sha. Its body remained motionless, yet it seemed as if countless mouths all over it were constantly breathing. At the same time, its originally cyan fur seemed to be shifting towards Xiao Qing’s coloration. Over these past few days, its fur had gained a touch of vibrant green. However, unlike Xiao Qing’s green, which harbored a beautiful but deadly poison, Old Sha’s was entirely like sunlit, brightly shimmering leaves. It radiated an indescribable vitality.
Although, for such plant-like, bursting vitality to appear on a creature like a Forest Wolf was, in itself, quite astonishing.
Old Sha’s animalistic traits had diminished substantially over the past few days. If Su Ping hadn’t been constantly by its side, it probably wouldn’t even have been able to make a sound in response. Because ’plants’ do not make sounds. Only Su Ping, its ever-present master, could restore its animalistic vitality.
This was what Su Ping cared about most. He certainly wanted to help Old Sha evolve, become stronger, and extend its lifespan, but what he wanted was a lively Old Sha, not a wolf-shaped wooden wolf.
Sensing Old Sha’s feedback, Su Ping let out a slight breath. He could wait no longer. This period had been one of the most torturous in his life. After all, Old Sha was not like his own Soul Contract Pet Beast in the Beast Taming Space, whose condition and state he could sense at any moment through their Soul Contract. The situation had him eating poorly and sleeping restlessly.
Even without Old Sha’s feedback, Su Ping was ready to try.Googlᴇ search No(ᴠ)ᴇlFire.nᴇt
So, he slowly took out an item.
Even under the bright daylight, this object still emanated an unparalleled brilliance, instantly capturing Old Sha’s full attention. A call from deep within its bloodline made Old Sha feel an indescribable longing! It wanted this object!
It was none other than the Sun Crystal.
The Sun Crystal, of course, wasn’t a fragment split from the sun hanging high above. If that were the case, forget Monarch Level beings, even Emperor Level ones would likely be overwhelmed. The Sun Crystal was formed from transformed Earth Element that, after prolonged exposure to abundant sunlight, had absorbed a massive amount of solar energy. It was also the most precious of the materials currently in Su Ping’s possession.
This item, worth tens of millions, perhaps even several tens of millions, was nevertheless casually extended by Su Ping and offered to Old Sha’s mouth. In Su Ping’s heart, anything that could be measured by money and value couldn’t compare to family like Old Sha. This naturally included a mere Monarch Level resource.
Looking at the Sun Crystal brought to its mouth, Old Sha, if this were before, would definitely have wondered how to eat such a glowing clod of earth, and if it was even edible. Now, however, with Photosynthesis continuously working inside its body, Old Sha’s craving for the Sun Crystal was extremely urgent. Without a second thought, it snapped the crystal into its mouth.
CRUNCH! CRUNCH!
The crisp chewing sounds echoed as light spilled from the gaps in Old Sha’s great maw, which had not opened to eat for several days.
The scene was extremely eerie, yet Su Ping watched with utmost seriousness. His mental focus sharpened intensely at this moment. If Old Sha couldn’t use the Sun Crystal to elevate its Photosynthesis Level and break through this final bottleneck, then this third stage of Evolution might indeed take some unpredictable turns.
At this thought, Su Ping’s heart grew even more anxious. The past few days of agonizing waiting—days spent almost inseparably accompanying Old Sha as it sunbathed and ate sunflower seeds. Later, when Old Sha slowed its eating, Su Ping had even peeled the seeds for it, soaked them in sunlit spring water, and wiped its body.
Now, it was finally time to see the results.
CRACK. CRACK.
After the last few hard chunks of the Sun Crystal were finally crushed by Old Sha with these crisp sounds, accompanied by a clear GULP, it swallowed them down.
The glow in Old Sha’s mouth vanished. In its place, its eyes closed.
Then, the next moment, a glimmer of light began to steadily ascend. After repeatedly absorbing countless rays of sunlight, it finally reached a pinnacle!
Su Ping sensed that although Old Sha’s mouth and nose were still, it was as if a gigantic vacuum pump was continuously breathing, purifying the world’s oxygen and spiritual energy!
And the next moment, this radiance from Old Sha suddenly spread out. Countless misty points of light surfaced around its body.
Merely standing next to Old Sha, Su Ping felt as if he were in the purest natural forest oxygen bar; the refreshing sensation with every breath was so invigorating that he momentarily couldn’t react.
However, Su Ping knew that in less than ten days, Old Sha had acquired a second Perfection Level Skill!
His gaze locked onto:
[Photosynthesis (Perfection)]

chapters.title: Chapter 86: Is Su Anyong Coming Back?
chapters.content:
Chapter 86: Chapter 86: Is Su Anyong Coming Back?
It was as if his tumultuous emotions had suddenly peaked, and at last, at this moment, they calmly landed.
Su Ping let out a long breath and, without a second thought, lay back on the grass beside Old Sha.
Perfection!
As long as Photosynthesis reached the Perfection Level, one could boldly proclaim:
Basically secure!
This was truly stable.
The most arduous and critical third stage of evolution for the Wanmu Wolf, perfected by the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, was finally complete!
Next, once Old Sha’s accumulated energy peaked and his condition was fully restored, he could begin the evolution, a unique stage in the Beast Taming society of Blue Star.
At this stage, there was no longer a need to live in fear and trepidation.
After all, Su Ping had absolute faith in the perfecting effects of the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas.
Thus, the string that had been taut in his heart these past days suddenly relaxed. Although immense excitement still enveloped his heart, in this sun-drenched, warm season, lying on the soft grass, Su Ping completely let go and actually dozed off into a deep sleep.
He had a dream.
He dreamt that he was at the center of a radiant light.
And by his side, there were countless Forest Wolves and other various Pet Beasts.
Like a tide.
Those flying in the sky, swimming in the sea, running on the ground.
Even beyond these Pet Beasts, there were many more, of types he couldn’t clearly make out, all surrounding him.
And Old Sha was among them.
Except Old Sha had transformed into another appearance.
Su Ping couldn’t describe that appearance. Like most people’s dreams, he knew it was Old Sha, but he just couldn’t remember the specific scenes in the dream.
Su Ping only knew this was the most comfortable sleep he had ever had, and the most beautiful dream.
Unfortunately, at the end of the dream, some not-so-good images suddenly appeared.
"I don’t want to! I don’t want to be a live-in son-in-law! I’m already a Breeding Master! I’m the strongest Beast Tamer..."
Su Ping suddenly opened his eyes, thrashing about in an attempt to stop the beautiful dream from turning into a nightmare.
He looked around, his bewildered gaze slowly returning to reality as he took in his surroundings.
The sky had already grown dim, and on the other side, a crescent moon was even making its appearance.
The confused Su Ping glanced around and realized that beside him, other than Old Sha, there was also a concerned Uncle Guan.
Seeing Su Ping waking up, although his last words in the dream had left Guan Qianshan with a strange expression, Uncle Guan himself clearly heaved a sigh of relief.
"You gave me a scare! I was about to carry you inside to sleep, but this Forest Wolf stopped me. Xiao Ping, have you been too tired these days? Take a good rest; cultivating Pet Beasts isn’t an overnight task."
Su Ping smiled and looked at Old Sha, then faced Uncle Guan’s concerned gaze before replying, "No worries, things are stable now. There’s no need to be so busy."
He rubbed Old Sha’s furry head and was suddenly startled.
The touch of his hand was no longer the soft yet coarse wolf’s hair but felt more like the branches and leaves of trees.
This unique and bizarre sensation momentarily left him without a reaction.
However, Su Ping understood that this was a sign Old Sha’s changes were already beginning.
In other words, Old Sha’s evolution had actually started.
His days of toil had not been in vain.
Su Ping breathed a sigh of relief and stood up with a smile. "Don’t worry, I’m fine now. By the way, Uncle Guan, have you made dinner? I’m hungry!"
Lao Guan looked helplessly at the young man, then replied, "It’s ready; we’ve been waiting for you. Come on, you’re completely different from your father in character! I really don’t know who you take after."
Following the chattering Lao Guan into the kitchen, Lao Guan put on an apron before taking out the food that had been kept warm.
Impressively, four dishes and a soup made Su Ping’s eyes light up, and then he began to devour it.
Watching Su Ping eat as if he were a reincarnated starving ghost, Guan Qianshan smiled with satisfaction.
"You haven’t eaten well these past few days, so don’t eat too fast. Binge eating is bad for your health."
"I never realized, Uncle Guan, your cooking skills are this impressive?"
At this, Lao Guan chuckled and said, "Impressive? That’s because you haven’t seen the cooking skills of my wife and daughter."
Su Ping raised his eyebrows; he hardly ever heard Lao Guan mention his family matters.
"How old is your daughter? You’ve never mentioned her before?"
"She’s about the same age as you, but she previously studied at the Second Middle School."
"Oh? So she’s a graduate this year, too? Has she chosen her Pet Beast yet?"
Su Ping blinked.
Lao Guan shook his head. "The girl is sensible; she always said she’d be fine with just contracting any random one, but I’ve been thinking of giving her a surprise. I’ve been telling her not to rush into a contract, wanting to buy her a good one when the time comes."
At this, Lao Guan looked at Su Ping expectantly. "Xiao Ping, you have a lot of insight into this area. Do you have any recommendations?"
Su Ping thought for a moment and said, "What is her talent?"
"Uh... the common talent, Telepathic Communication."
Su Ping nodded. In fact, he didn’t really recommend Pet Beasts with high-level Racial Potential because they were too expensive. Of course, evolving low-level Pet Beasts was not only expensive but also difficult. So, just as Uncle Guan and Zhou Shuchen believed, starting with Pet Beasts that had a sufficiently high initial Racial Potential Level was definitely better.
If it were someone else, Su Ping might have casually recommended a few, but Uncle Guan was different. After some thought, he said, "Uncle Guan, why not the Forest Wolf? When the time comes, I can help with its training and even evolution!"
"This... would that be too much trouble for you!?"
Guan Qianshan was somewhat embarrassed.
"No problem, it’s not a bother. Just consider it a bonus for all the help you give me around here!"
Benefit bonus?
Guan Qianshan was somewhat astonished. He knew that in the past couple of days, a single application of Cultivation Skills had generated an income of five million gold. Although he was aware that this was profit, not principal, it was more than enough.
He wanted to refuse, but he couldn’t bring himself to do so. After all, it wasn’t for him but for his child’s future prospects.
Su Ping smiled and didn’t say much more.
"I truly never expected that after you took over Heart of Woods, you could achieve such feats. You’re much stronger than your father was back then. He used to ask me to look after you, but now it seems like it’s completely you, kid, who’s looking after me!"
Guan Qianshan was somewhat sentimental.
"By the way, Uncle Guan, do you know what my dad is doing in Northern Cold?"
Su Ping found it hard to believe that Su Anyong had actually gone to find him a stepmother.
His old man, though unreliable, surely wasn’t *that* unreliable?
Guan Qianshan shook his head. "You know what your dad is like; he probably just up and left on a whim."
Su Ping thought for a moment and nodded.
True enough.
However, at this very moment, a crisp notification sound came from his phone.
Su Ping tapped it open and saw a message on the screen.
The sender of this message was none other than his own father, whom he and Guan Qianshan had just mentioned.Thɪs Novᴇ(l)Fɪre .ɴᴇt
And the content of the message made Su Ping pause in surprise:
[Su Anyong: Son, my business here is almost wrapped up, and your dad might be coming back in a few days. Miss me?]
Su Ping blinked.

chapters.title: Chapter 87: The Unachievable Evolution of Wanmu Wolf?
chapters.content:
Chapter 87: Chapter 87: The Unachievable Evolution of Wanmu Wolf?
「Beast Master Association.」
In the chairman’s office at the very top, two familiar figures sat opposite each other, the office filled with the fragrance of tea.
Vice President Liu savored a sip of the Spirit-Old Tea. His lips pursed slightly, his mouth immediately began to water, and he couldn’t help but exclaim, "No wonder Su Ping said my Snow Crest with Emerald couldn’t compare to this Spirit-Old Tea. It’s indeed true!"
Qin Erlong looked somewhat pained. "This is the only pot; there’s no more. It’s only because you brought that boy out that I’m even sharing this. Otherwise, you wouldn’t have gotten a sniff."
Vice President Liu wasn’t angered by this. He simply closed his eyes and savored a few more sips.
Seeing his enjoyment, Qin Erlong finally asked, "Speaking of which, how has that young man been doing lately?"
Vice President Liu opened his eyes. "How else could he be? He’s a promising talent. After class that day, Xiao Sun and the others wanted to take him out to fool around, but he refused them. His character is commendable."
If Su Ping heard this at this moment, he would certainly curse Sun Chaoju outright for being an old rat.
Old Qin also smiled and nodded. "Indeed, he’s impressive. So young, yet so devoted to the Beast Cultivation career and even able to resist various temptations—very promising! My granddaughter’s painstaking efforts weren’t wasted."
However, when Vice President Liu didn’t react to his cheerful expression, Qin Erlong continued, "How is the evolution of the Wanmu Wolf coming along?"ɪꜰ ʏᴏᴜ ᴡᴀɴᴛ ᴛᴏ ʀᴇᴀᴅ ᴍᴏʀᴇ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs, ᴘʟᴇᴀsᴇ ᴠɪsɪᴛ No(ᴠ)ᴇlFire.nᴇt
Vice President Liu then adopted a serious expression. "It’s quite good. Unfortunately, the success rate isn’t high."
"Oh, why’s that? Even you can’t manage it?" Qin Erlong perked up with interest. Evidently, after Sun Chaoju lost the Wanmu Wolf evolution method to Su Ping in a bet, he had given another copy to his own teacher. The reasoning was simple: if it could be researched successfully, Sun Chaoju, as the discoverer of this evolutionary path, would naturally gain immense benefits and fame.
Vice President Liu shook his head. "It’s not that it’s impossible, but it’s difficult to explain. The Wanmu Wolf evolution extends and expands the Forest Wolf’s Wood Attribute even further! Moreover, unlike the Crown Wolf Emperor, which controls Wood Attribute forces, the Wanmu Wolf, while also capable of controlling Wood Attribute power, primarily focuses on absorbing the essence of wood into its own body. This characteristic is wonderfully similar to how trees and other woody plants function. Therefore, after Xiao Sun completes an evolution, the resulting Wanmu Wolves all adopt that particular form. To fully master this evolution, the Wanmu Wolf must pass through an extremely special and delicate stage, one that requires numerous attempts. Furthermore, the potential of this Evolutionary Body is currently unknown. And if this evolution fails at any point after entering the evolutionary phase, the mortality rate is one hundred percent..."
As Vice President Liu elaborated, Qin Erlong’s frown deepened. Finally, he glared at Liu Fuhai. "You didn’t tell Little Su about this beforehand? What were you thinking?"
Vice President Liu also glared. "What should I have said? That the evolution for Little Su is too difficult, that even I would need to prepare meticulously if I wanted to try? That he should just forget it? If I put it that way, wouldn’t the kid just get more fired up? You bastard! I haven’t settled the score with you for last time! Your own granddaughter went to do the cultivation, and you damn well didn’t explain it to me clearly! You had Miss Qin come over to call me to account, and I, at my age, had to put on a smiling face for your granddaughter? Now you want to pick a fight with me over this kid’s business too? Qin Erlong, don’t think I’m scared of you now just because you found yourself a fierce wife!"
Seeing Old Liu flare up, Qin Erlong immediately softened and chuckled. "It’s only because it’s you, Old Liu. If Zuo Guang came here and dared to talk to me like that, I’d show him what’s what."
Noticing Old Liu had fallen silent, Qin Erlong quickly picked up the teapot, poured him another cup, and changed the subject. "Speaking of which, how come Zuo Guang has been in the Imperial Capital for so long and still hasn’t returned? Is he playing lapdog for headquarters again?"
"Your words don’t have to be so harsh. Old Zuo isn’t having an easy time either. Jianghai Province hasn’t produced any significant achievements in a long time, so it’s understandable he feels he’s lost face at headquarters."
"Results? What counts as results? It’s only in recent years, after the Holy Dragon took charge and significantly increased supervision, that things have changed. Otherwise, how much of the top-to-bottom resource allocation actually reached the hands of Research Breeders? Zuo Guang used to turn a blind eye to it all. If it weren’t for some old ties, he would have been guilty of connivance and sheltering. But now, it’s alright. He knows when to step back, is ready to retire, and has handed most of the association’s major affairs over to you. But the Breeders with Talent from back then have all left for other regions. How many are still in Jianghai? It’d be a wonder if they could produce any results." Qin Erlong sounded extremely dismissive, apparently holding the actual president of the Jianghai Province Breeder Association in no regard whatsoever.
Vice President Liu, however, merely smiled and didn’t pursue the topic. Generally, while the Beast Master Association did wield the most local power, the Breeder Association had different functions, making extensive involvement often inappropriate.
After a pause, Old Liu changed the subject. "So, that’s why I’m hoping that young man might create a miracle, isn’t it? If he can successfully develop the Wanmu Wolf’s evolution, then, setting aside everything else, Jianghai Province should at least make a respectable showing at the year-end Breeder Contest, don’t you think? Even if it’s an Advanced Level evolution for the Forest Wolf, considering the difficulty, it might not win us first place if it can’t be widely adopted. But at least Jianghai Province wouldn’t be so utterly disgraced, right?"
Qin Erlong was about to scoff, but then his eyes suddenly lit up. "In that case, shouldn’t the Breeder Association also provide strong sponsorship and support for the resources Su Ping needs for his evolution experiments?"
Vice President Liu was taken aback and shot the old scoundrel a speechless glance. "No wonder you managed to pursue her back then; you really do have thick skin. But rest assured, Little Su asked for a Sun Crystal a few days ago. I reckon that’s what he mainly needs, and I’ve managed to allocate a few more these past few days."
"That’s more like it! But it’s not enough. I heard Little Su wanted to buy some equipment. As the president of the Breeder Association, one must vigorously support promising new Breeders, don’t hold back..."
Vice President Liu immediately stood up. "I knew your tea wasn’t offered for free! I’m leaving. If I stay any longer, you old fox will fleece me for sure!"
Qin Erlong didn’t try to stop him. Ultimately, however, neither of them held out much hope. Even Liu Fuhai, a man who was not only the Vice President of the Breeder Association but also a Breeder specializing in Advanced Level Wolf Pets, had stated the evolution was extremely difficult. Therefore, even if Su Ping could complete it, it certainly wouldn’t be achievable in a short period.
However, what neither of them could have imagined was that on this very ordinary day, the evolution of the Wanmu Wolf—the one they believed couldn’t be developed in a short time—had already begun.

chapters.title: Chapter 88: Old Sha Evolves!
chapters.content:
Chapter 88: Chapter 88: Old Sha Evolves!
Su Ping was clearly still unaware. For the sake of Old Sha’s evolution into the Wanmu Wolf, Qin Erlong had, on his behalf, once again squeezed Old Liu for a hefty sum of resources, which was now waiting for Su Ping to collect and approve. Right now, he didn’t have the mind to deal with such matters.
Upon hearing that his dad would be back in a few days, Su Ping suddenly felt his spirits lift. Su Ping knew that although his dad often seemed unreliable, his affection for Old Sha was definitely no less than Su Ping’s own—perhaps even deeper. After all, his dad and Old Sha had practically grown up together. Otherwise, why would his dad, who usually paid little attention to the Heart of Woods base, have even attempted to help Old Sha evolve?
Therefore, Su Ping resolved that before his dad returned...
Old Sha must complete its evolution!
Indeed, this was the case. Over the past few days, all the money earned from completed cultivation orders at the Heart of Woods had been spent. If Su Ping hadn’t just finished cultivating a batch of pre-ordered Forest Wolves, his funds would have truly been insufficient. However, the results were excellent. He had used all that money to purchase Commander Level Wood Element resources, then had Old Sha consume them all at once.
Evolution requires an accumulation of surplus energy to be completed in a single, powerful burst! Older Pet Beasts find it difficult to evolve precisely because their vitality declines with age, making it hard for them to maintain a surplus of energy for extended periods. Under such circumstances, evolution naturally becomes extremely difficult. Fortunately, because Old Sha had previously ingested the Heart of Woods, it had serendipitously undergone a rank-up. This extended its lifespan and slowed the decline of its vitality. This all led to the scene today.
The sunlight shone brightly. In this post-September weather, it seemed as if even the heavens sensed Su Ping’s fervent hope, granting a rare succession of bright, sunny days. Today was especially radiant. This day was a very special one. Its significance was almost on par with the first time Su Ping had fed the Heart of Woods to Old Sha.
Consequently, on this day, none of the Forest Wolves trained as usual. Including Xiao Qing, all the Forest Wolves squatted patiently around the perimeter of an area that, for the past half-month, had been strictly forbidden for any person or Forest Wolf to approach. They stared intently at the center of the area, their eyes filled with excitement, anticipation, and a touch of yearning. And in the very center of this restricted ground stood Su Ping and Old Sha.
Old Sha at this moment was entirely different from half a month ago! Its originally dark cyan fur had become even more vibrant and green, yet its texture was unlike the fur of ordinary Wolf Pets. At first glance, it looked more like the cellular structure of leaves than fur. Along Old Sha’s spine, several even longer and narrower tufts of fur grew like spreading tree branches, giving it an indescribably peculiar appearance.
Old Sha’s eyes were closed, its body bathed in sunlight. Strands of green vitality swirled around it, and it almost seemed as if rhythmic breathing sounds emanated from Old Sha’s body. Its photosynthetic output, from just one wolf, seemed comparable to that of a small forest.
Perfection Level Photosynthesis!
If this Skill were on a Low-level Luozisong (Pine), it could probably enable it to break through several Realms in a short period. However, for a Forest Wolf, this Skill formed an exceptionally strange synergy with Sunlight Absorption. It wasn’t very distinct under the sunlight, but one could still sense a faint Light Cocoon forming around Old Sha. This Light Cocoon wasn’t thick, nor could it completely envelop Old Sha yet.
So, in front of Old Sha, there was one last thing. For Old Sha’s evolution this time, Su Ping had truly spared no expense. Perhaps it was because Old Sha’s Sunlight Absorption and Photosynthesis had both reached the Perfection Level, or perhaps for some other reason, but the final energy accumulation Old Sha required was slightly more than what Sun Chaoju had noted in his records. Su Ping had purchased three such Commander Level Wood Element resources, and now only the last one remained.
It was a leaf, only the size of a palm, yet it was the most expensive of the three Commander Level resources: Elf Leaves. A precious resource containing both Wood Element and Life Series powers, it had a significant boosting effect for such Pet Beasts. It was also the final trump card to help Old Sha accelerate its energy accumulation!
Sensing, perhaps, that its brewing energy was still somewhat insufficient, Old Sha slowly opened its eyes. In its eyes, there was joy, anticipation, and also fear.
It was joyful that it could, one day, still feel the Light of Evolution shining upon it.
It also anticipated its young master’s miraculous abilities, which it had witnessed before, hoping its young master could replicate that miracle this time.
Yet, at the same time, it was terrified. Even with all its young master had done, what if the evolution still failed?
It didn’t care about its own life or death. But it had consumed so many of its young master’s resources, so much of his effort; if it still failed, what then?
Thus, without even waiting for Su Ping to speak, its tongue—which seemed to bear the patterns of tree leaves—stretched out and lapped the life-infused Elf Leaves into its mouth. Su Ping understood its urgency. After it took the Elf Leaves into its mouth, Su Ping gently placed his palm on Old Sha’s head and said softly, "Old Sha, I believe in you. You have to believe in me too!"
No sound came from Old Sha. However, its gaze, fixed on Su Ping, was incredibly resolute as it looked at its young master. At that moment, its eyes seemed to convey all its conviction.
Of course, it believed!
It wanted to raise its neck. From its body, now gradually losing sensation, it yearned to let out a familiar howl towards the sky—a howl unheard for many long days. In this final, fate-deciding moment, it wanted to tell its young master that it absolutely, unequivocally believed in his capabilities!
But in the very next instant, Old Sha’s final gaze, its sparkling eyes, suddenly turned dull and vacant, as if they had transformed into plant matter itself. This was because the initially faint Light Cocoon, the Light of Evolution, had suddenly become incredibly thick the moment the Elf Leaves were swallowed. From head to toe, the Light Cocoon slowly enveloped Old Sha, which seemed rooted to the earth, covering everything except its head. The energy accumulation, with the help of the Elf Leaves, had finally reached Perfection!
However, just as this Light of Evolution was about to completely engulf it, from its proudly raised neck, from within its seemingly insensate body, and with every last ounce of its waning strength, a howl unlike any before—a howl born of Old Sha’s final, desperate effort—resounded through the sky above the Heart of Woods.Google seaʀᴄh
AWOOO...
However, this all-out Wolf Howl lasted less than a second. The very next second, the thick Light Cocoon of evolution completely enveloped Old Sha.
Su Ping, however, smiled faintly. He had heard Old Sha’s response and understood its unspoken meaning. That meaning was simple: ’Not only does it believe in its young master, but it also trusts that the young master will become the greatest Beast Tamer and Breeder in the future.’

chapters.title: Chapter 89: The Zhang Family Brothers Pay a Visit, Beast Tamer Legion!
chapters.content:
Chapter 89: Chapter 89: The Zhang Family Brothers Pay a Visit, Beast Tamer Legion!
"Xiao Ping, a customer said they know you. They mentioned before that they wanted to have a personal chat with you..."
In the walkie-talkie, Lao Guan’s voice came through. Su Ping’s brow furrowed.
"Uncle Guan, I don’t have time right now. You attend to them first. If they aren’t willing to wait, we’ll reschedule."
Su Ping’s gaze didn’t shift, remaining firmly fixed on the enormous Light Cocoon.
The Light of Evolution is a special phenomenon that only appears during a Pet Beast’s Evolution.
It is the time when a Pet Beast is at its most vulnerable, and any accident can easily lead to a failed Evolution due to external factors.
Even though this was his own home, Su Ping was unwilling to move even half a step during these final moments.
The duration of the Evolution depends on the strength of the Evolutionary Body.
However, under normal conditions, the process doesn’t actually take too long.
Su Ping estimated that forty minutes to an hour and a half should be sufficient.
After all, Evolution is a metamorphosis that occurs once all Energy prerequisites reach their peak.
Compared to this final Evolution, the Cultivation that came before was considerably longer and more arduous.
Fortunately, regardless, Su Ping had already completed the journey and reached this final step.
During these last moments, he certainly wouldn’t leave to attend to any customer, thereby missing the final second of Old Sha’s transformation.
Never mind mere customers; even if President Qin or Vice President Liu showed up, they would have to wait patiently. Of course, Su Ping estimated that if these two knew, they’d probably be quite willing to wait with him, right?
Su Ping directly cut off the signal. In the reception room, Lao Guan was left somewhat embarrassed. However, he still returned to the room and apologetically addressed the three figures on the sofa,
"Gentlemen, I apologize. Our boss is currently unavailable. However, here at Heart of Woods, we take the Cultivation of every Pet Beast very seriously. It’s personally overseen by Breeder Su himself, ensuring there are no issues whatsoever! Furthermore, our prices have always been consistent, with absolutely no hidden charges!"
If Su Ping were here, he’d probably recognize at first glance who these individuals claiming to know him were.
The two young figures sitting to the left and right were none other than the Zhang Wen and Zhang Wu brothers, whom he had met earlier at Yuntian Resort.
These were the brothers with the Talented Ability of telepathic connection.
However, upon hearing the Cultivation price of four million, or a one million material fee in the event of failure, they had decided to return home to discuss it. After finally making a decision and bringing their father—who seldom came home—they heard another piece of news.
The Cultivation fee at Heart of Woods had increased again, to five million, which undoubtedly left the two brothers stunned.
When Lao Guan learned of this, he also felt somewhat helpless.
At that time, Su Ping had a somewhat unclear understanding of his own Cultivation services and hadn’t anticipated so many customers. That was why price changes had occurred twice in rapid succession during that period.
Now that people were literally at his doorstep, what could he do? Could he decide on his own to lock in the Cultivation fee at four million for the two? This deal involved a two million difference; how could he possibly make that decision?
But to Guan Qianshan’s relief, the burly man sitting between the two young men didn’t seem angered by this. Instead, he appeared quite interested in examining the Heart of Woods reception room.
He didn’t seem to care at all about the heated haggling between his sons and Manager Guan.
In fact, he really didn’t care.
Although ten million was a sum he could ill afford, this time he had come with a special mission.
His name was Zhang Lie, and his identity was quite special.ᴛʜɪs ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀ ɪs ᴜᴘᴅᴀᴛᴇ ʙʏ NovᴇlFɪre.nᴇt
As one of the core cities in the east and an important city by the Eastern Sea, Jianghai Province naturally held a special status.
Accordingly, there were Beast Tamer Legions stationed in Jianghai Province.
However, the location of the Beast Tamer Legions’ military district was generally not disclosed to the public.
Zhang Lie was the commander of the Forest Wolf Troop, a unit within the Jianghai Province Legion, specifically from the Forest Wild Army’s War Wolf A Division.
Owing to its strategic position, the Beast Tamer Legions in Jianghai Province encompassed several army Legions.
Apart from two army Legions, the rest were naval forces and a portion of the air force.
After all, the location of West Dragon Lake was exceptionally advantageous.
Not only in Jianghai Province, but many water-type Beast Tamer Legions from the Eastern Military Region also operated around West Dragon Lake.
In this era, the primary tasks of the Beast Tamer Legions, besides driving away wild Pet Beasts that entered human-activity zones, were internal exercises and training.
Just last month, his Forest Wolf Troop had a simulated battle exercise with a brother troop from the Fierce Tiger C Division.
The result was a devastating loss: the opponent achieved victory with less than one-third of their own casualties, not only routing his forces but also capturing him, the commander, before he could even summon his Pet Beasts.
What was most embarrassing was that the exercise took place in a forest—terrain where his Forest Wolf Troop should have excelled.
Even now, Zhang Lie could still envisage the dark-faced expression of his superior officer.
Nevertheless, he understood why the opponent was so formidable.
The reason was simple: the Fierce Tiger C Division had undergone internal reforms, and that Rock Tiger Troop was the first to be affected. This exercise was intended to test the results using his Forest Wolf Troop.
The focus of this internal reform was elite Cultivation.
This involved specialized training programs, Skill Cultivation by professional Breeders, resource rewards for completing training objectives, and even Evolution.
Having learned all this, Zhang Lie had accepted this mission as a chance for redemption: find a suitable Forest Wolf Breeder and implement enhanced Cultivation and training for his own troop!
And just after he left the Legion base and returned home, his two sons informed him that in Linzhou, they had come across an interesting Forest Wolf Breeder who was actually capable of nurturing the Heart of Woods Skill!
Indeed, although the Beast Tamer Legions were separate institutions within the Dragon Nation and, serving as a national mainstay, had access to comprehensive resources and training, there was a certain rigidity within the Legions. The breeding departments within the Legions did exist, but they were, for the most part, outdated. After all, most geniuses with a Talent for breeding would not choose a military career. It was about time to appropriately introduce the diverse breeding methods from the outside world into the Legions to further enhance the battle strength of the Beast Tamer Legions.
Zhang Lie himself was not too convinced that a young fellow, about the same age as his two naive sons, could be such an impressive Breeder. But, acting on the principle of trying anything in a desperate situation, he came anyway. If he failed to complete this mission, as the commander of the Forest Wolf Troop, there was a high likelihood he would be demoted by his furious superiors to shoveling manure upon his return.
With this in mind, Zhang Lie dared not be careless. He smiled at the somewhat embarrassed Manager Guan and said,
"Manager Guan, could we take a look inside? As you know, nurturing a Pet Beast is no trivial matter!"
"Of course, this way, please. I expect our Breeder Su is currently researching Pet Beast Cultivation. Perhaps we’ll encounter him," replied Manager Guan.
With that, the four of them quickly made their way towards the Pet Beast Cultivation area in the backyard.

chapters.title: Chapter 90: Evolution Successful, What Kind of Evolutionary Being Is This?
chapters.content:
Chapter 90: Chapter 90: Evolution Successful, What Kind of Evolutionary Being Is This?
"Gentlemen, this is where our Heart of Woods Forest Wolves engage in activities and training..." Guan Qianshan was familiarly introducing the training ground to the father and his sons, but his words came to an abrupt halt halfway through.
"Manager Guan, your Forest Wolves..." Zhang Lie also spoke with evident interest.
Because at that moment, behind Guan Qianshan, there was not a trace of any Forest Wolf. On the large clearing in front of the forest, though, there were some remnants of vine markings and signs of battle. It was clear that Lao Guan hadn’t been wrong.
Guan Qianshan looked rather embarrassed as he glanced back, "Maybe it’s just not training time yet. The Pet Beast training is mainly handled by Breeder Su."
Zhang Lie nodded, not saying a word, feeling a bit disappointed. It was almost eleven o’clock now. As the leader of the Forest Wolf Troop, he naturally knew that unlike other wolves that are nocturnal, daytime was the best time for Forest Wolves to train and be active. Yet now, there was no sign of these Forest Wolves, nor any trace of that so-called Breeder; it clearly showed a lack of dedication. Although I anticipated this possibility, I can’t help feeling somewhat let down. It seems I might have to look for another Breeder after all.
But while he thought this, no other emotion showed on his face.
As for Lao Guan, he had completely given up. He didn’t even know what their young boss had been up to these past few days. Why was Su Ping staying so dedicatedly by that strange Forest Wolf, even halting the purchase of surrounding land deeds? All the money had been spent on resources for that Forest Wolf! It looked like this business deal was probably not going to happen.
However, driven by professional ethics, he still took the father and sons for an additional tour within the Heart of Woods. "Just ahead is the research project that Breeder Su has been studying these days, which is generally not open for casual visits. But since you gentlemen were acquainted with Breeder Su before, we can take a distant look from here, and that would be permissible."
"Hmm!" Zhang Lie nodded indifferently.
Seeing his two equally frustrated sons, he chuckled. His sons had always wanted to join the army with him and be part of the Forest Wolf Troop, so they had been training diligently. Now, they were excited to meet the reputable Breeder their father had recommended, and yet, they had encountered this situation.
First, the previously discussed price was off the table; it had suddenly risen by a million. Then, within the entire Heart of Wood Cultivation Base, not a single person could be found. Only this manager, who seemed to have materialized out of thin air, remained. This performance undoubtedly made his sons feel as though they had lost face in front of their own father.
Therefore, Zhang Lie, who was a stern figure in front of the new recruits and his subordinates, was quite an understanding and gentle father to his sons. Smiling, he said, "I trust your judgment. When that Little Breeder has time, you can visit and have a chat with him. If the price is the same as before, I’ll do whatever it takes to help you try!"
Zhang Wen frowned, "Forget it, who knows if it would even be successful!"
Manager Guan also felt somewhat helpless. However, he still wore an enthusiastic smile on his face as he approached the tempered glass enclosure, "This is the main research and Cultivation project that Breeder Su has been focusing on recently..."
Before he could finish, he saw the three individuals, who had just shown signs of boredom, focusing their gaze in unison toward the distance. Guan Qianshan also turned his head in surprise.
Immediately, at the edge of his vision, under the grass bathed in sunlight, all the Forest Wolves that had just disappeared were now gathered here. Squatting there, one by one, both large and small, there must have been dozens of them. At first glance, they looked like a collection of elementary school students dutifully listening to a lecture.
Zhang Lie witnessed this scene, and it strongly reminded him of small gatherings within his Legion, with every Beast Tamer warrior squatting down in a similar manner. Suddenly, his impression of the young Breeder Su started to change slightly.
To be able to tame so many wolves and keep them so well-behaved... he must have some skill, right? Could it be that I was mistaken? And what is that young Breeder having so many Forest Wolves do, squatting here? What’s he up to?
New ɴᴏᴠᴇʟ ᴄhapters are published on ɴoᴠel Fɪre.nᴇt
He moved forward a few steps and came to stand in front of the reinforced glass enclosure, squinting his eyes slightly. Then, those narrowed eyes began to gradually widen until, at last, they were as round as copper bells, staring in disbelief at those two blurred figures at the end of his line of sight, and at that one rare, yet captivating ray of light.
It was the light that every Beast Tamer, and countless Pet Beasts, most eagerly anticipated. This light signified a further step in progress, a vaster future, and greater strength, as well as an evolved Pet Beast that was different from the past! Every newly evolved Pet Beast came with a new species name, more Skills, and powerful Racial Potential.
Even within his own Legion, there were still few soldiers who had accumulated enough military merit to allow their little companions to achieve a satisfactory Evolution, himself included. Even though he, Commander Zhang Lie, was already at the Commander Level of Beast Tamers, his Pet Beast, the Forest Wolf, was still stuck at its race limit. It hadn’t undergone Evolution, not for lack of military merit, but because he hadn’t found a desirable evolutionary path.
Yet, what am I seeing? Inside the Cultivation Base of a Breeder said to be my son’s age, I’m seeing the Light of Evolution? This must be the Evolution of a Forest Wolf, right? What will its Evolutionary Body be? The most common, lowest-tier ordinary Forest Wolf, or something else?
Zhang Lie didn’t know. At that moment, however, his gaze was entirely captivated by that light far away at the end of his line of sight, unable to be moved away in the slightest.
Su Ping was clearly unaware that this final Evolution had unexpectedly attracted two onlookers. But even if he knew, Su Ping wouldn’t be concerned. The Evolution of the Wanmu Wolf would surely be shared and announced in the future. Being seen by others first didn’t really matter.
