Hmm? Not bad. The Shadow Leopard’s evolutionary body, the ’Chasing Shadow Leopard,’ reaching Commander Level is one thing, but for the Breeder to have a chance to cultivate the ’Shadow Step’ Skill? Interesting.
The Great Strength Vajra Ape? This is a Pet Beast with extraordinary strength at Peak Command, and there are even some evolutionary bodies with Monarch Level racial potential. Good, good.
As General Zhao read through the document, he nodded, making a mental note of the unit names that caught his eye, planning to pay special attention to their performance during the competition.
But soon, General Zhao’s eyebrows shot up, a look of surprise flickering in his eyes.
Those rascals from the Tiger C Troop must have seen what was happening with the Rock Tiger Troop, right? Just waiting for this order to be announced, tsk, tsk. The Roaring Snow Tiger’s peak Commander Level evolutionary body, the Ice Scale White Tiger, and the Winged Sky Tiger with its flying capabilities? Huh? And a Netherworld Demon Tiger with Monarch racial potential?
Just as expected! With even a slight leak of resources from within the Legion, what can’t those external Breeders cultivate? Why bother maintaining those worthless cultivation departments in the Legion that haven’t produced results in years?
However, judging solely from this Legion-wide competition, it seemed the Fierce Tiger C Troop would most likely have the last laugh.
Tiger-type Pet Beasts were indeed somewhat more powerful than other terrestrial Pet Beasts, and more evolutionary forms had been developed for them.
He continued scrolling. General Zhao, who could typically deduce a general idea just from the proposed cultivation directions, suddenly paused. He stared at the line below, blinking slowly, somewhat confused for a moment. Clearly, he didn’t immediately comprehend it.
The reason was simple, as the line below clearly read:
[Forest Wolf Troop, Wolf A Troop. Commander: Zhang Lie. Cultivators: Sun Xiao, Gao Hang, Li Da...]
The preceding details were not particularly special. The Forest Wolf Troop had a slightly larger number of personnel undergoing cultivation, but that was normal. He was aware of the recent exercise where the Rock Tiger Troop had inflicted a three-to-one casualty ratio on the Forest Wolf Troop.
General Zhao could guess that the young Lin Lei probably wanted the Forest Wolf Troop to redeem themselves, so he had selected a few more individuals for cultivation to choose the most suitable ones from among them.
But what he couldn’t comprehend was the line that followed:
[Cultivation Direction: Evolution, Skill Cultivation. Evolutionary Body: Wanmu Wolf. Cultivation Skill: Heart of Woods.]
Wanmu Wolf? Never heard of that before.
General Zhao pondered for a moment and even searched on the computer, but he still found no information. Not only was there nothing on the commercial market, but he couldn’t find any information on this Wanmu Wolf even within the Legion’s internal database.
What kind of evolutionary form is this?
General Zhao thought for a bit more, then pulled out the thick stack of documents. He quickly found the report pertaining to the Forest Wolf Troop, along with the details of the required resources and their delivery location.
Heart of Woods Cultivation Base? In Linzhou City? A completely new and undiscovered Forest Wolf evolutionary form? A young Breeder fresh out of graduation? An Intermediate Breeder registered with the Jianghai Province Breeders Association? One of Liu Fuhai’s people?
General Zhao’s pupils constricted, his interest genuinely piqued.ɪꜰ ʏᴏᴜ ᴡᴀɴᴛ ᴛᴏ ʀᴇᴀᴅ ᴍᴏʀᴇ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs, ᴘʟᴇᴀsᴇ ᴠɪsɪᴛ NoᴠᴇFɪre.nᴇt
The Forest Wolf was one of the most common and widely used Pet Beasts. If a new, popular evolutionary form for it emerged, it would be a major event!
And such significant news hasn’t leaked out at all? It’s either still in a confidential phase, or our own soldiers were being deceived.
However, the latter seemed unlikely.
Linzhou City?
At this thought, General Zhao stopped reading and took out his phone. He quickly found a familiar number. It belonged to none other than Liu Fuhai, the current vice-chairman of the Linzhou City Breeder Association.
Although the local Breeder and Beast Master Associations had no subordinate relationship with the Legion, the two men were on relatively good personal terms.
In the past, Linzhou City hadn’t produced any impressive results in the Breeder competitions.
Now, it seems Old Liu is planning to make a big splash with this Wanmu Wolf evolutionary form, keeping it under wraps until now, eh?
However, after considering it, General Zhao decided not to call during working hours. Instead, he merely sent a text message:
"Old Liu, congratulations! You’ve hidden this one quite deep! Haha!"

chapters.title: Chapter 114 - 105: The Riddle Man Deserves to Die! Xiao Qing’s Breakthrough
chapters.content:
Chapter 114: Chapter 105: The Riddle Man Deserves to Die! Xiao Qing’s Breakthrough
"This time, take the opportunity to discuss and learn from each other; it will greatly benefit your futures!"
In the office of Vice President Liu of the Breeder Association, he said to the several Breeders before his desk.
"Yes!"
Standing before Vice President Liu was a group of young Breeders. Most were under thirty years old and were newly promoted Junior Breeders sent from Jianghai Province to neighboring Huaiyang Province for an exchange program.
After sending them off, two people remained in the office.
These two were none other than the Intermediate Breeders from the Jianghai Province Breeders Association who specialized in Forest Wolves.
One was Sun Chaoju, whom Su Ping knew very well. The other was another Breeder from Linzhou City specializing in Forest Wolves.
Vice President Liu glanced at them, took a sip of tea to moisten his throat, smiled, and said, "Alright, what’s there to be so gloomy about? The job in the Legion isn’t that easy, is it? Now you’ve finally realized there’s always someone better out there, right?"
Sun Chaoju and the other Breeder specializing in Forest Wolves exchanged helpless looks.
It was Sun Chaoju, being relatively closer to him, who reluctantly looked at Vice President Liu and said, "Teacher, if it had been a fair competition, that would be one thing. But I had just begun negotiations with the deputy commander of that unit, and the very next day, I was replaced without any explanation. Old Wang, too. He had just settled on a preliminary agreement with the instructor of the Forest Wolf Troop, only to be informed that the contract was voided. Do you know what’s really going on?"
Vice President Liu continued sipping his tea, looking at them helplessly. "The Legion is making a major move. This time, it’s just an appetizer, aimed at internal changes. However, your abilities are indeed hardly sufficient to get involved in these muddy waters."
Sun Chaoju and Old Wang exchanged glances.
Their teacher really knew something?
ʀᴇᴀᴅ ʟᴀᴛᴇsᴛ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs ᴀᴛ No(ᴠ)ᴇlFire.nᴇt
Vice President Liu was a good man in all aspects, except for one: he loved to be coy.
The more anxious the two before him became, the more unhurriedly he savored his tea before continuing, "The higher-ups are dissatisfied with the Cultivation Department of the Beast Tamer Legion for taking resources without delivering results. So, the Legion is preparing to implement elite outsourced cultivation.
In Linzhou, besides you two who are skilled at Forest Wolf cultivation, there’s only that kid, Su Ping. However, he’s completely focused on the evolution of the Wanmu Wolf. He probably doesn’t know about this and wouldn’t be in the mood to bother with it anyway.
But you must understand, this is a revolution for the entire Forest Army!"
Vice President Liu’s expression turned serious. "The race limit of Forest Wolves is the Elite Peak Level. Even if some advanced resources are consumed to break through that race limit, the improvement isn’t significant!
However, the upper limit for this upcoming Legion-wide grand competition is the Commander Level! So, you should understand what this implies!"
The two were slightly startled, then understanding dawned, and they exchanged wry, helpless smiles.
They now understood what it meant.
The cultivation cap for the Legion competition was the Commander Level. However, normally, the Racial Potential of Forest Wolves only reached the Elite Level at best. This meant there was only one way forward!
That was to cultivate for evolution.
But how could cultivating evolution be so easy and simple?
They were aware of widely publicized evolutionary paths like the Forest Wolf and the Elf Wolf, but the success rates weren’t particularly high.
More importantly, could these two most common and widespread Forest Wolf Evolvers meet the requirements of the Forest Wolf Troop within the Legion?
Clearly, the answer was no.
So, why had the Forest Wolf Troop changed their minds after initial contact with them? The reason was simple: they had found a stronger Forest Wolf Breeder.
One capable of enabling Forest Wolves to complete their evolution and potentially secure a prominent place in the Legion’s upcoming internal grand competition.
What point was there in even talking about a serious competition with that unknown and mysterious Forest Wolf Breeder? Couldn’t the commander of the Forest Wolf Troop distinguish who was more capable? Obviously, no one was a fool. That was impossible.
So, after this blunt assessment from their teacher, Sun Chaoju and Master Wang, who was beside him, grew even more curious. They both looked at Liu Fuhai.
"Teacher, do you know who that Senior Forest Wolf Breeder is? Is he from our Jianghai Province?"
What kind of Forest Wolf Breeder could it be, and what kind of cultivation techniques would they use to meet the demands of the Forest Wolf Troop? They had even made a decision without any intention of continuing negotiations with us. As Breeders who also specialized in Forest Wolves, we naturally want to learn a thing or two. Even if we can’t learn much, it would be good just to broaden our horizons!
Unfortunately, Vice President Liu shook his head. "The Legion and local authorities cannot interfere with each other’s affairs unless there are special circumstances. Those are the rules."
Seeing the disappointment in his two students’ eyes, Old Liu smiled again and said, "However, when the time comes for the grand Legion competition, I should be among the spectators. I expect their respective Breeders will also be invited. Then, we can all see just who this remarkable person is."
It seemed that was all they could do for now.
Sun Chaoju and Master Wang exchanged looks. The former remarked with some feeling, "Speaking of which, if Su Ping were here, with his Heart of Woods, he’d surely be able to participate in the cooperative cultivation, wouldn’t he?"
The ’Heart of Woods’ skill is incredibly versatile with top-notch effects. It’s evidently indispensable in the cultivation of any Forest Wolf Evolver!

chapters.title: Chapter 115 - 105: All Riddlers Must Die! Xiao Qing’s Breakthrough_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 115: Chapter 105: All Riddlers Must Die! Xiao Qing’s Breakthrough_2
However, Vice President Liu simply shook his head.
It wasn’t just him; even when he visited Qin Erlong these past few days, that old fellow had prattled on at length.
Every word was a complaint about Su Ping:
He didn’t understand a girl’s heart.
He didn’t know to take the initiative as a young man.
It had been so long since he’d called Xiao Xue.
It was a stream of nonsensical blabber, just short of Qin Erlong taking Su Ping by the hand and teaching him how to woo girls.
Clearly, Qin Erlong must have pursued his own wife in the same way back then.
Of course, Qin Erlong did mention some serious matters too.
For instance, Qin Xiaoxue had told him about a Secret Realm about to manifest at Su Ping’s family home, asking him to keep an eye on things if Su Ping requested assistance.
Beyond that, Qin Erlong mostly complained about himself.Google seaʀᴄh ɴoᴠel Fɪre.nᴇt
Why on earth did I have to bring up the Wanmu Wolf’s evolution path? It only delayed the chance for their relationship to advance further!
Vice President Liu deeply disdained Qin Erlong’s attitude—both his frustration that Su Ping wasn’t living up to his romantic expectations and this purely inane chatter from someone with too much time on his hands.
A Breeder like Su Ping, a good kid who sets everything else aside and focuses solely on Pet Beast Cultivation, that’s how he achieved such profound expertise and research capabilities at such a young age!
Vice President Liu glanced at the two before him.
If these two had even half—no, a third—of Su Ping’s research spirit and dedication, they wouldn’t have been dismissed from the Forest Wolf Troop without even making an impression. Damn it, they made me lose face, and now they have the gall to come crying to me? Do they have any shame?
The more he thought about it, the angrier Vice President Liu became. With a wave of his hand, he said, "Get lost already! Instead of wasting time on this rubbish, you’d be better off figuring out how to improve your breeding skills."
After shooing away the two unpromising students, Vice President Liu looked down and saw a message flashing on his phone.
The sender of the message made Vice President Liu pause in surprise.
He had just been discussing the Legion tournament, and now the very protagonist of that event was messaging him.
What in the world is this message about?
Vice President Liu frowned slightly as he read the message on his phone, "Old Liu, congratulations! You sure kept that one quiet! HAHA!"
Congratulations for what? Kept what quiet?
After a moment’s thought, Vice President Liu replied, "What’s up?"
DING-DONG. The reply came quickly.
But it only left Old Liu more confused.
"HAHAHA, I get it! Don’t worry, I won’t tell anyone. It’s not often you get a chance to show off, Old Liu. I definitely won’t spoil your fun!"
Reading Zhao Deguang’s message, Vice President Liu grew even more perplexed.
Get what? Damn it, I don’t even understand what you’re rambling about! Riddlers really deserve to die.
But Old Liu couldn’t be bothered with him. As the Vice President of the Breeder Association—effectively the acting President—he had plenty of official duties each day and wasn’t just sitting in an office idly chatting.
Who has the time to waste gossiping with these old codgers?
「...」
At this point, Old Liu was obviously unaware that Su Ping had already completed the Wanmu Wolf Cultivation and had even begun deploying them.
Of course, one couldn’t blame Su Ping for not informing the Vice President of the Breeder Association, who was still waiting to offer assistance.
He was simply too busy.
Just as he often said, once he entered a busy phase, Su Ping truly would neglect sleep and forget to eat.
Especially with the Heart of Woods project, stimulated by the prospect of making quick money, Su Ping had directly lifted the weekly restriction of accepting only one Heart of Woods Forest Wolf Cultivation slot.
Naturally, the official explanation was that his Cultivation techniques had further matured, allowing for a significant increase in success rates and, consequently, a faster Cultivation speed.
Thus, Su Ping’s days were incredibly full!
Meditation, bonding with the ten Forest Wolves from the Legion, concocting and administering the Heart of Woods Magic Potion for their Cultivation, and combat training!
Indeed, with his mental vision, Su Ping could finally train the Forest Wolves in combat, not just passively have them use Skills.
Su Ping had also gleaned these training methods from Zhang Lie.
Old Sha served as supervisor while Su Ping’s own fifty Forest Wolves were divided into two squads.
Each wolf wore red or blue markers representing their respective teams.
Then, they engaged in stealth and annihilation combat exercises in the forest.
Of course, this "annihilation" wasn’t literally deadly. It would be too great a loss if they died during training without even facing a real enemy. A hit to a button placed on a vital spot, which then emitted a sound, counted as a ’death’.
If one had to describe it, it was somewhat similar to tactical exercises within a Legion.
Thanks to his mental vision, Su Ping could observe the combat maneuvers, spontaneous reactions, and fighting styles of the Forest Wolves he was connected to.
This provided him with opportunities for further adjustments and precise, targeted micro-training.
The only slight drawback is that they are all Forest Wolves, and battling in the woods becomes too monotonous. After a few rounds, the effectiveness diminishes. If I could develop different Species Pet Beasts and conduct mock battles between various species, that would be very promising!
And undoubtedly, the one thing most needed to achieve all this was money!
Therefore, in this recent period, in addition to awakening the Heart of Woods in all of his own remaining twenty-odd Forest Wolves, Su Ping had also successfully cultivated ten *additional* Forest Wolves with the Heart of Woods for clients!
After deducting expenses and taxes, he was left with a whopping sum of just over thirty million!
Then, more than half of this stupendous sum was promptly spent.
Under a contract, a large tract of undeveloped land south of the Lingxi River, along with the barren mountain behind it, would be developed and utilized by Su Ping and the Heart of Wood Cultivation Base for the next one hundred years.
Su Ping didn’t let the remaining funds sit idle either.
Although the money was still far from enough to complete the renovations according to his grand blueprint, he could certainly begin the planning phase.
After all, as the reputation of the Heart of Woods spread and its Cultivation success rate remained high, business was booming—not quite a case of raking in gold daily, but certainly thriving.
However, it was evident that Su Ping had overlooked one thing.
After finishing the day’s training, carrying Xiao Qing, Su Ping returned from the forest and grassland at the back to the reception and residential/experimental area up front.
There, he saw Lao Guan, who looked resentful and noticeably thinner after the past few days.
"Uncle Guan, have the designers left?" Su Ping asked.
Today was the day the specialists in courtyard design and renovation were scheduled to come, since neither Lao Guan nor Su Ping were professionals in that area.
To ensure the space was both practical and aesthetically pleasing, they naturally had to bring in some experts.
Lao Guan nodded without a word, just staring at Su Ping with that same resentful expression.
Su Ping felt somewhat awkward; he understood why.
These past few days, Lao Guan has been much busier than me. It’s no exaggeration to say he’s been rising earlier than a rooster and going to bed later than a dog.
Su Ping quickly said, "Uncle Guan, when is your daughter coming to have her Pet Beast cultivated? We have so many Forest Wolves now, I can easily help her cultivate one."
As expected, at this mention, Lao Guan sighed and said reluctantly, "Xiao Ping, setting other things aside, business is getting better and better. We really need to hire some reception staff, don’t you think? I honestly can’t handle it all by myself!"
Su Ping nodded helplessly, then his eyes suddenly lit up. "Right, what are your daughter’s plans for the future? How about this: let her come and help me out. She’ll get a regular salary, and frankly, I wouldn’t trust just anyone else with the job."
Speaking of which, I did call Li Shu to ask, but that fellow just kept saying he was busy with important matters. I have no idea what he’s actually up to. I couldn’t be bothered to press him. Now that I think about it, we really do need more people for reception.
"This..." Guan Qianshan hesitated.
However, Su Ping, still carrying Xiao Qing, quickly said, "Alright, alright, Uncle Guan, I have important matters to attend to. I’ll leave this with you. If your daughter isn’t sure what to do in the future, just have her join us here!"
Watching Su Ping dart into the medical room, Guan Qianshan shook his head helplessly.
But Su Ping hadn’t been fibbing to Lao Guan.
He genuinely had important things to do.
After several days of meditation, Xiao Qing felt stable and was now eager to try.
The little fellow wanted to attempt a breakthrough to the Elite Level by consuming a Devil’s Willow Leaf!

chapters.title: Chapter 116 - 106: The Onslaught of Xiao Qing! Poison Flower!
chapters.content:
Chapter 116: Chapter 106: The Onslaught of Xiao Qing! Poison Flower!
In some ways, Su Ping was not a qualified Beast Tamer.
Relatively speaking, the amount of energy he invested in his own Soul Contracted Beast was not significant. In fact, on many occasions, the attention he paid to it was less than what he gave to the little Paperman and Old Sha.
However, regardless of the circumstances, a Soul Contracted Beast was the most essential proof of a Beast Tamer’s true strength.
Fortunately, although Xiao Qing would occasionally get jealous and demand Su Ping set aside time each day to spend exclusively with the little one, at other times it was very well-behaved and motivated.
Perhaps in Xiao Qing’s heart, it was precisely because it wasn’t working hard enough and its strength wasn’t strong enough that its master didn’t pay much attention to it.
Therefore, among all the Forest Wolves of the Heart of Woods, Xiao Qing could be considered one of the most diligent.
Facts had proven that with great talent, sufficient effort, and a master providing ’cheats’ on the side, a Pet Beast could do as it pleased. Like now, Su Ping placed Xiao Qing on the Life Detector, took the necessary treatment tools, and Old Sha was ready outside, prepared to use emergency treatment measures at any time.
With the Eye of Truth, Su Ping looked at Xiao Qing before him.
In less than two months, the little one in front of him had transformed from a newly weaned puppy into what it was now:
[Mutated Forest Wolf (Contracted)]
[Attribute: Wood, Poison]
[Current Level: Common Tenth Level]
[Racial Potential: Commander Third Rank]
[Skills: Sunlight Absorption (Proficient), Poison Vine Strangulation (Proficient), Self-Healing (Proficiency), Accelerated Growth (Proficiency), Mutated Poison Wood Heart (Proficiency)]
A mutated wolf pup that hadn’t even advanced to Elite Level had reached Master Level in Vine Strangling and Sunlight Absorption in just a month. The rest of its skills, including the Mutated Poison Wood Heart, were also at Proficiency.
Such a speed of skill improvement could not simply be described as talented.
It was also because of the improvement of its own skills, as well as the presence of the Heart of the Poison Wood, that Su Ping dared to agree to Xiao Qing’s suggestion for a trial after it was proposed.
He obviously understood Xiao Qing’s desire to become stronger.
Once everything was ready, with a determined look in Xiao Qing’s eyes, Su Ping took something out.
It was a very small willow leaf, only the length and thickness of a finger. This willow leaf was pitch black with purple-red vascular patterns on it. At first glance, it looked less like any plant’s leaf and more akin to the fabled horns of a demon from the abyss.
However, upon seeing this, Xiao Qing became suddenly excited.
Objects of the same attribute held a great appeal for Pet Beasts. Therefore, high-level resources that emerged in the wild would often have Pet Beasts guarding them. The Devil’s Willow Leaf appealed to Xiao Qing due to its Poison Attribute and, making it an even better fit, its compatibility with the Heart of the Poison Wood.
But this time, Su Ping was not careless. He put on gloves and a mask, split the Devil’s Willow Leaf in two, and then brought one part to Xiao Qing’s mouth.
The leaf was too small. It was swallowed by Xiao Qing without a sound. However, just three minutes later, a reaction occurred!
Su Ping instinctively stepped back.Tʜe sourcᴇ of thɪs content ɪs NoᴠᴇFɪre.nᴇt
From Xiao Qing’s body, streams of faint, dark green breath spilled out from its nose and mouth.
To Su Ping’s surprise, as this faint mist touched the remaining half of the Devil’s Willow Leaf, it instantly absorbed the rest of the leaf, much like the Heart of Woods would absorb the power of plants.
Clearly, for Xiao Qing, just half of the Devil’s Willow Leaf was not enough! Not nearly enough!
Su Ping held his breath, his gaze unwavering as he watched both the Life Detector and Xiao Qing’s body.
Xiao Qing had fallen into a deep sleep, but on its body, apart from the enveloping mist, there was also a faint glow.
No wonder Poison Type Pet Beasts were said to be the most dangerous, perhaps second to none.
Su Ping now witnessed it firsthand.
Just the act of consuming a resource to attempt a breakthrough was enough for the surrounding mist to teach a lesson to any who thought to take advantage at that moment.
Simultaneously, Su Ping could see on the Life Detector that Xiao Qing’s heartbeat and pulse had suddenly accelerated. Not only that, but all other metrics also showed a significant increase.
The next moment, a low Wolf Howl resounded.
The engulfing mist completely disappeared. At the same time, Su Ping could feel very clearly in his spirit an indescribable sensation of refreshment. It fed back directly to Su Ping from the deepest part of his spirit!
Breakthrough!
Elite Level!
Beast Tamers and Pet Beasts were linked in terms of levels. A Beast Tamer’s level breakthrough would provide feedback to their Pet Beast, and similarly, a Pet Beast’s breakthrough would also provide feedback to the Beast Tamer. This was particularly evident in the early stages.
And naturally, there was a realm-based bond between the two. Generally speaking, as long as they were in the same realm, there wouldn’t be any problem. It was also barely acceptable for a Pet Beast to be slightly higher in realm than the Beast Tamer, as was the case now.
Although, if I were to put Xiao Qing into the Beast Taming Space again, my own Beast Taming Space would feel a sense of swelling. This is even though the Soul Contract is in place, meaning the Pet Beast Home’s talent restrictions naturally don’t apply to Xiao Qing.

chapters.title: Chapter 117 - 106: The Onslaught of Xiao Qing! Poison Flower!_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 117: Chapter 106: The Onslaught of Xiao Qing! Poison Flower!_2
These were some of the side effects when a Pet Beast’s level surpassed that of its Beast Tamer by a whole tier.
Fortunately, Su Ping could also feel that, with the feedback from Xiao Qing’s Soul Contract, his spiritual power had also reached a peak.
Whenever he wished, he could break through that vague barrier and become a true Elite Beast Tamer. This also officially meant becoming qualified to take the Beast Tamer professional certification exam.
Obviously, there was no hurry at the moment.
Su Ping’s spirit rippled, but his gaze remained firmly fixed on Xiao Qing.
The glimmer of the breakthrough disappeared, and the faint poisonous fog retracted into its body.
From start to finish, Xiao Qing, having digested the Devil’s Willow Leaf in less than half an hour, lightly leaped down from the Life Detector.
There was still no significant change. Its body was just slightly taller.
But soon, Su Ping sensed something was off.
After all, Xiao Qing was his Contracted Beast.
He could feel even the slightest change most directly, not to mention that Xiao Qing’s current changes were definitely not minor.
Immediately, the Eye of Truth, which had just been activated, was once again locked onto Xiao Qing before him!
And the changes, vastly different from half an hour ago, also registered in Su Ping’s mind.
[Mutated Forest Wolf (Contracted)]
[Attribute: Wood, Poison]
[Current Level: Elite First Rank]
[Racial Potential: Commander Third Rank]
[Skills: Simplified, Poison Flower (Beginner)]
As for the Level breakthrough, Su Ping did not care.
He did not care that the skill level hadn’t improved. At this moment, all of Su Ping’s attention was firmly locked onto the last skill that had appeared among Xiao Qing’s Skills!
Had Xiao Qing awakened a new Skill with this Level breakthrough?
Even for Mutated Pet Beasts, it was very difficult to comprehend an entirely new Skill beyond those of their original race.
But Xiao Qing had done it.
And obviously, it was an ability derived from its Poison Type mutation!
Su Ping eagerly checked Xiao Qing’s Skill changes:
[Poison Flower (Beginner): A Special Skill formed by combining Poison Type and Wood Element attributes. It can be used independently to create a fragrant aroma with Poison Type effects. It can also be attached to other Wood Element objects, imbuing the corresponding Wood Element abilities with poisonous effects.]
A very simple Skill.
It couldn’t even be considered powerful.
However, it gave Su Ping a strangely familiar feeling.
Poison Flower of the wolf... was his Xiao Qing aiming to further strengthen the ’Tree Realm Descent’ of the Wanmu Wolf?
Nevertheless, Su Ping knew this was just a sense of déjà vu from reading the Skill description.
The Skill itself was meant to enhance Xiao Qing’s own combat capabilities.
He affectionately ruffled the excited Xiao Qing’s head.
"Remarkable!"
Indeed, remarkable. In fact, this wasn’t just a matter of one Skill.
This aligned with what Vice President Liu had taught in his course: Skills are concrete displays and derivatives of a Pet Beast’s capabilities.
And Evolution is the transformation that occurs when a Pet Beast’s proficient abilities reach a peak.
Therefore, many Pet Beasts’ Evolutions could be researched by focusing on their Skills.
For example, the Wanmu Wolf, in essence, was the transformation of the Forest Wolf’s most basic racial skill, Sunlight Absorption, reaching its peak.
Xiao Qing’s comprehension of a new Skill undoubtedly represented a research direction for its Evolution.
Of course, this was truly just a direction, not even a concrete plan yet.
Su Ping shook his head, intending to lead Xiao Qing out, but at that moment, as expected, the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas also provided direct feedback:
[Cultivation of Poison Type mutated bloodline Pet Beasts has improved.]
[Poison Type mutated bloodline Pet Beast promoted to Elite Level, comprehended the Poison Type Skill: Poison Flower. Gained Forest Wolf Experience Points: 300!]
[Further analysis of the reasons for the Poison Type mutation in Forest Wolves has been carried out. Can expend 42,700 Experience Points from this Catalog to forcibly analyze the cause of the Forest Wolf’s Poison Type bloodline mutation and obtain methods for breeding this mutation.]
As expected!
Not only had he gained Experience Points for the Forest Wolf Catalog, but the Experience Points needed for the Poison Type mutation analysis had also decreased considerably.
Although for him, it was still an undoubtedly huge expense, hadn’t he also seen some glimmers of dawn?
Thinking of this, Su Ping glanced at the Forest Wolf Catalog, which had changed its appearance:
[Catalog: Forest Wolf]
[Current Catalog Level: 3 (619/20,000)]
The increase in Experience seemed trivial in the face of the terrifying amount required for leveling up.
Previously, Su Ping hadn’t really considered that after reaching LV3, the amount of Experience needed for further improvement would be so immense.
That was one of the reasons Su Ping planned to focus on illuminating the Catalogs of other Pet Beasts.
A requirement of 20,000 Experience Points, not to mention the Experience he would consume in the process, suggested that leveling up to LV4 wasn’t going to be easy.
After a brief look, Su Ping paid it no more mind. Leading the excited Xiao Qing, he said directly,
"Let’s go test the effects of the new Skill!"
"AWOOO!"
"Old Sha, you come with us too!"
"AWOOO!"
「In the middle of the night.」
Lao Guan yawned, went to the bathroom, and then, out of habit as the gatekeeper, took a stroll around the perimeter.
Although Su Ping had never requested this, Lao Guan, despite his grumbling, actually did much more than required. For instance, after patrolling the area and finding nothing unusual, Lao Guan went to the monitoring room for a final check.
However, Guan Qianshan, who was originally drowsy, was taken aback.
Under the dark night sky, the wooded area before the Heart of Woods was brightly illuminated by searchlights.
The area that should have been quiet was still bustling with activity.
In the video footage from the surveillance cameras, two wolves and one man appeared to have no trace of sleepiness.Thᴇ link to the origɪn of this information rᴇsts ɪn NovᴇlFir(e).nᴇt
In that clearing, they continuously unleashed Skills.
And Su Ping, beside them, was constantly directing them while swiftly jotting down notes in a brand-new notebook.
This was not the first time Lao Guan had seen such a scene.
Especially a few days ago, when the Old Wolf had not yet completed its Evolution, Lao Guan would almost certainly see Su Ping there every time he got up at night.
Over these past few days, Guan Qianshan had welcomed numerous Beast Tamers who came for Cultivation.
Nearly everyone was generous with their praise for Su Ping:
"’A true Genius Breeder!’"
"’He has great potential!’"
"’A bright future ahead!’"
This was all because their Forest Wolves had acquired the Heart of Woods Skill.
At such a young age, with such remarkable breeding proficiency and results, it seemed this young fellow truly deserved such praise.
This was particularly true after they learned the significance of the Wanmu Wolf.
Yet, Guan Qianshan was the only one who could see the hard work Su Ping put in behind his Talent.
Talent plus effort determines the upper limit for a Beast Tamer!
And in this world, that limit is always set by those who possess both Talent and the dedication to work for it.
But here before him was such a person.
So, just where was Su Ping’s limit?
Thinking this, Lao Guan let out a sigh, and even his drowsiness somewhat retreated.
Damn it, what’s with this sudden urge to work overtime!?
However, Lao Guan’s urge to work overtime remained unfulfilled.
This was because, before long, Su Ping noticed Lao Guan was still awake and asked him to cook some late-night snacks. After eating, Su Ping returned to his room under Guan Qianshan’s relieved gaze.
It was good that Su Ping was resting. That way, he could go back to sleep at 2 a.m. without feeling guilty.
However, just as Lao Guan thought Su Ping was finally resting, Su Ping, having finished washing up, lay on his bed and took a deep breath.
An Elite Level breakthrough was nothing major for Xiao Qing.
But for a Beast Tamer, an Elite Level breakthrough was crucial!
It was only after reaching the Elite Level that a Beast Tamer’s Beast Taming Space could be effectively utilized.
And now, he was about to begin his ascension to the Elite Level!

chapters.title: Chapter 118 - 107: Promotion to Elite! Su Ping’s Space Characteristics!
chapters.content:
Chapter 118: Chapter 107: Promotion to Elite! Su Ping’s Space Characteristics!
The Beast Taming Space is one of the primary manifestations of a Beast Tamer’s abilities. For a powerful Beast Tamer, the Beast Taming Space is not merely a portable space for their Pet Beasts; it is also an accumulation of wealth and resources, or even a training ground and medical facility for them. This is due to the Space Characteristics that emerge within the Beast Taming Space after each Realm breakthrough.
However, Su Ping was clearly different from other ordinary Beast Tamers. The Stone of Creation, after merging with his Beast Taming Space, was constantly transforming it. It was merely awaiting Su Ping’s advancement in Realm, his leap to becoming an Elite Level Beast Tamer, to fully awaken the ’Ecological Cycle’ Space Trait. And now, that moment had undoubtedly arrived.
The ripples in the space were inconspicuous within the dark Beast Taming Space. However, Su Ping felt an explosive sensation, as if everything around him was boiling with an excitement so intense it was difficult to contain. The cramped, dark Beast Taming Space seemed to shatter at this moment, as energy infused from his spiritual power ignited its shadowy depths.
An indescribable coolness flowed from his mind, spreading through his limbs and bones. His body, somewhat fatigued from helping Xiao Qing record its newest skill, Poison Flower, felt as if it had been completely rejuvenated.
Evidently, while a Beast Tamer’s primary abilities lay in controlling beasts with spiritual power and the aspects of their Beast Taming Space, each advancement also brought a certain enhancement to their physical body, albeit not a significant one.
Savoring the pleasant comfort, Su Ping refocused his attention on his Beast Taming Space. As his spiritual power surged and erupted, the once-dark Beast Taming Space began to slowly transform. A profound and mysterious power began to emanate, slowly carving out the space from its surroundings. The dark, murky air currents vanished, replaced by a void that was incorporated into the space.
The Stone of Creation, after vanishing for who knew how long, surprisingly re-emerged within Su Ping’s Beast Taming Space. A hazy fluctuation emanated from the Stone of Creation. This fluctuation not only accelerated the Beast Taming Space’s expansion but also transformed it from the size of a small storage room to that of a three-bedroom apartment. And it was still expanding.
Finally, with a sharp cracking sound, as if something had shattered, the Beast Taming Space ceased its expansion. Its area, roughly two hundred square meters with a ceiling dozens of meters high, was enough to fill Su Ping with pleasant surprise.
However, it was clear this wasn’t the end. That cracking sound hadn’t come from the space itself, but from the glowing Stone of Creation. The Stone of Creation completely shattered. But the changes it brought were not yet finished.
Actual earth materialized on the previously void ground. Moreover, this earthen ground was occasionally dotted with specks of vibrant green. Above, in the azure sky, clouds slowly began to appear. Then, to Su Ping’s utter astonishment, the tiny fragments of the shattered Stone of Creation slowly ascended into the sky and coalesced into a miniature sun!
At this moment, Su Ping’s Beast Taming Space, at first glance, seemed indistinguishable from the outside world.
Is this the benefit brought by the Stone of Creation?
Su Ping blinked, a wave of astonishment washing over him with a slight delay.
But no, that’s not right!
What else is there?
With the Stone of Creation, I should have gained the Ecological Cycle Space Trait. But what about the Space Trait I was supposed to awaken after my Level breakthrough?
Su Ping blinked again, and then realization struck him. In the next instant, the details of his Beast Taming Space’s newly awakened Trait appeared in his mind.
The first, undoubtedly, was the Trait bestowed by the Stone of Creation:
[Ecological Cycle: Nature Type Resource Type Trait. Forms a stable ecological cycle system, completely identical to the energy cycle governed by the true natural laws of the outside world. Capable of cultivating plants and raising any creatures or Pet Beasts from the outside world. Spiritual power can be consumed to accelerate growth by creating artificial rainfall and increasing sunlight exposure.]
This Trait, needless to say, was crucial. It allowed many activities to be conducted directly within the Beast Taming Space. It was also the most encompassing Space Trait, useful in virtually any situation. Of course, it would be absurd if a Trait granted by Emperor Level Peak resources wasn’t useful. If it weren’t, Su Ping wouldn’t be constantly plagued by that nightmare of needing to marry into another family for support.
What was truly important, undoubtedly, was the Space Trait he had awakened through his own breakthrough!
However, when his Beast Taming Space instinctively relayed the details of the Trait he had obtained to its master, Su Ping was stunned. Because he sensed a special Space Trait he had never encountered before:
[Space Absorption: Space Element Resource Type Trait. Can absorb the Origin of ownerless Secret Realms, adding corresponding changes and slight enhancements to one’s own Beast Taming Space from the absorbed Origin.]
(Note 1: User must be physically present within the Secret Realm to activate.)
(Note 2: Can only be successfully activated if there are no Pet Beasts within the Secret Realm whose Level exceeds the user’s own.)
(Note 3: The magnitude of the absorption effect is determined by the Level difference between the Secret Realm’s original master and the user.)

chapters.title: Chapter 119 - 107: Promotion to Elite! Su Ping’s Space Characteristics!_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 119: Chapter 107: Promotion to Elite! Su Ping’s Space Characteristics!_2
What did this mean?
Also, why had he awakened a Space Element Space Characteristic when his first Pet Beast was clearly a mutated Poison Type Forest Wolf?
However, this was considered somewhat normal; such cases had occurred before, and not infrequently.
After all, the acquisition of Beast Taming Space Traits, although somewhat related to one’s own Pet Beast, seemed to be mostly random.
What truly made Su Ping curious was the Ability of this Space Characteristic—what exactly did it entail?
Although, being his Space Characteristic Ability, he had an innate understanding of it, its specific effects would only be clear once he used it.
And the method of use was to find an unclaimed Secret Realm.
For others, this Space Characteristic was likely as useless as could be.
After all, it seemed Secret Realms weren’t so easily found.
But for Su Ping, it apparently wasn’t a problem.
Because in his own backyard, there was such a Secret Realm about to emerge.
It was like being handed a pillow just as he was getting sleepy,
Su Ping thought.
After much thought, Su Ping could only attribute this to possessing the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas.
Perhaps the world’s Origin was secretly watching over him?
Shaking his head, Su Ping wasn’t in a hurry to try. It wouldn’t be too late to study this Ability after the little Paperman’s Secret Realm appeared.
For now, he still needed to familiarize himself with his own Beast Taming Space.
Although the Space Absorption Trait he had awakened didn’t assist with cultivation within the space, he was fortunate to have Qin Xiaoxue’s help.
The ecological cycling Ability bestowed by the Stone of Creation was enough for Su Ping to truly experience the joy of cultivation.
And first and foremost was the planting of Plant Type resources!
In an instant, Su Ping thought of something quite suitable:
Smiley Sunflowers!
Even though it was an Ordinary Level resource, sunflower seeds containing Light Power had become one of Old Sha’s favorite snacks after his Evolution was completed.
Unfortunately, while buying a pound or two of these seeds wasn’t overly expensive, that amount was barely a couple of mouthfuls for Old Sha.
After all, while normal people needed to peel sunflower seeds, Old Sha didn’t; he crunched them down, shells and all.
Considering he might have several Wanmu Wolves in the future, supplying them would be a considerable expense. If he could grow the sunflowers himself, it would undoubtedly alleviate some of that financial pressure.
He decided to act immediately!
Su Ping promptly took out his phone, swiftly ordered several large bags of Smiley Sunflower seeds, and carefully read their planting instructions.
Indeed, they turned out to be quite suitable.
Smiley Sunflowers weren’t Plant-based Pet Beasts, but simply Plant Type resources. Moreover, they were extremely easy to grow, not demanding of the planting environment, needing only ample sunlight every day.
His Beast Taming Space perfectly met this condition.
For now, planting Low-level resources will do. Advanced Level resources aren’t so easy to grow.
Moreover, significant results would primarily depend on an increase in the Beast Tamer’s Level.
Su Ping hadn’t considered aiming too high. At this stage, trying to cultivate Advanced Level resources would be a pipe dream.
He let out a long breath. At this moment, not a hint of sleepiness remained; his Spirit was excited to the extreme.
Simultaneously, the fatigue in his body had been dispelled by the recent level-up and breakthrough.
He had never felt so good.Follow current ɴᴏᴠᴇʟs on novᴇl(ꜰ)ire.ɴet
Naturally, any sleepiness had vanished.
He focused inward for a moment. Sure enough, in his soul connection, besides the mind-linked Soul Contract with Xiao Qing, a new empty slot had appeared.
Elite Level Beast Tamer!
From now on, he was an Elite Level Beast Tamer!
Although this was merely the first threshold for professional Beast Tamers, and becoming a truly powerful Beast Tamer was still a distant goal, every journey begins with a single step. For Su Ping, this moment was profoundly significant.
So, Su Ping sat up straight.
He thought for a moment and then went to the side room.
In that room, under the deep night’s moonlight, only the little Paperman was present, practicing its sword draws repeatedly against a wall in the basement’s lightwell.
The little Paperman seemed to know neither loneliness nor monotony.
Previously, Su Anyong had also seen the little Paperman and had offered some opinions and suggestions regarding the Paperman Pet Beast.
Undoubtedly, the Paperman Pet Beast’s potential was far too low.
Even though Su Ping sensed it had a peculiar Racial Skill, and even if it might possess that Racial Skill—Paper Body Joint—it was still merely a Low-level Undead Pet Beast with Ordinary Level Racial Potential.
Its known potential and strength were incredibly weak.
However, Su Ping’s conviction had never wavered in the slightest!
Su Anyong’s words couldn’t influence Su Ping’s choice; the little Paperman was unquestionably his second Pet Beast.
If, initially, Su Ping’s curiosity about the Secret Realm had driven him to want the little Paperman as his Pet Beast to better understand the mysteries of that hidden domain, then later, through continued interaction, Su Ping had become genuinely satisfied with the little Paperman itself.
Its tenacious character truly suited Su Ping’s taste.
As for Racial Potential?
Su Ping had never given it much deep thought.
Is Racial Potential important?! Very important, extremely important!
He had already experienced the significance of a Pet Beast with high Racial Potential.
It could make someone as cautious and prudent as Zhou Shuchen suddenly become arrogant and conceited.
It had also made everyone deeply fearful of Miss Qin after witnessing the Monarch Level Racial Potential of the Life Ancient Tree.
But for Su Ping, it wasn’t that important.
If a Pet Beast could become a High-level, powerful Pet Beast just by eating, sleeping, and practicing casually every day, then what would be the need for Beast Tamers and Breeders? Perhaps some would say that Pet Beasts of strong Races would naturally become even stronger under the Cultivation of a powerful Beast Tamer. But Su Ping always believed that strength based on Level and Realm was only one aspect. That kind of strength could only bully the weaker; only those who attained strength step by step would have the courage to face stronger opponents—and become even stronger themselves!
The impact of the little Paperman’s sword strike against Old Sha, back then, still resonated deeply within Su Ping.
Besides, only this kind of Cultivation could bring a greater sense of achievement!
Thus, he appeared behind the little Paperman and said, "Little guy, how’s your practice going?"
However, just as Su Ping had expected, there was no improvement in the little Paperman’s Realm or skill levels.
It was still at the Ordinary Ninth Rank, with Jinge Technique at Perfection, Accelerated Casting at Beginner, and Paper Body Folding at Beginner.
It seemed no different from when Su Ping had finished its initial Cultivation.
"PIP!" it declared, its voice like dry leaves rustling. "Master, I am... getting stronger!"
The little Paperman sheathed its paper sword and bowed to Su Ping.
Su Ping didn’t correct the little Paperman’s form of address.
After all, at this moment, wasn’t the title ’Master’ rightfully his, in a sense?
So, after the little Paperman’s meticulous bow, Su Ping said, "Little guy, would you like to follow me always? To become my ’core disciple’?"
This time, the little Paperman responded almost instantly, its simple paper face seeming to light up with eagerness. "PIP! I’m willing!"
The little Paperman could feel that the ’Master’ before it was genuinely helping it grow stronger.
Moreover, it had previously seen how that big dog, with Master’s help, had suddenly become so formidable!
Even more formidable than before! It also wanted to become that formidable, to learn more Swordsmanship, and defeat more Experts! To become a true top-tier Swordsman!
Having truly arrived in this wider world, even though it was currently confined here, the little Paperman could sense many powerful auras.
"Good! Get ready! Don’t resist!"
The little Paperman nodded, its simple face showing serene determination as it closed its eyes.
Seeing the little Paperman close its eyes, Su Ping didn’t immediately establish the Soul Contract to make it his second Contracted Beast.
On the contrary, he fell into deep thought.
Because Su Ping had thought of a problem that, for him, was truly very, very difficult.
If he contracted the little Paperman, he couldn’t still call it ’little Paperman,’ right? The little fellow would need a name, wouldn’t it?
Undoubtedly, this was a matter more challenging for him than perfecting a Cultivation Secret Technique!

chapters.title: Chapter 120 - 108: The Second Pet Beast! The Opening of the Secret Realm?
chapters.content:
Chapter 120: Chapter 108: The Second Pet Beast! The Opening of the Secret Realm?
Su Ping thought of the look in his dad, Su Anyong’s, eyes a few days ago, and the sigh-filled words he heard after the name Xiao Qing was mentioned:
"Son, when you fight with Plant Type, Wood Element Beast Tamers in the future, it’s best not to call out the little guy’s name directly to command him; just use the Soul Contract. Otherwise, the opponent’s Pet Beast may not know who you’re calling, because their Pet Beast’s nickname might be the same!"
The reason Su Ping hadn’t missed the old man at all after he left was precisely because of his nagging mouth.
However, what the old man said did make some sense.
The name Xiao Qing was too common. Of course, now it was impossible to change Xiao Qing’s name, so Su Ping had to put more effort into naming his second Pet Beast.
So, as he watched the little Paperman open his eyes in confusion, Su Ping cleared his throat,
"From today onwards, as you have officially become my core disciple, it’s time for me to give you a true name!"
"WAH? (A name?)"
The little Paperman was first slightly stunned, then his eyes suddenly lit up. And I mean literally lit up:
"WAH! (A name!)"
"WAH... WAH? (Oriental... Blizzard?)"
Damn!
A wave of foreboding suddenly surged in Su Ping’s heart.
Throughout history, what name of those swordsmen in TV dramas and movies was ever normal?
And clearly, having such names bestowed upon Pet Beasts would be abnormal too.
If Su Anyong returned and found out not only had he made a Soul Contract with a Paperman, but had named it ’Oriental Blizzard,’ Su Ping could already fully imagine the state and mannerisms his dad would display!
Seemingly imagining some horrifying and terrible scene, Su Ping shivered and hastily shook his head.
"As my official disciple, you should have a two-character name just like me and Xiao Qing!"
He quickly tried to fix the issue.
However, seeing the little Paperman getting excited, Su Ping felt a headache coming on.
"WAH! (Invincible!)"
"WAH! (Flying Goose!)"
"WAH! (Unrivaled!)"
"WAH! (Blizzard!)"
"WAH..."
"Alright!"
Su Ping directly called a stop, interrupting the little Paperman’s obsession with ’Blizzard.’ He then summoned his terrifying Chinese Language Gaokao score of 82 points and began racking his brains as swiftly as possible.
Finally, after much effort, he decided to link his own dream to the young creature before him!
"The seed of the Heart of Woods is Xiao Qing! My small goal for the future is to become a Pet Beast Breeding Base worth a hundred billion! So, I’ll call you Qian Yi then!"
Su Ping was quite proud of himself.
Who says I’m bad at naming? Isn’t this name good? It has a nice meaning too.
In the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, the term ’myriad spirits’ is used. Beneath ’myriad’ is ’thousand,’ and the unit above it is ’billion.’ Combining these two could also be encompassed by this idea.
Also, at first listen, it’s quite catchy. Genius! I am a genius!
Su Ping was very satisfied.
And it seemed the little Paperman was satisfied too:
"WAH! (Qian Yi!)"
"WAH! (Qian Yi!)"
"..."
Watching the little Paperman repeating his new name, Su Ping nodded in satisfaction. Thankfully, it seemed the Paperman’s tastes were quite in line with his!
But as they communicated telepathically, Su Ping suddenly furrowed his brow after listening for a while.
Huh? It didn’t seem to be what he had in mind!
"WAH! WAH! (Qian Yi! One in a Thousand! I am the mighty swordsman who is one in a thousand!)"
Su Ping looked at the little Paperman, who had apparently excitedly accepted the name, in confusion.
Huh? Is this the name I wanted to give? Is this it?
But seeing the little Paperman so happy it couldn’t find north, Su Ping nodded.New ɴᴏᴠᴇʟ ᴄhapters are published on No(ᴠ)ᴇlFire.nᴇt
Yes! This was it! Qian Yi! That was the name he had chosen for the little Paperman!
Facing the little Paperman Qian Yi’s excited and admiring gaze, Su Ping finally said, a little after the fact,
"Alright, get ready, don’t resist!"
Qian Yi: (๑-◡-๑)
This time, Su Ping no longer hesitated. He slowly connected his soul to the little Paperman Qian Yi before him. That familiar sensation enveloped both him and the Paperman once again.
It wasn’t a connection of blood, but rather one of souls intertwined. Like a bridge opening to traffic, it completely interlinked him with the little Paperman.
This sensation made Su Ping’s soul feel as though it had suddenly gained a burden-bearing strength.
Though the little Paperman’s power was weak and its Realm was low, such a fresh force’s arrival still allowed Su Ping’s recently broken-through spiritual power to advance a small step forward.
Although the effect of this step wasn’t major, there was still some distance to reaching the Elite Level, Second Rank.
After breaking through to the Elite Level, Su Ping clearly felt that while the power feedback from upgrading Pet Beasts didn’t change, the difficulty of his own promotions increased.
However, this might be the case for Su Ping the Beast Tamer. But for the little Paperman Qian Yi, it was like directly consuming an unimaginably miraculous elixir. Upon the Soul Contract with Su Ping, it felt an immense amount of power feedback.
This power allowed the little Paperman, already at its Peak, to change its aura immediately. Its Level finally broke through, reaching the Common Tenth Level!
This was also, generally speaking, the theoretical race limit for the Paperman, an Undead Pet Beast.
"WAH!"
Little Paperman Qian Yi opened his eyes in excitement. His choice had clearly not been wrong.

chapters.title: Chapter 121 - 108: The Second Pet Beast! The Opening of the Secret Realm?_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 121: Chapter 108: The Second Pet Beast! The Opening of the Secret Realm?_2
The master before its eyes could help it become stronger. Sure enough, having just successfully become its disciple, its strength had once again improved.
The little Paperman was eager to try. Only by working hard constantly could it live up to its master’s trust and help!
If Su Ping weren’t still there, the little Paperman would have already planned to continue practicing drawing its sword ten thousand times and thrusting ten thousand times, using the methods taught by its master.
However, quite obviously, the little Paperman’s wish to continue working hard was unfulfilled because Su Ping, unable to sleep, had brought it to the place where they first met—the banks of the Lingxi River. He lay there on the lawn formed by Wolf Tobacco.
Come to think of it, Wolf Tobacco had no particular smell before it was processed and burned.
Even so, it had a stronger Life Force than common grass. Even though it was clearly autumn, it still grew extremely dense and lush.
The little Paperman, Qian Yi, didn’t know why its master had brought it here.
In fact, Su Ping just had nothing better to do.
He wanted to understand the little Paperman better and still had many questions about that Secret Realm, so he had simply picked a random place.
Previously, the little Paperman hadn’t hidden anything from Su Ping.
However, the little Paperman’s intelligence and its innate ability for Telepathic Communication were still relatively rudimentary.
For many specific questions, Su Ping could not get a definite answer.
Now, with the Soul Contract connecting them, Su Ping felt he could further question the little Paperman about the Secret Realm.
So, he thought for a moment and asked, "Qian Yi, in your home, have you seen any companions like yourself?"
This was a question Qian Yi previously couldn’t answer accurately.
Even when using nods for yes and shakes of the head for no, the little Paperman’s behavior of nodding and shaking its head simultaneously had confused Su Ping.
But this time, with the effect of the soul connection, Su Ping finally understood the little Paperman’s complex message:
"EEEP! (Yes... but they are not the same as Qian Yi!)"
Huh?
Clearly, such an answer was enough to prove that there were other beings in this Secret Realm. However, Qian Yi’s meaning was also quite clear: although there were Pet Beasts in the Secret Realm, they were not Papermen like itself.
Undoubtedly, this sparked even greater curiosity in Su Ping.
Although he hadn’t bought any real Papermen for a thorough study during this time, he had used the fragmented spare moments—time others might spend browsing short videos—to search and read a considerable amount of data.
This data was even downloaded from the Breeder Association.
He also understood.
Papermen were a very special Undead Race, like Skeleton Soldiers; if they didn’t evolve, individuals were very weak.
A Paperman, let alone surviving, even its birth was very peculiar.
However, considering the Sword Soul Mark on the little Paperman and its Perfect Level Jinge Technique, Su Ping felt that this peculiarity seemed tolerable.
So, Su Ping didn’t rush to ask again about the situation in the Secret Realm. Instead, he thought for a moment, but couldn’t resist his curiosity and asked Qian Yi directly, "Qian Yi, can you use the Sword Soul Mark skill?!"
The little Paperman tilted its head slightly, then looked at Su Ping in surprise.
The next second, a ripple in space appeared, and the little Paperman vanished without a trace.
Clearly, it had returned directly to that Mysterious Realm Space.
"Huh?" Su Ping was also stunned.
Was the Sword Soul Mark simply a portal back to the Secret Realm?
Come to think of it, when the little Paperman first mastered this spatial doorway, Su Ping had thought he’d encountered a rare spatial-Attribute Pet Beast.
But it seemed that wasn’t the case after all.
But really, did this skill only have this one effect?
Space rippled again, and the next second, the little Paperman reappeared beside Su Ping.
So, Su Ping thought for a moment. "Qian Yi, try infusing your Energy into this Sword Soul Mark again."
The little Paperman didn’t understand what he meant, but it seemed it really hadn’t tried it before.
For the little Paperman, this Sword Soul Mark seemed to be an instinctual ability, like eating and drinking for a normal person. Although it did consume some stamina, it was essentially negligible.
And what would happen if one used all their might—the kind used for suckling—on an instinctual action like eating or drinking?
Obviously, no one in their right mind would likely try such a thing.
However, under its master’s command, the little Paperman meticulously chose to execute it!
But this time, a scene Su Ping had never witnessed before slowly unfolded before his eyes!
At that moment, Qian Yi, who had previously only differed in outward appearance from ordinary Papermen, slowly began to manifest a faint shadow on its body.
This shadow was nothing other than a sword!
It appeared on the little Paperman’s body, behind it, like a strange cross disproportionate to its size.
The next moment, Su Ping’s breath caught in his throat.
From the void, it felt as if something in the great unknown had responded. If he had to make a comparison, it was somewhat similar to when he advanced to the Elite Level and his Beast Taming Space awakened its Space Characteristics.
It just wasn’t as dramatic.
Under the call of this sword shadow, right there on the bank of the Lingxi River, it was as if water from another dimension had spilled into this space. A ripple spread out, and then, right before Su Ping’s stunned eyes, a portal large enough for one person to pass through appeared.
Had the gate to the Secret Realm opened?!
...
「Linzhou City Center.」
High up in an Advanced Level apartment building, within a dark room, a pair of eyes snapped open, illuminating the pitch-black space like a beacon.
The next moment, the lights came on. Dong Muyun’s beautiful eyes furrowed. Then, with a thought, a silver light gleamed.
"CHIRP CHIRP!"
The Soaring Fish’s calls and movements startled Dong Muyun from her meditation.
"What’s wrong?"
Dong Muyun’s brows knitted slightly.
Through their Soul Contract, she already sensed the reason for the Soaring Fish’s agitation.
"The spatial marker you left has had a huge reaction?!"
Ever since completely falling out with Su Ping and realizing she had no way of dealing with that young troublemaker, Dong Muyun had not returned to Yuntian Resort.
As the chairman of Tianyun Group, Dong Muyun was hardly idle.
She had decided that out of sight was out of mind.
But unexpectedly, she still couldn’t escape it.
Feeling the Soaring Fish’s agitation, Dong Muyun eventually couldn’t hold back.
Although her negotiations with that brat had collapsed, and even if she didn’t have exploration rights, surely just taking a look wouldn’t hurt?
Damn it. A few years back, its Soaring Fish had a breakthrough and mastered the Special Skill ’Spatial Perception.’ While passing by a suburban area, it unexpectedly detected a peculiar reaction from the Heart of Woods. From this, she realized the space here was fragile and an unknown Secret Realm might descend.
Then, she began to make preparations.
Years went by, and not only did she come up empty-handed, but she also attracted a load of trouble.
However, no matter what, this was a Secret Realm she had been curious about and anticipating for years.
If she didn’t see what kind of Secret Realm it was, what lay within, which historical Beast Tamer powerhouse might have left it, and what type of Pet Beasts predominated there, Dong Muyun knew she would truly not be content.
So, without a second thought, she calmed the frantically chirping Soaring Fish, then put on a pair of gold-rimmed glasses and said in a low voice, "Yunning, switch to flight mode!"
"Master, you are currently in Linzhou City Center and not in a combat state. There are sky surveillance devices in the city center. Unauthorized flight without a permit will result in being photographed and fined. Are you sure you wish to enter flight mode?"
The mechanical voice did not faze Dong Muyun.
Although the influence and privileges of the prominent families and Beast Tamer clans had greatly diminished since that person took power, she could still handle such a minor issue.
"Confirm!"
Instantly, what looked like liquid metal flowed from the pendant around Dong Muyun’s neck, covering her.
It formed an extremely compact suit of battle armor. Then, from the window of the apartment, a hundred meters high, she leaped out.Follow current novels on ɴo(v)elFɪre.ɴet

chapters.title: Chapter 122 - 109: Cooperation? The Sword Secret Realm! Qin Erlong’s Shock!
chapters.content:
Chapter 122: Chapter 109: Cooperation? The Sword Secret Realm! Qin Erlong’s Shock!
Su Ping stared at the Secret Realm vortex before him, stunned for perhaps a third of a second before striding toward it, stopping just half a meter away.
Of course, he did not enter recklessly but instead sized up the spatial portal.
Was this the Secret Realm that someone like Dong Muyun had been fixated on all this time?
However, before he could react, a faint voice emanated from it:
"Beast Tamers may enter the Sword Secret Realm. Those who find the Sword Soul Mark within the Sword Tomb may receive the Sword Inheritance! Entrants must not be stronger than Commander Level. Those above will be suppressed to Commander Level strength while inside."
The voice wasn’t loud, but it was extremely clear!
Sword Inheritance? The Sword Secret Realm... isn’t this the Necromancy Series Secret Realm I had in mind?
Su Ping blinked.
And most importantly, the Sword Soul Mark...
Su Ping looked at the little paperman beside him, who still maintained its pose, but the ethereal sword-shaped shadow on its body had disappeared.
Abruptly, Su Ping seemed to sense something. With a thought, the little paperman’s body was taken into his Beast Taming Space.
The next moment, a figure appeared beside him, descending from the sky accompanied by jets of flame!
She wore mechanical armor that clung to her curvaceous body like liquid mercury.The most update n0vels are published on NovᴇlFir(e).nᴇt
The headpiece of the armor revealed Dong Muyun’s face, her long hair flowing.
Su Ping breathed a sigh of relief. Even though the little paperman had been recalled into the Beast Taming Space, the gate to the Secret Realm still remained.
Clearly, as long as the Sword Soul Mark was activated, the gate to this Secret Realm would open.
Dong Muyun’s gaze was firmly fixed on the sight before her, an irrepressible excitement gleaming in her beautiful eyes.
It’s finally opened!
After waiting for so many years, even making so many preparations, the gate to the Secret Realm has finally opened!
Dong Muyun took a deep breath, almost wanting to enter it right then, but then she saw Su Ping’s unfriendly glare blocking her path.
"Ms. Dong, I hope you’ll conduct yourself with propriety. This is my house; you’re currently trespassing on private property."
Dong Muyun suppressed the impulse to have Yunning split this brat in two, took another deep breath, and said,
"Su Ping, I truly mean no harm. You should know that with your current strength, developing this Secret Realm will be a difficult and lengthy task. Why not collaborate? We can quickly develop this Secret Realm together, and your growth and advancement could be much faster!"
Dong Muyun had a point. Su Ping pretended to ponder for a moment, then nodded.
Previously, Su Ping would have preferred to collaborate with the Beast Master Association, or even seek out that so-called official Qintian Monitor. He would absolutely not have been willing to cooperate with these capitalists.
But now, knowing what this Secret Realm was really all about, he agreed to Dong Muyun’s proposal almost instantly.
This is an inheritance-type Secret Realm!
It’s a Secret Realm left by ancient Beast Tamers to pass on their legacy and recruit disciples!
And the key to unlocking this inheritance was the little paperman, Qian Yi!
So, besides this Sword Inheritance, what other truly valuable treasures could there be in this so-called Sword Tomb?
Obviously, even if there were any, they wouldn’t be the most precious ones.
So, through this so-called cooperation, I could definitely use these seemingly trivial things to get some benefits from Dong Muyun!
Thus, Su Ping pretended to think for a moment and said,
"What kind of cooperation do you have in mind?"
"I only need twenty-four hours of exploration time! After twenty-four hours, I will definitely leave. As for what I find, you can decide on the split, or you can name any resources you want as compensation—it’s all negotiable!"
Su Ping’s eyes lit up:
"Anything at all?!"
An irrepressible joy flashed in Dong Muyun’s eyes.
A Beast Taming Space expands over time after its master’s death, but twenty-four hours would be enough for me to plunder a Secret Realm thoroughly!
This kid actually agreed!
So, Boss Dong, with a grand and decisive wave of her hand, declared:
"Anything at all!"
"One Spirit Saint Level or Legendary Level Pet Beast cub, and three Spiritual Level Resources. Is that possible?"
Watching this seemingly philanthropic goddess before him, Su Ping blinked with innocent eyes.
And then, the goddess transformed into a harpy:
"Possible? In your dreams..."
Dong Muyun forcefully swallowed the expletive that had nearly slipped out and stared firmly at Su Ping:
"Items like those are nowhere near the value of a Secret Realm! Don’t even mention that I don’t have them; even if I did, I wouldn’t trade them. After all, we still don’t even know what this Secret Realm is really like!
How about this: the Yuntian Resort was built specifically for this Secret Realm. After I’m done exploring, I’ll transfer everything to you—including the equipment, personnel, and facilities. I’ll hand it all over to you, lock, stock, and barrel!"
Su Ping was actually somewhat tempted:
"It’s still not enough!"
Dong Muyun sighed. "Then what else do you want?"
Su Ping narrowed his eyes, his gaze sweeping up and down Dong Muyun’s shapely figure.
Dong Muyun involuntarily took a step back, looking at this brat with a mixture of alarm and shock.
He dares to set his sights on me?
But the next second, she realized she had misunderstood.
"Ms. Dong, that Mechanical Pet Beast of yours is truly amazing."
"Alright!" Dong Muyun nodded.
"Besides Yun Tian, I’ll give you one Mechanical Core. That should be enough, right?"
"Ten!"
Su Ping immediately shot for the stars!
"Impossible! Mechanical Cores are strategic resources, and their value isn’t comparable to those constructs made from failed Mechanical Core awakenings! Two. That’s my bottom line!"

chapters.title: Chapter 123 - 109: Cooperation? The Sword Secret Realm! Qin Erlong’s Shock!_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 123: Chapter 109: Cooperation? The Sword Secret Realm! Qin Erlong’s Shock!_2
It turned out that a capitalist’s proclaimed bottom line wasn’t necessarily worth more than a prostitute’s pretense of virtue.
After a round of haggling that left Su Ping parched, they finally settled on four Mechanical Cores!
Both sides felt they had profited. Dong Muyun finally couldn’t hold back.
After haggling for over half an hour, can I finally go in and investigate?
However, just as she was about to step forward, the Secret Realm’s vortex, which had been present all along, gradually dissipated into nothingness.
"What’s going on?"
Su Ping glanced at the little Paperman in his Beast Taming Space, who had fainted from energy depletion, and touched his nose somewhat awkwardly. "Could it be because the space is still unstable and cannot maintain a fixed existence?"
Dong Muyun nodded. "That’s possible. But since the gate to the Secret Realm has already appeared, it should only be a matter of a few days. Perfect, come to Yun Tian tomorrow and sign the contract."
Without a signed contract, Dong Muyun truly worried that this cunning young man might resort to other tricks.
Fortunately, Su Ping thought the same.
He had even considered things more thoroughly than she had.
「The next morning, Su Ping waited at his own doorstep.」
He was respectfully demure, like a young bride meeting her in-laws for the first time.
In fact, in a certain sense, it was indeed quite similar.
Su Ping didn’t have to wait too long.
Soon after, an ordinary car stopped at the entrance of the Heart of Wood Cultivation Base.
And a figure he hadn’t seen in a long time emerged from it.
"President Qin!" Su Ping bowed respectfully.
Yes, the person before him was none other than Qin Erlong, President of the Jianghai Province Beast Master Association.
Qin Erlong smiled warmly and nodded. "Xiao Xue mentioned it to me before, and I’ve been waiting for news from you. This is good timing; I also want to see exactly what this new Secret Realm is like."
For ordinary people, the appearance of a Secret Realm was a rare event, but for Qin Erlong, it clearly wasn’t an uncommon occurrence.
"Thank you for your concern, President Qin. It’s mainly regarding the Tianyun Group. Without an elder overseeing things, I wouldn’t feel at ease..."
"Don’t worry. With me here, no one can force you to do anything. However, I didn’t expect you to choose to cooperate with Tianyun."
Qin Erlong smiled and said, "Alright, aren’t you going to sign the contract with that young lady from the Dong Family? Let’s go."
Su Ping smiled and then proceeded with Qin Erlong into Yun Tian. With Dong Muyun’s instructions, they naturally encountered no obstacles and arrived at her office.
Dong Muyun had been waiting there. Seeing Su Ping finally arrive, she began, "You’re finally here. I..."
Her words caught in her throat. Seeing the smiling Qin Erlong behind Su Ping, her expression suddenly became incredibly complicated!
Qin Erlong smiled faintly. "Little Su was uneasy, so he asked me to come and take a look. Young lady Dong, you don’t mind, do you?"
Dong Muyun quickly put on a radiant smile. "Of course not! It’s my honor to see you, Elder Qin. Please, have a seat."
She glanced aside at Su Ping, her eyes filled with a hint of resentment.
Was this necessary? It was just signing a contract; was it really that serious? I did consider having my lawyer tinker with the contract, but did he really need to bring *him* to supervise?
But obviously, what could she say at this moment?
She shot a look at her lawyer, then personally took the teapot and poured a cup of tea for Qin Erlong.
"Elder Qin, this is the Flaming Heart Tea my father recently acquired. It has a robust flavor. Please try it."
Qin Erlong took a sip and nodded. "Not bad. How has Dong Lingtian been recently?"
"Thanks to your good wishes, Father is in good health."
Su Ping watched, and seeing that Dong Muyun had no intention of pouring him any, he simply picked up the teapot and poured himself a cup.
Under Dong Muyun’s unfriendly gaze, he also took a sip. "Indeed, it’s good tea."
Qin Erlong, unconcerned, chuckled. "I’ve heard about Little Su’s situation. The emergence of a Secret Realm in Linzhou is a good thing! Little Su’s conditions aren’t excessive. This is a mutually beneficial arrangement for you both."
"Yes!"
In fact, despite Dong Muyun’s firm stance the previous day, Su Ping’s asking price, as Qin Erlong said, was not unreasonable.
They exchanged pleasantries, and an entire morning passed before the lawyer returned with two copies of the contract.
Su Ping didn’t rush to read it but handed it directly to Qin Erlong. The latter scanned it briefly and then nodded.
Once the contracts were signed and names written, Su Ping and Dong Muyun both let out a simultaneous sigh of relief.
Only after copies were printed and retained by each party was the matter truly settled.
Su Ping was also extremely excited.
Mechanical Cores! His father’s ultra-shadow and the Breeder Association’s compression machine were both results of failed awakenings with Mechanical Cores! Yet, their value was already unimaginably high. And now, I’ve managed to swindle four Intelligent Cores just like that?
Dong Muyun was also quite satisfied.
No matter what, a huge weight had been lifted from her heart.
Looking at Su Ping, he no longer seemed so detestable. She immediately said with a smile, "A pleasure doing business with you. It’s lunchtime, Elder Qin, Su, would you like to stay for a meal?"
Clearly, Dong Muyun was just being polite, but to her surprise, both Su Ping and Qin Erlong nodded. "That would be nice."
At the dinner table, after everything was settled, Dong Muyun finally dared to start making some pointed remarks. "Student Su, you’re so handsome and exceptionally talented. You must have had many girls interested in you during your school days, right? I wonder if you’ve ever had a girlfriend?"
Su Ping glanced at this meddling woman.
Setting aside the fact that my relationship with Qin Xiaoxue is innocent, even if there were something, what could your few words possibly do? Besides, is this even trying to cause trouble? This is clearly divine assistance to prevent me, Su Ping, from marrying into their family!
So, Su Ping nodded and said, "I have!"
He really has?
Dong Muyun was stunned.
This kid actually dared to admit it!
She immediately grew excited and looked towards Qin Erlong.
To her slight surprise, Qin Erlong wasn’t angry at all. Instead, he smiled and nodded. "Not bad. Experiencing some relationships when young helps one mature and take things more seriously later on. Like me, back in the day..."
Huh? What the hell? It can be like that?
Dong Muyun nearly choked on a mouthful of rice she had just swallowed. She hurriedly took two sips of water and said awkwardly under the surprised gazes of Qin Erlong and Su Ping, "Sorry, something went down the wrong way..."
However, just as she said this, Dong Muyun’s expression suddenly changed. It wasn’t just her; Qin Erlong, beside her, also raised an eyebrow.
"What’s wrong?" Su Ping asked, noticing the change in their expressions.
Qin Erlong smiled slightly, a look of interest on his face. "Your family’s Secret Realm—it’s appeared again!"
Hmm?
Su Ping instinctively glanced at the little Paperman in his Beast Taming Space.
The little Paperman is still there, and it hasn’t fully recovered from last night’s energy depletion yet!
But Su Ping quickly realized!
This time, it wasn’t summoned by the little Paperman; the gate to this Secret Realm had truly formed on its own.
Instantly, the three of them wasted no more time, soaring into the air and arriving at the familiar bank of the Lingxi River.
Sure enough, a spatial vortex was slowly materializing on the bank of the stream.
Dong Muyun, looking at this spatial vortex, almost without a second thought, stepped inside.
The contract was signed; her right to explore was a matter of course.
Su Ping, on the other hand, hesitated slightly.
Ultimately, he made up his mind!
At the same time, Qin Erlong turned his head, frowning slightly. "Little Su, this Secret Realm has restrictions. At my Level, I can no longer force my way in. Otherwise, the Secret Realm might fracture. If you want to enter, be mentally prepared."
Su Ping nodded. After a word with Qin Erlong, he quickly ran towards his front yard.
Qin Erlong was somewhat puzzled, but then, thinking about the situation at Su Ping’s home, he nodded in understanding.
Exploring a Secret Realm wasn’t like a Pet Beast battle in an arena; naturally, one could use non-Contracted Beasts.
It must be that Commander Level Old Forest Wolf I saw when I visited last time, right?
Sure enough, Qin Erlong didn’t have to wait long.
Su Ping returned, but this time, there were three figures behind him.
Qin Erlong didn’t quite register it at first.
He immediately spotted the two Commander Level Forest Wolves!
Is this kid’s family background so substantial? Two Commander Level Forest Wolves that have broken through their race limit?

However, soon, Qin Erlong’s pupils suddenly constricted. He looked behind Su Ping in disbelief.
A figure that, at first glance, resembled a Kylin, appeared before his eyes.
What kind of Pet Beast is that?

chapters.title: Chapter 124 - 110: Entering the Secret Realm! First Battle with the Wanmu Wolf!
chapters.content:
Chapter 124: Chapter 110: Entering the Secret Realm! First Battle with the Wanmu Wolf!
