As Dong Muyun spoke, a gleam of irrepressible excitement burst forth from the depths of Su Ping’s eyes, his gaze filled with eagerness.
Dong Muyun cast a slightly resentful glance at this unromantic young brat.
And here I went to the trouble of preparing all this so thoughtfully,
she mused.
However, perhaps it’s precisely because of such focused determination that he has been able to progress so far in Pet Beast Cultivation?
Su Ping, of course, was oblivious to Dong Muyun’s thoughts at that moment; his entire attention was on the two documents in front of him.
The Forest Wolf and the Elf Wolf.
These two were currently the most popular Evolutionary Bodies of the Forest Wolf on the market.
Especially the Forest Wolf. It was a direct Evolution of the Forest Wolf that further strengthened its Abilities. Although the improvement wasn’t substantial, it was at least officially recognized as having evolved.
As the most popular Evolutionary Body, its acquisition wasn’t particularly difficult.
Some Beast Tamers specializing in Forest Wolves were exceptionally adept at mastering it, including ones like Sun Chaoju.
However, while they had mastered it, they couldn’t reveal it to just anyone.
Their Cultivation methods were mostly acquired through exchanges for Points within the Breeder Association.
And the number of Points required was not small.
I was planning to take out some research results, submit them to the Breeder Association to exchange for a large number of Points, and then get these two Evolutionary Bodies,
Su Ping had been thinking.
Yes, I did consider exchanging for them,
Su Ping affirmed to himself.
Although the Wanmu Wolf is truly excellent, far exceeding my expectations, the Forest Wolf and Elf Wolf, as standard popular Evolutionary Bodies, definitely have their merits,
he considered.
Moreover, my goal is to strengthen in two directions: the wolf pack and the Wood Element.
Within the wolf pack, I can’t just have the Wanmu Wolf as the only Evolutionary Body; a diverse wolf pack would have a mutually enhancing effect.
And for the Wood Element, using the ’Forest Torrent’ battlefield strategy could greatly improve the combat capability of Plant-type Pet Beasts within it.
I naturally want to capitalize on my advantages,
Su Ping thought.
However, I haven’t decided which Plant-type Pet Beasts to focus on cultivating in the future, and there’s no rush for now.
For now, the Luozisong (Pine) seems pretty good.
Still, I’m not very familiar with Plant-type Pet Beasts. When I have time, I can visit the Pet Beast market and the Breeder Association to look around properly and see if there are any suitable ones to bring home and try raising,
he mused.
And now, the Cultivation and Evolution methods for the Forest Wolf and Elf Wolf had just been given to Su Ping by Dong Muyun.
Su Ping paid no mind to the fact that he was still in Dong Muyun’s office.
He hurriedly opened the documents and looked at the contents:
"The Forest Wolf is the basic Evolutionary Body of the Forest Wolf, the longest-existing Evolutionary Body of the Forest Wolf, and it is also the first choice for optimizing the Forest Wolf Race!"

chapters.title: Chapter 148 - 119: Racial Degeneration? Cultivation of Forest Wolf and Elf Wolf!_4
chapters.content:
Chapter 148: Chapter 119: Racial Degeneration? Cultivation of Forest Wolf and Elf Wolf!_4
Species optimization?
Su Ping slightly narrowed his eyes.
He had come across this term before while studying the educational materials from the Breeder Association.
However, this was essentially not closely related to the work of Beast Tamers and Breeders; it was a change that occurred over a long period.
I wonder how many years ago—perhaps a few hundred or even thousands—today’s Forest Wolves were not so numerous! Instead, there was a Pet Beast called the Wood Wolf. It was a very basic Wood Element Wolf Pet, possessing only the Racial Potential of an ordinary peak species, making it a considerably Low-level Pet Beast. And the Forest Wolf was actually an Evolutionary Body of the Wood Wolf! Of course, this also seemed somewhat discernible from their names. So, the Forest Wolf was the species optimization after the initial Evolution of the Wood Wolf. After the Wood Wolf evolved into the Forest Wolf, the progeny born from Forest Wolves were new Forest Wolves.
Of course, in ancient times, such probabilities might have been lower because a generation of evolved Forest Wolves had a greater chance of producing Wood Wolves with relatively better aptitude. Only when the evolutionary bloodline was more concentrated was there a chance for the direct birth of Forest Wolf offspring. Therefore, even in modern society, offspring produced by Forest Wolves occasionally show atavism, reverting from Forest Wolves to Wood Wolves. This is the most compelling evidence supporting this deduction.
The Forest Wolf, as a further Evolutionary Body of the Forest Wolf, with its relatively simple and unadorned Evolution and its widespread appeal—it’s possible similar situations might occur in the future. This could lead to Forest Wolves breeding among themselves to produce new Forest Wolves, causing the original Forest Wolves to become increasingly scarce. This is called species optimization. It’s a likely occurrence with the passage of time.
However, this suddenly gave Su Ping some ideas.
Those inherently powerful Pet Beasts, Pet Beasts with a high race limit, like the so-called Life Ancient Tree—could it be that long ago, they too were other Low-Level Pets that evolved and then underwent lengthy species optimization to become what they are now? So, could it be that some initial atavistic, degenerated forms of powerful races have actually disappeared over the long expanse of time? The history recorded in the civilization of Beast Tamers, even for the oldest Dragon Nation, doesn’t reach tens of thousands of years. Yet, the time that Living Beings have existed on Blue Star is an unimaginably vast number. It could easily be in the hundreds of millions of years.
If...
Thinking this, Su Ping blinked, his interest genuinely piqued.
If there were a way to cause powerful Pet Beasts to degenerate to their basic race, and from that foundation, either allow them to breed anew or explore other research angles to unearth different evolutionary branches... wouldn’t this mean one could develop even more, perhaps unprecedented, species of Pet Beasts and entirely new Evolutionary Bodies?
The answer to this is almost certainly affirmative. Some ancient Pet Beasts, in their Evolution over countless eons, were influenced by the environment, underwent subtle and gradual Evolution, or experienced survival of the fittest. However, Evolution driven by the environment can only be said to be best suited for survival in that specific environment, not necessarily the strongest or most laden with potential!
Take the Forest Wolf as an example. After a Forest Wolf evolves into a Forest Wolf, it naturally still has a chance to evolve into the Wanmu Wolf. However, it has absolutely no chance of transforming into an Elf Wolf of the same level, because their race limit is the same: Commander-Level Peak.
So, for the Elf Wolf, whose Evolution focuses mainly on the Life Series and partial Elementalization—even though its direct combat strength might be less than the Forest Wolf’s, can one say its potential and utility are lower?
No! In fact, because of its Life Series healing abilities, the Elf Wolf could be even more useful. However, compared to the Forest Wolf, the Elf Wolf has a higher difficulty in Evolution. Furthermore, its primary abilities lie in life-healing, making its survival and overall combat effectiveness in the wild inferior to the Forest Wolf. Therefore, it is not adapted to the survival environment of Pet Beasts in the wild.
Su Ping believed that the examples of the Forest Wolf and the Elf Wolf were definitely not unique. In those distant Ancient Times, throughout the long history of Pet Beast development, there were undoubtedly many similar weak Pet Beasts that completed their Evolution under the natural laws of survival of the fittest.
It remains the eternal maxim and truth of the Breeder world:
The weaker the Pet Beast, the more infinite its potential. The lower the tier of the Pet Beast, the more diverse its Evolution!
There are no truly useless Pet Beasts, only Breeders who have yet to unearth their potential.
So, if one wants to take this as a subject and study these possibly existent degenerated ancient species—brand new, ancient Pet Beast basic juveniles unrecorded in history—then degeneration is, paradoxically, what needs to be researched. But how can a Pet Beast’s degeneration be achieved? Especially for those incredibly powerful Pet Beasts of Advanced Level Racial Potential. Thinking about it, this research direction seems quite extravagant, doesn’t it?
Someone like me, not rushing to think about Evolution, but instead pondering troublesome degeneration—I’m probably the first, huh?
Su Ping couldn’t help but smile wryly.
However, at this moment, he had clearly forgotten that there was another person in the office.
Dong Muyun looked at the youngster before her with a peculiar expression.
Has this brat already forgotten there’s another person here? He’s been staring at the first page of that document for nearly half a Xiaoshi now. What on earth is he thinking about? And now he’s making such an unsightly smile. Don’t tell me my good intentions backfired?
Undoubtedly, from ancient times to the present, the methods by which powerful, long-standing Families maintained their continuity—just like in the world Su Ping had transmigrated from—were all the same: investment, recruitment, and marriage alliances.
And Su Ping was undoubtedly a talent most worthy of investment and recruitment.
Thus, Dong Muyun coughed lightly.
Only then did Su Ping look at her.
"What are you thinking about? Have you had some other insight?"
"Um..."
It had to be said, now that the investment was formalized, Dong Muyun was essentially an ally. Su Ping indeed felt considerably more at ease around her and didn’t conceal anything, sharing his recent thoughts with her in full. Her background was considerable; perhaps she had some understanding in this area. Or perhaps she knew some Secret Technique for degeneration unknown to others.
Unfortunately, Su Ping was clearly overthinking. In this world, Breeders who studied Evolution were a dime a dozen. But those who researched degeneration were exceedingly rare. Even if there were some, it was very difficult to produce any results.
So, Dong Muyun listened to Su Ping’s far-fetched ideas. He had extrapolated so much from just the four words ’species optimization’ and the relationship between the Forest Wolf and Elf Wolf species. He had even proposed such a bold direction—one that sounded utterly preposterous at first, but upon careful consideration, actually seemed remarkably plausible. For a moment, Dong Muyun herself became somewhat bewildered.
Is this the thought process of a Genius Breeder? The Low-level form of a Pet Beast with Advanced Level Racial Potential before species optimization. After degeneration, explore and develop new unknown Evolutionary Bodies from other directions? Is this something that a Beast Tamer like you, merely Elite Level and a recent adult graduate, should be contemplating?
However, she had to admit, in this regard, Dong Muyun was thoroughly impressed.
Then she became flustered and could only stammer, "Uh... I... I really don’t know..."
She couldn’t deny Su Ping’s ideas, yet she was also unable to provide any advice or help.
So Dong Muyun, who had originally wanted to further close the distance with this brat, could only choose to change the subject very awkwardly, "Anyway, I’ll go check out what’s happening in the Lingxi River!"
Su Ping also came back to his senses.
The matter of species optimization, as well as Evolution and degeneration, was naturally just a topic and direction worthy of research. However, for the current Su Ping, the difficulty was still too great.
Thinking this, and since it concerned his own territory, Su Ping didn’t remain idle. He nodded and said, "I’ll go with you to take a look!"
Su Ping also wanted to see what exactly was causing harm in the area near his territory.

chapters.title: Chapter 149 - 120: Rainbow Coral! The Most Special Aquatic Pet Beast?
chapters.content:
Chapter 149: Chapter 120: Rainbow Coral! The Most Special Aquatic Pet Beast?
Arriving at the spot pointed out by Guan Lili and the others, Su Ping once again looked over this part of the Lingxi River.
Then, under Su Ping’s envious gaze, Dong Muyun said softly, "Yunning!"
Instantly, Dong Muyun extended her hand, and a mechanical voice came from the watch on her wrist, "Master, awaiting your commands!"
"Switch to single underwater combat form and detach for remote control!"
"Yes, Master!"
The mechanical voice replied. Then, with a faint electronic whirring sound, the watch detached from Dong Muyun’s wrist.
The next moment, a specially-shaped individual robot appeared and, with a PLOP, jumped into the water.
Dong Muyun, meanwhile, leisurely took out a tablet. After a few taps, the live underwater feed from Yunning appeared on its screen.
The deep underwater world appeared pitch-black. Fortunately, Yunning was equipped with an extremely powerful searchlight that illuminated everything in its beam.
Su Ping had never imagined that the Lingxi River connected to his home would be so deep.
As Yunning dove deeper, Su Ping could clearly see it had already descended more than thirty meters.
The surging undercurrents and the pitch-black underwater environment made Su Ping feel a sense of unfamiliarity and terror.
However, even more terrifying than the environment itself was what had now appeared before their eyes!
Su Ping had never, ever considered that the Lingxi River, so close to his home, would be teeming with such a vast number of aquatic Pet Beasts!
Yes, as Yunning continued its descent and finally reached the pitch-black riverbed, the surroundings were revealed to be filled with what could only be described as dense swarms of aquatic Pet Beasts!
Spiny Scaled Fish, Glint Fish, Rose Poison Stingray, Dual-Horned Tiger Fish, Ghostly Tuna...
Many aquatic Pet Beasts were identified by Su Ping in just this short time.
And these were only the ones he recognized; there were many more he didn’t.
The highest Level among them had even reached Commander Level.
This was effectively the apex for common aquatic Pet Beasts found inland.
But both Su Ping and Dong Muyun sensed that something was amiss.
The reason was simple: there were just too many of them!
Even though the Lingxi River wasn’t far from West Dragon Lake, the occasional passage of a few Pet Beasts would have been normal. But how many were there now?
A rough estimate suggested there were definitely more than a hundred, without a doubt.
Keep in mind, these were Ranked Pet Beasts!
Moreover, this was only in the area Yunning had explored, a section of water merely thirty to fifty meters deep.
Seeing this, Su Ping broke out in a cold sweat.
During the past month or so, he had played more than once with the little Paperman on the banks of the Lingxi River.
Although it was some distance from this spot, it wasn’t that far.
And while most aquatic Pet Beasts don’t leave the water, higher-Level ones could still fight on land.
If any of the Commander Level Pet Beasts they had just seen had appeared on the bank back then...
Su Ping didn’t dare to complete the thought.
Fortunately, they had discovered it now.
Dong Muyun, however, showed no surprise. Instead, a hint of excitement glinted in her eyes.
Such a bizarre scene definitely had a reason behind it!
Usually, even in the Pet Beast World, the principle of ’big fish eat small fish, and small fish eat shrimp’ applies.
Therefore, these Commander Level fish would not normally coexist in the same area with lower-Level ones. Otherwise, the latter would have already been devoured.
But now, while it couldn’t be called peaceful coexistence, at least no such rampant slaughter was occurring.
However, Yunning’s powerful searchlight did attract attacks from many fish.
Of course, for Yunning, which had reached Monarch Level, this was no threat. Several Low-level, less intelligent fish were lured in by the intense light and quickly dispatched by Yunning.
The higher-Level ones, seeing the newcomer’s ferocity, immediately turned and fled without a second thought.
Instantly, a clear zone formed in the chaotic underwater depths.
"Yunning, continue exploring ahead. Let’s see what’s really going on down here!"
Yunning, in its underwater robot form, moved swiftly forward, propelled by its arms and the mechanical fins on its body.
Finally, after it swam about another three hundred meters, a glimmer of light appeared at the edge of the searchlight’s beam, seeming to reflect it.
It was a splendidly colorful light.
The moment it appeared and interacted with the searchlight, it created an indescribable rainbow-like shimmer in the pitch-black water.
"What is this..." Dong Muyun murmured, then quickly instructed, "Yunning, keep moving forward."
The rapid current had no effect on the distant rainbow light. This time, even when illuminated by the searchlight, the schools of fish around the light showed no startled reaction, as if they hadn’t noticed anything at all.
They continued to circle that Rainbow Light, their swaying movements showing complete enthrallment with the object at the center!
Yunning loyally fulfilled Dong Muyun’s command. Carrying the searchlight, it moved slowly through the water, finally approaching within ten meters of the light’s source.
Simultaneously, the source of the light became clear through the relatively clear water.
It was located within a crevice in the riverbed, where an undercurrent flowed.
It was an incredibly large coral!
Easily over ten meters across, it was nestled in this crevice on the riverbed.
The coral glowed with a fluorescent light, beautiful and mysterious.
It wasn’t just the fish that saw it underwater with their own eyes; even Su Ping and Dong Muyun, observing from Yunning’s perspective onshore, couldn’t help but show looks of fascination.
This thing was too beautiful!
From any angle, it emanated a colorful, misty glow.
Combined with the schools of fish also illuminated in these brilliant colors as they circled the coral, the scene resembled a true underwater paradise.
But clearly, this thing was anything but paradise.
In fact, its essence wasn’t that of an incredibly precious resource at all. It was a Pet Beast!
Staring at it, Dong Muyun finally asked uncertainly, "Rainbow Coral?"
Her voice held an indescribable mixture of joy and shock.
Su Ping looked at her. He was still too young, and even with his current achievements, it was impossible for him to recognize all Pet Beasts.
This was especially true for aquatic Pet Beasts, which were incredibly numerous, with many still unknown.
Undoubtedly, the one before them was such a case!
"What is a Rainbow Coral?"
Pleased at this rare instance of the usually knowledgeable young man’s ignorance, Dong Muyun explained excitedly while watching the footage, "It’s one of the most special and precious aquatic Pet Beasts. Nominally, it’s a Water Element Pet Beast, but it’s a unique type combining Insect and Elemental characteristics. Its Racial Potential is extremely low, and it completely lacks combat abilities, yet it is extremely valuable!"
"Oh? Why is that?" Su Ping asked, his curiosity piqued.
In the Pet Beast World, there were countless magical Pet Beasts with all sorts of astounding abilities. Not all could be measured simply by combat power. And quite evidently, this Rainbow Coral was one such exception.
Because Dong Muyun had already begun to explain its purpose.
"The Rainbow Coral Worm is a very special kind of Pet Beast," she continued. "They possess no combat capabilities and can hardly even move without external forces. However, no Water Element Beast Tamer can resist the allure of the Rainbow Coral Worm! This is because the Rainbow Coral Worm creates such a Rainbow Light around itself, attracting schools of Pet Beast Fish. Furthermore, water touched by this Rainbow Light can effectively nourish aquatic Pet Beasts! This allows the fish to thrive without needing to consume large quantities of food. Moreover, rumors say that aquatic fish-type Pet Beasts spending extended periods near the Rainbow Light not only experience faster Level growth than usual but also have a chance to comprehend the Special Skill ’Rainbow Aurora.’"
Su Ping blinked, looking once more at the massive coral, easily over ten meters in size.
The Pet Beast World was indeed full of wonders. There really were such special Pet Beasts?
At the same time, a burning desire surged in Su Ping’s heart.
However, what Su Ping didn’t expect was that there was even more.
Dong Muyun paused, then continued, "Additionally, the beautiful Rainbow Coral formed by the worm’s secretions is also an excellent material for Water Element Pet Beasts. If the Tianyun Group could obtain a Rainbow Coral Worm for Crescent Island, then its endeavors there would become smoother by an unimaginable factor!"
Su Ping narrowed his eyes slightly. "Is this thing really that rare?"
"Extremely rare!" Dong Muyun affirmed. "There are three reasons. First, the attracted fish schools can sometimes bring in powerful aquatic Pet Beasts. These Pet Beasts are very domineering. If the Rainbow Light cannot satisfy their hunger, they will directly consume the Rainbow Coral. Even a slight bump could cause its death.
"Second, unlike other coral worms, while the outer coral structure appears large, there is actually only one Rainbow Coral Worm inside. They are mostly solitary creatures.
"Third, and most importantly, is their method of reproduction. Generally, a Rainbow Coral Worm only reproduces asexually when the previous generation dies. Most of the time, it lays only a single egg, with an infinitesimal chance of producing two. However, despite the protection of the outer Rainbow Coral, any mishap can cause the fragile eggs or newly born Rainbow Coral larvae to die. Furthermore, the coral worm’s growth cycle is very short, with a lifespan typically only three to five years."
Dong Muyun recited these facts as if enumerating treasured heirlooms.
It was apparent that her earlier decision to send Lao Guan to Crescent Island for aquatic Pet Beast Cultivation was no joke; the Tianyun Group was indeed seriously pursuing this direction.
Naturally, they had thoroughly researched such a rare Pet Beast.
She didn’t notice, however, that Su Ping’s eyes were now shining as he gazed at the Rainbow Coral Worm in the footage.
If he could get this Rainbow Coral Worm into his artificial lake, wouldn’t the Heart of Woods have a new industry?

chapters.title: Chapter 150 - 121: Resource Production? A New Industry! The Terrifying Cost of Breeding! (Alliance Leader Bonus)
chapters.content:
Chapter 150: Chapter 121: Resource Production? A New Industry! The Terrifying Cost of Breeding! (Alliance Leader Bonus)
It’s capable of producing resources: Rainbow Coral.
Although the rank of these coral polyps isn’t high, considering how rare this thing is, the value of this resource must be around Commander Level, right?
It can attract schools of aquatic Pet Beasts. So, if I connect the artificial lake with the Lingxi River and take some measures, I just need to prevent large and powerful Pet Beasts from arriving.
Then, I could set up a paid fishing activity on this artificial lake. That wouldn’t be excessive, would it?
Of course, fishing is fishing. However, the fish you catch aren’t necessarily yours to keep. After all, these Rainbow Corals attract schools of aquatic Pet Beasts.
Are these ordinary fish?
At most, whoever catches them can sell them back to me at a fraction of the market price. HEY!
A single venture could earn double the money! And what’s most important, this business very likely wouldn’t require any initial investment!
Su Ping had been thinking earlier. Although buying Pet Beasts for the botanical garden, the Undead basement, and the Forest Wolf packs required money, it was nothing compared to the cost of purchasing aquatic Pet Beasts for the artificial lake.
Who would have thought that the Pet Beast business could be run without any initial investment?
Even with the Beast Tamer Legions present, there wouldn’t be too many Pet Beasts coming in and out of the connection point between the Lingxi River and West Dragon Lake.
But that’s relative to the entirety of Jianghai Province and the Lingxi River, which flows through both Jianghai and Huaiyang Provinces.
In fact, as one of the main waterways leading to the sea, how many aquatic Pet Beasts pass through the Lingxi River daily?
It’s impossible to calculate!
And now, if I have this, do I still need to buy aquatic Pet Beasts to raise?
That would be an utter luxury.
Once these coral polyps are placed, to the passing schools of fish, it’s an irresistible lure, like Tang Monk’s flesh.
Su Ping’s gaze was clearly too intense.
Dong Muyun finally snapped out of her excitement. When she noticed Su Ping’s fervent gaze, her eyelids twitched.
"Su Ping, you shouldn’t need this, right? Isn’t Heart of Woods mainly focused on the Forest Wolf cultivation industry?"
Su Ping chuckled,
"To be honest, I’ve already bought all the land behind Yun Tian, including the banks of the Lingxi River and that deserted mountain five kilometers away. I was planning to dig an artificial lake on the land behind Yun Tian that connects to the Lingxi River. Otherwise, why would I have cleared out the aquatic Pet Beasts near the Lingxi River that might harbor aggressive intentions?"
Dong Muyun pursed her lips,
"The problem is, I discovered this Rainbow Coral, and Yunning is still down there..."
Su Ping shifted his gaze from the Rainbow Coral—seen through Yunning’s perspective—back to Dong Muyun and blinked.
"But, as I just said, I’ve bought all the land deeds for this area. According to Article Nine of the Dragon Nation’s Land Protection Law..."
"..."
Dong Muyun clenched her fists, wishing she could punch this smug brat who was so easily rattling off the land protection law.
It’s the land deeds again! Always the land deeds!
Previously, with the Secret Realm, she was constrained by this brat because of those damned land deeds, and now it’s happening again because of this blasted land deed!
I hate real estate!
Should Tianyun Group transition into real estate? Who knows, there might be some incredible treasure on that plot of land!
No, that can’t be right. If that were the case, the world would be full of lucky people.
It’s purely this brat’s ridiculously good luck.
Dong Muyun took a slow, deep breath.
"How about this: you’ve always wanted a Mechanical Core, right? Tianyun Group will offer two billion, plus a Mechanical Core, in trade. That should be sufficient, shouldn’t it?"
However, Su Ping shook his head again.
"Your cultivation base is only so big. Even if you manage to build an artificial lake, getting it to a few kilometers in diameter would be a feat. Using this Rainbow Coral on it would be an extravagant waste, wouldn’t it?!"
Dong Muyun was exasperated.
The area behind Yun Tian was only a few kilometers from the Lingxi River at most.
Under such circumstances, even if Su Ping wanted to build an artificial lake, how large could it possibly be?
Su Ping didn’t even blink,
"I’ve changed my mind. I’ve decided to expand the artificial lake’s scale. I’ll directly connect the area behind Yuntian Resort to the Lingxi River and then extend it southward. It will form a large, Taiji-shaped artificial lake with the Lingxi River as the dividing line. I conservatively estimate its diameter to be about twenty kilometers."
Dong Muyun was out of options.
She sighed helplessly. Seeing Dong Muyun looking defeated and ready to give up, Su Ping quickly said,
"Look, we’re in the same boat now. Besides, you hold shares in Heart of Woods; nominally, you’re the second-largest shareholder after my family! If Heart of Woods becomes powerful, wouldn’t that be much better than Tianyun Group? You’re the chairperson of Tianyun Group, but it’s not entirely yours, is it? Your Dong Family has so many brothers and sisters. What if someone else takes over? Wouldn’t all your efforts just be paving the way for someone else?"
Su Ping had laid it all out.
Dong Muyun, however, just glared at this brat who was gloating after getting his way.
It was true that she personally held only five percent of Tianyun Group’s shares. However, her father’s and brother’s shares, totaling twenty percent, were managed by her.
Aside from her grandfather, who had relinquished his authority, she was the Dong Family’s largest shareholder in Tianyun Group. She was the actual person in charge, second only to her grandfather, the highest authority.

chapters.title: Chapter 151 - 121: Resource Production? A New Industry! The Terrifying Cost of Breeding! (Alliance Leader Bonus)_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 151: Chapter 121: Resource Production? A New Industry! The Terrifying Cost of Breeding! (Alliance Leader Bonus)_2
She was even the acting chairman now.
"Could it be that Tianyun Group’s twenty percent shareholding is worth less than one percent of Heart of Woods?"
Still, it had to be said that Su Ping’s words indeed made Dong Muyun feel a lot more comfortable.
Dong Muyun hummed lightly, but still said,
"Since that’s the case, do you know how to raise this thing? How to bring out its most appropriate effects?"
Su Ping’s eyes lit up, and he quickly flattered,
"I don’t know, please teach me, sister!"
Su Ping wasn’t an all-rounder; he couldn’t possibly know everything about business models and the breeding of various Pet Beasts.
Let alone the fact that he had never even heard of the Rainbow Coral Worm before.
"TSK TSK, now you know to call me sister. But it’s a pity, I, your sister who only knows money and profits, am afraid I’m not as good as the younger and prettier Miss Qin."
Su Ping touched his nose somewhat awkwardly.
Fortunately, Dong Muyun didn’t tease him any further and directly said,
"To raise the Rainbow Coral Worm, you need to prepare Star Algae, which is its favorite food. Secondly, to be able to approach the Rainbow Coral Worm in the water at any time, and simultaneously prevent passing schools of fish from harming it, you need to isolate it."
"Isolate?"
Su Ping frowned slightly.
If it were isolated, how could the schools of fish use the Rainbow Water tainted by the glow of the Rainbow Coral Worm? How could they comprehend the so-called Rainbow Aurora under its light? How could the halo of the Rainbow Coral Worm continue to attract schools of fish?
From Dong Muyun’s description, Su Ping had never considered making this precious little creature a Pet Beast.
After all, a Pet Beast that at best lived a few years—you know, when a Pet Beast reached its lifespan, if you tried to artificially prolong its life, that would consume the Beast Tamer’s own Origin.
Although the Rainbow Coral Worm was precious, it was purely a Resource Type Pet Beast and not suitable as a battle-type Contracted Beast.
At least in the short term, Su Ping had no such thoughts. Since that was the case, if the Rainbow Coral Worm can’t provide resources when isolated, what was the point?
But fortunately, Dong Muyun wasn’t the type to play coy and directly explained with a smile,
"That’s right. It’s just that the materials for isolation are different. You need a special material from the Water Elemental Series: Water Element Barrier!"
Su Ping slapped his forehead.
He had been silly. How could he apply the physical knowledge of his previous world to measure things in this magical world?
The Water Element Barrier, a special Elemental Type material, is a water-based barrier that can block most solids but does not hinder the flow of water.
It is a special material sometimes used in Water Element Pet Beast venues.
However, Su Ping had never encountered it before, so he quickly flashed a flattering smile again and looked towards Dong Muyun.
She also laughed. On those cheeks, as charming and delicate as roses, every smile she wore couldn’t help but make one feel a twinge of fear.
And sure enough, as soon as Dong Muyun opened her mouth, Su Ping felt what cataclysm meant.
"Tianyun Group sells it! A square meter is only priced at five hundred thousand! Tianyun Group can customize the desired shape, space, and size for customers. They also assist with installation, regular maintenance, and repairs, including warranty after damage."
Su Ping’s vision darkened.
Five hundred thousand didn’t sound like much.
But that was the price for just one square meter!
Not to mention, the Rainbow Coral Worm itself, along with the connected coral, was already over ten meters wide. You couldn’t really leave it with no space, right?
In that case, how would it continue to secrete Rainbow Coral?
This was a resource and material!
It was the only resource material that Heart of Woods could foreseeably produce on its own!
So, if they went by what Dong Muyun said, disregarding other factors, just in terms of length and width, one side of the enclosure would need to be twenty meters.
The four sides of a square enclosure together would mean eighty square meters of barrier material if it were one meter high.
Therefore, not considering height, surrounding the Rainbow Coral with a one-meter-high Water Element Barrier would require a whopping forty million!
But how could one not consider the height issue?
The secreted coral needed to attach itself to soil or rocks to coexist.
So, stacking this Water Element Barrier from the bottom of the lake upwards—if their artificial lake was ten meters deep, they’d multiply the forty million base amount by ten, which amounted to a whopping four hundred million!
Four hundred million!
And that was just for ten meters of height.
In fact, if they really calculated according to the depth of that artificial lake, with Lingxi River at the center—that is, where the Rainbow Coral Worm was right now—the height of the Water Element Barrier needed from the Lingxi River down to the riverbed would be nearly one hundred meters...
Four billion?
Su Ping only felt darkness before his eyes.
Dong Muyun had clearly foreseen this scenario and was watching Su Ping with a smile.
Su Ping said with a sheepish smile, "That..."
"This is already the discounted price! As you know, there’s a reason why Tianyun Group’s products are expensive. If you buy this kind of material from somewhere else, they won’t take care of it after installation, you know! If an accident happens later on and the Water Element Barrier has a breach, Tianyun Group offers a twenty-year warranty with free replacement!"
Indeed, once Dong Muyun put it that way, it did seem like there was good reason for it to be expensive.
It’s just, what’s with that damn woman’s tone?
Su Ping clenched his fists!
Money is the courage of heroes, gold is the backbone of men! Indeed, a man must not be without money.
Therefore, Su Ping thought for a moment and asked,
"They say beneath a man’s knees lies gold. Can I use the gold beneath my knees to offset the cost?"
Dong Muyun smiled and said,
"I have no use for that. And besides, what if Miss Qin tries to fight me to the death over it? However, there is something you could use to offset the price!"
"Oh?"
Su Ping’s eyes lit up.
"For instance, further shares of Heart of Woods!"
The smiling Dong Muyun at this moment seemed like a fox incessantly wagging its tail.
Unfortunately, Su Ping didn’t take the bait, watching the woman warily.
"No way! Just a symbolic one percent is fine!"
One percent of the shares was what Su Ping used to form a certain alliance with this woman. If it went any further, it would be different, and he naturally refused without hesitation.
Even if he could recover it, Su Ping didn’t want to take that risk any further.
Dong Muyun didn’t seem disappointed and just shrugged her shoulders.
"Well, then there’s nothing we can do!"
Su Ping sighed, somewhat worried.
Money, oh money. Why is it that despite having the skill to slay dragons and earning money at a rate far beyond any other Breeder’s imagination, the money was becoming increasingly harder to hold onto, and the damn holes just kept getting bigger?
Dong Muyun was not in a hurry either.
She watched with a smile as Su Ping racked his brains, trying to figure out ways to get money.
However, clearly, while Dong Muyun was not in a hurry, something at that moment was.
「Below Lingxi River.」
Yunning, having transformed into an underwater robot, scratched its smooth, bald head with arms controlled by its awakened mechanical intelligence. Its mechanical eyes, emitting the light of searchlights, showed a hint of bewilderment.
What is Master doing? It’s still soaking in the water. At this moment, Yunning, as a mechanical life form, also felt that everything around it was dark and lonely.

chapters.title: Chapter 152 - 122: Su Ping’s Ten-Day Diary, the Second Wanmu Wolf!
chapters.content:
Chapter 152: Chapter 122: Su Ping’s Ten-Day Diary, the Second Wanmu Wolf!
Ten days passed in the blink of an eye.
During this period, almost every day, the entire Heart of Woods was undergoing earth-shattering changes.
On the first day, designers and architects were hired to discuss and mark out the area of the backyard connecting to the Lingxi River.
On the second day, the architect in charge summoned Earth-type Pet Beasts: the Plowing Ox and the Gravel Bee. These two Pet Beasts were tasked with tilling the ground and paving a path.
Behind the Forest Wolf Forest, extensive Wolf Tobacco grasslands bordering the Lingxi River were cleared and converted into arable land. Of course, Su Ping still retained a portion for future research on Wolf Tobacco.
Su Ping designated this area to build his laboratory. Because it was situated behind the Forest Wolf Forest and not far from the Lingxi River, this spot was the most remote, quiet, and safest.
On the third and fourth days, the road connecting the Heart of Woods to Yuntian Resort was paved, and the necessary land preparation was completed. Simultaneously, teams of Mountain Mover Apes began the excavation!
The cost for the two construction crews, plus design fees, was approximately fifteen million.
On the fifth day, materials for the thirty-million-cost protective fence were purchased, and installation began. The fence started from the Forest Wolf Forest within the Heart of Woods and extended to encompass the entire area north of the Lingxi River, including the vast expanse Su Ping planned for his artificial lake.
This was a very special material that could not only withstand attacks from powerful Pet Beasts but also emitted a specific scent that discouraged Pet Beasts from voluntarily approaching the fence.
Luckily, the thirty-million cost also included installation fees.
Indeed, these products were from the Tianyun Group.
On the sixth and seventh days, the Mountain Mover Apes continued digging the artificial lake. Underwater, certain seagrass plants were planted, and rocks beneficial to aquatic Pet Beasts were also placed. This part didn’t cost much—less than ten million—leaving a significant amount remaining.
On the eighth day, the excavation of the artificial lake on the north bank of the Lingxi River was completed. If desired, it could be connected to the Lingxi River at any time to draw water. Simultaneously, professional landscape artists were again invited to provide some aesthetic landscaping around the artificial lake, which Su Ping had named ’Heart Lake.’
On the tenth day, the fence installation was completed. The Heart of Woods purchased several internal sightseeing cars for one million, and a professional bridge builder was called to the bank of the Lingxi River, beside Heart Lake, to survey for bridge construction.
They spent an entire day on research and discussion.
A construction plan was developed for a bridge spanning the Lingxi River at a point over two hundred meters wide. The total cost for materials and labor was estimated at over twenty million.
In fact, normally, it wouldn’t require such an expenditure.
However, Su Ping opted for the most robust materials and special construction techniques, incorporating filters on both sides of the bridge.
Once connected to his artificial lake, these filters would prevent larger aquatic Pet Beasts from entering Heart Lake from the Lingxi River, ensuring maximum safety.
Thus, of the one hundred million Dong Muyun had invested, more than half was spent on the construction of the Heart of Woods in just ten days.
And the spending wasn’t over yet.
Once the connection to the Lingxi River was established, the expenses for the wilderness botanical garden on the other side, and for other areas Su Ping had yet to plan, would be enormous.
Paving roads and erecting fences alone, not to mention other things, would incur an exorbitant cost.
During these ten days, Su Ping rarely left his residence, except to occasionally supervise construction. He spent the rest of his time at the Heart of Woods, attending to his own affairs.
In these same ten days, the experiences Su Ping gained and the tasks he undertook were, much like the transformations at the Heart of Woods, immensely significant!
Su Ping recorded these changes in his Breeder’s diary almost every day:
The first day:
’October 1st, clear. Continued with the cultivation of the ten Legion Forest Wolves.’
’Went to the Linzhou Center and purchased a large quantity of Soul-Settling Paper, Undead Crystals, and bought another eleven Papermen. Started their rearing and feeding. It cost me over five million.’
’Ah, what a fulfilling day! It’s just a pity I’ve been too busy these past few days and have somewhat neglected meditation; the enhancement of my spiritual power hasn’t been very noticeable.’
The second day:
’October 2nd, clear. Among the twenty-two Papermen, one Paperman’s Paper Body Folding skill reached the Proficient Level. Its folding speed is faster, and perhaps it can also perform more complex transformations?’
’All ten Forest Wolves of the Beast Tamer Legion completed their Photosynthesis cultivation.’
’And among these ten Forest Wolves, the Wood Heart Skill of four of them reached the Proficient Level! Although the remaining six didn’t improve their skill level, one could see a significant leap in their skill proficiency!’
’Indeed, the evolutionary steps of the Wanmu Wolf significantly accelerated the improvement of the Wood Heart Skill.’
’Oops, I forgot about my meditation again. Oh well, I’ll deal with it tomorrow.’
The third day:
’October 3rd, clear turning to cloudy with a north wind. I received good news this morning: little Paperman Qian Yi’s Paper Body Folding also reached the Proficient Level, and along with it, seven other Papermen did the same.’

chapters.title: Chapter 153 - 122: Su Ping’s Ten-Day Diary, the Second Wanmu Wolf!_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 153: Chapter 122: Su Ping’s Ten-Day Diary, the Second Wanmu Wolf!_2
At the same time, I flipped through the cultivation methods for the Forest Wolf and the Elf Wolf. Heh, I didn’t expect to have an accidental discovery; it’s just a pity that it requires (erased) a bit too much. And there’s no need for that at the moment.
But the Forest Wolf is one thing; the Elf Wolf is really interesting. It gradually abandons the body of the Forest Wolf, turning towards a semi-elementalized wolf form. It’s a shame I don’t know if there is a corresponding Evolutionary Body for the Elf Wolf. Has it completed the transition from an animal-type Pet Beast to an Elemental Type?
As expected, no Evolutionary Body is simple; my journey is still long.
Unfortunately, searching for the Evolution of the Elf Wolf wasted too much time, and it seems like I won’t have time for meditation today.
Day Four:
October 4th, overcast. Such annoying weather.
So today, after briefly taking care of the Forest Wolf’s cultivation, I went to the basement’s Paperman area where the sky can’t be seen.
To try out how many Paper Swords Qian Yi could control at the same time, I tested it with him for quite a while. I even let Xiao Qing and Qian Yi try sparring against each other for the first time. The result was actually a draw?
Clearly, neither Xiao Qing nor Qian Yi were in good spirits. Xiao Qing, because it’s at Elite Level, yet failed to defeat an Ordinary Level Pet Beast.
And Qian Yi was annoyed because, despite having so many Paper Swords and its Jinge Technique having reached Perfection, it still ended up in a tie.
However, what was consistent was that although both little guys were upset, they both became more diligent. Indeed, appropriate internal competition is a good thing.
It’s just that I’m out of time for meditation again.
Su Ping, oh Su Ping, you can’t neglect your own meditation while cultivating Pet Beasts!
Day Five:
October 5th, cloudy. Is it going to rain?
One of the Papermen’s Paper Body Joint Skill reached Proficient Level. However, no obvious changes have been noticed. Obviously, this has not yet satisfied the basic requirements for Evolution, whether it’s the Skills or its own Level.
Fortunately, over these past few days, all the Papermen have advanced from First Rank to Second Rank after consuming Soul-Settling Paper and a large number of Undead Crystals.
That woman Dong Muyun came again. Doesn’t she have anything better to do?
She insisted on having a couple of drinks with me, drunkenly blabbering about the difficulties of large families, conspiracies, and such. I don’t understand. Can it really be harder than for those impoverished families who can’t even afford Pet Beasts?
So, after all the nonsense this woman spouted, all I wanted to do was go back and meditate.
Day Six:
October 6th, light rain. I really hope this damn weather will end soon. Praise the Sun!
Today’s cultivation endeavor showed breakthrough progress!
Among the ten Legion Evolutionary Body Forest Wolves I’m cultivating, Xiao Qiang—whose Sunlight Absorption Skill was only at Proficient Level—had its Photosynthesis also rise to Proficient Level, nurtured by Smile-Faced Sunflower seeds and sunlight spring water!
Due to this damn weather, this progress is much slower than it was with Old Sha, but thankfully, I have finally completed one.
The Forest Wolf has met the minimum requirements for Evolution into Wanmu Wolf and has entered the third stage of the Wanmu Wolf cultivation process, beginning to store Energy in preparation for Evolution.
I want to see just how much potential difference there is between a Forest Wolf evolved with Proficient Level Sunlight Absorption and one with Perfection Level.
Good timing. I should also apply for some more resources from the Legion!
I wonder if there are materials for a Water Elemental Barrier in the Legion’s storages. I really want to get up close with the Rainbow Coral Worm. Because there’s a reason I can’t write in this diary.
Turns out they really do! After talking to Commander Zhang about the new materials and the cultivation progress, I exchanged some Battle Merit Points for a Water Elemental Barrier. It’s just a pity that there’s again no time for meditation.
Day Seven:
October 7th, partly cloudy. The sun has come out. That’s nice.
All the Papermen have reached Proficient Level in both Paper Body Folding and Paper Body Joint, but only the little Paperman Qian Yi’s Mutation Paper Body Control Skill remains at Entry Level. This is truly frustrating.
At the same time, two of the Legion’s Forest Wolves with Sunlight Absorption at Master Level—’Dull Head’ and ’Dull Brain’—have reached the required Photosynthesis Level and started to store Energy alongside them.
The Legion is really fast! I made the call yesterday, and they’ve already delivered today!
The Water Elemental Barrier is fascinating. It can be touched by hand and even picked up as if it’s transparent glass. But when you pour water on it, the water goes straight through. What kind of physical Rule is this? What kind of liquids can it actually block?
Can liquid metal, like mercury, pass through it?
I’ll get Dong Muyun to take this Water Elemental Barrier back to Tianyun Group for basic processing first!
I have to pay this woman the processing fee again. Really detestable. But at least the processing comes with a warranty.
It’s a shame that the meditation time I reserved for today was interrupted by a phone call from Miss Qin.
Day Eight:
October 8th, sunny. Praise the Sun.
An unremarkable day. The only thing worth mentioning is that two more Forest Wolves in my home have broken through to Elite Level! That includes Little Ones! Heart of Woods is truly flourishing more and more!
But Miss Qin called again in the evening.
Sure enough, Su Anyong was right: women only disrupt my progress in meditation.
Day Nine:
October 9th, sunny. Praise the Sun.
Xiao Qing’s Level has increased, reaching Second Rank Elite. The little guy is so hardworking; I can feel a significant boost to my spiritual power!
Is it possible that if a Pet Beast keeps breaking through, its master won’t need to engage in meditation anymore?
Miss Qin called again.
She wants me to visit Magic Capital Academy in two months, before the end of the year?
Before the year’s end... I wonder if it will conflict with the Breeder Competition?
And why do I feel a little nervous about it?
Day Ten:
October 10th, sunny. The Sun loves me so much; I’ll sing a song for the Sun.
An exhilarating day!
Indeed, for a Forest Wolf with only Proficient Level Sunlight Absorption to evolve into a Wanmu Wolf, the required Evolution Energy is minimal. In just these few days, using only two Elite Level materials, ’Gyro Pine Nuts’ and ’Whitewisker Grass,’ and one Low-level Commander resource, ’Green Phosphorus Fruit,’ the Evolution was completed!
The Evolution was successful! The second Wanmu Wolf has finally appeared!
Indeed, there’s quite a gap in potential compared to Old Sha; it barely reached the Racial Potential of a First Stage Monarch! Also, it didn’t comprehend the ’Life Magnetic Field’ Skill!
I don’t know if it’s unable to comprehend it or just hasn’t yet, much like Old Sha didn’t comprehend the Blinding Technique.
But it’s good enough that its Racial Potential can reach First Stage Monarch; that’s quite incredible!
Sunlight Absorption being only at Proficient Level means it doesn’t need many cultivation resources. It needs neither Lungs of Nature nor Sun Crystals—only a massive amount of Sunlight Springwater, a large quantity of Smile-Faced Sunflower Seeds, and subsequent resources for accumulating Evolution Energy. Adding it all up, the total Evolution cost is roughly between 15,000,000 to 20,000,000!
Such a cost for the Evolution of a Wanmu Wolf that can reach Monarch Level potential—in Old Liu’s words, this year’s Breeder Competition should be no problem.
Moreover, after completing the Evolution, Xiao Qiang’s Level directly broke through from Elite Peak to Third Rank Commander! Not bad at all!
Most importantly! I finally managed to get some meditation in today! Nothing should disturb me now, right?
Su Ping’s days passed uneventfully, as succinctly summed up by the few words in his diary.
However, it was obviously quite different for others.
It would be truly strange if the masters, connected by Soul Contracts, couldn’t feel the Evolution of their Pet Beasts and such significant breakthroughs.
Over the past month or so, the Legion had maintained absolute trust in Su Ping. Even when delivering resources, they would at most ask a couple of questions.
But today was evidently different. The second Wanmu Wolf had appeared.
「Without a doubt, pandemonium erupted inside the Forest Wolf Troop’s base a hundred kilometers away!」

chapters.title: Chapter 154 - 123: Is this evolved form so fierce?
chapters.content:
Chapter 154: Chapter 123: Is this evolved form so fierce?
The War Wolf C Division Command Center.
In Chief Lin Lei’s office.
Chief Lin still sat behind his desk, listening as one of his battalion commanders reported on the progress and achievements of the past month or so.
"Sir, the Evolution of the Desert Wind Wolf has been completed, only..."
"Only what?" Lin Lei gave the man a look.
In a certain sense, a few battalions in War Wolf C Division were always at the bottom. Forest Wolf, Sand Wolf, and Snow Wolf were unquestionably these bottom-ranking battalions.
The man standing before him was Wang Feng, the battalion commander of the Sand Wolf Battalion.
"Sir, there’s only a little over half a month left until the martial competition begins! I can’t seem to book any joint internal training sessions with our brother battalions. Old Yang’s Snow Wolf Group has already started training with the Instructor’s Shadow Wolf Group. I had hoped to find Lao Zhang, but he said his Forest Wolf Troop hasn’t finished its Cultivation yet..."
Lin Lei glanced at the man. "Indeed, his troop hasn’t finished its Cultivation. Why don’t you make arrangements with a few other battalions, or perhaps arrange some cross-training? There’s still half a month left; what’s the rush to train for combat? Let me tell you, if you disgrace me in front of the entire Legion this time, I’ll have you learn postnatal care for sows!"
Wang Feng was not the least bit concerned by Lin Lei’s threat. Instead, his eyes darted about, and he chuckled. "Sir, I heard that Lao Zhang’s Forest Wolf Troop has cultivated something remarkable?"
Lin Lei’s expression remained unchanged as he took a sip of water. "Where did you hear that?"
"Is it true?" Wang Feng’s eyes widened.
"True or false, what damn business is it of yours? Get back to your training, now!" Lin Lei said impatiently.
Seeing the Chief getting angry, Wang Feng fell silent awkwardly, though he didn’t dare retort. Just as he reached the door, Lin Lei’s voice came from behind. "I don’t care where you heard about this, but let me tell you: watch your mouth! It’s one thing to spread rumors within our division. But if word gets out to other divisions, I’ll be the first to come looking for you!"
Wang Feng was startled, then his expression turned bitter.
Could it be true?! Where did that bastard Zhang Lie find such a Breeder?
For a moment, Wang Feng was truly itching to know more, but he dared not ask further. However, just as he was about to open the door, it was suddenly pushed open from outside.
"Sir! It’s done, the Cultivation is complete..." Zhang Lie’s voice trailed off.
He saw Wang Feng, whose face was brimming with eager curiosity.
"Commander Zhang, what’s completed?" Wang Feng asked, winking.
Wang Feng was startled by Chief Lin’s furious voice from inside the office. "Damn it, don’t you know to announce yourself before entering? And you, if there’s nothing else, get lost!"
Regret welled up inside Wang Feng, but he quickly stood at attention. "Yes, sir."
Finally, with no outsiders left in the office, Lin Lei spoke. "Alright, what’s going on? Tell me."
Zhang Lie immediately became excited again. "Sir! Chai Xiaowei’s Forest Wolf has successfully evolved! He himself has directly broken through from Commander First Stage to Commander Second Stage!"
Lin Lei was stunned. "That company commander of yours?"
"Yes!"
Seeing Zhang Lie’s excited demeanor, Lin Lei suddenly thought of something. "So, you came because..."
Zhang Lie chuckled. "The other brats couldn’t wait either. Since the competition starts in just over half a month, we can’t get much training done within our troop. I was thinking about taking them over there to see and join in the training. Is that okay?"
Knowing that one’s own Pet Beast had completed its Evolution, yet being unable to be by its side, was an undeniable and immense torment! Furthermore, Zhang Lie wanted to see for himself what his ace soldiers’ Pet Beasts had become.
Watching Zhang Lie’s excitement, Lin Lei opened his mouth. He almost wanted to report to General Zhao and ask if he too could go see it.
Would that be alright? Of course! A brand new, never-before-seen Evolutionary Body! And one with Monarch-level species’ Racial Potential! Who wouldn’t want to see that?
Unfortunately, given his status and position, he couldn’t simply leave the Legion base.
However, what Zhang Lie said did make some sense. Cultivation was one aspect. During the martial competition, it wouldn’t just be the Pet Beasts entering the field, but also their Beast Tamers. The Pet Beasts and Beast Tamers needed to synergize to achieve even greater effects.
Thinking of this, Lin Lei didn’t mince words and said directly, "Fine. However, they can stay there. As for you, return to me immediately after you’ve delivered them! And don’t forget to write me a 10,000-word self-criticism!"
"Yes, sir!"
「Soon, under the bright midday sun, a military vehicle swiftly departed the Legion base.」
No one in the vehicle spoke. The ten soldiers whose Pet Beasts were being cultivated were filled with a mix of excitement and nervousness. They all pursed their lips, their tanned faces unable to conceal their irrepressible joy and anticipation.
Seeing them made Zhang Lie grit his teeth. "Damn it! Once we get there, all of you better keep your composure! I’m telling you, you are elite soldiers of the Forest Wolf Troop! Don’t act like unsophisticated mutts who’ve never seen anything! Understood?"
"Yes, sir!"
「Time passed slowly.」
Su Ping, having finished lunch and burped contentedly, didn’t rest. He brought Xiao Qiang and Old Sha, along with over ten elite Forest Wolves, to the combat arena.
After merging with Yun Tian, Su Ping could finally conduct Pet Beast battles without any reservations. With a dedicated combat arena, they could safely use their Skills and unleash their full power, no longer needing to worry about damaging the ecological environment of their Forest Wolf woods.
In the open-air venue, basking in the sunlight, Old Sha and Xiao Qiang both squinted their eyes in sheer enjoyment.
But Su Ping spoke up. "Alright, Xiao Qiang!"
"AWOO! (Here!)"
The Forest Wolves from the Legion reacted swiftly to the roll call, which greatly satisfied Su Ping.
"Next, I’m going to test your combat capabilities!"
"AWOO! (Yes!)"
At this moment, Xiao Qiang had already assumed the form of the Wanmu Wolf. The green, horn-like antlers on its head swayed slightly as it awaited Su Ping’s further instructions.
"First, you’ll face these dozen or so Elite Forest Wolves. However, your goal isn’t to defeat them. If you can’t overpower them quickly, then my Cultivation of your Evolution would be a failure. So, your task is to control them for ten seconds, then release them. Wait for them to attack you again, and then see if you can wear them down until they completely lose all combat power!"
This was a rather unique battle method. However, it was a very useful combat training method. It allowed for the maximum observation of Xiao Qiang’s sustained combat power and trained an even more important aspect: mental fortitude.
Su Ping then looked at the summoned Wolf Pack. "And you all, your job is to attack it relentlessly. Understood?"
"AWOO!"
"Good, go ahead!"
Both sides stepped onto the training field together.
「Meanwhile, a military vehicle had stopped at the entrance of the Heart of Woods.」
Lao Guan, seeing Zhang Lie arrive, smiled and said, "Xiao Ping is in the combat arena over there, training the evolved Forest Wolf. Commander Zhang, you and your men, please follow me."
Zhang Lie nodded. The ten Legion Soldiers behind him were all keenly focused. One of them was so excited he involuntarily held his breath after boarding the sightseeing vehicle with Lao Guan.
He was Chai Xiaowei, Xiao Qiang’s current Beast Tamer. It was he who had sensed the changes in Xiao Qiang through their Soul Contract, even experiencing a direct boost of a minor Level himself!
Zhang Lie, seeing this soldier’s dazed expression, smiled and said, "Alright, I’ve seen the Wanmu Wolf before, so I have some understanding of it. The Wanmu Wolf’s Abilities lean more towards battlefield control and creating forest terrain, which Forest Wolves excel in. Its individual combat prowess might not be that strong. It’s primarily more formidable when fighting in coordination with others."
He had indeed seen it; after all, he was the first witness to Old Sha’s Evolution.
Saying this, they all disembarked from the vehicle and followed Lao Guan into the combat arena Su Ping had reserved.
The venue was extremely deserted. Although open-air, it was only open from above; a circular wall enclosed its perimeter. However, just as they stepped inside, a series of whistling sounds reached their ears.
Zhang Lie immediately spotted Su Ping standing by the fence. But at that moment, his gaze slowly shifted towards the training field.
The vast arena, normally a relatively open training field, was now densely packed. Trees! It was entirely filled with trees, roots, branches, and leaves!
If not for the walls and fences around the combat arena, Zhang Lie would have thought it was a small forest. But clearly, this wasn’t a normal forest. A natural forest wouldn’t be this abnormally dense. These trees were packed and squeezed together, looking less like a potted plant arrangement and more like a patch of weeds magnified a thousandfold.
Then, in the next moment, he saw a figure strolling leisurely outside this ’forest’ on the training field. It was draped in branches that seemed to flow down from its body, resembling a peculiar Old Wolf wearing a straw rain cape. However, the emerald-green, Y-shaped antlers on its head were reminiscent of the legendary auspicious Divine Beast: the Kylin.
At that moment, everyone knew that the peculiar Forest Wolf on the field, resembling a Kylin, was indeed the Wanmu Wolf! It was the very Contracted Beast they had sensed through their soul connection.
Beside them, Chai Xiaowei’s eyes widened, and he clenched his fists in excitement. However, mindful of his commander’s earlier warning, he dared not make any overly conspicuous movements, merely staring at the scene on the field with thrilled eyes.
However, soon, none of them could remain calm!
They then noticed that within the dense thicket of entwined branches and leaves—branches stretching out like dark green pythons—figures were darting up and down. They were all too familiar with these figures. They were ordinary Forest Wolves. There were over a dozen of them! All at the Elite Level.
Yet, these Forest Wolves were scrambling to attack Xiao Qiang on the field. However, the small ’forest’ before them seemed like an insurmountable natural barrier. The branches, moving faster than the wolves, would swiftly bind any wolf that made a move, immobilizing it for about ten seconds before releasing it again.
It was like a cat toying with mice, tirelessly watching these struggling little creatures attempt to challenge this Wolf King of the trees in its jungle!
Even considering the difference between Commander Level and Elite Level, wasn’t this gap a bit too large?
At that moment, they finally grasped the true charm and combat power of this Forest Wolf Evolutionary Body.
Instantly, several soldiers looked at their commander with admiration.
No wonder! No wonder our commander was so confident this time and paid such a heavy price for us to undergo this Evolution! Such a powerful Evolutionary Body is truly worthy of the commander’s high regard. And yet, an Evolutionary Body this powerful isn’t considered strong in single combat? Then what kind of creature *would* be considered strong?
It was then that Zhang Lie, who had been quiet all this time, watching the leisurely Wanmu Wolf and the dozen-plus Elite Forest Wolves being effortlessly captured, finally couldn’t hold back.
"Damn... is this Evolutionary Body really that fierce?!"

chapters.title: Chapter 155 - 124: The Martial Contest Approaches! Legion Formation Training! Blinding Technique!
chapters.content:
Chapter 155: Chapter 124: The Martial Contest Approaches! Legion Formation Training! Blinding Technique!
Zhang Lie ignored the strange looks from his teammates.
At this moment, he had only one thought:
Outrageous! This is utterly outrageous!
Generally speaking, a Commander Level Pet Beast naturally held an absolute advantage over Elite Level ones.
But could the advantage truly be this significant?
He just watched. For a full ten minutes since they had entered, those Forest Wolves hadn’t even touched Xiao Qiang once. The forests that kept springing up seemed to appear at their feet at any moment. Most importantly, the control and growth rate of these forests were just too fast!
Logically, the energy consumed in this process should be substantial, right?
But!
So much time had passed! They had already been inside for ten minutes, and who knew how long Xiao Qiang had been fighting before they even arrived!?
Yet, despite such wide-range and frequent manipulation of the forest, Xiao Qiang showed no signs of energy depletion at all.
On the contrary, those Forest Wolves were clearly starting to run out of steam.
Trapped by the Wanmu Wolf’s Tree Prison and then forced to relentlessly attack once released, they were still running a deficit, even in broad daylight with Sunlight Absorption for replenishment.
Incomprehensible!
Zhang Lie truly couldn’t understand.
He didn’t get how such large-scale terrain-modifying Abilities could consume so little Energy! All he knew was that he hadn’t misjudged the Wanmu Wolf bounding above; it was like a Kylin, a truly magnificent sight! This was the best Forest Wolf Evolutionary Body.
Su Ping paid no attention to the crowd that had entered; his gaze was firmly fixed on Xiao Qiang above.
He understood what was happening even better than Xiao Qiang’s owner did.
The reason he had so ostentatiously tested Xiao Qiang’s strength was precisely because of this understanding.
Xiao Qiang’s Sunlight Absorption was only at the Proficient Level.
Thus, the evolved Photosynthesis was also only at the Proficient Level.
And most importantly, after completing the Evolution, Xiao Qiang’s Heart of Woods had also risen to the Proficient Level!
These three Skills formed a formulaic iron triangle, creating a continuous synergy within Xiao Qiang.
It was simply too difficult to advance to Perfection Level! For Old Sha’s Heart of Woods to reach Perfection Level was not something achievable in a day or two. Thus, this first experimental Evolutionary Body, where the Heart of Woods Level matched the other two Skills, held great research significance.
Indeed, that was the case.
At this very moment, Xiao Qiang’s Energy cycling within its body was much smoother and more natural.
The physical strain from extensively using these three linked Skills—similar to how Old Sha had in the Secret Realm—would be minimized.
However, the mental fatigue from rapid Skill usage was still inevitable.
But, this was already quite impressive.
It also highlighted the power of this Skill formula.
It’s a pity that Sunlight Absorption, the source, being only at the Proficient Level, was indeed too low. It couldn’t achieve a qualitative change, making it impossible to further observe the upper limits of this Skill combination.
「Half an hour later」
Xiao Qiang was still in the arena. Its movements showed hardly any signs of disorder, yet in front of it lay numerous Forest Wolves.
Some of the Forest Wolves with lower Elite Levels had already fainted.
Even those at higher Elite Levels, including two at the peak Elite Level, were barely hanging on in this battle.
It was almost impossible for them to resist again.
This outcome wasn’t entirely unexpected, but the process was certainly awe-inspiring!
One against sixteen!
Wanmu Wolf, a complete victory!
「Two hours later」
Zhang Lie stood at the entrance of the Heart of Woods, a look of reluctance on his face, but he still remarked to Su Ping as he was leaving, "I was a bit worried before, but now I’m not afraid at all! Breeder Su, these ten rascals will stay with you for now. Don’t hesitate to order them around as you see fit! If any of them dare to act up, call me, and I’ll skin ’em when I get back!"
Zhang Lie glared fiercely at the ten people behind Su Ping.
Not a single one of the Beast Tamer soldiers denied it. In fact, one who had a good relationship with Zhang Lie even spoke up directly, "Commander, you don’t even have to say it. If anyone dares to disrespect Breeder Su, we brothers will beat the living crap out of him!"
To be honest, Zhang Lie absolutely believed him.
In this whole world, who else could cultivate a Pet Beast like the Wanmu Wolf? Was this Su Ping before him just some young kid? No, he was the guide to their bright future!
Zhang Lie shot them a look. "You rascals got lucky this time! So, in the Legion competition half a month from now, if anyone dares to mess up, you’ll all suffer five times the punishment I get from the Division Commander!"
"Yes! Guaranteed to complete the mission!"
After receiving a satisfactory response, Zhang Lie finally turned to Su Ping and said with heartfelt sincerity, "Breeder Su, sorry to trouble you. Any expenses these rascals incur here will be fully reimbursed by the Forest Wolf Troop! We absolutely won’t let you waste a single cent of your money."
Su Ping smiled and shook his head, "Commander Zhang, you’re being too distant."
Let alone the Forest Wolf Troop offering reimbursement, Su Ping himself was eagerly awaiting the arrival of these ten Legion Beast Tamers!

chapters.title: Chapter 156 - 124: The Martial Contest Approaches! Legion Formation Training! Blinding Technique!_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 156: Chapter 124: The Martial Contest Approaches! Legion Formation Training! Blinding Technique!_2
The reason was simple: among these ten individuals, the one with the lowest military rank was already a company commander, in charge of around two hundred people and Pet Beasts. The rest were either battalion commanders or elite non-commissioned officers, all of whom had extensive experience in group combat.
If Su Ping wanted to command a horde of beasts in battle in the future, he was more than eager to discuss this with the Beast Tamers within the Legion! That’s what he thought, and that’s what he did.
At first, these ten Beast Tamer soldiers were indeed very cautious. The reason was simple: Su Ping didn’t make the best first impression on them. The first time he came to summon Pet Beasts, he was anything but polite. After summoning them, he simply told them to beat it.
However, after this interaction, they found that Su Ping, despite his exceptional talent, wasn’t as odd-tempered as they had thought.
"A horde? A Legion? Breeder Su’s ideas are quite bold!"
That evening, sitting on the grass in the Forest Wolf woodland, one of the soldiers, the oldest and a thirty-year-old Beast Tamer named Li Da, spoke up in surprise.
"That is the idea," Su Ping said. "I am sentimental about Pet Beasts I have raised from youth, so I’m reluctant to sell them. I figured, though arena combat might be out, for exploring Secret Realms and defending against Ferocious Beasts, I could still employ some."
The others were also surprised. They knew that in the Beast Tamer Legion, Pet Beasts collaborated in combat under the command of Beast Tamers, who themselves followed orders from superior officers.
But if one person were to command a Legion’s worth of Pet Beasts? Not to mention two hundred Pet Beasts from a company, even managing thirty to fifty Pet Beasts from a platoon would be difficult, wouldn’t it?
They were surprised but didn’t discuss this further. Li Da nodded and said, "I believe Breeder Su can do the impossible."
After a little flattery, he made his suggestion, "If that’s the case, then I suggest, Breeder Su, you shouldn’t command them all at once in battle. That would surely lead to mistakes. You should primarily engage with a few highly-talented Forest Wolves, get them used to your commands, and make them understand your commands.
"Then, use these Forest Wolves as the core to build combat squads! Let these core Forest Wolves command the others. This will be more efficient, and it’s best to conduct tactical-focused training so they get used to their roles!"
Upon hearing this, Sun Xiao, a soldier standing next to him, laughed, "Isn’t this just like the training methods of our Legion’s companies and platoons? Breeder Su, you don’t need to ask Commander Li. He’s all talk, but I’m the one with the real combat experience!
"If you trust me, leave it to me. I can’t promise miracles, but I can develop a set of guidelines for you during this time. You just train them according to these methods, as long as you can command each ’Forest Wolf squad leader’!"
"And me! Breeder Su, I’m the instructor of the assault company, responsible for the company’s Pet Beast assault training..."
"I can help as well..."
Watching hands rise one after the other, Su Ping smiled.
Who in this world understood Legion combat better than the members of the Beast Tamer Legion? Who knew better how to ensure that a group of Pet Beasts performed effectively in large-scale warfare? Clearly, no one! So, I really only need to train according to the methods of these most endearing individuals.
As for their concerns about whether uncontracted Forest Wolves would understand my commands? Clearly, there was no need for concern. The soul sight ability bestowed by the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas was my most reliable skill. It seemed that after completing this Cultivation task, in the future, I could continue my collaboration with the Beast Tamer Legion. Besides, just having these Beast Tamers from the Legion help oversee the Forest Wolves’ combat training was already a huge help to me.
This also allowed Su Ping to devote more energy to the further Cultivation of Forest Wolves and Papermen.
Indeed, that’s what happened. This peaceful lifestyle continued for two more days. During that time, including the previously advanced ’Dumb’ and ’Dazed’, a total of eight Forest Wolves that had reached Master Level in Sunlight Absorption also finally upgraded their Photosynthesis skill to Mastery Level. This marked the beginning of the third phase in the Cultivation of Forest Wolves.
Accumulating power, preparing to evolve!
At this stage, Su Ping didn’t have to worry too much. By now, of the ten Forest Wolves, only Li Da’s had yet to complete this skill level Cultivation. It couldn’t be helped. That Forest Wolf, like Old Sha’s, had reached Perfection Level in Sunlight Absorption. To upgrade its Photosynthesis, it needed to stabilize first before consuming another Sun Crystal.
Although I now have several Sun Crystals that can be reused, I can’t waste them, can I? After all, my own Forest Wolves might need them in the future. Saving one means earning tens of millions. Where else could I find such a deal normally?
However, Su Ping and Li Da didn’t have to wait too long. After two more days, once it had consumed a Sun Crystal, Li Da’s Forest Wolf, ’Da Zhuang’—which had already achieved Perfection in Sunlight Absorption—also reached Perfection in Photosynthesis. It then began accumulating power in preparation for Evolution.

chapters.title: Chapter 157 - 124: The Martial Contest Approaches! Legion Formation Training! Blinding Technique!_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 157: Chapter 124: The Martial Contest Approaches! Legion Formation Training! Blinding Technique!_3
Apart from these Forest Wolves being bred, what caught Su Ping’s attention the most was undoubtedly the Paperman.
The progress of the Paperman also brought joy to Su Ping.
Qian Yi had to be evolved as soon as possible.
Therefore, the twenty-two Papermen, seven Paper Sword Forms, and the small Paperman Qian Yi were training themselves day and night without rest.
The results were extraordinary!
Six Papermen, with unlimited supplies of resources like Soul-Settling Paper and Undead Crystals in this period, soared from the common Third Rank they were at when first purchased, much like rockets, all the way up to the common Seventh Rank.
The upgrading of their skill levels was the same.
The Paperman’s Racial Potential was low, their Skills were few, and even their self-awareness wasn’t high.
But there was also a benefit to this.
That is, they could focus more.
They were more single-minded.
As Su Ping had the small Paperman Qian Yi practice swordsmanship while supervising the other Papermen in performing ’joint’ and ’disjoint’ exercises, several Papermen advanced their ’Paper Body Joint’ skill from just learning it to the Mastery Level in less than a month.
Su Ping figured that the shared learning effect was certainly one aspect, but it also indicated that the difficulty of upgrading the Paperman’s ’Paper Body Joint’ skill really wasn’t high! In a way, it was even effortless. Such Skills were indeed easier to improve.
However, what truly excited Su Ping was that three days later, the small Paperman Qian Yi’s mutated ’Paper Body Control’ skill, after a great deal of effort, had finally advanced from the Beginner to the Proficient Level!
Unlike the Paper Body Joint skill of the ordinary Paperman, which showed no noticeable change in appearance, the improvement in Qian Yi’s Paper Body Control was extremely evident.
This fact became clear when it could even remotely control Paper Swords around thirty centimeters from its body, showing how significant this skill level upgrade was for the small Paperman.
Unfortunately, while the breeding of the Pet Beasts was going strong, the construction of the Heart of Woods hadn’t made much progress over these days.
The reason was nothing else but the familiar problem of being out of money again.
Some construction team expenses could be put on credit.
But the special materials required for building bridges could not be deferred, resulting in a temporary halt to the work.
If Su Ping didn’t have some expectations for evolving the Crown Wolf Emperor, he would have even considered selling the natural essence in his hands.
The resources from the Legion had a special marking, making them difficult to sell, but the origin of the natural essence was clean.
It’s a pity. How could Su Ping not have expectations when Miss Qin was evolving the Crown Wolf Emperor? Money could be earned, but resources like these were really hard to come by.
However, Su Ping was determined to put the development of new industries around the Heart of Woods and the training of new Breeders on his agenda when he had the time.
Besides, after the Beast Tamer warriors led by Li Da arrived, Su Ping finally had time to properly meditate and solidify his skills. In the days that followed, he successfully broke through to become an Elite Third Rank Beast Tamer.
Of course, there was an even more important matter at hand.
The Forest Wolves bred by the Legion were nearly finishing their Evolution one by one.
Over these few days, the eight wolves who had reached the Master Level of drawing from the sunlight had also finally completed their Evolution.
They became the third to the tenth Wanmu Wolves in the world!
This provided Su Ping with over 500 experience points. However, putting that aside, the most important development concerned the Forest Wolf ’Er Zhuang,’ who was already at the Commander Level.
After evolving, a dazzling sunlight brilliance burst from its body.
Its fur color was a bit more golden than the other Wanmu Wolves.
The reason was that Su Ping, using his Eye of Truth, clearly saw an Ability in Er Zhuang’s evolved skill list that no other Wanmu Wolf possessed: ’Blinding Technique!’
「At the same time, there were less than ten days left until the Legion’s big competition.」

chapters.title: Chapter 158 - 125 Going to the Legion! Who is Forest Wolf’s Breeder?
chapters.content:
Chapter 158: Chapter 125 Going to the Legion! Who is Forest Wolf’s Breeder?
