Once again, with incredible proficiency, they wove the sky above the small town into a green web!
This is terrifying!
Almost all the teams couldn’t help but raise their heads to look at the spreading branches in the sky. These branches connected with the ten-story buildings of the town, forming a Tree Prison that trapped them inside!
This is the real Tree Prison! No, this is the true Advent of the Tree Realm! The Tree Realm Prison!
Excitement beyond belief shone in Su Ping’s eyes!
Though the town was indeed very small—it was questionable if it even spanned three kilometers from end to end. After all, only about twenty buildings stood there. It could hardly be called a town; if anything, it was merely a residential complex.
But one had to remember, these were only five Wanmu Wolves for now!
What if in the future... if I cultivated a few dozen Wanmu Wolves to serve as ’battlefield controllers,’ supplemented by main attackers and a logistics team responsible for healing? If a complete iron triangle were formed, could this legion perhaps disregard the threat of Beast Tides numbering in the hundreds or thousands?
It seemed this was indeed the case!
With little concern for energy consumption, once the Tree Realm Prison enveloped the sky, every piece of wood fell under the Wanmu Wolves’ control. They didn’t need to attack other troublesome Pet Beasts. Instead, they utilized their near-limitless agility within this jungle. Able to traverse the woods at will, even move along the tops of trees to achieve an effect akin to ’flying,’ their assaults on the Beast Tamers were impossible to defend against!
Thus, as the chaotic battle commenced, messages began to flood the leaderboard!
[Forest Wolf Troop’s Sun Xiao has eliminated ’Zhang Bing’ of the White Tiger Group, gaining +1 Point...]
[Forest Wolf Troop’s Gao Hang has eliminated ’Li Tie’ of the Iron Arm Ape Group, gaining +1 Point...]
[...]
At a speed no one could have imagined.
In this vast jungle, it seemed they were the ones being hunted.
The Forest Wolf Troop, which had previously fallen to third place, surged back to the top in just one short hour!
What were they to do!?
At this moment, everyone felt paralyzed.
However, soon, a crucial piece of news acted like a shot in the arm for everyone who had started to lose hope.
"Captain, look! The Forest Wolf Troop has suffered casualties!"
That’s right. After an hour of such chaotic fighting, the Forest Wolf Troop was not truly invincible after all.
Casualties had finally appeared.
It was Xiao Can, one of the five. His Wanmu Wolf was only a Commander Sixth Order.
But that wasn’t the true reason!
"Fire Type Pet Beasts, the natural nemesis of the Wanmu Wolves, have arrived!"
Everyone who had witnessed the recent events was discussing it animatedly.
Indeed, Xiao Can’s elimination was at the hands of the flame gorilla currently standing atop a building.
This year’s grand competition was undoubtedly the worst for the Ape Masters. Trouble seemed inevitable for them once they returned.
However, perhaps due to the Forest Wolf Troop’s luck, almost all the Fire Type Pet Beasts from the various divisions had been nearly wiped out.
Even the Ashen Wolf Lord of the War Wolf Division was no exception.
Hence, no Fire Type Pet Beasts had appeared until now.
Who would have thought that the Ape Troop would have a lone survivor!
This single remaining flame gorilla became the hope for breaking the deadlock!
The elimination of a single Wanmu Wolf instantly created a gap in the Tree Realm Prison that had enveloped the small town.
"Protect that flame gorilla!" someone roared, and then they all rallied together.
At this moment, they seemed to have truly disregarded their own scores!
Their sole objective was to eliminate the Forest Wolf Troop!
Otherwise, even if they achieved other decent rankings and points in this competition, their honor would be utterly lost!
The Forest Wolf Troop must be eliminated!
And at this crucial juncture, the arriving flame gorilla became the key to turning the tables.
The wood, now charred by flames, prevented the Wanmu Wolves from drawing power from it to sustain themselves.
Moreover, the interconnected trees, usually their strength, now became a deadly weakness under the blaze, helping the fire spread rapidly!
Flame Gorilla!
Li Da’s eyes were bloodshot; they had already accumulated a significant number of points.
After brawling for nearly the entire morning, everyone was practically consumed by battle frenzy.
But their stamina and Energy had been severely depleted.
However, while they were expending stamina and Energy, their enemies were losing their lives!
In just that morning, both the Black Tiger Group and the Shadow Leopard Group had each suffered one or two casualties.
And all the Titan Pythons of the Great Serpent Master had been completely eliminated!

chapters.title: Chapter 184 - 133: The Final Battle! A Brutal Contest!_4
chapters.content:
Chapter 184: Chapter 133: The Final Battle! A Brutal Contest!_4
So, if they wanted to win, they had to kill that Flame Gorilla.
Unfortunately, during the morning’s fierce battle, three of the Cold Water Wolves from the Snow Wolf Group—a natural counter to the Flame Gorilla—had been eliminated, leaving only one shivering in fear.
They had to kill that Flame Gorilla!
Li Da knew that if they didn’t kill the Flame Gorilla, which was rampaging through the Tree Realm Prison under everyone’s protection, his side would definitely be annihilated!
He knew he had to make a move now.
Because in just a short time, the Forest Wolf Troop, originally of five, was now down to just him and Sun Xiao.
These bastards surrounding the Flame Gorilla made it impossible for them to break out and assassinate it.
But waiting here would only lead to death in the end.
Sun Xiao and Li Da stood together and, in just a moment, confirmed their tactics.
Thus, Li Da made his move. It was the first time he used his Talented Ability: a very simple gift called Mirror Heaven Reflection.
It was an abstract ability that could change his own appearance or that of a Beast Tamer.
It seemed simple and apparently useless for Pet Beast cultivation, but it could play a critical role at crucial moments. For example, right now...
...in the instant the ability activated, Da Zhuang, who was in front of them, slowly shifted from his Wanmu Wolf form, transforming into Li Da’s appearance. Meanwhile, Li Da himself slowly turned into a Wanmu Wolf, completely inverting the roles between master and servant.
And in the next moment, Sun Xiao, controlling Er Zhuang, gave chase, shouting, "You curs! Have you no shame?"
The intensity of the battle reached an unimaginable fever pitch. Now, with the tactical triumph and stroke of genius against the Flame Gorilla, Mo He, the captain of the Black Tiger Group, couldn’t help but smirk.
"This time, I admit the Forest Wolf Troop has won," Mo He said, "but if you think you can make us lose this embarrassingly, you’re mistaken!"
With that thought, Mo He narrowed his eyes.
"Go, someone tie this guy up! Old Lu, keep controlling the Flame Gorilla to sweep through this area. This brat is just trying to lure the tiger away from the mountain. Don’t be fooled by him."
The others nodded. Old Deng, the aloof commander from the Shadow Leopard Group, immediately went forward. His Soul-Eating Leopard’s psychic influence instantly activated, causing the swiftly fleeing Er Zhuang to stagger. The psychic attack nearly made it fall from the tree.
The horror of the Psychic Element lay in its silent, imperceptible activation, making it impossible to guard against. However, forming a Psychic Ability was extremely difficult, and its attack power was relatively low.
As long as they didn’t catch the Beast Tamer, such an attack was nothing to Er Zhuang.
Then, in the next moment, on the frontline, another Wanmu Wolf suddenly appeared in the forest woven by Li Da.
"Hahaha, Old Li, it seems you’re nearby, ready to assault the Flame Gorilla? Don’t waste your energy!"
With both Wanmu Wolves in play, Mo He finally stopped hesitating. This meant that the Forest Wolf Troop had reached the end of their rope.
Although their own losses were greater—greater beyond imagination—just being able to eliminate the Forest Wolf Troop was enough. Otherwise, it would be too shameful!
"Still want to run? Chase them!" Mo He ordered. "Additionally, Old He, you take Old Lu and the Flame Gorilla to sweep through these woods and flush out Old Li, who’s unwilling to emerge from within."
"The rest of you, chase! Contain this Forest Wolf. Once we’ve dealt with this one, the remaining one will be easy to handle!"
Mo He took the lead, riding atop his Netherworld Demon Tiger. With a leap over the treetops, he headed straight for the Wanmu Wolf not far away.
The Wanmu Wolf was still running ahead, but Mo He, closely followed by another Beast Tamer from the Shadow Leopard Group, was rapidly closing in on the swiftly fleeing creature.
At that moment, an ominous premonition suddenly struck Mo He.
He looked at this Forest Wolf Evolver and felt something was off.
What was strange about it?
Mo He quickly figured it out: the opponent was too slow.
Was it deliberately waiting for them, or was there another reason? Could there be a trap?!
Mo He slowed his pace, warily scouring the surroundings. The Flame Gorilla’s fire had spread along the branches, adding a brilliant streak of flame to the battlefield, which was shrouded in dark clouds!
Li Da helplessly looked up at the sky. At this moment, he damn well wanted to inexplicably cry out, "Oh, vast heavens, why treat me so unjustly?"
If there were still sunlight in this final opportunity, and if they could eliminate the Flame Gorilla, the Forest Wolf Troop would still have a chance to turn the tables. But now, that chance was slim.
However... A resolute light flashed in Li Da’s eyes.
Regardless of the situation, his priority was to eliminate that annoying Flame Gorilla.
AWOO~
A piercing howl sounded from not far away. Li Da’s mouth curled into a smile, while Mo He turned his head in disbelief, looking towards a distant place.
That was where Old Lu, the Flame Gorilla, and another Netherworld Demon Tiger were searching for Li Da!
How could this be?
The first Forest Wolf was restrained by Old Deng’s Soul-Eating Leopard, and the second Forest Wolf was right in front of them.
Could it be that Old Ling, the remaining member of the Snow Wolf Group, had made a comeback?!
But in the next moment, he knew the answer. The Forest Wolf before him slowly revealed its illusory form. Under the Netherworld Demon Tiger’s clutches, the life indicator on his wristwatch burst into light.
[Forest Wolf Troop member Li Da, you have been eliminated. Current Forest Wolf Troop points: 101. Please immediately restrain your Pet Beast and either wait on-site or evacuate the battlefield!]
Eliminated!
In just a morning’s chaotic battle, the Forest Wolf Troop was left with only Sun Xiao and Er Zhuang, a Wanmu Wolf, still struggling to hold on.
But Li Da was content. Through the Soul Contract, he could clearly sense that his Da Zhuang had not only taken out the Flame Gorilla’s Beast Tamer but had also eliminated the Beast Tamer of the last remaining Netherworld Demon Tiger, apart from Mo He.
This transformed ambush had resulted in an unimaginable victory!
"The rest is up to you now, Old Sun!"

chapters.title: Chapter 185 - 134 The Last Glimmer of Light! The Mutated Wanmu Wolf!
chapters.content:
Chapter 185: Chapter 134 The Last Glimmer of Light! The Mutated Wanmu Wolf!
TSK.
Su Ping shook his head involuntarily as he watched the tragic scenes unfolding on the screen. He knew that this was probably the end of the line for the Forest Wolf Troop’s final battle.
With Li Da eliminated, even though Sun Xiao and Er Zhuang were still left, several other opponents remained. And these guys, they were all seeing red.
They had to eliminate the entire Forest Wolf Troop.
Even without the Flame Gorilla, Su Ping knew that under the current circumstances, Er Zhuang and Sun Xiao wouldn’t last much longer.
The reason was simple. Beyond the physical and mental burden from continuously using the Sunlight Absorption Formula, the most crucial factor was the current situation: dark clouds now obscured the sun.
If the sun were still out, with boundless sunlight available, they might still have a chance. But now, that was clearly gone.
With Er Zhuang’s three Sunlight Absorption Formula skills—Sunlight Absorption, Photosynthesis, and Heart of Woods—all reaching Master Level, the burden he bore was indeed somewhat less than that of the other Wanmu Wolves.
But without direct sunlight, it was useless! Even the most skilled artisan can’t work without materials!
Thus, the Flame Gorilla was just the last straw that broke the camel’s back. But that was enough.
Around him, after witnessing the chaotic battle that morning, everyone looked at Su Ping with pure amazement.
Even in this situation, it was clear the Wanmu Wolf had weaknesses. Its vulnerability to fire was particularly obvious, and it lacked direct, high-damage offensive skills, focusing more on crowd control and versatile development. But what other Commander Level Pet Beast, focused on raw power, could achieve such results? Clearly, none! And because there were none, was it reasonable to demand that the Wanmu Wolf also possess even greater offensive power under these circumstances? That was clearly asking too much.
Even Vice President Liu, who was beside him, let out a long breath and said, "You really gave me a big surprise, kid!"
Indeed, it was a big surprise!
A Wanmu Wolf like this, if it participated in the Breeder Contest... it might not be guaranteed to take first place, but it would definitely have a very high chance. Although this wasn’t a low-level evolution that could be easily popularized due to certain breeding costs, compared to those costs, the Wanmu Wolf’s potential was well worth it.
After a pause, Old Liu continued confidently, "When we get back to the association, I’ll keep my promise and personally apply for your Senior Breeder certificate for specializing in Forest Wolf!"
Old Liu had never, ever imagined this. He never imagined his earlier prediction would come true so quickly.
Su Ping smiled slightly. He wasn’t particularly concerned about these matters but was, instead, quite curious about the Breeder Contest. "There’s no rush for that, President Liu," he asked. "When exactly is this year’s Breeder Association conference held?"
Liu Fuhai replied without even thinking, "You haven’t paid any attention to it before, have you? It’s held every year after New Year’s Day and before Chinese New Year’s Eve. Usually, it’s all over in one day. After all, the Dragon Nation has over twenty provinces. If each province takes about ten minutes or so to present their achievements, that’s sufficient. There’s no need to fully disclose the findings, just to demonstrate the experimental process, breeding insights, and the final product!"
Su Ping blinked. "I see. I thought the results and breeding methods had to be completely shared with all viewers to qualify!"
Vice President Liu chuckled. "You wouldn’t believe it, but the original Breeder Contests indeed aimed for that. However, in doing so, breeders would hoard their secrets, and not many wanted to share publicly! Think about it, who would be willing to give away their hard-researched methods to other breeders for free? Moreover, it was later discovered that this approach wasn’t ideal. It could lead to price crashes for items and Pet Beasts, not to mention potentially causing localized unrest. Ultimately, the drawbacks outweighed the benefits.
Our Dragon Nation does have a patent fee system. However, it’s still difficult to manage such situations perfectly with that alone, so the requirements for sharing aren’t too strict here. As I mentioned, you can choose to submit your breeding method to the association. In return, the association will give you a large number of academic credits all at once! You might even receive rarer, more valuable designated resources. Additionally, any Breeder who obtains your breeding method through the association will pay you a significant share of their academic credits as a patent fee! Furthermore, breeding methods obtained from the association are strictly prohibited from being shared further; this is mandated by law. Of course, even with laws and the requirement to sign Soul Contracts, truly enforcing strict prohibition can sometimes be difficult."
Vice President Liu clarified the pros and cons. Su Ping nodded.
He was already aware of these subsequent details. But Vice President Liu was right. Human nature is inherently selfish; no one is willing to share their researched breeding methods for nothing. That’s why powerful Beast Tamers in the Secret Realms would choose to pass on their breeding methods as a legacy before their death. This was true in ancient times, and it hasn’t changed much in the modern era either.
Vice President Liu glanced at Su Ping. Just as with the Heart of Woods, he didn’t insist on anything from him, and said with a smile,

chapters.title: Chapter 186 - 134 The Last Glimmer of Light! The Mutated Wanmu Wolf!_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 186: Chapter 134 The Last Glimmer of Light! The Mutated Wanmu Wolf!_2
"So, all you have to do is show the Evolutionary Body of the Wanmu Wolf, and that’s it. You don’t need to overthink it."
Su Ping nodded. "A day’s time is easy to spare, but I need to visit the Magic Capital. I don’t want it to delay my trip."
"The Magic Capital?"
Vice President Liu was slightly startled, then asked eagerly, "Is it Xiao Xue from the Qin Family who’s asking you to go?"
Su Ping nodded.
He had told Qin Xiaoxue about Woodhead’s Evolution before. When it evolved into the Crown Wolf Emperor, he was to witness it with his own eyes.
Getting the confirmation, Vice President Liu then squinted and smiled slightly. "Then you don’t need to worry. This year’s Breeder Conference will be held in the Magic Capital..."
"Ah?"
Su Ping was engaged in a lively chat with Vice President Liu, while on the battlefield, the situation was still just as heated. Unfortunately, it wasn’t as relaxed as it was for them.
Sun Xiao had already sustained a few minor injuries. They weren’t from attacks, but purely from cuts by branches and leaves as he jumped quickly through the forest. However, now was not the time to worry about these minor wounds.
Sun Xiao looked helplessly at Er Zhuang panting heavily beside him, and at those damn sons of turtles that had trapped him in a corner with no escape.
"You bunch of bastards, winning without honor!"
"Commander Sun, the adult world only looks at outcomes, not processes."
Mo He’s expression was indifferent, but
his heart was bleeding.
Damn it! The Forest Wolf Troop’s Sun Xiao is now a lone commander. Where exactly has his Black Tiger Group’s strength gone? And now, he too is the only surviving captain of the Black Tiger Group.
The chaos of the morning’s battles, chasing the Forest Wolf Troop within these tree prison confines, had indeed killed four of their men, but the losses suffered by the other teams were many times greater.
Without a doubt, the Forest Wolf Troop has become the brightest star in this competition. Even if they aren’t first, they are certainly the most noticed and praised, because their defeat was not shameful.
Besides, with the current situation, the likelihood of the Forest Wolf Troop not taking first place is slim, unless they play dirty and don’t continue fighting, choosing to just chat until the poison circle closes in and they earn a huge load of survival Points. Only in that case would it be possible to completely overtake the Forest Wolf Troop, which is already far ahead from the morning.
But is that possible? Wouldn’t it be shameful? At this point, aside from the Forest Wolf Troop winning first place, no other team has the gall to claim it.
However, thankfully, no matter what, they’ve finally cornered the Forest Wolf Troop. Otherwise, apart from the Battle Wolf A Division, the other divisions would really have no face left.
Thinking of this, Mo He’s eyes turned stern, and he didn’t hesitate anymore. "Brothers, get ready!"
Although he wasn’t everyone’s captain, Mo He had indeed been the one leading the hunt to annihilate the Forest Wolf Troop.
Now is not the time to hesitate. In a corner like this, where the Forest Wolf Troop has no escape, we’ll attack together. We just need to eliminate this damned Forest Wolf that has thoroughly disrupted the Legion Grand Tournament, and that will be it!
Sun Xiao looked helplessly at the pouncing Netherworld Demon Tiger, Soul-eating Leopard, Demonic Shadow Leopard, Biyun Baboon, and Cloud-Patterned Tree Python, feeling somewhat resigned.
Among them, the Biyun Baboon and Cloud-Patterned Tree Python are both Wood Element Pet Beasts. It’s quite apparent that in this kind of jungle, besides their strong Racial Potential, Wood Element Pet Beasts have relatively stronger self-preservation abilities.
Damn it, no martial ethics! Er Zhuang barely has any Energy left to continue the upcoming battle. And these damn sons of turtles are attacking together!
Sun Xiao’s eyes darted. "Commander Deng, among those who are left, after my Forest Wolf Troop is out, it will be your Shadow Leopard Group with only two combatants left. I’m afraid after they eliminate me, it will be your turn to suffer! How about we join forces, eliminate them first, and then I’ll willingly concede the championship to you? What do you say?"
As soon as these words were spoken, everyone’s gaze immediately turned to Commander Deng, but the latter simply said, "No need. Among us who are left, there’s no winner. Eliminating the Forest Wolf Troop first is the best outcome."
"HUMPH! Still trying to sow discord? Go to hell!"
"ROAR!"
The Netherworld Demon Tiger roared and pounced straight towards Sun Xiao. Resigned, Sun Xiao took out his life signs watch.
However, just as he was about to trigger the life signs watch, a piercing howl came from the side!
"AWOOO!"
The Wolf Howl made Sun Xiao pause. He looked towards his own Pet Beast.
Clearly, the Wolf Tribe is the most arrogant Pet Beast Race. Such Wolf Tribe Pet Beasts would not accept conceding without a final, desperate battle.
So, sensing its master’s gaze and the approaching ferocious tiger, Er Zhuang still moved!
Even without the Sun to activate the Solar Formula for Rapid Recovery of its strength, Er Zhuang’s body was not completely drained. It still possessed a Wood body, the sharpest of claws and fangs, and...
At that moment, a light shone forth. The pouncing Netherworld Demon Tiger and Biyun Baboon both experienced a blinding flash, as if a powerful light threatened to sear their eyes.
Subsequently, it was a different story for the Netherworld Demon Tiger. The power of its Dark Element was clearly demonstrated, as the Blinding Technique had an extremely minimal effect on it.

chapters.title: Chapter 187 - 134 The Last Glimmer of Light! The Mutated Wanmu Wolf!_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 187: Chapter 134 The Last Glimmer of Light! The Mutated Wanmu Wolf!_3
However, the Biyun Baboon was clearly hit hard. A bright light flashed before it, blinding it completely. Erzhuang, ignoring the other Pet Beasts, charged straight forward, its sharp claws landing directly on the Biyun Baboon’s body.
Its claws pierced several bloody holes. Then, with a final surge of Energy, entwining branches formed Wood Spikes and thorny vines, shooting straight for the Biyun Baboon’s Beast Tamer!
[Tree Ape Troop member: Cheng Yuan, you have been eliminated. Current Tree Ape Troop Points: 72. Please immediately restrain your Pet Beast and wait on site or withdraw from the battlefield!]
At this final moment, another Beast Tamer was eliminated?
With the Tree Ape Troop’s leader’s face turning even darker, everyone else’s expression became priceless.
"Damn it, how many more tricks does this Forest Wolf’s Evolutionary Body have up its sleeve? Another Skill has popped up; what is this Skill now?"
"Blinding? Creating a bright light to blind the enemy to some extent."
"What? Isn’t this Skill unique to special Attribute Light Series Pet Beasts? How come Nature Type ones have it?"
"Who knows? If someone had told you before that the Forest Wolf Troop could win the championship in the tournament, would you have believed it?"
"True, damn, that Breeder kid is a freak."
"Luckily, it’s finally over."
Even if they could ultimately eliminate that Biyun Baboon, the final outcome would still remain unchanged. And that was indeed the case.
Sun Xiao managed to evade the Pet Beasts’ attack trajectories with several quick dodges. However, it was obvious that Erzhuang, having fought strenuously to protect its master, was now covered in wounds.
Even on its chest, there were wounds deep enough to expose bone.
It was over!
Even Sun Xiao thought so.
Because not only was Erzhuang exhausted, but he, too, had no strength left to dodge. Although a Beast Tamer’s physical strength was much greater than that of an ordinary person, they did not rely on this for their livelihood. Not to mention Erzhuang’s current state.
However, this time Sun Xiao did not attempt to activate his Life-Signs Watch preemptively.
If Erzhuang wished to die standing, then so be it; let the opponent’s attack decide!
And so, Sun Xiao went directly to the side of Erzhuang, who was panting heavily. He gently rubbed its eyelids, which were so heavy they seemed to fight to stay open, as Erzhuang continuously let out whimpering sounds.
Then, facing the surging dark tide from the Netherworld Demon Tiger, Sun Xiao closed his eyes.
However, after waiting a full three seconds, the voice from the Life-Signs Watch announcing elimination, which Sun Xiao had been expecting, never came.
He opened his eyes in astonishment, only to freeze slightly in surprise.
Erzhuang’s body was standing in front of him.
Obviously, such a competition would not involve life and death; his own Pet Beast understood this clearly. So, the kind of touching scene often witnessed on real battlefields—a pet beast senselessly blocking a fatal blow for its master—would never occur in a competition like this.
So, what did this mean?
What was happening?
Not only Sun Xiao but also Mo He and the other team members were dumbfounded. Everyone watching the scene unfold on the live broadcast was equally shocked.
Was it really necessary?
It’s just a competition, not a fight to the death; was such a gesture necessary?
Besides, even if it blocked one attack, the final outcome wouldn’t change, right?
Even Su Ping blinked. Subconsciously, he felt a bit anxious.
Damn it, could there have been a problem with his training and Cultivation before?
Had he not trained Erzhuang properly, causing it to become rigid and wooden-headed at this moment?
If so, it was possible that Erzhuang had failed to grasp reality, its mind becoming dull.
The question was, the other Wanmu Wolves didn’t have this issue, and they all trained together. Could it be that Erzhuang had done fewer math problems or skimped on its training?
Su Ping’s heart drummed with unease.
However, the next moment brought a sudden turn!
On the huge live broadcast screen, the Wanmu Wolf standing before Sun Xiao slowly began to emit a glow. It started from the Y-shaped antlers on its head; they lit up as if electrified, resembling two incandescent columns of light!
In the next moment, to everyone’s utter astonishment, it seemed as if a ray of sunshine had pierced through the dark clouds—which weren’t actually all that thick—in the overcast Sky Dome, shining down upon Erzhuang.
In this dim world, from this seemingly insignificant little wolf, a final, faint glimmer of light seemed to bloom.
Su Ping seemed to suddenly realize something, his eyes widening. Incredulously, he stared at the scene unfolding on the screen.

chapters.title: Chapter 188 - 135: Super-Rank? The Final Result of the Solar Formula?
chapters.content:
Chapter 188: Chapter 135: Super-Rank? The Final Result of the Solar Formula?
It wasn’t just Su Ping. At this moment, everyone’s eyes were wide, staring at the scene unfolding before them. They watched the Wanmu Wolf, cornered and facing imminent doom, to see what kind of last-resort card it could still play, what kind of trick it could pull off at this critical juncture.
Clearly, they believed the Wanmu Wolf still had some unknown skills up its sleeve, which it had chosen this moment to finally use. But at this instant, perhaps only Su Ping might have guessed what was truly happening, what the situation entailed. However, at this time, he naturally had no leisure or mood to explain anything to the others. Unblinkingly, he focused on the dramatic scene playing out on the screen.
Light! Er Zhuang’s transformation at this moment was startling. Not only Sun Xiao but even Mo He and the others in front of him were dumbfounded. Then, almost in that very instant, everyone, including the Netherworld Demon Tiger that had just been attacking, decisively chose to flee! There was no choice. The closer it came to this moment, the more cautious they had to be. Previously, they had witnessed the uncanny and terrifying capabilities of this Forest Wolf Evolver. Not to mention, the extent of the Tree Realm Prison and those seemingly conjured-from-thin-air skills had truly left them somewhat PTSD-stricken. So, upon seeing that the Forest Wolf Evolver had undergone another strange change, their first reaction was to beat a hasty retreat.
As it turned out, had they made the right choice again?
Er Zhuang, at this moment, looked so different that even Sun Xiao blinked in confusion, a sense of unfamiliarity washing over him. Even the other members of the Forest Wolf Troop, who had been moved from the battlefield but allowed to continue watching, blurted out astonished curses, staring at the screen in disbelief. Because at this moment, Er Zhuang seemed utterly foreign to them.
The Wanmu Wolf was already quite extraordinary, especially in terms of appearance. The Y-shaped antlers resembling tree branches and the foliage-like fur draped all over it meant that if one didn’t look at its head, it hardly resembled a Wolf Pet anymore. While not exactly imposing or dominating, it possessed an indescribable sense of depth and substance.
But at this instant, Er Zhuang, before everyone’s eyes, transformed yet again. A bright light, starting from its antlers, spread all over its body. The Wanmu Wolf, at this moment, connected with the singular, faint ray of sunlight pouring down from the sky and burst into a gentle glow. This glow wasn’t like the effect of a Blinding Technique. It was soft, yet it permeated its entire body with light. Its body seemed to become translucent, and the draping branch-like fur turned into a fusion of gold and white—a color reminiscent of white gold. Even its eyes turned slightly pale.
Looking at the Wanmu Wolf before them, their own Er Zhuang, Sun Xiao was bewildered. Su Ping was also bewildered. All the eliminated warriors were bewildered. Except for Li Da, who hadn’t yet been evacuated from the field, the Forest Wolf Troop’s other three members were also stunned.
What the hell was all this?
Did their own Forest Wolf have this skill?
They hadn’t heard Breeder Su mention this before!
Even they had no idea what capabilities it possessed in this state. But, without a doubt, such a dramatic transformation, once it occurred, was definitely not for show.
Indeed, this seemed to be the case. Sun Xiao stared at Er Zhuang before him. However, Er Zhuang was not looking back at its master, Sun Xiao. Instead, its gaze was directed towards the other Beast Tamers and their Pet Beasts who had fled into the building.
In that moment, the Wanmu Wolf, enveloped by the only sliver of available sunlight, seemed to be the sole protagonist spotlighted on a pitch-dark stage. Above in the sky, a streak of golden light from behind the clouds connected with Er Zhuang.
The entire legion, including Zhao Deguang and the general beside him, were intently watching the solitary figure on the screen. They also wanted to see what other tricks this peculiar Forest Wolf Evolver could pull off at such a time. And the outcome did not disappoint them.
Er Zhuang’s slightly pale eyes let out a very deep, whining sound. Suddenly, a radiance as brilliant as the break of dawn surged from the antlered branches atop its head, striking directly towards the building where the remaining Beast Tamers had hidden!
The spectacle was beyond description! Su Ping, with his 82 points in the Chinese language college entrance examination from his previous life, found himself unable to articulate the scene before his eyes.
The light instantaneously illuminated the entire broadcast. This was true for Sun Xiao’s live feed and for the views of other Beast Tamers looking their way. An endless radiance, as if a miniature sun had burst open on the spot; though it lacked the sun’s terrifying flames, it carried a blazing brilliance and the substantive impact of concentrated light!
BOOM!
A colossal rumbling sound exploded at the epicenter of the battlefield. The fully realistic tall building, under such an impact, instantly broke apart. The earth shook and mountains trembled!
Apart from this tumultuous chaos, there were only a few crisp BANG! BANG! BANG! sounds! Those were the sounds of the shields activating on the life-sign wristwatches of all the Beast Tamers present. This wasn’t limited to Mo He and the others; it appeared Sun Xiao’s shield had activated as well.

chapters.title: Chapter 189 - 135 Super-Rank? The Final Result of the Solar Formula?_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 189: Chapter 135 Super-Rank? The Final Result of the Solar Formula?_2
However, besides these, there was also a cry of alarm:
"Er Zhuang!"
Beyond that, the entire live broadcast screen had gone silent.
Not a glimmer of light or shadow appeared again.
Clearly, the final burst of light had utterly destroyed even the life-sign monitoring capabilities of the smartwatches. All live broadcast footage had vanished. The screens turned black, displaying no signal.
What exactly had happened?
At this moment, no one knew, not even what that last scene truly was.
They subconsciously turned their heads to look at a lone figure in the corner not far away. It was that figure who had created such a monster, who had raised such a Pet Beast.
Now, what exactly had this Pet Beast done under such circumstances? Unquestionably, asking the instigator seemed the most direct approach.
However, facing everyone’s gaze, including Liu Fuhai beside him and Qin Erlong, who had similarly not processed what had just happened, Su Ping closed his eyes, as if he hadn’t seen their looks at all.
If it had been any other time, these people would have already demanded answers in frustration. Who could keep them in suspense like this?
But not now.
Over the past two days, every appearance and action of the Wanmu Wolf had been shattering their imaginations, challenging their cognition. Right up until now, they found it impossible to describe this strange Wanmu Wolf with words.
Is this damn thing a Commander Level Pet Beast?
Who the hell would believe you?
Whose Commander Level Pet Beast could single-handedly eliminate enemies several times their number in a chaotic battle? And whose Commander Level Pet Beast could unleash such terrifying power at the last moment?
So, what exactly had this Breeder done? Although no one knew, no one dared to hasten him either. They even subconsciously believed that Su Ping’s closed eyes indicated his satisfaction with this Wanmu Wolf, a sign that he had everything under control.
Yet, no one saw Su Ping’s fist trembling inside his sleeve.
Indeed!
He knew it!
At this moment, Su Ping was exceptionally certain, absolutely positive, that his previous ideas were indeed correct! The formula he had realized—ever since he began the Cultivation of the Wanmu Wolf and Old Sha started to change, initiating its Evolution—was absolutely correct!
That bizarre Sunlight Formula.
It had become the most direct reason for the Wanmu Wolf’s current terrifying state. Otherwise, without the Sunlight Energy Transformation formula formed by Heart of Woods, Sunlight Absorption, and Photosynthesis, the Wanmu Wolf might still be extraordinary, but it would essentially be just that.
It wasn’t that Su Ping was being harsh—it was simply the truth!
Without the bug-like effects of the Sunlight Formula for energy transformation, the Wanmu Wolf wouldn’t have had enough Energy to maintain such control with the Tree Prison, let alone unleash a forest torrent effect akin to the Advent of the Tree Realm. The Tree Prison’s duration probably wouldn’t have exceeded half an hour.
Thus, the Wanmu Wolf’s Racial Potential and inherent strength, while top-notch, definitely couldn’t exceed those of the elite Pet Beast Evolutionary Bodies in this arena by too much. Those who made it into the competition arena were all Evolutionary Bodies from top-tier Cultivation!
In the end, it was still the inclusion of its own Heart of Woods Skill that led to such a transformative change.
From the beginning, Su Ping had calculated the special combination of this skill formula. However, the ultimate result was merely the rapid absorption and transformed application of Solar Power. The qualitative change he had calculated had never occurred.
But now, Su Ping felt he had seen it!
Indeed, once the local skill levels of these three energy-transformation Skills achieved consistency, an unimaginable metamorphosis would occur. And just now, Er Zhuang, who seemed to have become light itself, was the best proof.
Only Liu Fuhai beside him might have noticed Su Ping’s anomaly at this moment.
Similarly, among all present, only Liu Fuhai and a few other Breeders could guess what had happened based on such subtle clues.
Liu Fuhai was one. Rong Qiu, sitting with the invited Breeders, was also one.
At this moment, Rong Qiu, the indifferent woman from Beiyuan Province wearing a black robe, looked at the screen that had turned pitch-dark, and for the first time, her facial control slipped. Her red lips parted in disbelief, staring fixedly at the dark screen, as if trying to glimpse once more that horrifying scene from the blackness, and to suppress the raging tempest and roars within her heart:
What kind of monstrous son has that old scoundrel Su Anyong managed to raise?
Meanwhile, Ding Yan took a deep breath. He finally swallowed hard. However, it was clear that this newly promoted Senior Breeder didn’t grasp the significance of what had just happened as vividly.
Only those Breeders who genuinely understood and had gleaned some insight into what had truly transpired were left utterly stunned.

chapters.title: Chapter 190 - 135 Super-Rank? The Final Result of the Solar Formula?_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 190: Chapter 135 Super-Rank? The Final Result of the Solar Formula?_3
But as Breeders, they could still understand that the combat strength and potential of the Wanmu Wolf were enough to prove Su Ping’s excellence.
For a moment, the scene was somewhat frozen. However, just then, someone suddenly exclaimed, "No, there’s one more person left!" Indeed, at the very edge of their field of vision, a display screen was still lit. The next moment, without needing any command, this sole remaining screen took over the largest central spot, instantly drawing everyone’s gaze.
Ling Peng cautiously looked toward the not-too-distant location. This last captain of the Snow Wolf Group had managed to survive until the very end.
In the chaotic battle that had just transpired, although the Snow Wolf Group primarily focused on harassment, by standing on the same side as the Forest Wolf Troop, they had suffered an unprecedented blow. This assault had decimated the Snow Wolf Group, leaving only Captain Ling, who had fled in the confusion.
Ling Peng reassured himself that he had done his duty to the Forest Wolf Troop. When he got out, he should be able to explain himself to Chief Lin and the Troop Leader.
So, under these circumstances, lasting a little longer means a few more survival points. Perhaps a critical ranking could come down to this one or two-point difference?
But just then, Ling Peng, who had already retreated to the outermost edge of the battlefield’s center, saw a huge flash of light flicker in the city center. The next instant, even from the city’s outskirts, he heard a deafeningly terrifying sound and felt the ground tremble violently.
This vibration and this noise made Ling Peng feel immensely relieved about his retreat.
If I had been at the very center, who knows how I would have ended up?
Luckily, he had run fast.
But intense curiosity also compelled Ling Peng to look back towards the city center.
What on earth happened there?
He glanced at his life signs watch. The personnel status displayed on it hadn’t changed at all.
What’s going on?
he wondered.
With such a huge commotion, not a single person was eliminated?
Finally, Ling Peng gritted his teeth. With his Cold Water Wolf, which had somewhat recovered, he rushed rapidly towards the city center.
After the immense vibration, an eerie silence descended. The entire city was as quiet as a ghost town. Signs of battle were visible everywhere: solidified tree branches, burned-out buildings, and shattered walls and streets. These were the remnants of the previous melee, but now, not a whisper could be heard.
The footage followed Ling Peng’s perspective closely, making everyone’s heart race.
Don’t tell me they were all wiped out just like that?
they thought.
If that’s the case, it would be utterly outrageous! These are the elites of each team! If these elites were to die or be injured in the competition, it would be a tremendous loss.
Especially concerning that last event, the Forest Wolf’s Evolutionary Body. Theoretically, the one who activated the skill should be fine. Moreover, the life signs watch’s shield is supposed to withstand the power of a Monarch Level skill. But you can never rule out the unexpected. After all, Sun Xiao’s final cry before the live broadcast screen went black was deeply concerning.
"Damn it, what’s this kid dawdling for? Why isn’t he moving faster?" one of the commanders grumbled.
"Besides this kid, there are no other teams left. What’s he still trying to outlast?" another added.
"Chief Lin, how do you usually instruct your soldiers? How can he still be so timid at a time like this? This won’t do!"
Even the Legion’s Chief of Staff beside them turned unhappily to look at Lin Lei. Clearly, Ling Peng’s manner of slowly, almost stealthily, inching forward toward the center was getting on their nerves. The entire Legion was watching this unfold. Damn it, all the top brass throughout the Legion saw Ling Peng’s pathetic, creeping advance, as if he were tailing someone.
Lin Lei felt aggrieved.
Is this really something to be scolded for?
he thought.
In the Legion, especially in live combat exercises, isn’t being too careless and losing a tactical opportunity the biggest taboo? Ling Peng is being cautious; no matter how you look at it, that should be considered reasonable, shouldn’t it?
But what could Lin Lei say? Under the watchful, unfriendly gazes of the Chief of Staff and several other curious commanders, Lin Lei could only begrudgingly lower his head.
However, he was also irritated internally.
The Sand Wolf Troop was too bold and reckless, while Ling Peng of the Snow Wolf Group is indeed too timid. It isn’t just the front-row commanders who are curious; I, Chief Lin, am also uncontrollably curious! Who wouldn’t be? After all, my own soldier is now in the limelight. What exactly is going on? How could I not be curious?
But there was nothing he could do at this moment. It had to be said that, aside from the emergence of the Wanmu Wolf which had amazed the entire Legion, and the five elites of the Forest Wolf Troop, the person currently leaving the deepest impression on the commanders was Ling Peng, inching so hesitantly towards the very center.
It just remains to be seen what Ling Peng himself will think of all this later.
Fortunately, the small city itself wasn’t very large. After an agonizing wait as Ling Peng traversed several blocks, the man and wolf finally approached the city center, having come from the outskirts.
However, upon witnessing the scene before him, Ling Peng’s jaw dropped. His first instinct was that he had to be seeing things.

chapters.title: Chapter 191 - 135 Super-Rank? The Final Result of the Solar Formula?_4
chapters.content:
Chapter 191: Chapter 135 Super-Rank? The Final Result of the Solar Formula?_4
What did he see?
A ten-story building had collapsed right before his eyes.
Amidst the building’s shattered ruins, several fluorescent shields flickered, their protective effects appearing rather fragile. This was because the Beast Tamers and Pet Beasts within those light shields were either unconscious or had apparently been recalled to their Beast Taming Spaces.
What the hell is this?
Ling Peng thought.
Could Beast Tamers from a neighboring country have attacked? Or had those damn logistics team members deployed some Monarch Level Pet Beast on this battlefield? Otherwise, what the heck is going on with this ground? It looks like it’s been carpet-bombed!
Ling Peng pursed his lips; he actually didn’t quite dare to get closer.
To directly bypass the protective capabilities of the life-monitoring watch’s shield and instantly knock out Beast Tamers and their Pet Beasts—just how terrifyingly powerful was that force? What if it wasn’t over yet?
However, it was quite clear that Ling Peng was still hesitating. But someone had finally grown impatient. Previously, hesitation might have been understandable, but now, what was there to think twice about?
So, the chief of staff directly entered his authorization at his station. Suddenly, the chief of staff’s voice sounded on Ling Peng’s life-monitoring watch:
"Battalion Commander Ling Peng of the Snow Wolf Group, please hurry to confirm the situation of the Forest Wolf Troop and the other comrades. The logistics team and medical team have already been dispatched at top speed. Please, if conditions permit, do your utmost to ensure the safety of all comrades and their Pet Beasts!"
The voice jolted Ling Peng. He snapped to attention, saluted the air, and declared, "Yes, Sir!"
He finally led his Cold Water Wolf and jogged over, quickly checking each person and Pet Beast.
The final result allowed everyone to breathe a sigh of relief: "Reporting to the Chief, all comrades are merely unconscious. No life-threatening injuries have been found so far. Only this Forest Wolf seems to have completely exhausted its energy and sustained some injuries."
PHEW...
Even Su Ping could hear the collective long sighs of relief. Obviously, this outcome had put everyone’s minds at ease, Su Ping included.
But his gaze, through Ling Peng’s perspective, remained fixed on Erzhuang’s condition. Erzhuang had reverted to its previous appearance. Yet, even just through the live broadcast, Su Ping could sense that Erzhuang was likely in a terrible state—weakened to an unimaginable degree.
Had Erzhuang truly mastered that strange power just now?
Su Ping wondered.
Could it be that such power is unlocked once three Skills simultaneously reach Mastery Level?
The problem was, Erzhuang had never displayed such an ability before—not in previous training, nor in any other scenario. Unfortunately, there were too few samples. The only somewhat comparable case was Xiao Qiang, whose three Sun Formula skills had reached Proficient Level.
But there were still differences between Erzhuang and the other Wanmu Wolves. The Mastery Level Sun Formula itself, and its mastery of the Blinding Technique—these were abilities the other Wanmu Wolves lacked. These were Erzhuang’s advantages.
And looking at it, Erzhuang’s activation just now was very likely a flash in the pan; he probably hasn’t fully mastered it yet,
Su Ping mused.
With those thoughts, his concern for their immediate safety eased, and Su Ping once again fell into deep contemplation. He knew he had work to do again, even though this task was already part of his plans.
But I have to figure it out!
he resolved.
I must even enable my Wanmu Wolves to fully master such a miraculous ability!
Because, compared to the Wanmu Wolf’s evolutionary cultivation method, which was directly perfected by the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, this peculiar Sun Formula was the true fruit of Su Ping’s own research.
Liu Fuhai observed Su Ping, who was lost in thought. He opened his mouth, but ultimately couldn’t resist asking in a somewhat conflicted tone, "The formula for the Super-Rank Skill... it’s still not perfect, is it?"

chapters.title: Chapter 192 - 136: First-Class Merit? Honorary Major Su Ping!
chapters.content:
Chapter 192: Chapter 136: First-Class Merit? Honorary Major Su Ping!
"Hmm?" Su Ping turned his head and glanced at Liu Fuhai, whose face was marked with a peculiar expression.
A Super-Rank Skill? What Super-Rank Skill?
Blinking, Su Ping quickly came to his senses and looked at Vice President Liu with amazement. "Is this the cultivation of a Super-Rank Skill?"
Vice President Liu pursed his lips, the corners of his mouth twitching slightly. He didn’t answer Su Ping’s question. Instead, he looked up to the heavens, speechless and choked with emotion.
Super-Rank Skills were the domain and expertise of Breeding Masters. Only those who had truly perfected the cultivation of Super-Rank Skills and made breakthroughs in the path of cultivation could rightfully be called Breeding Masters. But what exactly was the concept of a Super-Rank Skill?
It’s too difficult!
As the saying goes, not every Emperor-Level Pet Beast even has the opportunity to master a Super-Rank Skill. The effects and power of Super-Rank Skills far exceeded those of ordinary skills, sometimes even defying common sense. Of course, Super-Rank Skills also varied in strength.
For so many years, Vice President Liu’s research into Super-Rank Skills had never ceased, not even for a moment! Especially in the past two years, he had focused his entire being on the Super-Rank Skill cultivation for the Icefang Whitewolf. Yet, he still hadn’t achieved the slightest result. The specific combination of Skill Modules, intended to produce an extraordinary synergistic effect, stubbornly refused to undergo a qualitative transformation. This highlighted just how difficult it was to cultivate Super-Rank Skills through nurturing.
But what about this situation right now?
Vice President Liu could clearly and distinctly feel that the Wanmu Wolf’s ability was incredibly powerful, almost beyond comprehension. Its final outburst, in particular, made him one hundred percent certain.
This was the Skill Module of a Super-Rank Skill!
Yet this blasted kid looked completely clueless, asking him such an exasperating question.
However, Vice President Liu knew Su Ping might not actually be pretending. For countless Breeders, the cultivation of Super-Rank Skills was undoubtedly an enigma. This was because very few people truly knew how Super-Rank Skills were actually cultivated into existence. During his lectures, Vice President Liu had only ever scratched the surface of the subject. Never mind Intermediate Level Breeders; even some Advanced Level Breeders had limited understanding of Super-Rank Skill cultivation.
Watching the live feed as the logistics and medical teams carried away the fainted Beast Tamers, marking a rather unique conclusion to the match, Vice President Liu paused. Eventually, he couldn’t resist asking, "If you didn’t know, how did you discover it?"
Su Ping genuinely hadn’t been very clear on the matter before. He only knew that, according to theory, skills formed using the ’Solar Formula’ were supposed to undergo a qualitative change. However, he had never imagined that this change would be of *this* nature.
A Super-Rank Skill? So, does this mean the ultimate composition of the Solar Formula results in a Super-Rank Skill?
Hearing Old Liu’s question, Su Ping didn’t hide anything. The Wanmu Wolf had been born from his own hands; he was the origin, so Su Ping wasn’t worried. He also trusted Old Liu’s character.
As it turned out, he had trusted a bit too soon. An internal struggle was evident on Old Liu’s face before he finally sighed helplessly and said in a low voice, "Apart from me, this matter can, at most, be mentioned to Qin Erlong and Miss Qin. No one else must disclose it recklessly. In a little while, I’ll have a word with Zhao Deguang. I’ll get everyone who witnessed this battle to sign a partial non-disclosure agreement."
Su Ping was taken aback. He eyed the old fellow suspiciously, "Is it really necessary? Is it that serious?"
Old Liu glanced at this clueless brat who completely failed to grasp the gravity of the situation and shook his head helplessly. "Although it’s highly probable that your discovery was largely due to good luck, I’m worried that some people with ulterior motives might not see it that way. Of course, right now, probably not many people understand what truly happened, but it’s always better to be safe than sorry!"
Su Ping genuinely had no idea what this ’just in case’ scenario entailed.
But Vice President Liu understood better than anyone. This ’just in case’ referred to an event twenty years prior to Su Ping. A man had risen from obscurity to fame in one fell swoop, his key to success being the cultivation of the Sand-Eating Jiao and its Super-Rank Skill, ’Quicksand Stomach.’ He was the current Master of the Holy Dragon of the Dragon Nation. After his ascension, his sweeping reforms over just a few years had, if not turned the Dragon Nation completely upside down, then at least thoroughly revitalized it.
Vice President Liu was also more aware than anyone of how the ancient, established families, those with lineages stretching back to antiquity, gritted their teeth in hatred at this Master of the Holy Dragon, yet were powerless against him.
Therefore, the Dragon Nation could not allow another new Master of the Holy Dragon to emerge.
Even if the possibility was minuscule—perhaps only one in ten, or even one in a hundred—after all, just because their breakthrough creations were similar didn’t mean their subsequent growth and achievements would also be comparable. But again, one had to prepare for the unexpected. He believed those ancient families felt the same way.
Fortunately.
Vice President Liu looked around. He realized that very few people truly understood what had happened; it was too complex for most to grasp. For the vast majority, the Wanmu Wolf’s final burst was merely an incredibly powerful trump card, a burst-type skill.
Nothing more. As a Breeder himself, he just needed to steer the conversation in that direction later. Naturally, no one would then consider other possibilities.

chapters.title: Chapter 193 - 136: First-Class Merit? Honorary Major Su Ping!_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 193: Chapter 136: First-Class Merit? Honorary Major Su Ping!_2
Super-Rank Skills are something countless Beast Tamers dream of but can never attain.
"Remember, don’t tell anyone about this. If you’re going to announce it, do it at the Breeder Convention. Got it?"
Seeing Old Liu’s stern expression, Su Ping belatedly realized that what he had created seemed a bit more incredible than he had anticipated.
Su Ping nodded.
Liu Fuhai did not say anything more. Vice President Liu, who seemed to have been just making casual remarks, returned to his jovially encouraging demeanor, watching the final tally of scores on the screen.
The Military Strategist’s voice rang out after the last few stunned Beast Tamers were carried out, "The Legion Tournament has ended! The tournament is successfully completed, and rankings will be based on points!"
Under the holy light emanating from the medical Pet Beasts—especially from the ’Holy Bamboo’ which had reached Monarch Level—all the Legion Beast Tamers who had fainted eventually regained consciousness, including Sun Xiao.
He looked around blankly, then seemed to recall something. Only after seeing that Er Zhuang, too, had recovered, did he breathe a sigh of relief.
However, Sun Xiao soon noticed a problem with Er Zhuang’s Level.
Er Zhuang was previously Commander Sixth Order, but after waking up this time, its Level had dropped to Commander Fifth Stage? A regression in Realm?
Sun Xiao thought back to the last scene again.
What exactly was that?
He didn’t know. He feared this question could only be answered by asking Su Ping, the Breeder, later.
However, the Legion’s final announcement would not cease just for his thoughts.
The Military Strategist’s voice rose again from above, "Next, we will proceed with the ranking and award ceremony. Teams and their commanders whose names are called, please come up to the stage to receive their awards!"
"First place, Forest Wolf Troop! Awarded a Group Second-Class Merit, and an Individual Second-Class Merit for each member! Each person is awarded 8,000 Battle Merit Points!"
There was no doubt; the first place in the tournament went undisputed. The performance of the Forest Wolf Troop and that mysterious Evolutionary Body had thoroughly conquered everyone. They had completely overpowered everyone else. If anyone other than the Forest Wolf Troop had taken first place, it would have been unbelievable.
And the reward had everyone green with envy.
Not only a group merit, but each member also receives an individual Second-Class Merit?
This was a bargaining chip for promotion. Perhaps soon, these individuals’ official ranks could climb yet another level. Besides, 8,000 Battle Merit Points was an unimaginably large amount.
"Second place, Black Tiger Group! Awarded a Group Third-Class Merit, and an Individual Third-Class Merit for each member! Each person is awarded 5,000 Battle Merit Points!"
Undoubtedly, the reward for second place was significantly lower.
"Third place, Shadow Leopard Group! Awarded a Group Third-Class Merit, and an Individual Third-Class Merit for each member! Each person is awarded 3,000 Battle Merit Points!"
In contrast, the difference in reward between third and second place wasn’t that large.
"Fourth place, Snow Wolf Group! Awarded an Individual Third-Class Merit for each member! Each person is awarded 1,500 Battle Merit Points!"
The fourth-place winner, however, was a surprise to everyone. The Snow Wolf Group!
The Snow Wolf Group was the team that survived until the end. So, by adding points for their number of survivors (calculated as survivors multiplied by 10) to their base score, and then gaining another 10 points, they managed to surpass the Bull Python Group and Tree Ape Group, which had only a small point gap with them. Thus, they secured fourth place.
"Fifth place, Tree Ape Group..."
Eventually, the five teams and their respective commanders took the stage.
It was evident from Zhang Lie’s face, which was beaming with a smile more radiant than yesterday’s sunshine. Unfortunately, no one was inclined to acknowledge him.
After they stepped down, everyone shifted their attention to the next figures about to appear on stage. The Legion had long made promises. For this outsourced Cultivation, the Breeders who placed in the rankings would also receive a reward from the military. And now was undoubtedly the time to present the awards.
They had little interest in the other Breeders, but among them was one whose name had become thunderously well-known over the past two days: Su Ping! At the mere age of eighteen or nineteen, he had bred a completely new Evolutionary Body for the Forest Wolf. And this new Evolutionary Body had performed spectacularly in this Legion Tournament. Anyone could tell that in the future, Su Ping’s name would likely spread, especially in Jianghai Province and even among certain circles in the eastern provinces.
Unfortunately, Su Ping hadn’t been sitting with the other Breeders; he was seated elsewhere. This made it difficult for those Breeders who had intended to approach him—whether to get acquainted, build connections, or even poach him with ill intentions—to make their move. Of course, perhaps Vice President Liu had sensed the malicious intent of these individuals and had made preparations in advance.
Sure enough, they didn’t have to wait long, as the Military Strategist’s voice quickly rose again: "Next, I invite Breeder Su Ping from the Forest Wolf Troop, Breeder Mo Tu from the Black Tiger Group, Breeder Bai Ying from the Shadow Leopard Group, Breeder Ms. Rong Qiu from the Snow Wolf Group, and Breeder Li Senlin from the Tree Ape Group to come to the stage."
Su Ping stood up from his seat. Under the strange gazes of everyone present, and unlike the other Breeders, he quickly reached the Military Strategist’s side in just three steps.

chapters.title: Chapter 194 - 136: First-Class Merit? Honorary Major Su Ping!_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 194: Chapter 136: First-Class Merit? Honorary Major Su Ping!_3
Even this individual was momentarily taken aback but quickly composed himself, offering a faint smile without saying anything.
Only after all five had arrived did this individual’s voice ring out again:
"General Zhao, please present the awards to the outstanding Breeders who have cooperated with the Legion!"
Zhao Deguang stood up and approached them.
However, this time, he started with the last Breeder, a man named Li Senlin!
"Tree Ape Group Breeder Li Senlin, for cultivating the Biyun Baboon, which enabled the Tree Ape Group’s elite team to achieve the commendable fifth-place result. Therefore, the Legion awards a Third-Class Merit Medal and an exchange quota of 5,000 Legion Battle Merit Points! Furthermore, you may cooperate with the Legion in the future and will have priority in recommending suitable members to join the Legion!"
The rewards were already quite good, and there was even a Third-Class Merit Medal! However, it was apparent that the Breeder named Li Senlin was still slightly disappointed.
"Snow Wolf Group Breeder Rong Qiu, for cultivating the Cold Water Wolf, which enabled the Snow Wolf Group’s elite team to secure the commendable fourth-place result. Therefore, the Legion awards a Third-Class Merit Medal and an exchange quota of 10,000 Legion Battle Merit Points! Furthermore, you may cooperate with the Legion in the future and will have priority in recommending suitable members to join the Legion!"
Zhao Deguang handed the Third-Class Merit Medal to Rong Qiu, saying with a smile, "Congratulations, Miss Rong Qiu."
Rong Qiu’s expression remained remarkably calm; she merely nodded.
Su Ping, looking on from the side, was somewhat surprised.
This Breeder from Beiyuan Province knew people from the Legion?
But Su Ping couldn’t be bothered to dwell on it.
"Shadow Leopard Group Breeder Bai Ying, the Legion awards a Third-Class Merit Medal and an exchange quota of 8,000 Legion Battle Merit Points! Additionally, after deliberation by the Legion, you are awarded the honorary rank of Lieutenant in the Legion! You will enjoy all the benefits of an officer of that rank and may join the Legion at any time. Upon joining, your honorary rank can be promoted by one level!"
Instantly, as Zhao Deguang spoke, countless gazes filled with envy and admiration turned towards the man in his thirties named Bai Ying.
Ultimately, in this Legion competition, what mattered most to them as Breeders was this honorary military rank!
This was the primary reason all the Breeders had come.
Unfortunately, it seemed only Breeders who made it into the top three were eligible.
To enjoy all the Legion’s benefits without needing to train or undertake missions—who could refuse such a fantastic deal of reaping rewards without the work?
Not to mention, if they wished, they could join the Legion at any time, and their military rank could continue to rise.
Of course, most people probably wouldn’t choose to join directly; reaping benefits without the associated duties was the dream.
For a Senior Breeder like Bai Ying, joining the Legion merely as a Captain wouldn’t be appealing anyway.
Without giving the others too much time for envy or resentment, Zhao Deguang then approached Mo Tu.
"Black Tiger Group Breeder Mo Tu, the Legion awards a Second-Class Merit Medal and an exchange quota of 8,000 Legion Battle Merit Points! Additionally, after deliberation by the Legion, you are awarded the honorary rank of Captain in the Legion! You will enjoy all the benefits of an officer of that rank and may join the Legion at any time. Upon joining, your honorary rank can be promoted by one level!"
"Thank you, General Zhao!"
Mo Tu was a man in his sixties, but he showed no signs of old age, clearly possessing considerable Beast Tamer strength. Moreover, he seemed to be acquainted with this General Zhao, lacking the usual reserve of ordinary people.
Finally, Zhao Deguang’s steps slowly brought him before Su Ping.
Even Su Ping instinctively held his breath.
It was finally his turn.
Everyone’s gaze followed, settling on Su Ping.
They also wanted to know what kind of reward Su Ping, such a young Breeder and the champion of this first Legion Grand Tournament, would receive from the Legion.
A First-Class Merit seemed unlikely; the criteria were incredibly demanding.
It would be very difficult to earn for just one competition; otherwise, the Forest Wolf Troop wouldn’t have previously received only one collective Second-Class Merit and one individual Second-Class Merit.
However, amidst the many expectant gazes, Zhao Deguang smiled and said, "Forest Wolf Troop Breeder Su Ping, the Legion awards a First-Class Merit Medal and an exchange quota of 10,000 Legion Battle Merit Points! Additionally, after deliberation by the Legion, you are awarded the honorary rank of Major in the Legion! You will enjoy all the benefits of an officer of that rank and may join the Legion at any time. Upon joining, your honorary rank can be promoted by one level!"
As he spoke, Zhao Deguang took out a military medal and a pin representing the honorary rank of Major.
Looking at Su Ping with a smiling gaze, he said, "Breeder Su, stand tall. This is a man’s most glorious moment!"
However, at this moment, Su Ping was stunned. Looking uncertainly at the smiling Zhao Deguang, he asked, "A First-Class Merit?"
Zhao Deguang nodded with a smile. "Yes, third place gets a Third-Class Merit, second place a Second-Class Merit, and first place a First-Class Merit. Isn’t that to be expected?"
Expected? Expected, my foot!
The honorary rank of Major alone made Su Ping feel somewhat undeserving.
And now a First-Class Merit on top of that?
Meeting Zhao Deguang’s smiling gaze, Su Ping desperately wanted to ask the General, ’Am I truly worthy of this?’
Even those below were stunned, including Liu Fuhai.

chapters.title: Chapter 195 - 136: First-Class Merit? Honorary Major Su Ping!_4
chapters.content:
Chapter 195: Chapter 136: First-Class Merit? Honorary Major Su Ping!_4
Old Liu also narrowed his eyes slightly and turned his head directly toward Qin Erlong. "Old Qin, what do you think? Is Old Zhao also trying to poach someone?"
Qin Erlong silently rolled his eyes at his old mate.
Damn it, this old coot has developed a persecution complex. Does everyone look like a poacher to him?
However, Qin Erlong also looked at Zhao Deguang with some suspicion. "Indeed, something’s not right. By the way, you’ve been to Old Zhao’s place before. Does he have a daughter, granddaughter, or great-niece or something?"
Liu Fuhai, in turn, gave this old fellow an eye-roll.
You’re not much better yourself, old coot.
But there was definitely something fishy about this matter!
The two old foxes exchanged a glance, sensing there was more to it.
As a matter of fact, the two old men weren’t wrong.
While everyone was still astonished, shocked, and slow to react, Zhao Deguang pinned the first-class military medal on Su Ping and officially conferred upon him the rank of Honorary Major. Then, straightening Su Ping’s collar, he whispered, "Stop by my office before you leave later. I have something to discuss with you."
Discuss what?
Su Ping wondered. Liu Fuhai and Qin Erlong were even more curious.
So, the three of them went to the office together.
Zhao Deguang was rendered speechless seeing the two glare at him like predators, protectively shielding Su Ping behind him as if Su Ping were a little chick. "What’s this about, you two?"
"Old Zhao, you don’t have any unmarried granddaughters or great-nieces, do you?"
"Old Zhao, it isn’t easy for Jianghai to produce a Breeder. You can’t add insult to injury!"
"..." Old Zhao’s brow furrowed slightly. Looking at these two old coots, he thought,
What on earth is all this nonsense?
"I have genuine business with Su Ping, unlike your petty speculations. Scram, scram, scram! I need to talk to Su Ping alone."
After getting Old Zhao’s assurance, although Liu Fuhai and Qin Erlong were still not quite at ease, they eventually left the office.
Whose fault was it but their own for being on his turf?
With the door closed, Zhao Deguang then turned to look at the somewhat constrained Su Ping.
He couldn’t help but feel constrained! This was a General, after all!
The Beast Tamer Corps under his command was one of the primary forces in the East, making him a true big shot. Moreover, this big shot was from the Legion. Su Ping’s own father had mentioned serving in the armed forces, so Su Ping held him in considerable awe.
However, Su Ping was also curious.
What kind of official business could this Legion Commander, with whom he’d never had any prior contact, possibly have with a mere Breeder like himself? Even if it was official business, they shouldn’t need to seek him out personally, right?
"Su Ping, relax." Noticing Su Ping’s slight nervousness, Zhao Deguang consciously softened his stern expression and said with a smile, "I know you’re a bit puzzled. According to regulations, even for Legion competitions, a first-class merit award wouldn’t typically be issued unless under special circumstances. It certainly wouldn’t be given to an outsider who isn’t even an official member of the Legion!"
He paused, then continued, "Therefore, I also have a favor to ask of you."
Su Ping raised an eyebrow, but before he could speak, Zhao Deguang continued with a smile, "Of course, don’t misunderstand. Whether you agree to my request or not, this first-class merit award is yours. No one can take it away, and no one will question it.
"However, I genuinely believe this matter could also benefit you. If you are selected, it would be a great help to your development."
Hearing Zhao Deguang put it that way, Su Ping’s interest was piqued. "What exactly is it?"
Zhao Deguang smiled slightly. "Recently, the higher-ups intend to establish a new Special Beast Taming Forces. For this, they need to select a group of Breeders to dedicate themselves to researching the cultivation and evolution methods of specific Pet Beasts. This is to meet the Pet Beast requirements for the Special Beast Taming Forces. Each provincial Legion Commander has one nomination slot..."

chapters.title: Chapter 196 - 137: Special Beast Taming Forces Training? Return to the Heart of Woods!
chapters.content:
Chapter 196: Chapter 137: Special Beast Taming Forces Training? Return to the Heart of Woods!
On the aircraft.
Qin Erlong and Liu Fuhai exchanged glances.
Ever since Su Ping had left Old Zhao’s place, he had been lost in thought.
The two were curious but did not press him with questions.
Liu Fuhai mentioned the confidentiality agreement to General Zhao.
Su Ping took another look at Er Zhuang and Sun Xiao. After Lin Lei secretly gave him a third-class merit medal, Su Ping set off with the two old fellows to return to Linzhou City.
The original promise was that if he made it into the top five, Lin Lei would find a way to secure a second-class merit for him, in addition to the third-class one from their corps.
But now, the goal had been far exceeded; Old Zhao had been generous and given him a first-class merit. Lin Lei’s third-class merit was just the icing on the cake.
However, throughout the journey, Su Ping wasn’t in the right mindset, his thoughts occupied by what General Zhao had told him.
Special Beast Taming Forces?
Was there really such a thing within the Legion?
A brand-new Special Beast Taming Force?
Even now, with so many Breeders and Evolutionary Bodies in the Dragon Nation, had none met the requirements for that Special Beast Taming Force?
What kind of Pet Beasts did this so-called brand-new Special Beast Taming Force need?
On this point, General Zhao did share some information.
When the time came for selection, an instructor from the Special Beast Taming Forces and several Breeding Masters would conduct personal interviews.
It was only during the actual interview and selection process that the desired cultivation direction and the requirements for Evolutionary Body Pet Beasts would be revealed.
However, Old Zhao wasn’t entirely without news. After a moment’s thought, he continued,
"It should be in the Undead Type cultivation direction. When the request was made, they prioritized Breeders proficient in Undead Type cultivation, but it wasn’t a mandatory requirement! So you can try your luck when the time comes; there’s nothing to lose if you’re not selected."
Undead Type.
His first thought was, naturally, of his precious little Paperman, Qian Yi.
But, claiming Paperman as part of the Necromancy System seemed a bit far-fetched, given its appearance.
And besides, these were the Special Beastmaster Troops!
Though Su Ping had never been in contact with them, he could glean some clues from special forces units in his previous life.
Inhuman training processes, formidable individual combat capabilities, unwavering willpower.
They represented the elite, the very pinnacle of the Legion.
In today’s Beast Taming society, this was even more true.
They were even more powerful and mysterious.
Because in today’s Dragon Nation, even the Legions under Zhao Deguang’s command did not have direct authority over any Special Beast Taming Force.
Each Special Beast Taming Force was incredibly secretive, taking orders directly from higher echelons and operating independently of the local Legions.
One could only imagine how secretive these Special Beast Taming Forces were.
Not to mention, for this matter, even the selection of Breeders would be personally overseen by Breeding Masters and that mysterious instructor from the Special Beastmaster Troops.
Such prestige, such profound foundations—could a Pet Beast like Paperman even qualify for such a place?
Although Su Ping now had a direction, and he believed that with his research and development, Paperman’s future was definitely not so simple...
However, Old Zhao had also said that the Breeder selection for these so-called Special Beastmaster Troops would officially begin next spring.
And before New Year’s Eve, all Breeders who wished to pre-qualify for the selection had to register.
Could he present Paperman’s potential direction and satisfy the instructor from the Special Beastmaster Troops, or even the Breeding Masters, before the New Year?
Su Ping didn’t know. Even he lacked that much confidence.
Yet, it was so incredibly tempting!
Zhao Deguang looked honest and unassuming, but damn, he wasn’t a good person at all!
He was blatantly tempting him.
Things like, "Once you’re in the Special Beastmaster Troops, all resources, even Emperor Level ones, you can take and use as you please."
And, "As long as you have the chance to complete missions, your rank as an honorary major could be further promoted, and the monthly welfare Battle Merit Points and such would be more than you could ever spend."
And, "The Breeders in the Special Beastmaster Troops will be provided with special resources to accelerate meditation, all for your use."
And even, "There are also special resources like the Stone of Creation, a supreme treasure that can alter and enhance a Beast Tamer’s Space Characteristics each time they break through a Great Realm."
The old fellow even said, "The Legion’s high command possesses a type of treasured resource that can help improve a Beast Tamer’s Talent effect, enhancing their Talent effects."
Su Ping had never even heard of these things during his school days.
Blah, blah, blah, a whole long list.
But in reality...
When Old Zhao mentioned the third point—the abundance of resources that could accelerate his personal meditation and rapidly advance his Meditation Realm—Su Ping had already succumbed.
Just as Old Zhao had said, there was no harm in trying.
"Su Ping, what kind of bewitching potion did Zhao Deguang give you? Are you still not back to your senses?"
Finally, as they approached the outskirts of Linzhou City, Liu Fuhai couldn’t help but speak up.
Su Ping snapped back to reality, pulling himself from his thoughts, and belatedly scratched his head.
"Sorry..."
"Su Ping, what exactly did Old Zhao tell you?"
Qin Erlong was also curious.
Su Ping, however, felt somewhat helpless.

chapters.title: Chapter 197 - 137: Special Beast Taming Forces Training? Return to the Heart of Woods!_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 197: Chapter 137: Special Beast Taming Forces Training? Return to the Heart of Woods!_2
General Zhao had told him that the matter of the Special Beast Taming Forces was not to be spoken of to outsiders.
Although the two before him were not strangers, Old Zhao hadn’t specified if *they* could be told.
The Special Beast Taming Forces were an absolute secret.
Every detail about these forces—from members to Breeders, instructors, and Pet Beasts, even down to the type of Pet Beast and the names of the forces—was not permitted to be divulged in the slightest.
Seeing Su Ping’s troubled expression, Qin Erlong was also taken aback.
It was Liu Fuhai who asked, "You can’t say it? Is it like that matter you told me about before?"
Su Ping nodded.
"Alright then," Liu Fuhai also nodded. "We won’t ask. Legion matters are, after all, fraught with taboos, and it’s better not to hear about them."
This time, it was Qin Erlong’s turn to be suspicious. He turned to Liu Fuhai. "What did you and Su Ping talk about?"
Liu Fuhai shot him a glance. "Didn’t I tell you? I can’t say!"
"Can’t you act like a human being?"
This time, Qin Erlong experienced the same maddening frustration Liu Fuhai must have felt when he himself was being cryptic earlier.
This agonizing curiosity made him shift his resentful gaze from Liu Fuhai to Su Ping.
"Uh, Old Liu," Su Ping touched his nose somewhat helplessly. "Didn’t you say before that you could talk it over with Old Qin? There’s no one else here now..."
Liu Fuhai hummed twice, and Qin Erlong immediately understood.
"A few days ago, Magic Capital sent me a package with a jin of Dragon Blood Tea..." Qin Erlong began.
Liu Fuhai’s eyes lit up, and he looked at Qin Erlong eagerly. "What Dragon Blood?"
Qin Erlong shot the old coot—who wouldn’t lift a finger unless there was something in it for him—a speechless glance. "What other Dragon Blood could it be? The best-tasting kind—Ice Dragon Blood..."
"Eight liang!"
"Nonsense! Three liang at most!"
"Deal."
Old Liu was utterly satisfied, feeling as though a heavy burden that had been weighing on his chest for some time had finally been lifted.
He felt thoroughly refreshed from head to toe.
"Alright now, spill it. What exactly happened? I saw you being all secretive at Old Zhao’s place earlier."
Liu Fuhai paused for a moment, then spoke in a low voice, "At the end of the previous competition, that immense radiance emitted by the Wanmu Wolf, and its state of being enveloped in light—that was the initial combination of a nascent Super-Rank Skill’s Skill Module!"
Wanmu Wolf, immense light, Super-Rank Skill, nascent...
