The moment these four keywords connected in his mind, even with Qin Erlong’s considerable composure, he couldn’t help but blurt out, "What the fuck?!"
Perhaps because he wasn’t a specialized Breeder, Qin Erlong didn’t know much about certain aspects of Cultivation.
But as a powerful Beast Tamer, Qin Erlong was crystal clear about matters related to Pet Beast combat.
So naturally, he understood what Super-Rank Skills represented.
Qin Erlong looked at Su Ping, his eyes wide with a newfound worry.
Indeed, he was worried.
Because before this, he had thought that—concerns about his own old age aside—with his wife, their unfilial son, and Xiao Xue’s own Talented Ability, Xiao Xue was certainly a good enough match for this rascal Su Ping, even if Su Ping only possessed a modicum of talent in Cultivation. In fact, from the standpoint of social standing, they weren’t perfectly matched.
But if his granddaughter fancied him, that wasn’t a major issue.
But now, it seemed things weren’t quite so simple, were they?
How did this rascal keep shattering his perceptions time and again?
Is this reasonable?
Previously, his granddaughter Xiao Xue had used the example of the Master of the Holy Dragon to refute Sun Chaoju. And now? Had it turned into a self-fulfilling prophecy?
Although this kid will likely face enormous difficulties compared to that Master of the Holy Dragon in the future, starting off exactly the same way is still too much to handle!
At this moment, Qin Erlong understood why Old Liu had kept this matter under wraps.
"Indeed, this matter must be kept secret for now," Qin Erlong nodded after exhaling slowly. "At least until the Breeder Competition."
By then, Su Ping might enter the sights of certain influential people, and those who might want to resort to underhanded tactics wouldn’t dare.
Old Liu shot him a disdainful look. "What nonsense are you spouting? Breeder Competition? It’s still in its nascent stages. We haven’t even confirmed the number of Skill Modules, and that burst from the Wanmu Wolf was just a flash in the pan. I even went to check afterward; there was hardly a trace."
"To prove achievements at the Breeder Competition, he must fully display a Super-Rank Skill. Do you think that’s like you drinking tea? One slurp and it’s done? It’s incredibly difficult! Ultimately, there’s only so much time before this Breeder Competition; whether he can complete it is still unknown. Next year’s Breeder Competition, perhaps..."
"Just because you can’t do it doesn’t mean Su Ping can’t, understand?" Qin Erlong, clearly feeling bold again, snorted coldly. "Do you think I was asking you? I’m talking to Su Ping! Who the hell was it that swore up and down to me that it was impossible to cultivate the Wanmu Wolf in a short time? And now you’re here barking at me, flaunting your seniority as a Breeder?"
Indeed, this tirade made Liu Fuhai’s face flush red, and he was left speechless.
Having regained the upper hand, Qin Erlong took out his phone and started scrolling through it.
"What are you doing?" Old Liu said. "Let me tell you, this matter cannot be leaked carelessly. No, seriously, can’t you, an old coot like you, have some dignity? Why do you have to report every little thing to your wife? At your age..."
Qin Erlong sneered and ignored him.
What does this old fool know?
Having my wife in on it will provide an extra layer of security for Su Ping, won’t it?
Listening to the two bickering beside him, which was giving him a headache, Su Ping felt rather helpless and quickly changed the subject, "By the way, Old Liu, where is Breeder Yang?"
However, Su Ping hadn’t expected this question to completely stump Liu Fuhai.
Only then did Old Liu recall that back at the Legion base, he seemed to have forgotten a student, hadn’t he?
「Legion Base.」
Yang He watched the figures coming and going outside the spatial vortex; they were all Breeders departing.
He pursed his lips for a moment, looking around for any sign of his teacher.
But he couldn’t find a hide nor hair of him.
Eventually, among all the Breeders coming and going outside the spatial vortex, only a solitary Yang He remained, looking around in bewilderment.
One of the returning Legion members recognized him.
"Huh? Breeder Yang? Why are you still here? Your teacher? You mean President Liu? He left with President Qin and Breeder Su a long time ago. I thought you’d left with them..."
Feeling the Jianghai weather, which was on the verge of winter—though not excessively cold by the coast—Yang He felt as if snowflakes were landing on his head, and a solitary winter plum was blooming beside him.
...
「Less than half an hour later」
Su Ping finally returned to Linzhou after being away for over two days.
Unfortunately, before he could even step into his house, Old Liu dragged him off to the Breeder Association to discuss the Wanmu Wolf’s Cultivation and the progress of the Solar Formula.
Old Liu knew his limits and didn’t probe too deeply.
Noticing Su Ping’s exhaustion, he simply waved his hand, telling him to go back and rest first.
Then, just as Su Ping had stepped out of the gate, he was stopped by Sun Chaoju and others.
At this moment, Su Ping profoundly felt how fickle circumstances could be.
Just a few months ago, Sun Chaoju couldn’t stand the sight of him, no matter how he looked at him. Now, he was practically ready to kneel and call him ’Dad’.
He was incredibly warm, and then, calling over his friends, insisted on throwing Su Ping a welcome-home banquet.
He’d only been gone a few hundred kilometers for a little over two days. What was there to give a welcome-home banquet for, or to ’dust him off’ from?
Su Ping managed to decline only after considerable effort. By the time he was escorted back to Heart of Woods, the sun was setting, and the sky had already darkened.
Looking at his own front door, Su Ping felt an unprecedented warmth, like a young swallow returning to its nest, as he opened the door to Heart of Woods. Unfortunately, just as he had comfortably flopped onto his sofa and let out a groan of contentment, Old Guan appeared before him.
"Xiao Ping, you really are back!"
What’s with the ’really’?
Su Ping suddenly had an uneasy premonition.
"A woman, who says she also came from the Legion, is here to see you about something!" Guan Qianshan informed him.
Filled with doubt, Su Ping went to the reception room in Heart of Woods and immediately saw the woman, still dressed in black.
Who else could it be but Rong Qiu, the Breeder from the Snow Wolf Group?
However, Su Ping had barely sat down, before he could even ask the purpose of her visit, when her first words left him utterly stunned.
"Xiao Ping, you don’t mind if I call you that, do you? After all, your dad wanted you to recognize me as your godmother..."

chapters.title: Chapter 198 - 138: Xiao Qing’s Cultivation? The Benefits of Military Ranks!
chapters.content:
Chapter 198: Chapter 138: Xiao Qing’s Cultivation? The Benefits of Military Ranks!
Two days ago, Rong Qiu had just wanted to give Su Anyong an eye roll for his words.
Never mind social status; based on age alone, is she suitable to be this brat’s godmother?
A stepmother, maybe. But the old guy was, at best, all talk.
However, now Rong Qiu suddenly felt that maybe age wasn’t so important after all?
So, after finishing her business, she didn’t rush back to Beiyuan Province but hurried to the Heart of Woods instead.
As for Su Ping, he blinked, looking at the smiling woman in black before him. For a moment, he couldn’t react.
Dammit, could it be that his old man wasn’t just shooting the breeze with him?
The stepmother that the old coot mentioned, was she real?
Su Ping had never believed a word Su Anyong said. But now, with this woman who seemed to pop out of nowhere appearing so suddenly, Su Ping was actually quite stunned.
"Excuse me, do you know my father?"
Rong Qiu nodded with a smile.
"Of course, I know him, and our relationship is beyond your imagination, you know~"
This woman, completely different from how she appeared in the Legion, winked at Su Ping, giving him an ’you know what I mean’ look.
Su Ping remained silent.
Indeed, one is influenced by the company one keeps.
Could a woman who knew his old man be up to any good?
It had to be said, if possible, Su Ping naturally preferred to spend more time with attractive women. But hanging out with a woman whose intentions were unclear and who had an ambiguous relationship with his dad made Su Ping even miss Dong Muyun.
So, he cut to the chase.
"Then, do you need something from me?"
Rong Qiu clicked her tongue. Apparently sensing Su Ping’s wariness, she nodded in satisfaction.
"No wonder Su Anyong left with such peace of mind. I’m here regarding a matter your dad entrusted to me..."
She paused before continuing.
"How is that mutated Poison Type Wolf Pet of yours doing now?"
This woman even knew about this?
It seemed she wasn’t lying.
Su Ping let down his guard a little. Xiao Qing had been in the Beast Taming Space these past two days. Su Ping had given the little guy things to do. During the days he was at the Legion, he had Xiao Qing help him plant sunflower seeds in the Beast Taming Space.
Rong Qiu let out a soft laugh. "Alright, it’s good to be cautious, but don’t be so guarded all the time. It can easily hinder emotional connection."
Su Ping really didn’t know what sort of emotional connection he was supposed to have with this woman who wanted to be his godmother out of the blue. He replied helplessly.
"It’s okay, Elite Second Rank, and it’s probably not far from breaking through to Elite Third Rank."
Rong Qiu nodded.
"When that little guy was sent away from my Rong Family, I was quite concerned. It was a stroke of luck for it to find a good home with you. Honestly, talking to you, brat, is less interesting than talking to Su Anyong. Since that’s the case, I’ll just get to the point. Your dad has entrusted my Rong Family with a task: to find and complete the evolutionary Cultivation of your mutated Poison Type Little Forest Wolf. The Rong Family specializes in the Cultivation and Evolution of various Poison Type Pet Beasts."
Upon hearing this, Su Ping raised an eyebrow.
So Xiao Qing’s origin was related to this woman?
And it was sent over from that... Rong Family?
And now, that old coot wanted this Rong Family to conveniently handle Xiao Qing’s evolutionary research and Cultivation?
This was the so-called stepmother and the so-called gift that the old man had talked about.
Su Ping wasn’t excited. Instead, he frowned slightly and asked,
"What conditions did Su Anyong agree to with your family?"
Rong Qiu shrugged, smiling as she said,
"That’s not something you should be worrying about, kiddo!"
Su Ping’s frown deepened.
"If I don’t need the Rong Family’s help and decide to research Xiao Qing’s evolutionary Cultivation on my own, does Su Anyong still need to fulfill the conditions?"
If this were before, Rong Qiu would have dismissed such talk out of hand. Pet Beast Cultivation, especially evolutionary Cultivation, isn’t simple. If it were that easy, everyone would be a Breeder, especially a Poison Type Breeder. There are quite a few basic Poison Type Pet Beasts, but their Evolutionary Bodies might be the rarest among all Attribute Pet Beasts. After all, Poison Type Cultivation can often directly threaten the Life of the Pet Beast itself.
But for the Su Ping in front of her, Rong Qiu didn’t harbor a shred of doubt. The scene that had unfolded within the Bai Tian Legion would remain an unforgettable shock for Rong Qiu for the rest of her life. The young Beast Tamer before her was indeed qualified to make such a statement.
However, Rong Qiu shook her head helplessly.
"Xiao Ping, many things aren’t as simple as you think. But rest assured, your father’s Life won’t be in danger."
Truth be told, Rong Qiu’s words did slightly relieve the tension in Su Ping’s heart. Although he wasn’t sure exactly what this woman did, as a direct party involved, she had no reason to lie to him about such a matter.
Rong Qiu blinked.
"So, Master Su, do you still want to study the evolutionary Cultivation of that mutated Poison Type Forest Wolf by yourself?"
Su Ping pursed his lips.
"How exactly can you and your so-called Rong Family help me?"
If help is offered, insisting on doing everything alone is just foolish, isn’t it?
Since Su Anyong had already paved the way, Su Ping wasn’t the type to be difficult and reject his parents’ help. He certainly wasn’t the kind of fool who would do that, only to then shamelessly use their connections or money while pretending to be struggling independently.

chapters.title: Chapter 199 - 138: Xiao Qing’s Cultivation? The Benefits of Military Ranks!_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 199: Chapter 138: Xiao Qing’s Cultivation? The Benefits of Military Ranks!_2
Rong Qiu smiled faintly, "There’s no rush for that at the moment. No matter what, the Level of that mutated Forest Wolf needs to reach at least the Elite Eighth Stage. Additionally, during this time, I’ll give you some of my Cold Water Wolf’s Cultivation experiences. It is also a Poison Type Snow Wolf that has been converted. You can have a look when the time comes. Once your Forest Wolf’s tier has advanced, if you have time, come visit Beihai City. Then, based on your ideas and requirements, we can determine the Forest Wolf’s Evolution direction."
Cold Water Wolf!
It had to be said that within this Legion, Su Ping’s impression of Rong Qiu’s Cold Water Wolf was indeed quite profound. The poisonous fog was also a wide-range, lethal, crowd-control Pet Beast. It was able to fight until the very end and even stealthily secured a spot in the top five. Although it related to tactics and strategy, there was no doubt about the strength of the Cold Water Wolf itself—it was absolutely adequate.
However, to directly share the experience of cultivating Evolutionary Bodies?
Su Ping glanced at Rong Qiu.
So generous?
The experience of any Breeder, even if it wasn’t a complete Cultivation method, was a Breeder’s entire life’s work. One could learn a lot from it.
Could she really be that magnanimous?
Obviously, Rong Qiu could not decipher the meaning behind Su Ping’s gaze.
She didn’t linger. After taking out a small booklet from her Beast Taming Space and handing it over to Su Ping, she left the Heart of Wood Cultivation Base amidst Su Ping’s waving goodbye.
Rong Qiu didn’t even delay, heading straight to the suburban airport. While waiting, she took out her mobile phone and, after some consideration, dialed a number.
"Hello, Qiuqiu, what’s the matter this time?"
"I’ve mentioned the Cultivation matter to Su Ping."
"..."
Su Anyong, on the other end of the phone, fell into silence, clearly no longer in the mood for jests.
"When will you stop being so willful?" Su Anyong finally spoke with some resignation.
"It’s not too bad. Your son is alright. The first thing he asked about was your condition."
"You..."
"Don’t worry, I know the rules." Rong Qiu snorted with disdain, "Initially, because of the close relationship between you, me, and my family, they pulled you out of that forsaken place. And now, they’ve made you an instructor for the new military unit. In the end, it’s because the Rong Family pledged loyalty. Those people felt reassured and, realizing that what they did in the past was unseemly, now want to make amends."
"Alright, some things are best left unsaid. Now that you’re this age, you’ve become increasingly loose-lipped, haven’t you?" Su Anyong sounded a bit impatient.
Rong Qiu didn’t mind, "By the way, what’s this new unit going to be called? What will be its main focus?"
Su Anyong felt somewhat helpless. Among the few people in his life he felt most at a loss with, not even Su Ping was more daunting than Rong Qiu.
"Nothing’s been decided yet. For now, it will mainly focus on the Necromancy Series, aiming for diverse functionality and adapting to various extreme environments. Also, this is the last time I’m telling you about this. Don’t bring it up again."
"TSK, I’m not even interested."
"By the way, the Legion tournament is over, right? How did it go?" Su Anyong ultimately couldn’t resist asking.
How did it go?
Rong Qiu thought again about what she had witnessed that morning, the event that had occurred, and let out a sigh. "First place, Honorary Major, a first-class merit."
"WHAT!?!" Su Anyong’s voice suddenly boomed.
But Rong Qiu had anticipated this and had already moved the phone away from her ear.
"Has the Eastern Corps gone mad? Honorary Major? A first-class merit? Does that General Zhao want my son as his son-in-law or grandson-in-law or what?"
"Who knows? But Su Ping is indeed worthy of that first-class merit."
"Oh? Why?"
"HEH, not telling you. Anyway, I’m boarding soon, so I won’t talk to you anymore."
"..."
"Oh right, one last question. Does the offer for me to be Su Ping’s godmother still stand?"
"Ah?"
"Hanging up..."
...
Rong Qiu’s arrival and departure left Su Ping with no time to properly examine his gains this time. While interacting with Rong Qiu, Su Ping was able to further confirm that Su Anyong’s identity was as complex as he had thought. However, it also gave him some peace of mind. As long as his father was safe, he could naturally be at ease.
Therefore, after settling down completely, Su Ping began to review his current gains.
The ten thousand Battle Merit Points, needless to say, were incredibly valuable. On the Legion’s internal website, even a Sun Crystal only required 1,100 Battle Merit Points for exchange. Ten thousand Battle Merit Points was indeed a substantial amount of resources. Moreover, resources obtained with these Battle Merit Points could be sold externally! A single Monarch Level material, when sold externally, could bring in tens of millions, possibly even several tens of millions. Although it seemed somewhat inappropriate to sell resources obtained with Battle Merit Points for money, he had no choice at the moment, given his financial situation.
Su Ping’s eyes quickly scanned the Legion’s resource supply network. He soon found that within the Legion, some High-level resource exchanges were not attainable with just Battle Merit Points. Of course, this was not an issue for Su Ping. He had one first-class merit and one third-class merit.
In the Legion’s internal network, there were two distinctions for such resources. One required unlocking permissions, which one obtained by accumulating a certain number and grade of military merits. The other consisted of even more precious resources that required the use of military merits for exchange.

chapters.title: Chapter 200 - 138: Xiao Qing’s Cultivation? The Benefits of Military Ranks!_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 200: Chapter 138: Xiao Qing’s Cultivation? The Benefits of Military Ranks!_3
Of course, the former still required the corresponding military rank. As for the latter, even after using Battle Merit Points to exchange for resources, it didn’t mean the military merits vanished; they simply transformed into pure honor and achievements.
Su Ping thought for a moment, swallowed, and then started searching within the Legion intranet.
He really had no idea about the names of any high-level materials before this.
And this Legion intranet was quite a pain, as it didn’t directly provide a resource list. For high-level resources, one had to search for the specific resource name to view them.
However, having experienced the Secret Realm of the Fengdu Sword King, Su Ping had seen a bit of the world.
Therefore, in the search bar, Su Ping typed out one of the two Spiritual Level Resource names he knew:
’Sword Intent Origin’
After a second of loading, to Su Ping’s relief,
did this Legion intranet really have this item?!
[Sword Intent Origin: A special Spiritual Level Resource. It is produced from Spirit Saint Level Sword Device type Pet Beasts. There’s a thirty percent chance such a Pet Beast will leave behind Sword Intent Origin upon its demise. This is an extremely precious Spiritual Level Resource. It can be used on Pet Beasts to significantly boost their comprehension of sword-type Skills. It can also be used by Beast Tamers. During a Level breakthrough, there is a certain chance to comprehend sword-related Space Characteristics and to lay the foundation for random sword-related resources.]
[Exchange requirements: Exchanger must hold a mid-grade General Level military rank, or use two first-class merits and three second-class merits to gain eligibility to exchange for this item, consuming 300,000 Battle Merit Points.]
Su Ping pursed his lips. He decisively shut down the Legion intranet. As for military rank, that likely had nothing to do with him for the rest of his life. Two first-class merits and three second-class merits were needed just to unlock eligibility for this exchange. And then it still required 300,000 Battle Merit Points?
Give me a break.
With his current rank as an honorary major, Su Ping glanced at it; his monthly Battle Merit Points were 650.
His fixed annual income from Battle Merit Points was only around eight thousand.
So, even with a military rank and merits, to exchange for this Sword Intent Origin, he would have to save up for thirty or forty years?
Is this what Spiritual Level Resources are like?
Su Ping felt that exploring Secret Realms was more reliable and offered better chances.
After all, putting other factors aside, even the rank of honorary major was not something ordinary people could achieve.
As for advancing further, he might really only be able to count on the training provided by the Special Beast Taming Forces.
Shaking his head, Su Ping stopped dwelling on impractical thoughts.
Instead, he looked into the social benefits associated with his honorary major rank and military merits.
The more he looked, the brighter Su Ping’s eyes became, and the more excited he grew.
Previously, his father had mentioned that the honorary military rank came with many advantages. Su Ping hadn’t quite believed it then, but now it seemed his father hadn’t deceived him!
Instantly, the exhaustion from the past few days vanished.
Su Ping shot up to his feet. "Uncle Guan!"
Lao Guan’s figure had already disappeared. He probably still had some things to take care of at the base.
Su Ping wasn’t in a hurry. He crossed through his base to the resort area. Just as he stepped into the central building, he almost bumped into someone.
Dong Muyun looked at the excited Su Ping. "Eh? You’re back? What’s the rush?"
Why is this woman still here? But this is perfect.
Su Ping looked at Dong Muyun, who was clearly about to go out. "Are you going to the city center?"
Dong Muyun nodded.
"Great, take me with you! I’ve got some things to handle too."
"..."
After getting into Dong Muyun’s car, Su Ping looked it over and clicked his tongue. "No wonder you always fly around on Yunning. Your car really isn’t up to par, is it?"
Dong Muyun shot the brat a sideways glance, too lazy to bother with him. She’d heard he had gone to the Legion these past two days but had no idea what for.
"Since you’re heading back to the city center today, why aren’t you flying?"
Dong Muyun gave him another sideways glance.
What could she say? Could she admit that she had been flying too frequently lately, gotten flagged by the Beast Master Association, had all the points on her pilot’s license deducted by the Air Traffic Control Bureau, and was also fined over a hundred thousand?
Miss Dong chose to change the subject. "It’s so late. Where in Linzhou are you heading? And what for?"
"The bank! To withdraw money!" Su Ping suddenly became extremely excited.
He was going to have money! Was he finally going to have money?
For the past half a month, to train the Wanmu Wolves for those guys in the Legion, he had even postponed some of the Heart of Woods’ cultivation business.
If it weren’t for the one hundred million Dong Muyun had sponsored, many operations at Heart of Woods would have truly ground to a halt.
And now, he was finally going to see the light at the end of the tunnel!
Dong Muyun looked at the exuberant Su Ping with a strange expression.
He’s going to have money? Since when did working for the Legion warrant payment? She had never heard of such a thing before.
One had to know, before that person took charge and started restructuring the Legion, the Dong Family also had some influence within the Legion, and they were somewhat familiar with the Legion’s situation.
Could this be one of the details of the Legion reforms?
Dong Muyun’s interest was piqued. "Okay, which bank?"
"All of them!"
Dong Muyun blinked and gave the young rascal a once-over. However, to satisfy her curiosity and get a peek at the inside story of the Legion’s current affairs, she nodded. "Alright. We’ll start with Jianghai Bank, then go to Oriental Bank. Are you visiting the two big ones? The Cultivation Bank and the Beast Tamer Bank?"
"Yes, all of them!" Su Ping said resolutely.
Dong Muyun nodded, decisively taking on the role of driver and assistant.
Not long after, she asked cheerfully, "Want me to call the vice president who’s directly responsible for Tianyun’s account to come and assist you?"
Never one to pass up a freebie, Su Ping nodded. "Sure."
Tianyun was a major corporation in Jianghai Province, and even in the eastern region of the Dragon Nation. Any reception, at any time, had to be handled impeccably.
She made one phone call. Even though that vice president was still at a dinner party, Dong Muyun’s call summoned him immediately.
Twenty minutes later, the two of them got out of the car in front of the local Jianghai Bank in Jianghai Province.
The vice president, who had been waiting there, immediately put on an incredibly warm smile. Looking at Su Ping and Queen Dong exiting the car, he asked, "Chairwoman Dong, is there any business you need me to handle?"
"Not me. Him," Dong Muyun said, pointing at Su Ping.
The vice president was clearly no fool and, without any hint of neglect, promptly inquired, "Sir, what business do you have with Jianghai Bank?"
Facing the vice president’s enthusiastic smile and Dong Muyun’s rather attentive gaze, Su Ping stated decisively, "I want a loan! The kind without collateral and without interest!"
Seeing the young man’s confident expression, the vice president struggled to maintain his composure. After a moment, he couldn’t help but cast a doubtful glance at Dong Muyun.
Was Queen Dong of Tianyun Group perhaps making fun of him?

chapters.title: Chapter 201 - 139: Loans! The Cultivation and Perfection of Forest Wolf and Elf Wolf!
chapters.content:
Chapter 201: Chapter 139: Loans! The Cultivation and Perfection of Forest Wolf and Elf Wolf!
Dong Muyun really wanted to ignore the deputy bank president’s questioning gaze.
But it had to be said, Su Ping’s words also made it a bit hard for her to maintain her composure.
"Su Ping, loans always require collateral. Of course, you might have seen those so-called unsecured ones, but in reality, they’re secured by personal credit, and those loans can only support small amounts." Dong Muyun quickly understood his line of thinking.
After all, no matter how talented Su Ping was, he wasn’t that old and perhaps didn’t know much about certain societal matters.
In such cases, having been short on funds before, learning about the possibility of a loan naturally energized him.
"As for interest-free, it’s the same deal: either your collateral is sufficient, or the amount is small. Otherwise, unless the interest is very low, it can be kept very low."
Watching Dong Muyun patiently explain, the deputy bank president showed a smile that was both embarrassed and politely restrained.
Was this all Queen Dong had dragged him here for?
But he couldn’t really say anything; after all, this was his job.
Besides, for Queen Dong to explain things this way, this gentleman must be no ordinary person, right?
So, he quickly said, "Chairman, let me speak with this gentleman. But let’s go inside to discuss it first."
They followed him into the office.
It was there that the deputy bank president said, "Sir, with the Chairman present, I can use my authority to approve an interest-free, unsecured loan of up to 2,000,000 for you. Does that sound acceptable?"
This showed that the deputy bank president indeed handled matters efficiently. He didn’t say much, simply using his own authority to help. Although it was out of respect for Dong Muyun, Su Ping still nodded in satisfaction.
However, he shook his head. "Not enough! Here’s the thing, my current status should allow me to apply for more interest-free, unsecured loans. Could you please check online? Here’s my ID card."
The deputy bank president felt somewhat helpless.
Damn it, even as a deputy bank president using his own limit, he only had two million in interest-free, unsecured loans.
After all, Jianghai Bank was just a local bank in Jianghai Province. It wasn’t one of the two major banks, was it?
Besides, what kind of status would allow someone to borrow a large interest-free, unsecured loan from the bank?
Even for Dong Muyun standing before him, it would be impossible.
Because such things always entailed risk.
Even with the resources of Tianyun Group, it would be very, very difficult to casually obtain loans of a large magnitude.
And now this young man was saying his status could secure more loans?
Having worked at Jianghai Bank for so many years, the deputy bank president hadn’t encountered such a situation.
But still, out of respect for Dong Muyun, he didn’t say anything more. He took the ID card, said softly, "Please wait a moment," and then turned on the computer that had been shut down.
It was Dong Muyun, however, who looked oddly at Su Ping. "You rascal, after all this time, your method of getting money is to take out a loan?"
No wonder she was speechless.
How much money could a loan possibly provide?
Unless this darn kid was going to reveal their family’s secret cultivation techniques, in which case he could undoubtedly secure a sky-high loan. Otherwise, even for the Heart of Woods cultivation base, the most one could borrow would be a few tens of millions at best.
But how much could be lent on an interest-free, unsecured basis?
Just as this thought crossed her mind, and before Su Ping could reply, a crisp exclamation echoed through the empty office.
"What the heck?"
Dong Muyun looked toward the office desk, where the deputy bank president sat, looking as if he’d seen a ghost.
"What’s wrong?"
For the first time, the deputy bank president didn’t respond to his benefactor’s question. Instead, he rubbed his eyes as if he had misread something, then stared fixedly at the computer screen again.
Only then did his expression, still like he’d seen a ghost, turn back toward Su Ping, who was sitting there.
Finally, still with that same look, as if he’d seen a ghost, he remained stunned, not coming back to his senses for a long time.
It had to be said, Su Ping was also somewhat nervous. Although the introduction to the honorary military rank and the effects of the medals had mentioned some figures, Su Ping was still unclear about the exact numbers.
Observing the deputy bank president’s expression, Dong Muyun raised her eyebrows slightly. "What’s the matter?"
The deputy bank president gave a wry smile, then quickly stood up. He respectfully handed Su Ping’s ID card back.
"I apologize, Major Su. I was impolite earlier. With your honorary military rank and your personal credit rating, you’re eligible for an interest-free, unsecured loan of 30,000,000 at our bank! Additionally, since you’ve been awarded a First-Class Merit and a Third-Class Merit, as per our bank’s policy, an additional 31,000,000 in interest-free, unsecured loans will be granted on top of the initial 30,000,000! That’s a total of 61,000,000 in interest-free loans, offered in gratitude for your service and contribution to the Legion and to the Dragon Nation! Salute to you!"
And it was no empty platitude. After those final words were spoken, genuine goosebumps rose on Su Ping’s skin.
He had never felt anything like this before.
Moreover, this wasn’t just verbal respect; it came with real, tangible benefits!
Just one bank could directly approve over sixty million in loans?
It was something Su Ping hadn’t expected.
This was also a difference between the Controlling Beasts world and his previous life.
In that world, while the respect and preferential treatment for soldiers, especially for decorated heroes, were also plentiful,

chapters.title: Chapter 202 - 139: Loans! The Cultivation and Perfection of Forest Wolf and Elf Wolf!_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 202: Chapter 139: Loans! The Cultivation and Perfection of Forest Wolf and Elf Wolf!_2
But it must be said, often, it’s genuine gold and silver that are most heartwarming.
However, this was also normal. Generally speaking, in the Beastmaster Society, Beast Tamers who had made achievements in the Legion, and especially those who had obtained the extremely rare honorary military ranks, were usually not short on money. This so-called interest-free loan was just a small gesture for emergencies. But it indeed resolved Su Ping’s big trouble.
He took his identity card with satisfaction, turned his head, and saw Dong Muyun beside him, her bright red lips parted, looking at him with an expression as if she had seen a ghost ever since the vice president began speaking.
Major Su? An honorary title? A first-class merit? A third-class merit? What the hell was all this about?
Su Ping had indeed visited the Legion, but hadn’t it only been for two days? Could some powerful Time-Series Pet Beast have activated its Ability, causing *her* perception of time to slow? Had many days actually passed? That was pure nonsense! In other words, had Su Ping really achieved all these things within just two days in the Legion? How had he done it?
She naturally understood what a first-class merit represented. It implied that anyone who had any ill intentions toward Su Ping would have to consider whether they might offend the Legion. In the Dragon Nation, even if you offended the Beast Master Association, you absolutely could not offend the Legion in this regard. This was because, within the entire Dragon Nation, the Beast Master Association wasn’t a monolith; it had many factions. But the Legion was different. Especially when it came to a decorated hero; if anyone dared to act against them without just cause, no established family would want to directly confront the Legion. Moreover, was this really a first-class decorated hero? If a first-class hero of the Legion met with an accident while on duty and the Legion did nothing, how could it maintain military morale and fighting spirit? How could it reassure the Beast Tamer warriors who were stationed far from the cities, in the desolate borderlands, resisting the Beast Tides of wild Pet Beasts and risking their lives? But, ultimately, it all came down to the same question: where on earth did this brat get these things? Was he truly capable of earning such high-level military honors?
Dong Muyun looked at Su Ping with a strange expression, but Su Ping had already joyfully received the answer he wanted from the vice president.
"Major Su, please understand that regardless of anything, procedures must be followed. I’ve already reported it directly. This loan should be in your hands in the next day or two!"
"Not at all, not at all! Thank you for your hard work, much appreciated!" Su Ping said, smiling eagerly.
After all, this was the God of Wealth approving his funds; being a little polite was hardly an issue.
The vice president, however, felt extremely flattered.
He might appear distinguished, but he was just a member of the management system. He might have a high salary and social status, and even a comfortable fortune at home if he employed a few tricks. But in the Beastmaster Society, status and power were far more useful than money. If it had been an ordinary recent graduate, the vice president wouldn’t have batted an eye, not even deeming them worthy of a second glance. But who was this person before him? Who on earth had ever seen an eighteen-year-old honorary major? A recipient of first-class and third-class merits? Not to mention, being treated with such consideration by the chairman of Tianyun Group indicated his own status was undoubtedly exceptional. In the hierarchy of the Beastmaster Society, from the perspective of influential figures like Dong Muyun, a branch vice president like himself was merely an administrative staffer. There were plenty of such personnel vying for positions. To Dong Muyun and this Major Su, he was perhaps just a slightly more high-ranking attendant, nothing more. Yet, who would have thought this young major would be so courteous to *him*?
For a moment, whether from the earlier drinks or sheer excitement, the vice president’s cheeks flushed red, his face alight with uncontrollable exhilaration and joy.
"It is my honor to be of service to you, Major Su. I also thank Chairman Dong for giving me this opportunity."
His face beaming, he respectfully escorted Dong Muyun and Su Ping out of Jianghai Bank.
After getting into the car, Dong Muyun finally remarked with a sigh, "I must say, I’ve never seen Vice President Fu so eager and excited before."
Su Ping nodded. "Being a vice president really is a waste of his talents."
Dong Muyun shot him a sideways glance. "His surname is indeed Fu. However, if you’ve taken a liking to him and wish to cultivate a connection, it’s just a matter of calling President Qin. Although the Beast Master Association doesn’t meddle much in administrative management, as the highest local authority, a small thing like this is merely a word from the old man and a phone call."
Su Ping waved his hand. "Forget it, forget it. I don’t have that kind of pull."
"What exactly did you do at the Legion these past two days?" Dong Muyun finally couldn’t resist asking.
"I participated in a competition, used the Pet Beast I’d cultivated, and just casually took first place, that’s all," Su Ping said nonchalantly. He had no interest in elaborating on the matter with Dong Muyun, so he just gave a brief overview.
Dong Muyun wasn’t foolish. She gave him a complicated look.
Winning first place in the Legion’s competition equates to a first-class merit? There must be more to it.
But since Su Ping wasn’t elaborating, she couldn’t press further.
Besides, many matters within the Legion were indeed best left unsaid.

chapters.title: Chapter 203 - 139: Loans! The Cultivation and Perfection of Forest Wolf and Elf Wolf!_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 203: Chapter 139: Loans! The Cultivation and Perfection of Forest Wolf and Elf Wolf!_3
Too many taboos.
"Head to the next bank?"
"Yeah! Let’s see if I can continue."
When it came to such actions of exploiting loopholes, Su Ping was exhilarated. Although it was a loan that he would have to repay in the future after making money, these funds could undoubtedly greatly accelerate the construction of his Heart of Woods at present.
Thinking of this, Su Ping felt incredibly invigorated.
Thus, Dong Muyun continued fulfilling her role as his chauffeur, driving to Jianghai Bank, the Oriental Bank, the Beast Tamer Bank, and the Breeder Bank! Su Ping visited all four. Afterwards, he had secured nearly four hundred million in interest-free, unsecured loans!
The sixty-one million from Jianghai Bank was actually the least. This was understandable, considering it was a local bank and not one spread across the entire Dragon Nation. The Oriental Bank lent a bit more, but it wasn’t particularly high either—a loan of seventy-two million.
The Beast Tamer Bank and the Breeder Bank, these two behemoths, were the real heavy hitters. The Beast Tamer Bank approved a whole one hundred million.
An honorary military rank was even more valuable than the regular ranks within the Legion. Even if Zhang Lie and Lin Lei came, with nothing but talk, they wouldn’t dream of getting such a large interest-free loan; of course, the Legion wouldn’t allow it either, unless there was genuinely a special difficulty. Su Ping, however, had no such worries.
As for the Breeder Bank, that was even more unexpected for Su Ping. Besides the honorary military rank and military medals, something else increased his loan limit: his status as an Intermediate Breeder. Then, a total of one hundred and fifty million was approved.
Banks are really loaded,
Su Ping thought.
Sitting in Dong Muyun’s car, Su Ping, who would have three hundred and eighty-three million in loans arriving in his account in the next day or two, couldn’t help but sigh with emotion.
Dong Muyun rolled her eyes at him. "They’re not running a charity. Even though it’s an interest-free, unsecured loan, don’t forget you have to repay it! Let’s see when you can manage that."
Speaking of which, Su Ping really did feel a bit of a headache coming on.
With the Legion’s issues resolved and some time still before he had to attend the Breeder competition in the Magic Capital, he wasn’t in a hurry. So, in the period before the end of the year, his top priorities were indeed perfecting his own breeding focus, building the Heart of Woods, practicing meditation, and further researching money-making schemes.
Without an official announcement, he couldn’t release the evolutionary cultivation method for the Wanmu Wolf and couldn’t fleece the rich through genuine high-end cultivation. If he only relied on the Heart of Woods and the resort for income, accumulating such a huge sum of money would indeed be difficult.
Currently, among my own ventures, making money by fishing with Rainbow Coral Worms is definitely one aspect,
Su Ping mused.
But what about cultivation?
At this thought, Su Ping remembered the cultivation task for the Forest Wolf and Elf Wolf that Dong Muyun had entrusted to him.
Indeed, both of these are quite suitable.
Moreover, previously, by observing the cultivation methods for these two common evolutionary bodies through the Myriad Spirits Catalog, Su Ping had made some additional discoveries.
With these thoughts, Su Ping closed his eyes on the ride back.
Dong Muyun, driving while sneakily watching him, felt her anger flare up.
Damn it, does this little brat really think of me, Miss Dong, as his chauffeur and assistant?
However, Dong Muyun had no choice. After leaving the Breeder Bank, she drove Su Ping back towards the Heart of Woods on the outskirts of Linzhou.
After running around all evening, this brat didn’t even offer to buy me a meal? Now it’s so late, I haven’t done any of my own things, just been dragged around by this kid. Right, what was I supposed to do when I got back to Linzhou City Center?
Dong Muyun scratched her head. Then, deciding not to bother with it anymore, she drove straight towards the Heart of Woods base on the outskirts of Linzhou.
Su Ping was truly unaware of this Queen Dong’s thoughts. His entire mind and attention were focused on the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas that had emerged in his mind.
It was still the very familiar Forest Wolf Catalog, but this time, there was a significant change! The biggest change was the Experience Points!
Two months had passed. Although there were a few days when Su Ping didn’t interact much with the Forest Wolf, causing the accumulation of Experience Points to slow down, over this ’long’ period, the Experience Points in the Forest Wolf Catalog had indeed made unimaginable progress.
Besides experience, there were also two other relatively conspicuous special changes!
[Catalog: Forest Wolf]
[A special Wolf Tribe adept with the Wood Attribute, possessing incredibly strong Life Force. Adult Forest Wolves are typically Elite Level and are skilled in Skills such as: Sunlight Absorption, Vine Strangling, Self-Healing, and Accelerated Growth.]
[Current Catalog Level: 3 (8,210/20,000)]
Known Evolutionary Atlas, special cultivation:
[Universal Cultivation Method - Accelerated Casting: ...]
[Forest Wolf-specific Magic Potion - Heart of Woods: ...]
[Special Cultivation Evolutionary Body - Wanmu Wolf: ...]
[Discovered Forest Wolf Cultivation Evolutionary Body: Forest Wolf! Consume 800 Experience Points to further perfect the Forest Wolf’s perfect Evolution Law, increasing the success rate of cultivation evolution and, to a certain extent, enhancing the potential of the successfully evolved Forest Wolf!]
[Discovered Forest Wolf Cultivation Evolutionary Body: Elf Wolf! Consume 1,200 Experience Points to further perfect the Elf Wolf’s perfect Evolution Law, increasing the success rate of cultivation evolution and, to a certain extent, enhancing the potential of the successfully evolved Elf Wolf!]
Habits and preferences:
[...]
Journal records:
[...]
That was right. Aside from the Experience Points, when Su Ping saw the Cultivation Methods for the Forest Wolf and the Elf Wolf, the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas had once again provided such prompts. These involved further perfecting the Evolution Law for both, significantly increasing the chances of successful cultivation, while also enhancing the potential of the resulting Evolutionary Bodies.
However, Su Ping hadn’t paid much attention to this before, as he was busy with the cultivation and training of the Wanmu Wolf.
Now that the Legion’s matters were temporarily concluded, it was time for him to truly expand the cultivation business at his Heart of Woods!

chapters.title: Chapter 204 - 140: The Laboratory! Reigniting the Research on Nicotiana lupulina!
chapters.content:
Chapter 204: Chapter 140: The Laboratory! Reigniting the Research on Nicotiana lupulina!
In the darkness of night, at the heart of Linzhou City, on the thirty-second floor of a skyscraper by the window, a man supported his chin with his hand. He gazed at the night view of Linzhou City without a trace of appreciation in his eyes, displaying instead weariness and impatience.
After checking his watch countless times, just as he was about to lose his patience and make a phone call, at last, the distinct CLACK, CLACK, CLACK of high heels approached from outside the private room.
The door to the room was pushed open, and Dong Muyun’s figure appeared.
The man finally spoke. "Three hours ago was our agreed time, right? In other words, Dong Muyun, you are a full three hours late!"
Dong Muyun was unfazed, not even bothering with a perfunctory apology. She simply shrugged. "Something came up unexpectedly."
"What could possibly be more important than my affairs?"
Dong Muyun sat down, crossed one leg casually over the other, and said, "Much more important than your business, Dong Mutian. If you’ve got something to say, spit it out. I don’t have time to play guessing games with you here."
The man looked at his sister, who hadn’t changed over the many years, and the impatience and irritation on his face surprisingly vanished. He said, "Father’s orders. I’ve come to temporarily take over two subsidiaries under Tianyun Group: Tianyun Real Estate and Mirror Sky Entertainment."
"What?" Dong Muyun raised her eyebrows in disbelief, looking at Dong Mutian. She asked, "Are these Father’s orders?"
"You can call and ask!"
Dong Muyun’s brows furrowed. Right in front of Dong Mutian, she made the call.
"Dad?"
"Has your brother arrived?"
The voice on the phone, along with its words, clearly confirmed Dong Mutian’s claims.
Yet Dong Muyun found it even harder to understand. She asked, "Dad, what does this mean? Haven’t I been managing Tianyun all this time?"
There was a moment of silence on the other end of the line. After about a dozen breaths, a muffled voice continued, "Muyun, the family is preparing to focus all its efforts on developing Tianyun Group. Other areas will make way for now. Tianyun Group is so vast, and it’s just the right time for Mutian to help you share some of the burden. Besides, real estate and entertainment aren’t our main industries..."
Dong Muyun’s fox-like eyes narrowed. She nodded decisively and said, "Fine, I get it..."
She didn’t wait for a response, hanging up abruptly to vent her dissatisfaction.
Then, under Dong Mutian’s amused gaze, she settled back into her seat, resuming her pose with one leg casually crossed over the other.
"Asked him already?" Dong Mutian said. "Over the past few years, the group’s financial reports haven’t just failed to improve; they’ve shown losses. The real estate side has lost over a hundred million on the Crescent Lake construction and that Yuntian Resort. Father has long been dissatisfied..."
Looking at her smug, good-for-nothing brother, Dong Muyun scoffed disdainfully. She retorted, "Problems with the Legion? Kicked out, were you?"
At this, Dong Mutian’s face darkened.
Dong Muyun huffed and said, "Do you know why you’ll never be the true heir in Father’s and the family’s hearts? Dong Mutian, even without Dong Muxuan, and with me here, the ambitions you and your dead mother harbor—to truly head the Dong Family and take over—will never happen in this lifetime! It’s because you’re such a worthless good-for-nothing."
BOOM!
The table in front of them was sent flying by an explosive burst of spiritual power.
Dong Mutian abruptly stood up, staring intently at the woman before him.
Dong Muyun, however, didn’t seem to care in the slightest. Instead, she laughed and said, "Alright, alright, as if I don’t know your capabilities. Enough of the show. It seems the pressure this time was really significant for a complete waste of the family like you to be driven out of the Legion."
With that, Dong Muyun slowly rose, waved her hand, and walked straight out of the private room.
Reaching the doorway, she seemed to remember something. She turned her head back to Dong Mutian and said, "Come to the group’s headquarters tomorrow. I’ll have someone show you how to take over the real estate and entertainment companies..."
After leaving these words behind, Dong Muyun’s figure finally disappeared from the private room, leaving Dong Mutian, whose expression had turned a slight shade more pleasant.
He really hadn’t expected Dong Muyun to be so accommodating, handing over the management rights of the two companies to him just like that?
But who knew if there was some other trick up her sleeve.
Indeed, that was the case. As soon as Dong Muyun stepped out of the room, her previously breezy demeanor vanished, her face turning extremely grim.
The company she took over at sixteen, building it up step by step to its current state—was she really going to hand it over to someone else?
What had the family said back then?
Her eldest brother, Dong Mutian, was to strive within the Legion, carving out influence within the official power structures of the Dragon Nation. Dong Muyun was responsible for the entire family’s commercial ventures. Although she had leveraged the family’s connections and power, consolidating those myriad small shops and subsidiaries into the behemoth that Tianyun Group had become was a feat that had cost her unimaginable effort and youth. As for Dong Muxuan, over a decade younger than his siblings, he was still studying at the Magic Capital Advanced Beast-Taming Academy.
Looking at it now, the family’s situation was indeed not good.
At this thought, Dong Muyun’s expression slowly returned to coldness. That person, over the past few years, had brought the suppression of Families to an extreme. Before this, the Dong Family’s status and influence had been Dong Muyun’s greatest support and strength.

chapters.title: Chapter 205 - 140: The Laboratory! Reigniting the Research on Nicotiana lupulina!_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 205: Chapter 140: The Laboratory! Reigniting the Research on Nicotiana lupulina!_2
But now, it seemed to have become a burden. This was especially true in recent years; in Jianghai, it would have been tolerable, but in the entire eastern region of Dragon Nation...
A glint of light flashed in Dong Muyun’s eyes.
She suddenly thought of the somewhat joking collaboration she had with Su Ping.
For a moment, after she got into the car, Dong Muyun gazed at the passenger seat Su Ping had just occupied and fell into deep thought.
The Dong Family had never truly believed in her!
Dong Muyun had always known this; otherwise, her position as the acting chairman with shares wouldn’t have been limited to just five percent of Tianyun Group.
The majority was in the hands of her grandfather and father.
Moreover, Dong Muyun knew better than anyone that business strategies and territorial control—whether within Dragon Nation or even across Blue Star—might not hold as much significance or utility as one might think.
It wasn’t that it was useless, but her position, especially in the Dong Family, could be replaced at any time.
Money, the company’s sales channels—these were all to serve strength!
What about her two brothers?
Even a failure like Dong Mutian was pressured by the Dong Family to join the Legion.
With the help of the Dong Family, if Dong Mutian could perform well, what could he gain? High-level Legion contacts, significant personal power growth.
He would also have the chance to break into the management layer of Dragon Nation in the future, which was the traditional path for major families.
Not to mention Dong Muxuan, who was directly sent to the Magic Capital Beast Taming Academy and became the disciple of the sole Sky Hunter King in Magic Capital.
He was establishing himself firmly within the academy and its corresponding factions.
Only her!
Even within Tianyun Group, her hands were tied; she had to report the mobilization and use of even slightly higher-level resources.
Why?
Now that Dong Mutian had messed up in the Legion, he wanted to continue leeching off the territory she had fought for all these years? How could she possibly accept this?
Finally, Dong Muyun let out a long sigh.
Sometimes, a catalyst is needed to make up one’s mind and take that step forward.
「...」
Su Ping didn’t know that this night was an extremely important one for Dong Muyun.
He, on the other hand, had slept soundly.
The issue with money had been temporarily resolved, and he had returned to his own home.
There’s no place like home.
But Su Ping woke up quickly. This was because, early in the morning, Liu Fuhai had eagerly called him.
"Hurry up and sign for it; I’ve brought you stuff!"
Su Ping, still in his sleep robe and without even washing up, walked out the door, glancing skeptically toward the entrance.
With that one look, the little sleepiness lingering in Su Ping vanished without a trace.
There were large shipping containers.
Each container was open, and looking inside, one could see gleaming metal machinery.
Various kinds of mechanical devices, even in places where sunlight couldn’t reach, still sparkled in Su Ping’s mind.
’High-Polymer Automated Mechanical Core Compression Extraction Machine’
’Biological Central Computer’
’Liquid Nitrogen Storage Device’
’Basic Molecular Purification Instrument’
’Precision Gene Gun’
’...’
All sorts of equipment he had previously only seen in pictures on the Breeder Association’s website were now vividly present before his eyes.
Old Liu is impressive! All this in one night? It was a good thing I remained steadfast and wasn’t swayed by offers from breeders in other provinces after the competition.
"Kid, where are we putting all this stuff?" Vice President Liu’s voice came from behind him.
He was very pleased with Su Ping’s excited, wide-eyed expression.
It reassured him that the items from the Breeder Association were not just going to sit and collect dust.
Though, he didn’t understand what this brat wanted these things for, or what on earth he was going to do with them!
"Follow me, follow me!"
At this moment, Su Ping felt somewhat relieved.
Fortunately, when he previously cultivated the Wanmu Wolf of the Legion, the transformation of the Heart of Woods had reached a bottleneck due to a lack of money.
However, beyond the forest of the Heart of Woods, the area Su Ping had planned to use as a base for his experimental lab had already been constructed.
Now it can finally be put to use!
Liu Fuhai once again stored the experimental equipment inside his Beast Taming Space.
Afterward, he followed Su Ping through the Heart of Woods and arrived at this newly constructed lab.
"Good lad, you were already prepared, weren’t you?"
Looking at the lab, Liu Fuhai nodded with satisfaction.
Then, following the plan Su Ping had prepared, they moved all the delicate experimental machinery into the lab.
After familiarizing Su Ping with the use of these instruments and returning to the guest room with him, Liu Fuhai couldn’t help but ask, "What are your current research directions? Is there anything I can help with?"
If an ordinary Breeder heard that, they’d probably be ecstatic. But there’s really nothing he can help me with,
Su Ping thought.However, he indeed had quite a few research projects going on lately.
The completion of the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas entries for the Forest Wolf and the elite wolf didn’t require much active research from him.
I’m not the squeamish type to refuse to use my Golden Finger.
Secondly, there was the research on Wolf Tobacco.
However, I don’t even know if this Wolf Tobacco research will yield any results. I’d feel pretty bad wasting Vice President Liu’s time on it.
As for the most important thing, that’s undoubtedly the Wanmu Wolf’s so-called Super-Rank Skill. But according to the Sun Formula, my main focus next is still on cultivating and improving Old Sha’s Heart of Woods skills.
Besides these, there’s also the research into the Paperman’s evolution and Qian Yi’s evolutionary cultivation. However, these aren’t things Vice President Liu can help with. After all, he’s a Wolf Pet Breeder, not a Breeder of the Necromancy Series.
So, facing Old Liu’s expectant gaze, Su Ping felt a bit awkward and scratched his head.
Old Liu immediately understood and gave Su Ping a wry look. "I’ll just take it that you’re sparing me the worry. But don’t forget the important stuff; I’m waiting for you to become famous across the world!"
Famous across the world?!
Those words made Su Ping’s heart quiver.
He naturally understood what Old Liu meant and nodded with a smile. "Rest assured!"
Vice President Liu was, of course, reassured. Right now, in the entire Breeder Association, there was probably no one who gave him more peace of mind than Su Ping.
However, after a pause, Old Liu finally spoke up, "Su Ping, what are your plans for the Wanmu Wolf’s Cultivation Method?"
Plans for it?
Su Ping understood Vice President Liu’s meaning at once.
He pondered for a moment.
Actually, I haven’t placed much importance on the Wanmu Wolf’s cultivation and evolutionary method. It’s not that the Wanmu Wolf’s evolutionary form is strong on its own; it’s strong because I fortuitously discovered the Sun Formula and combined it with the Wanmu Wolf. Others cultivating the Wanmu Wolf definitely wouldn’t reach the strength and standard I have. And there’s another reason: strictly speaking, the Wanmu Wolf’s evolution doesn’t solely belong to me. Sun Chaoju also has a share in it. As the discoverer who handed over all findings and the cultivation process to me, Sun Chaoju has every right to know about the Wanmu Wolf’s Cultivation Method. With my current status, I could certainly exclude Sun Chaoju completely. But again, it’s not worth it. And it would be unseemly. I do care about my reputation. An evolutionary method might seem precious to others, but with the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, it doesn’t really count for much to me.
So, Su Ping thought for a while and said, "About that, after Breeder Sun arrives, we can discuss it a bit more before making a decision. I don’t really lack anything right now, and as for exchanging credits for resources, I don’t have any particular goals at the moment."
Liu Fuhai nodded, his face showing pleased relief. "Alright, I’ll mention it to Xiao Sun and have him come here to discuss it with you."
After respectfully seeing off Vice President Liu, Su Ping couldn’t hold back any longer. He jumped up and sprinted back to his now crammed-full lab!
This is a lab that truly belongs to me! It was one of my dreams from over two months ago! I didn’t expect to achieve it so easily! Setting other matters aside, those stocks of Wolf Tobacco I’ve accumulated can finally be put to good use!

Chapter 207: Chapter 141: New Research: ’Heart of the Wolf’ Magic Potion Adjuvant!_2
"Really?!"
Qin Xiaoxue’s eyes lit up with joy, but then she quickly noticed something and hastily returned to her previous expression, nodding firmly, "That’s great! This way I can focus on meditation and cultivating Pet Beasts, striving to surpass you as soon as possible!"
Qin Xiaoxue consoled herself and then continued to rationalize in her mind.
In order to surpass Grandma sooner and become a powerful Beast Tamer, it’s only right to find a formidable Breeder to help, right?
After figuring it out, Qin Xiaoxue, with her high ponytail swaying, finally left the office.
The woman smiled as she watched her little bok choy leave, and then she took out her phone and dialed a number.
"Qin Chuan."
"Hello, Mom, what’s up?"
"What are you doing?"
"Well... I’m receiving a top-tier High Order Breeder from Eagle Country. He’s also from our Dragon Nation, and actually from Jianghai—kind of like a fellow townsman of Father’s, hehe. He plans to visit Linzhou once he’s done with his business in Magic Capital."
The woman’s brows furrowed, but after a pause, she said, "From now on, you don’t have to worry about Xiao Xue’s matters anymore. You hear me?"
"Mom, I..."
"Did you hear me?"
"Yes..."
The woman then continued, "Also, don’t always be preoccupied with those businesses and assets. Dragon Nation is not Eagle Country across the ocean; those things aren’t as important here. Additionally, you can have contact with people from other nations, but don’t get too intimately involved."
The woman took a moment before she added, "This is a reminder from me as your mother."
However, after a pause, a voice replied from the other end of the phone, "I understand, Lord Sang Sheng."
「...」
"What? You want to partner with me to register a company?"
A few days later, Su Ping, in a white lab coat and reeking of a mix of Wolf Tobacco and wolf dung, sat once again in front of Dong Muyun.
Su Ping looked at the woman with suspicion—what exactly did she want?
Dong Muyun nodded. "I’ve had all the stock of water element barriers you needed transported to you. They were originally intended for Crescent Island, but they’re no longer needed there, so I’m giving them to you at a bargain price. Meanwhile, I wanted to hear your opinion."
Upon hearing the mention of water element barriers, Su Ping’s eyes lit up.
However, he still looked at the woman warily. "How much?"
"If you agree, it’s free."
Su Ping instinctively shrank back. "Then I disagree."
Experience had taught him that in this world, the most expensive things are those that are free.
Dong Muyun’s brow slightly furrowed, and then she said resignedly, "Su Ping, Heart of Woods is actually quite large and has a lot of potential, but it’s just too informal. With your abilities..."
Su Ping raised his hand, stopping Dong Muyun from continuing. "Heart of Woods isn’t mine alone. Spit it out, why are you looking to partner with me to start a company?"
Dong Muyun’s visit was quite strange. She clearly had some hidden agenda or there was more to it.
Dong Muyun looked deeply at the young man. He didn’t seem as young as his appearance suggested. How on earth did his brain develop?
Dong Muyun didn’t conceal anything and recounted everything about Dong Mutian.
This time, Su Ping was intrigued. "Wow, so the struggle among the children of wealthy families is real?"
Dong Muyun rolled her eyes at him.
Su Ping nodded. "So, you’re looking to step out of the Dong Family to go solo and then cooperate with me? What industry do you plan to get into?"
"Of course, it’s Pet Beast breeding, which you’re best at!"
Su Ping looked bemused at Dong Muyun, who took it for granted.
She shrugged. "Though it seems like you’re not interested in cooperating?"
Let alone the fact that Heart of Woods wasn’t his alone; even if it were, Su Ping wouldn’t want to slave away to corporatize it in this field.
However, if this could lead to forming a company in some other industry, Su Ping was indeed quite interested.
It was the general trend of the times, after all. Developing a side business was quite necessary.
Conveniently, Su Ping had recently made some research discoveries that seemed like they could potentially develop into a side business.
Thus, Su Ping looked at Dong Muyun. "Does Tianyun Group have any involvement in Magic Potion industries?"
Dong Muyun was slightly taken aback but nodded. "Tianyun encompasses everything related to Pet Beast breeding, so of course, that includes Magic Potions. What about it?"
"I could indeed consider collaborating with you, but I won’t manage anything. I can provide you with the formula patents; production, sales—you’ll have to handle all of it yourself. How about it?"
Dong Muyun’s gaze narrowed slightly, looking at Su Ping in disbelief. "You’ve made another new research discovery? A Magic Potion?"
Currently, Dong Muyun dared not underestimate this young man in the slightest. This kid was too frightening; the result with the Wanmu Wolf was the best example. Not to mention, he was now an honorary major of some Legion and a first-class merit award recipient. If her elder brother had achieved even half of what Su Ping had in the Legion these past few years—or rather, in the few days Su Ping had been involved—he wouldn’t have been unceremoniously kicked out with his tail between his legs.
Who could fathom what secrets and treasures lay buried in that incredible brain, so starkly different from ordinary people’s?
So, Dong Muyun was immediately interested.
Su Ping nodded. "It’s not completely formulated yet, but I estimate it will be ready in a day or two."
"What kind of Magic Potion is it? What’s its name?" Dong Muyun’s eyes gleamed with excitement.
Su Ping just smiled slightly.

Chapter 211: Chapter 142: He’s Not From the Same World as You!_3
One was the bored Vice President Liu, and another was Ding Yan, the Senior Breeder of the Flame Wolf and developer of the Ashen Wolf Lord, whom Su Ping had encountered in the Legion a few days prior.
The last one, Su Ping only found familiar. He was likely one of the Intermediate Breeders from when Vice President Liu had given a lecture. However, Su Ping had no significant interaction with him, knew little about him, and didn’t even remember his name clearly.
"The Flame Wolf’s temperament is volatile, so to approach and command it, one needs a profound understanding of its habits."
"Here in Jianghai Province, Teacher Liu once discussed the simplest method of bonding with a Flame Wolf..."
In the partitioned room, a Flame Wolf Breeder from Jianghai Province was chattering incessantly to the Breeders from Huaiyang Province who had come for the exchange.
However, the Junior Breeders from Huaiyang below clearly weren’t paying the slightest attention.
Because the teacher leading their team this time was a Senior Breeder of the Flame Wolf, speaking of these matters in front of him was like performing a sword dance in front of Guan Yu.
Even Vice President Liu hadn’t developed his own new Evolutionary Body for the Flame Wolf. So, in their hearts, when it came to expertise on the Flame Wolf—aside from other Pet Beasts—it was better to listen more to their own teacher.
Neither Tian Xinghuo, the Breeder sitting at the head of the table, nor Vice President Liu cared much anymore.
This exchange, supposedly for sharing ideas, was in reality an opportunity for the Breeders from Huaiyang Province to show off.
But it had to be said, some promising young talent had indeed appeared this time.
The young man with sword-like brows and star-bright eyes, who had previously spoken of the Forest Wolf’s low cultivation value, was particularly noteworthy. He was a disciple of an equally high-ranking Senior Breeder from Huaiyang Province.
Reportedly, he had successfully cultivated the ’Temperature Elevation’ Skill for a Molten Canine.
Had the success rate not been so low, perhaps this 19-year-old lad could already have become an Intermediate Breeder over in Huaiyang Province.
There were one or two others in the team with similar achievements, but their contributions weren’t as valuable or significant as the Molten Canine’s ’Temperature Elevation’ Skill.
Previously, Vice President Liu had been quite envious of Huaiyang Province for producing so much promising young talent. But now, Old Liu was indifferent. He regarded these youngsters with a calm, detached gaze, as if observing a passing breeze.
The gap between one genius and another is even greater than that between a genius and an ordinary person. In his heart, ten thousand of these so-called cultivation geniuses didn’t amount to a fart when compared to Su Ping.
Ding Yan seemed to feel the same way. Since returning from the Legion, he had lost the desire to show off, and his attitude toward the Jianghai Province Breeder Association had somewhat improved.
It was only these youngsters he’d brought along who clearly hadn’t realized what had transpired. They still carried an air of superiority, not particularly caring about the Breeders from Jianghai Province.
A bunch of little brats who have yet to be battered by society and have never seen a real genius. Look at Su Ping. He possesses such talent and ability, yet not a trace of arrogance. His entire focus is on the cultivation of Pet Beasts.
After such reflections, when they looked back at these youngsters, everyone adopted a more laissez-faire attitude.
The current situation was no different. However, as Old Liu was teasing the Flame Wolf at his side, he glanced up and was momentarily taken aback. His eyes lit up when he saw two figures outside the high-temperature glass.
He quickly stood up, briskly opened the door, and let Su Ping enter.
"Su Ping, what brings you here?"
Before Old Liu could speak, Ding Yan, who had also noticed Su Ping, spoke up.
All eyes turned to the two newcomers.
They recognized Sun Chaoju, the Intermediate Breeder of Forest Wolves, who was with the newcomer. He had spoken to them about the pros and cons of the Forest Wolf before, but they had been utterly uninterested.
The person next to Sun Chaoju, however, was a young man around their age.
Does our Teacher Ding know him? And to be so enthusiastic? Didn’t their teacher say that these Breeders from Jianghai Province were all incompetents, only good at infighting, petty individuals with no ambition?
Su Ping smiled slightly. "Senior Ding is here too. I have something to discuss with Old Liu."
"What is it?" Old Liu asked with a smile, glancing at Ding Yan from the corner of his eye.
Little bastard, still dare to look down on us Breeders from Jianghai Province?
"I’m working on an experimental project, and I don’t have many wolf-type Pet Beasts at my place. So, I came to our association to borrow some Pet Beasts for the experiment. I’d also like you to take a look to prevent any accidents."
An experiment!? Not only did Liu Fuhai’s eyes light up, but Ding Yan’s did as well. Wolf-type Pet Beasts—obviously, this was an experiment involving wolf-type Pet Beasts.
Vice President Liu laughed heartily. "Just this? Come on, I’ll take you to get the Pet Beasts. Let’s go to my lab!"
Old Liu was inwardly excited. This cheeky youngster finally remembered him, a Senior Breeder of Wolf Pets at the Breeder Association! At last, he could be of use.
After a quick word of instruction to Tian Xinghuo, Old Liu, practically buzzing with impatience, was ready to lead Su Ping away, completely ignoring everyone else behind him.
Meanwhile, Ding Yan, fidgeting beside him, ultimately couldn’t hold back. Under the astonished gazes of all the Junior Breeders from Huaiyang Province, he spoke up,
"Uh... Su Ping, do you need any help from me?"
Su Ping was taken aback. He turned his head to look at Breeder Ding and, after a moment’s thought, said,

chapters.title: Chapter 212 - 142: He’s Not From the Same World as You!_4
chapters.content:
Chapter 212: Chapter 142: He’s Not From the Same World as You!_4
"Sure, it’s not a big deal anyway. Brother Ding, you can come too if you want!"
Indeed, it wasn’t a big deal. The experiment with the Heart of the Wolf required all other Wolf Pets to give it a try, naturally including the Flame Wolf, along with various Magic Potions and resource combinations for consumption.
The more people helping out, the better they could understand any situation that might arise.
Moreover, Su Ping had another purpose. The effect of the Heart of the Wolf could work on any canine-type Pet Beast.
When the time came to start a company with Dong Muyun, the demand from individual households was one aspect.
More importantly, the demand from Breeder Associations everywhere, and Cultivation bases for canine-type Pet Beasts all over—their consumption would be the bulk of it.
The more people who knew, the greater the demand would be when the time came—it would be like advertising.
Therefore, amidst the two men’s excited gazes, Ding Yan didn’t even bother with the other Junior Breeders, who were looking at him helplessly, and followed Su Ping, leaving the Flame Wolf base behind.
As for Liu Fuhai, he deliberately lingered at the back. After everyone left, he cast a meaningful glance at Tian Xinghuo, who couldn’t hide his grievance and longing.
Tian Xinghuo wanted to go too!
He was also in the ’Jianghai’s Wolf’ group chat and naturally knew exactly what Su Ping had accomplished.
After the Breeder Competition at the end of the year, this guy would be the youngest specialized Senior Breeder in Jianghai Province!
And now, this man seemingly had another new discovery—who the hell didn’t want to be the first to witness it?
But as Tian Xinghuo watched Teacher Liu leave, he seemed to have understood something. Once only he and the remaining Breeders from Huaiyang Province were left in the base compartment, he cleared his throat.
"Quiet down and continue to familiarize yourselves with the Flame Wolf..."
Clearly, the scene just before had left everyone baffled.
At this, the young man with sword-like eyebrows and starry eyes, who was a leader among them, couldn’t help but ask, "Um, Teacher Tian, who was that student just now...?"
Hearing this usually proud youth—who didn’t take other Breeders seriously and always acted superior—address him as ’Teacher,’ Tian Xinghuo smiled slightly, "Oh, that? Su Ping is an Intermediate Level Breeder from our Jianghai Province Breeders Association. He just graduated last summer, I believe. Ah, young people these days are really more and more impressive..."
"Tsk, there’s no choice but to accept one is getting old..." Tian Xinghuo said in a reflective, almost indifferent tone.
Just graduated this year?
Intermediate Level Breeder?
The young man and the other Huaiyang Province Breeders, who fancied themselves as having extraordinary talents, exchanged glances.
"Um... Breeder Su, what Pet Beast and Cultivation Skills does he specialize in?" the young man with sword-like eyebrows and starry eyes asked, a bit unconvinced.
"Forest Wolf. As for Cultivation Skills, it’s the Wood Heart Skill. I’ve even heard that Breeder Su’s success rate with cultivating the Wood Heart Skill in Forest Wolves is extremely high; he has almost never failed..."
Instantly, the young man clenched his fists, his eyes filled with disbelief.
Although he had dismissed the Forest Wolf as nothing special last time, he knew that there were no weaklings among any of the Elite Peak Pet Beasts.
He, and they, had to admit that Su Ping—seemingly younger than most of them—indeed seemed to be more outstanding than all of them.
However, that wasn’t the end of it. Pausing, Tian Xinghuo then continued, "However, you shouldn’t feel too inferior, because Su Ping is simply not from your world, nor from mine. A few days ago, I heard that Breeder Su independently developed an Advanced Level Evolutionary Body of the Forest Wolf. He will probably go to represent Jianghai Province at the Breeder Competition at the end of the year.
"By then, he will be promoted to Senior Breeder. So, don’t compare yourselves to Breeder Su; it’s pointless. Some people are just not from the same world as ordinary folks. Alright, continue with your Cultivation of the Flame Wolf."
This simple sentence left everyone frozen in place.
Tian Xinghuo, however, didn’t care. Although Teacher Liu had told them not to spread the word widely, Ding Yan was a witness. After going back, he would certainly share the news with Huaiyang Province. For now, revealing this served his purpose, so there was nothing wrong with it.
But everyone else was already silent.
Don’t feel too inferior... not from the same world... comparing with him is pointless...
Usually, others used these words to describe them, but now, these words were used to compare them to another peer.
They found themselves at a loss for words.
Because if what he said was true, perhaps that person really wasn’t from the same world as them?
However, before long, Tian Xinghuo once again spoke in a bland tone, "Of course, being with outstanding Beast Tamers and Breeders can make you more outstanding. Huaiyang Province is good, but I’m afraid it lacks geniuses like Su Ping, right?
"If you have time, Su Ping might occasionally come to give a lecture and share his Cultivation insights. Of course, that privilege is reserved only for Breeders affiliated with the Jianghai Province Breeders Association.
"Over here in Jianghai, we’re also recruiting some talented Breeders. If you’re considering transferring to the Jianghai Association, there are benefits waiting for you..."
Tian Xinghuo looked at these young Breeders, who were deep in thought, finally revealing his intention.
Poaching? What’s the big deal? Everyone does it!

chapters.title: Chapter 213 - 143: The Best Supplement! The Effect of Heart of the Wolf!
chapters.content:
Chapter 213: Chapter 143: The Best Supplement! The Effect of Heart of the Wolf!
The departing Ding Yan was clearly unaware that the new Breeders in Huaiyang Province were undergoing a ’life and death’ trial.
He had enthusiastically followed Su Ping into the laboratory.
There, he heard about the results of Su Ping’s latest experiment.
"This time, it’s to test the effects of a new Magic Potion I’ve developed over the past two days. It’s called Heart of the Wolf, and it’s primarily designed to help wolf-type Pet Beasts digest Magic Potions and absorb resources more effectively. It’s a special kind of adjunct potion. However, its exact effects still need to be tested, so all of our Association’s wolf pets might be used for the trial. Also, do you have any other Magic Potions or resources that show effects shortly after absorption? I can pay for the experiment, and if there’s any loss..."
Su Ping hadn’t finished speaking when Ding Yan eagerly interrupted, "What’s a little expense? If the Jianghai Breeder Association won’t cover it, our Huaiyang Breeder Association will..."
Old Liu shot the man a disdainful look. That bastard truly never missed an opportunity to poach talent.
Old Liu waved his hand dismissively. "The Jianghai Breeder Association really isn’t short on this kind of expenditure. Xiao Sun, go notify all the major canine bases to send two experimental subjects each to Laboratory 002, along with the corresponding Magic Potions and resources."
Sun Chaoju nodded, took out his mobile phone, and walked out. He returned shortly after. "Teacher," he reported, "they will be delivered in three minutes. However, the Shadow Wolf base has no spare Pet Beasts at the moment. Mu Hang borrowed them for his breeding base and hasn’t returned them yet."
Mu Hang was the Shadow Wolf specialty Breeder who had been with Sun Chaoju when Su Ping first attended Liu Fuhai’s class.
Missing one wasn’t a huge deal.
