At this thought, a hint of interest appeared at the corners of his mouth. As Charles had said, if the Heavenly Tomb in Eagle Country contained such gains,
then what secrets lay within the Heavenly Tomb on Blue Star?
The pitch-black Darkness vanished. The situation in the interrogation room reappeared before everyone’s eyes. Su Ping looked dubiously at Leng Ye as he walked out of the interrogation room. Although the latter’s expression had returned to normal, Su Ping could still tell that something unexpected must have happened in the past few moments. However, in the footage, Mu Yu, who had turned into a charred skeleton, indeed showed no sign of life anymore.
What exactly had happened just now?
Su Ping did not know, and it was clear that Leng Ye had no intention of explaining.
At this point, it was Qu Ming from the Law Enforcement Office who mustered up the courage to ask, "Sir, how should we proceed with that?"
Leng Ye looked up and glanced at the last interrogation room. Inside was none other than the last person brought by Mu Yu: his apprentice, Chris. Leng Ye’s brows tightened slightly. Instead of answering, he simply nudged the blue flame resting on his shoulder to move again. Piercing howls erupted once more, but they did not cause any change in the expressions of the people present. Because everyone knew that at this time, it wasn’t over yet!
Mu Yu and his two companions were dead. The situation was now clear. So, with these three dead, and all prior Soul Searches preserved, their criminal acts were as good as proven. Even if confronted by people from Eagle Country, they could say nothing in their defense. The use of Mechanical Weapons, and within the urban limits of Dragon Nation at that—what this implied was self-explanatory. This was Eagle Country; if it had involved some relatively small neighboring countries, given the temperament of those in charge in Dragon Nation, they would even have had grounds to dispatch troops directly.
But though they were dead, it didn’t mean everything was settled, because at this very moment, another anxious figure sat in the room. Qin Chuan’s lips had turned a bit pale. Because in the silence of that moment, he could feel that gaze slowly shifting towards him.
Clearly, how would Qin Chuan be dealt with in this situation?
At that moment, Leng Ye’s voice also rang out, sounding like the Grim Reaper’s decree as he said, "In consideration of Sang Sheng’s reputation, I can give you a chance to explain."

chapters.title: Chapter 277 - 165: Demands That Can Be Made Casually!
chapters.content:
Chapter 277: Chapter 165: Demands That Can Be Made Casually!
He was given an opportunity to explain.
Qin Chuan pursed his lips, sweat already forming on his forehead.
Because he knew that in the Magic Capital, countless people showed him respect because of his mother’s presence. But today was different. And undoubtedly, the words spoken by the man before him were definitely not a joke. If his explanation wasn’t satisfactory, this man would not be ambiguous!
Qin Chuan said powerlessly, "Ghost Saint, I really didn’t know that this matter was related to Su Ping, and the things that Mu Yu was asking about were also trivial matters! Please believe me..."
Su Ping wanted to speak, but a strand of cold that enveloped his body rendered him voiceless.
Only then did Leng Ye indifferently say, "Being overly intimate with people from Eagle Country, even wishing to join some ’Heart of Gold’ organization of theirs, do you really want to rid yourself of Dragon Nation that much? What’s next, are you planning to change your nationality?"
Upon hearing this, Qin Chuan’s complexion turned even paler, but he had no explanation to offer. Because what was said was the truth.
"Relying on the relationship and background of Sang Sheng and President Qin, your Ability, using the resources of Dragon Nation, and then you go seeking an organization from Eagle Country? I now suspect whether this is your idea, or perhaps even Sang Sheng or President Qin has a change of heart?"
With these words, not just Qin Chuan, but even Qin Erlong by his side turned pale.
This accusation was too severe. So severe that even he wouldn’t dare be stained by it, much less his own wife.
"Ghost Saint, Qin Chuan has only been in touch with Eagle Country for a while," Qin Erlong said. "I can put my life on the line to guarantee that he holds no second heart towards Dragon Nation! Qin Chuan merely didn’t want to be under the protection of me and Ah Sang. Please understand. I can assure you, such an incident will absolutely not happen again."
"Your guarantee..."
Leng Ye let out a disdainful laugh but did not continue speaking, the implication hanging in the air.
However, at that moment, Su Ping finally realized that the piercing cold that had prevented him from speaking had vanished.
He now understood his second great-uncle’s well-meant intentions.
He feigned a light cough and said, "Second great-uncle, I think this matter shouldn’t involve Old Qin, and President Qin truly didn’t know about Mu Yu’s affairs. How about we let it go?"
Second great-uncle?
It was the first time Su Ping used this term in front of Qin Erlong and Liu Fuhai.
In that moment, the doubts that had lingered in their minds were immediately resolved. But then, a bigger doubt surged forward.
How had this Ghost Saint become this youngster’s second great-uncle? They had always prided themselves on knowing Su Ping for a long time, understanding him quite well. Where had this kid gotten such immense familial influence? They had no idea.
And by his side, Qin Chuan had also become numb.
Once again, he looked at this young man with a complexity of emotions, uncertain of how to express himself.
Naturally, Leng Ye had no intention of actually dealing with Qin Chuan.
Although he often acted with reckless abandon, that was on a personal level. As for Qin Chuan, well, that might be fine, but the individual from the Magic Capital involved the whole Dragon Nation. Educational reforms were absolutely necessary. The changes in the Rules for professional Beast Tamer examinations. The support for Beast Tamers from humble backgrounds after graduating from Basic Beastmaster Academies. As well as the enrollment Rules and restrictions of the Advanced Beastmaster Academies. A slew of policy changes needed to be tried and updated. The one from the Magic Capital was at the forefront of it all. To deal with his son so harshly at a time like that would indeed involve too much.
However, while a death penalty might be spared, a lesser punishment was unavoidable, especially for someone like Qin Chuan, an ungrateful brat who returned after years abroad without recognizing his Ancestors. Leng Ye indeed had no regard for such a fellow. Enjoying the resources on Dragon Nation’s side, his parents in high positions, yet still thinking about ingratiating himself with the people of Eagle Country? If it were his own kid, Leng Ye wouldn’t waste words and would have Lanling eat him instead.
So, the purpose of this conversation was to give him a warning.
It hardly mattered whether Qin Chuan lived or died, or even what happened to his parents from Leng Ye’s perspective.
But nothing could go wrong with Dragon Nation’s upcoming major strategies!
So, although he disliked the situation, Leng Ye uncharacteristically refrained from taking action. Of course, this also gave the youngster some face and a favor.
After all, Qin Erlong held absolute authority in Linzhou and Jianghai. There were many matters in Jianghai that he, still in Beiyuan, couldn’t reach.
Therefore, upon hearing Su Ping’s words, he also followed the path of least resistance, thought for a moment, and then nodded. "Fine then, for your sake, let’s drop it. But if there’s even a hint of this again, don’t blame me for not being polite!"
After saying this, he didn’t wait for the others to react, gave Su Ping a look, and led the way out of the interrogation room.
Su Ping smiled helplessly and then gestured to Qin Erlong and Liu Fuhai, "Old Qin, Old Liu, I’ll come find you for tea when I have the time."
Old Liu waved his hands with a cheery smile, feeling entirely at ease.
By his side, Qin Erlong quickly propped up a smile and waved his hands. After Su Ping, along with Dong Muyun and Lin Lei (who had been spectating the entire time), left, his expression finally sunk into a complete gloom.
Liu Fuhai glanced at Qin Erlong, then at Qin Chuan. This time, he did not speak and left first, not even accompanying Qin Erlong further.
The others were perceptive as well. All the interrogators leaving the interrogation room, including Captain Gu Hao and Director Qu Ming, hurriedly exited.
For a moment, within the interrogation room, only the father and son remained.
Qin Erlong looked at the slowly emerging dawn’s light through the window of the interrogation room.
「A whole night had passed.」
This night was the most memorable and difficult one for Old Qin in more than a decade. Because on one hand was his son, and on the other was the younger generation he was most optimistic about—and before this, their relationship could have potentially become even closer. But after this night, the future was uncertain.
Even though, in reality, his actual subjective relationship with Qin Chuan was indeed not great. Nevertheless, Qin Chuan unknowingly provided Mu Yu with information that almost led to Su Ping’s death, and that was a fact.
And the arrival of the Ghost Saint was something he had never imagined.
So, looking at the distant, pale Sky Dome of dawn, Qin Erlong finally said, "I won’t tell Xiao Xue about this. There’s no need for her to end up like you, hating your own parents for a lifetime."
The first sentence made Qin Chuan purse his lips.
"But you won’t be able to hide it from your mother, so prepare yourself. Take the initiative and tell her later, then admit whatever mistakes you should admit. Sell that damn company of yours or give it away. Then go to the Magic Capital and be a teacher!"
"Dad!" Qin Chuan instinctively spoke out, his eyes filled with reluctance. But in the end, he could only lower his head. "I understand."
Because he knew that this time, it wasn’t his parents making him do it. The person just now definitely wouldn’t discuss mercy with him.
So, under Qin Erlong’s gaze, Qin Chuan took out his phone. He dialed the number he never wanted to call in his life.
"Hello, I never thought there would come a day when you would actually call me first..."
"..."
Su Ping didn’t know the situation inside the interrogation room, but he could guess some of it.
In fact, he couldn’t understand why Qin Xiaoxue would have such a father? But no matter what, for the sake of Miss Qin, he wouldn’t take any drastic actions, especially since Qin Erlong had been very good to him. As for Qin Chuan, Su Ping held no resentment, only curiosity.
Noticing his confusion on the way back, Leng Ye chuckled, "Don’t look so perplexed. That woman from the Magic Capital isn’t too vicious, but she has a strong desire for control. In his younger years, everything in this Qin Family kid’s life was arranged for him. Until it came to the major matter of marriage."
Leng Ye clicked his tongue and said, "In short, it’s a dramatic mess. Because of a woman and a marriage partner, this Qin Family kid, after many years of pent-up frustration, completely fell out with his family. However, in the end, he submitted to his mother’s dominance. Then it’s said some muddled things happened afterward; apparently his wife died, and then he left the country for a few years."
Obviously, Leng Ye had no interest in these affairs, only mentioning it briefly before changing the subject with Su Ping. "If you want to know about their messed-up family squabbles, you can ask someone else in the future. Once we finish this last job, I’ll head back to Beiyuan."
Pausing, Leng Ye continued, "You can rest assured, there shouldn’t be anyone coming after you for the Heavenly Tomb Sword Seal anymore. Charles believes Dragon Nation is trying to lure him out. He also likely believes he knows where the *real* Heavenly Tomb Sword Seal is now. Su Ping, you’re the decoy with the ’treasure.’ Once your role as bait is fully exposed or understood by the enemy, you’ll paradoxically attract less direct attention for it."
"Of course, you still need to be cautious, but I reckon, for the time being, your protection here shouldn’t be your concern anymore."
Leng Ye was correct; the Legion and the two major associations would probably focus on this. Even further development of Linzhou’s suburbs was possible.
「A night passed quietly.」
Standing at the door of Heart of Woods, looking at the slowly rising sun and morning glow in the distance, Su Ping truly felt as if he had experienced a lifetime apart.
A lot had indeed happened over the night.
After not returning for a night, Su Ping led Leng Ye into the guest room of Heart of Woods.
Seeing Su Ping, who was still a bit dazed, the latter said directly, "Kid, you can slowly savor this later on. The path of growing as a Beast Tamer can’t possibly be smooth sailing, but now, you can make your requests! Go ahead, anything!"
He didn’t at all conceal the value of the Heavenly Tomb Sword Seal from Su Ping. He even directly offered Su Ping such generous terms. He was even genuinely afraid that Su Ping would sell himself short. After all, this was, in a way, his own kid. So, Leng Ye was very generous.
Demands! Ask for anything!
It must be said, at that moment, Su Ping’s mind was indeed filled with various demands. High-level resources, Pet Beast cubs with super high Racial Potential. Even various Pet Beast Cultivation and Evolution methods, among other miscellaneous requests. After all, this was the time to make extravagant demands!

chapters.title: Chapter 278 - 166: Su Ping’s Demand! Feifei Repairs!
chapters.content:
Chapter 278: Chapter 166: Su Ping’s Demand! Feifei Repairs!
Magic Capital, Advanced Beastmaster Academy.
Inside the personal villa belonging to the esteemed Sang Sheng, a woman sat cross-legged atop the rooftop terrace.
Even though it was deep autumn, on the cusp of winter, her courtyard remained lush and green, full of vibrant life.
As the woman sat there, with each breath she took, the surrounding greenery seemed to slowly unfurl its branches and leaves. Bathed in the rising sun, it appeared lush and verdant.
Finally, the woman slowly opened her eyes, her indifferent pupils gazing into the rising sun without the slightest hint of being dazzled.
At this moment, the woman’s entire body trembled slightly.
It was as if, in that instant, she transformed into a gigantic plant. Countless branches and leaves followed the rhythm of her breathing, swaying with her thoughts.
This continued for more than half an hour before she returned to her normal state.
The woman stood up and walked back to the first floor.
In the dining room, her breakfast had already been prepared.
It was a bowl of ’vegetable salad.’
Even after reaching her cultivation Realm, her dietary requirements had greatly diminished. Especially when practicing the Forest of Myriad Forms Meditation Method, she could draw sufficient nutrients from sunlight and oxygen alone.
However, the woman had still formed this habit.
Though called a ’vegetable salad,’ the dish actually contained no salad dressing, only various plant leaves and twigs. Some were edible, while others, strictly speaking, weren’t considered food.
Carefully savoring the taste and texture of each plant fiber aided her cultivation and her understanding of Pet Beasts.
A habit formed over many years wasn’t going to change.
Unfortunately, today, the woman seemed somewhat distracted.
She was already aware of Qin Chuan’s situation. Such a significant event had occurred in Linzhou, something she herself had not anticipated. But it had happened. Getting angry or blaming someone was not in her character.
Of course, the matter now seemed to be resolved to Perfection, so she didn’t need to intervene.
Only now, she had started to doubt something.
A phone call this morning, after Qin Erlong and Qin Chuan had called to apologize, brought her some news.
That young man from Linzhou, Su Ping, now apparently had a ’second grandfather’ surnamed Leng.
The woman found herself speechless.
Could her words truly have become a self-fulfilling prophecy? Would Qin Erlong eventually call, claiming that young man was the illegitimate child of the Legend of the Holy Dragon?
Shaking her head, the woman let out a helpless sigh.
However, she wasn’t particularly angry, even though she had indeed felt a surge of fury upon hearing Qin Chuan’s words.
But after calming down for a moment, she considered it might even be a good thing. For Qin Chuan, this was indeed a major setback in his life. All his past efforts and the company he had built were now in ruins. But in truth, to her, that blasted Dachuan Real Estate meant nothing; it wasn’t even worth a sideways glance. At least this had quieted him down and, at the same time, removed his inclination to stay in contact with those from Eagle Country. This was far better than him potentially committing a catastrophic mistake in the future.
Thus, she wasn’t really angry.
Her thoughts now turned to how she might mend her relationship with that young man.
Previously, when Qin Erlong and Xiao Xue had been optimistic about him, the woman hadn’t particularly cared but hadn’t objected either.
But now, even though she still found it all rather surreal, she couldn’t help but revise her assessment of this young man—whom she had never even met—upwards again, for what felt like the umpteenth time.
With that in mind, the woman made a phone call to Qin Xiaoxue.
"Xiao Xue, Su Ping’s second Pet Beast, you mentioned before that it’s of the Necromancy Series, right?"
"Ah? Yes... yes, that’s right..."
Qin Xiaoxue’s voice sounded somewhat guilty.
In her view, Su Ping had chosen his second Pet Beast from the Necromancy Series because of her suggestion. She had previously told Su Ping about her desire to try two Meditation Methods from Magic Capital: ’Forest of Myriad Forms’ and ’Union of Myriad Transformations.’ This meant his second Pet Beast would need to be either a pure Wood Element, Plant Type Pet Beast, or an Undead Pet Beast. But undoubtedly, this was against the rules.
Now, hearing the old lady suddenly inquire, she instantly thought she was about to be reprimanded. Qin Xiaoxue also wondered who could have told the old lady about this.
However, unexpectedly, the anticipated reprimand from the old lady didn’t come. Instead, she just nodded and continued with a smile, "Vacation starts in a month. Don’t forget to tell Su Ping to come to Magic Capital then to see your Woodhead’s Evolution..."
"Yeah, I’ve already told Su Ping."
"Alright, that’s all. Go to class. You’re entering the Linhai Secret Realm today, right? Be prepared and don’t get hurt."
"Mmm, I know, don’t worry, Grandma!"
After hanging up, Qin Xiaoxue scratched her head, a little confused about what her grandmother meant.
Meanwhile, the woman, having hung up, made another call.
Shortly after, a woman walked into the dining room, "Headmistress."
Upon seeing the newcomer, the woman smiled lightly, "Xiao Qin, do me a favor. Go to Linzhou and deliver something for me."
"Yes!"
...
Su Ping waved at the oddly-shaped aircraft as it slowly ascended into the sky.
In just an instant, the Sky-splitter disappeared from view.
It’s to be expected, after all.

chapters.title: Chapter 279 - 166: Su Ping’s Demand! Feifei Repairs!_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 279: Chapter 166: Su Ping’s Demand! Feifei Repairs!_2
Being able to travel from Beiyuan to Jianghai in less than two hours.
What did that even mean?
So, watching the disappearing Sky-splitter, Su Ping once again showed a hint of envy.
Next to him, Dong Muyun, seeing the look of envy on Su Ping’s face, said oddly, "Kid, I can’t get that thing for you. If you want it, you’ll have to work hard yourself!"
Su Ping curled his lips. He didn’t plan on thinking about it for a while.
Good grief, Spirit Saint Level.
If reaching that level were so easy, then Spirit Saint Level Beast Tamers wouldn’t be so rare all over the world, nor would they have such a high status in Dragon Nation.
Since ancient times, those who have reached that level have been as rare as phoenix feathers and unicorn horns.
Seeing that Su Ping wasn’t paying him any attention, Dong Muyun didn’t mind and also said with considerable admiration and emotion, "Ghost Saint is truly powerful!"
"But speaking of which, why did Ghost Saint look at you so weirdly before he left?" Dong Muyun seemed to recall something and looked at Su Ping with surprise.
Su Ping touched his nose somewhat awkwardly upon hearing this. "
Really? Was it because I asked for too much? But it was Leng Ye who told me to make any demand I wanted. And didn’t he outright refuse in the end!? Damn it! He clearly said I could name any price, and yet when I mentioned several Mythical Level and Legendary Level Pet Beast cubs, not only did he refuse, but I even got hit for it.
"
Thinking about this, Su Ping was filled with righteous indignation.
In the end, despite not gaining any substantial benefits, it seemed as if he had somehow offended the other party greatly and deeply aggrieved him. Is there anyone else in this world like him?
Indeed, the value of the Heavenly Tomb Sword Seal is very high. Considering how desperately the people from Eagle Country were after it, it must be valuable. And Leng Ye did indeed give him the power to ask for a hefty price. However, apart from those Pet Beast cubs that didn’t seem very relevant, Su Ping didn’t really want anything else. In fact, even if there were those Legendary Spirit Saint Level cubs, Su Ping wasn’t particularly interested in them. At best, it was just boasting. With the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas at hand, Su Ping was naturally unsuited for those exceptionally High-level, extremely rare special Pet Beasts. He wasn’t too interested in those naturally divine and holy Pet Beasts either. Of course, if he could research them and see if he could devolve those Pet Beasts, Su Ping would be quite interested. But to waste such a precious opportunity on experimental subjects whose success he wasn’t sure of... Su Ping didn’t feel so extravagant.
"
So, after tossing and turning with the thought all morning, Su Ping, damn it, still couldn’t think of anything he actually needed.
Advanced Level materials like Soul Seed or Sword Intent Origin? What use would they be to him? For his Paperman to continue using? There’s no need for that for the time being! As for Xiao Qing’s evolution, that’s even more of a mystery; he had no clue what materials it might require, not even Su Ping himself knew.
"
Thus, Su Ping, who had been prepared to make a huge demand, ultimately couldn’t figure out what he really needed.
He did indeed need some things, like resources to quickly enhance his own Realm. But although those resources were scarce, Su Ping himself felt it would be a waste to use such an opportunity for them. He could exchange for them at either the Breeder Association or in the Legion, so why waste this chance?
"
Therefore, after much consideration, Su Ping simply made a very special, basic request.
As the saying goes, it’s better to teach a man to fish than to give him a fish!
For Su Ping, a momentary precious Spirit Saint, or even Legendary Level resource, was indeed valuable, but it might not provide much help to him at present, especially when it comes to the critically important Realm advancement of a Beast Tamer.
"
So, Su Ping’s condition was: Secret Realm Exploration!
Su Ping’s "fishing skill" was his Beast Taming Space characteristic, which normally didn’t have much opportunity to be utilized.
The Space Element Resource Type characteristic: Space Absorption!
Su Ping had never forgotten about this.
For a Beast Tamer, Pet Beasts are their combat power, but the true foundation of a powerful Beast Tamer is always their Beast Taming Space.
A Beast Tamer’s Beast Taming Space is also one of their fundamentals.
Su Ping’s Realm was too low, and currently, his Beast Taming Space couldn’t yet effectively nurture or cultivate too Advanced Level resources.
But that wouldn’t always be the case in the future.
Moreover, with the Space Absorption ability, it was even possible to absorb residual origin characteristics from other Secret Realms and assimilate them into his own space characteristics.
For Su Ping, the potential that this space characteristic brought to his Beast Taming Space was unlimited.
Unfortunately, there hadn’t been many Secret Realms appearing, leaving this space characteristic with no real use!
But now, an opportunity had undoubtedly arisen.
The situation with Secret Realms was complex, as Leng Ye had said.
Under normal circumstances, Secret Realms are categorized as renewable and non-renewable.
If it’s renewable, then it’s truly precious.
The energy in such a Secret Realm can be cyclically regenerated. Even if the owner dies, the Beast Taming Space that formed the Secret Realm will still have effective space characteristics and resources.
Many of Dragon Nation’s High Order resources are produced this way.
Typically, such Secret Realms can also exist stably for a long time.
After all, Dragon Nation and the local forces would carefully preserve and maintain these Secret Realms.

chapters.title: Chapter 280 - 166: Su Ping’s Demand! Feifei Repairs!_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 280: Chapter 166: Su Ping’s Demand! Feifei Repairs!_3
And those that cannot regenerate are characterized by an inability to maintain their Traits. Their energy only depletes without replenishment.
Such Secret Realms do not have a guaranteed existence. Some, like the Fengdu Sword King’s Secret Realm, collapse almost instantaneously.
Others may last for a year or two, perhaps even three to five years, but there is no certainty.
Once they appear, Beast Tamers go in for a quick plunder before retreating.
As for when they will collapse, if they pose some danger and are too close to populated areas, measures would be taken to deliberately trigger their destruction sooner.
If they are not particularly dangerous, they would simply be left as is, without much interference.
Clearly, Secret Realms that can continuously regenerate resources are treasured in any region.
For those, if Su Ping were to enter and begin absorbing spatial Origin Traits, even with Leng Ye there, he would undoubtedly get killed.
However, those non-renewable Secret Realms that are quickly plundered are evidently different.
Leaving such Secret Realms to collapse in the void is a waste; isn’t it fair for them to contribute some power in the end?
Su Ping didn’t think it was excessive.
Regrettably, under the laws of Dragon Nation, not just anyone can access these types of Secret Realms.
More importantly, not just anyone can find them.
Unless one has a Space-based Pet Beast with extremely sensitive perception like Dong Muyun, maybe then they can sense these fluctuations and locate the Secret Realms. Otherwise, it would be like finding a needle in a haystack.
Without a doubt, Su Ping did not possess such a Pet Beast, and even if he did, it would be only slightly better than looking for a needle in the ocean.
The most direct and efficient method, of course, is to leverage the government’s power to search for these Secret Realm resources, giving oneself the information and identity necessary to enter!
Indeed, that was the condition Su Ping finally offered to Leng Ye.
Therefore, Su Ping felt that the look Leng Ye gave him when he left wasn’t disdain for asking too high a price, but too low! Su Ping flattered himself, thinking that exemplary youths like him who contribute to the nation’s development were truly rare!
After all, Leng Ye did say, when leaving, that Su Ping could come to him if there was anything else.
This promise was more precious than many conditions.
Shaking his head, Su Ping wondered when Leng Ye would be able to sort things out.
Su Ping had always been looking forward to the development of the Beast Taming Space.
Once the Beast Taming Space was enriched, the ability to produce some resources would be the true foundation of a Beast Tamer.
So, the conclusion was still the same old saying: giving a man a fish is not as good as teaching a man to fish.
Dong Muyun paid no attention to Su Ping’s showmanship.
She didn’t even delve into what exactly was going on between Su Ping and Leng Ye.
Instead, she spoke directly:
"I have something to tell you. Dachuan Real Estate was sold to our Pingyun Company for the price of five hundred million!"
"Hmm? Ah?"
Su Ping looked at her suspiciously.
He certainly knew that Dachuan Real Estate was Qin Chuan’s business, but he hadn’t expected things to move so fast!
It had only been a day!
And five hundred million? Wasn’t that too cheap?
Not to say it was a giveaway, but it was almost there. Not to mention other things, just the several land deeds Dachuan Real Estate had secured in Linzhou during this period alone must be worth more than five hundred million, right?
"I agreed to this transaction without seeking your approval. You’re not going to blame me, are you?"
Su Ping gave Queen Dong an odd look. She was acting unusually coy. "I’ve already said that you have the administrative rights to the company," he replied.
Dong Muyun feigned a wistful head shake and said:
"That’s true, but since Qin Chuan is Miss Qin’s father, if you blame me out of regard for Miss Qin, this young lady can only silently bear it."
Su Ping gave the woman a speechless glance.
As they became more familiar with each other, is this woman revealing her true nature more and more?
However, he didn’t continue to speak.
Qin Chuan is Qin Chuan, and Qin Xiaoxue is Qin Xiaoxue. The help Miss Qin provided, especially from the Stone of Creation, was extraordinarily significant to me. Therefore, if Qin Chuan’s actions were truly unintentional, I wouldn’t take it out on others.
As for Qin Chuan himself, I have no comment.
But as for Dong Muyun, her visit this time was undoubtedly for some serious business:
"By the way, there’s more, your Mechanical Core has been repaired!"
"Hmm?!"
Su Ping’s eyes lit up, "That fast?"
"When it comes to matters concerning Director Su, how could a humble worker like me not handle them properly?"
Su Ping frowned slightly, "Can’t you speak properly anymore?"
Dong Muyun rolled her eyes at him, then continued:
"This Mechanical Core’s self-intelligence is much higher than that of a typical newly-born Mechanical Pet Beast.
Following the explosion of that mechanical weapon, it used its hardest part to face the blast. At the same time, it was protected by Black Blood’s mechanical shell!"
"So, it wasn’t affected too much. Naturally, using specialized restoration methods for these kinds of things and consuming some resources wasn’t too difficult."
Dong Muyun spoke lightly, but Su Ping knew that it must have still cost quite a bit.
However, he didn’t say much.
It was Dong Muyun who continued with interest:
"As for your Third Pet Beast, if you want to choose this item, you’d better think it through!
Mechanical Pet Beasts are different from all other Pet Beasts. Do you have any familiar Mechanists? Do you want me to introduce you to one?
Or maybe I could just sell you some mechanical blueprints at an internal price from Tianyun?"
Mechanists, mechanical blueprints?
Su Ping scratched his head.
Admittedly, I’m not very familiar with Mechanical Pet Beasts, a luxury type of Pet Beast.
"However, your Pet Beast can’t merge with a mechanical body. Blueprints and the like are also unnecessary. If you ask me, if you want to contract a Mechanical Pet Beast, why choose such a one?
If you wish, getting a successfully awakened Mechanical Core is still definitely possible!"
Dong Muyun didn’t understand Su Ping’s persistence.
And sure enough, Su Ping, holding Feifei’s Mechanical Core, shook his head with a smile and refused:
"No need. I didn’t choose Feifei because of a Mechanical Pet Beast’s core, but rather because of Feifei, I want to contract the Mechanical Core."
These words made Dong Muyun pause.
They also made Su Ping pause.
Because just as he uttered these words, suddenly, a glow burst forth from the deepest part of his soul’s Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas.
Then, an Illustrated Handbook that Su Ping had never seen before appeared in his mind.
It was an Illustrated Handbook that shone with a golden glow.
Of course, this golden glow was not of a Legendary Level Illustrated Handbook.
It was simply because the Pet Beast on the Illustrated Handbook was golden.
At the same time, on the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, the feedback from this unfamiliar Catalog also appeared in Su Ping’s mind:
[Catalog ’Gold Elemental Elf’ activated, Current Level: 1, Origin Reward Obtained: Elementalization!]

chapters.title: Chapter 281 - 167 Feifei’s Attribute!
chapters.content:
Chapter 281: Chapter 167 Feifei’s Attribute!
The appearance of this Illustrated Handbook’s prompt left Su Ping stunned.
In the next moment, the knowledge fed back from the Illustrated Handbook didn’t give Su Ping enough time to react.
Then, before Dong Muyun’s astonished gaze, he turned and ran straight into his Heart of Woods base, waving his hand rapidly at Dong Muyun as he ran, "Sister Yun, I just remembered something urgent, so I won’t keep you!"
Watching Su Ping suddenly vanish in a flash, Dong Muyun didn’t have time to react before she lightly stamped her foot in frustration.
This guy...
Ignoring Dong Muyun’s resentment, Su Ping had already dashed back to his study.
He quickly closed his eyes and looked at his Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas.
His gaze fell on the ’Gold Elemental Elf’ entry in the Catalog, which was now illuminated.
Clearly, this so-called Gold Elemental Elf is the Mechanical Core.
However, the descriptions of the two seem somewhat different.
[Catalog: Gold Elemental Elf]
[A special Basic Elemental Spirit Pet Beast. These beings are born from an Elemental Core and exhibit a wide variety of forms and exceptionally unique growth abilities. However, due to the special nature of the Gold Element, Gold Elemental Cores are relatively easy to find, yet pure elemental elves born from Gold Elemental Cores are extremely rare.
Racial Potential: Elite Level. Racial Skills: Elemental Body, Jinge Technique, Heart of Gold, etc.]
[Current Catalog Level: 1 (100/500)]
Known Evolutionary Atlas, special Cultivation:
[Mechanical Awakening: Uses a Gold Elemental Core activated by modern Electromagnetic Force. Data and knowledge are used to forcefully awaken the core’s intelligence. The downside is its inability to form an Elemental Body or corresponding Racial Skills. However, it can instead complete mechanical Cultivation. This is a special Cultivation method with high potential.]
Preferences, habits:
[Preferences: Enjoys consuming metal and conducting electricity.]
Record Log:
[Discovered and contacted an awakened Mechanical Core (Gold Elemental Core). Intimacy requirement met. Catalogue Experience +100!]
[This Mechanical Core is a special Mutant. Each subsequent day spent with it will add +5 Catalogue Experience!]
As expected!
Su Ping nodded. The Pet Beast born from the Mechanical Core couldn’t be considered a new type of Pet Beast.
Instead, it was a variant of the so-called Gold Elemental Elf, an awakened form achieved through Cultivation.
However, on closer reflection, it did seem to be the case.
Su Ping often heard about Pet Beasts like Wind Element Spirits, Water Element Elves, and even the relatively rare Thunder Element Elves and Earth Element Elves.
He had even just witnessed a Fire Elemental Spirit.
Indeed, it was Leng Ye’s Blue Flame Heart Demon.
Of course, that was an Evolutionary Body of a Fire Elemental Spirit.
But he had hardly ever heard any mention of the Gold Elemental Elf.
The birth of Gold Elemental Elves is extremely rare.
The specific reasons for this were also provided in the Catalog.
Gold Element is relatively rare and difficult to condense.
So, could Feifei evolve in this direction?
However, Su Ping scratched his head; he was clearly getting ahead of himself.
Because damn it, in that annoying, cursed Record Log, he frustratingly found those two words once again:
’Mutation!’
Su Ping placed Feifei’s Mechanical Core on the table and then said, "Feifei, are you there?"
He was quite certain that Feifei had already awakened.
Otherwise, the Gold Elemental Elf’s entry in the Catalog wouldn’t have lit up after he spoke those words.
This undoubtedly meant that Feifei had heard him, which was why its intimacy with him had finally reached the required level.
Sure enough, the Mechanical Core rotated slightly, and then a voice emerged from it, "Master, I’m here~ Thank you for repairing me, allowing me to see you again, dear Master."
It was, indeed, Feifei’s voice.
Su Ping breathed a sigh of relief and then turned his attention to Feifei.
He had to see, damn it, how could a Mechanical Core mutate?
And what kind of strange variations could a Mechanical Core even undergo?
The Eye of Truth was instantly activated, locking onto Feifei before him.
[Awakened Mechanical Core (Wild)]
[Attribute: Psychic]
[Current Level: Common First Rank]
[Racial Potential: Common Tenth Level]
[Skills: Psychic Perception (Proficiency)]
Su Ping blinked.
He was so shocked by this unexpected answer he nearly threw out his back!
Even if it had mutated, as a mechanical life consciousness awakened from a Gold Elemental Core, shouldn’t it have retained the Metal Element Attribute?
What in the world was this?
And why was it Psychic Element?
Psychic Element Pet Beasts were reputed to be the hardest type to cultivate. Although quite powerful, they required an extremely large investment.
Still, a Psychic Element Mechanical Pet Beast? As odd as it sounded, Su Ping had to admit that, aside from his astonishment, he was greatly intrigued.
A Psychic Element Mechanical Pet Beast?
Su Ping didn’t know if anyone else had ever heard of such a thing, but he certainly hadn’t.
Mechanical Pet Beasts have many advantages.
For instance, it was easier to equip them with single-use Mechanical Weapons, allowing them to engage in battle without consuming their own Energy.
Furthermore, besides self-circulating Energy absorption and recovery, they could also use batteries or charging to rapidly replenish their power.
Most also possessed transformative abilities, much like Transformers, offering diverse functions. Yunning, for example, could travel anywhere, whether on land, in the sky, or underwater.
Their Cultivation was also more interesting and relatively simpler. One merely needed enough money to replace the materials and components of their mechanical bodies...

chapters.title: Chapter 282 - 167 Feifei’s Attribute!_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 282: Chapter 167 Feifei’s Attribute!_2
Therefore, most mechanical Pet Beasts hadn’t experienced much development in their spiritual aspect.
Su Ping scratched his head as he remembered his conversation with Feifei from the previous day. He gained a deeper understanding of Feifei. Feifei had said that it hurt when it merged with its mechanical body! Clearly, this was an extremely rare occurrence, and a situation that shouldn’t have happened. It was for this reason that Feifei had failed to merge with the mechanical body, transforming into its current form—a mechanical core ball resembling a dinosaur egg, devoid of any combat ability.
So, was this why Feifei’s Metal Element was extremely low while its Psychic Element was extremely high?
He looked at Feifei spinning in circles on the table and, for the first time, felt utterly stumped. Even Qian Yi hadn’t posed such a challenge for him. Of course, the main issue was Su Ping’s severely lacking research on mechanical types. Suddenly, Su Ping had found a new direction for absorbing knowledge. And admittedly, it wasn’t too late.
He still had some distance to cover before reaching the Commander Level. Only after breaking through to the Commander Level could he contract a Third Pet Beast. This was a good opportunity to raise Feifei while studying simultaneously. At this thought, Su Ping relaxed slightly. Indeed, there was no need to rush.
For now, Xiao Qing was more important. Su Ping was very satisfied with the results of Qian Yi and Xiao Qing’s actual combat practice the previous night. Qian Yi’s "Qian Yi Whirlwind" might have had a lame name, and using it left Qian Yi almost devoid of combat power. However, the skill’s power was undeniable. It could directly spin a Commander Level Steel Arm Ape to death, making it a viable killer move and trump card. Simultaneously, it could also function in area-of-effect combat. This was quite impressive. A Pet Beast capable of fighting beyond its level was truly a protagonist’s standard, so Su Ping was very satisfied.
Xiao Qing, however, had clearly been less impressive in this battle. The significant difference in strength against the opponent was one factor. Furthermore, in terms of abilities, Xiao Qing was certainly inferior to Qian Yi. Of course, their roles were different as well. Xiao Qing was designed for group combat, but Su Ping had been careless and hadn’t brought the Wolf pack into action.
Regardless, researching Xiao Qing’s evolution path was the most pressing matter for the foreseeable future, aside from cultivating Old Sha’s Heart of Woods. Of course, there was no immediate rush. He was merely planning his focus for the period following Qian Yi’s evolution.
So, Su Ping lay on his bed and began to contemplate the other reward he had just acquired. He had lit up a new Talent awarded by the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas. Although most of these Talents had been mediocre previously, and a Beast Tamer couldn’t solely rely on them. For instance, some web novels from his current life depicted characters awakening Mythical Level Talents and becoming invincible—though such stories were indeed rare. Nevertheless, Talents could still play a crucial role in many situations. Any Talent that could be utilized in combat was a good Talent, and Su Ping had finally acquired one. Yes, this time the Talent could actually be useful in combat:
[Elementalization: A special Beast Tamer Talent. It allows the user to transform their body into an elemental state, greatly increasing speed. Simultaneously, it grants immunity to many special types of damage abilities.]
If this Talented Ability could affect Pet Beasts, it would be a game-changing trump card. However, for a Beast Tamer, while still remarkable, it could only be used as a life-saving skill. Su Ping, nonetheless, was already very content with this. For one thing, with this skill, the damage he’d take from Mechanical Weapon explosions would be greatly reduced. After all, an opponent wouldn’t know he possessed this Elementalization ability. Therefore, they wouldn’t prepare Mechanical Weapons capable of harming an elementalized state in advance. This ability could genuinely serve as a life-saving trump card. And admittedly, a Talent that involved transforming one’s own body was quite amazing!
With a slight mental prompt from Su Ping, his body instantly became incredibly light. In such a state, his speed would naturally surge. Simultaneously, his body began to turn translucent. He took a pair of crafting scissors and gently pushed them into his body. As expected, they passed right through.
However, as Su Ping watched the scissors pass through his body, a reckless, potentially self-destructive thought surfaced:
What would happen if he deactivated Elementalization while the scissors were still passing through his body?
Su Ping shuddered and quickly dismissed the thought. Although he possessed a scientific spirit and was interested in studying various skills, it clearly made no sense to be so harsh on himself.
If they really got stuck in there, could they even be removed?
Although it was highly probable the scissors would be ejected, there was clearly no need to gamble with his life like that.
Nevertheless, the sensation was truly peculiar. Su Ping felt that maintaining this state required the consumption of spiritual power. However, it was precisely this consumption of spiritual power that allowed him to perceive the more specific details of being elementalized even more clearly. These details gave him a deeper understanding of Elementalization.
He had previously thought about trying to evolve the Elf Wolf.

chapters.title: Chapter 283 - 167 Feifei’s Attribute!_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 283: Chapter 167 Feifei’s Attribute!_3
Now that Qian Yi’s evolution is complete,
I can finally free up my hands to tinker with things a bit. The Elf Wolf is one aspect, but the most important is still the Elementalization evolution and Cultivation. I wonder if it’s possible to follow the Elf Wolf’s Cultivation and Evolution methods, as well as those perfected by the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas, to bestow the semi-Elementalization abilities and effects of the Elf Wolf upon the rest of the Evolutionary Bodies? As of now, the Elf Wolf hasn’t been bred, but it’s actually me, the Beast Tamer, who has mastered the ability of Elementalization through the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas.
However, it is precisely for this reason that Su Ping has gained a more intuitive understanding of this ability. Some details concerning Elementalization have suddenly become clearer and more profoundly understood.
Unfortunately, Su Ping exited the state of Elementalization after only five seconds.
The consumption of spiritual power is simply too enormous! Even now, having reached Elite Sixth Rank, I cannot maintain the state of Elementalization indefinitely due to such excessive consumption. Clearly, in the end, the Realm of a Beast Tamer is fundamental!
"Feifei, you stay here for a while."
"Okay, Master, rest assured!"
Mechanical Pet Beasts are great. For one thing, they’re not high-level, but they have high intelligence and can even communicate through speech. Unlike my own two Pet Beasts—one just howls like a wolf, and the other whimpers.
Su Ping didn’t mention yesterday’s events to Lao Guan and his daughter, nor to Li Shu. He headed straight for the Forest Wolf woods. Sure enough, Li Shu and Guan Lili were feeding tree fruits to the Forest Wolves. Seeing Su Ping approach, Li Shu hurriedly waved at him.
"Bro Ping!"
"How have things been recently?"
"Great! After getting used to it, I’ve completely fallen in love with life here! BOO HOO HOO, I love you, Bro Ping!"
Su Ping gave the guy a dismissive glance. "I’m asking how the Forest Wolves are doing."
Li Shu stiffened, scratched his head, and then said, "Each has made breakthroughs, especially in skill level. Three Forest Wolves have even had their Skills raised to Mastery Level, and there are even more breakthroughs to Proficient Level!"
Su Ping’s brow furrowed slightly. "None have broken through to Perfection Level?"
"That... No..."
After getting the answer, Su Ping pursed his lips and nodded.
As expected, leveling up Skills becomes increasingly difficult the further one progresses. Even though I’ve now broken through to Elite Sixth Rank and can share as many as forty-two Skills, training them to Perfection is still not something that can be accomplished in a short time.
However, if possible, Su Ping still wanted to cultivate Old Sha’s Heart of Woods to Perfection Level before the Cultivation competition began.
Only then can I verify what the ultimate result of my Solar Formula truly is. Otherwise, without solid evidence, it won’t be persuasive enough.
Thinking this, Su Ping narrowed his eyes slightly.
I do have a way to achieve this, but I simply haven’t attempted it before. Now, not only do I have the Heart of Woods, but Pingyun is also here. As for Cultivation funds, I don’t need to worry at all. It’s time to try some methods that don’t care about money.
However, just as Su Ping was about to speak and make arrangements, a dark shadow suddenly flashed across the sky.
Su Ping instinctively looked up, then his eyes widened and his mouth gaped open again.
Appearing in the sky was a small, silver-white aircraft.
I just saw a similar one not long ago, but it was black. And now another one shows up?
Before Su Ping could react, and before some of the guests of Heart of Woods and Yun Tian could look up to get a good look at the aircraft, it vanished from the sky as abruptly as it had appeared.
Then, within Su Ping’s sight, a woman as agile as a cheetah, wearing a tight-fitting combat suit, dropped from the sky.
Damn, that entrance really is flashy. But no matter how flashy it is, did I really need to see it twice in one day?
Nevertheless, Su Ping could tell that the woman in front of him was also quite special. Moreover, Su Ping could already guess some aspects of her true identity. Previously, he had speculated about Miss Qin’s identity. After this turmoil, he could finally confirm it.
That person from the Magic Capital?
As soon as this thought emerged, the black-short-haired woman spoke, "I am looking for Major Su Ping. May I ask..."
"That’s me!" Su Ping responded. He then thought for a moment and took out the certificate and medal Zhao Deguang had given him last time from his Beast Taming Space.
The woman completely ignored Li Shu and Guan Lili beside her, who looked utterly dumbfounded. Li Shu, in particular, looked up again with an exaggerated expression, seemingly trying to gauge the height from which she had descended and how on earth she had managed the jump.
The woman said directly, "Greetings, Major Su Ping. It’s a pleasure to meet you. I was sent by Principal Sang to deliver something to you. Please sign for it!"
As expected.
Su Ping sighed helplessly. He could guess her intention, but really, it wasn’t necessary.
I’m not that petty. No matter what, Qin Xiaoxue was kind to me, and Qin Erlong has also been quite considerate. However, when dealing with such a high-level person, I should just take what’s given. She sent someone personally, and in such a manner, leaving no room for refusal.
Su Ping nodded, took the box that was handed to him, and then said, "Thank you, and please convey my thanks to Principal Sang as well. I will personally visit Magic Capital after some time to pay her a visit!"
The woman just smiled. Then, perfectly displaying her impetuous nature, she leaped back into the sky. The flying device reappeared out of thin air, and in the next second, it was gone.
The entire exchange, from start to finish, lasted no more than two minutes.
Su Ping, however, ignored the stares of Li Shu and Guan Lili. Holding the box, he returned to his room and opened it.
To his slight surprise, a book lay quietly inside the box.
On the cover of the book, several words were clearly written: ’Myriad Transformations Meditation Method.’

chapters.title: Chapter 284 - 168: The Grand Fusion of Transformations! Feifei’s Internal Documents
chapters.content:
Chapter 284: Chapter 168: The Grand Fusion of Transformations! Feifei’s Internal Documents
The All-Encompassing Meditation Method.
Looking at the item inside the box, Su Ping felt no particular surprise. It was something he had anticipated, and its appearance seemed perfectly reasonable. Thus, Su Ping felt at ease, sat down, and opened the book.
What appeared before him was an ancient text quoted in relation to this special Meditation Method:
’When the heart condenses and the form is released, all transformations merge into the dark...’
Then, after reading for half an hour, Su Ping confirmed that this Meditation Method had absolutely nothing to do with the name from the ancient text. Su Ping had every reason to suspect that this name had been created first, and then someone had simply picked a pleasant-sounding name from ancient writings to attach to it.
However, it had to be said that despite the unrelated name, the content within was enough for Su Ping to overlook this minor flaw.
Su Ping finally understood the origin of Meditation Methods. Before actually seeing this, Su Ping had never explored research in this direction.
Now that he considered it, within the Beast Tamer Civilization, although recorded history didn’t span ten thousand years, an endless stream of talented individuals had still emerged.
And this direction was the Soul Contract!
In this All-Encompassing Meditation Method, humans were also considered a type of ’Pet Beast.’ They were special ’Pet Beasts’ primarily of the ’Psychic’ element, with the ’Space Element’ as a supplement.
However, humans, as this type of ’Pet Beast,’ could not autonomously possess power, nor could they change form through Evolution. Even acquiring a Soul Contract and a Beast Taming Space required the aid of an ’Awakening Stone.’
But, every loss has its gain. Meditation allowed humans to achieve virtually limitless growth through self-cultivation. The Soul Contract, moreover, was a unique Ability of human Beast Tamers.
The Meditation Method was a technique for achieving meditative resonance with Pet Beasts bound by a Soul Contract. Through this resonance, one’s spiritual power would become familiar with this type of force.
Once a minor level of proficiency was achieved, Pet Beast assistance was no longer required, and one could meditate alone. During such meditation, effects and manifestations differing from normal meditation would occur.
It sounded easy, but it was extremely difficult in practice.
Therefore, Su Ping didn’t overthink it. Instead, he chose to try it directly!
What were the benefits of practicing this Meditation Method? Qin Xiaoxue had previously spoken of it somewhat vaguely. Su Ping hadn’t paid much mind then, but now it seemed that practicing this Meditation Method offered far too many advantages compared to simple meditation.
Take this All-Encompassing Meditation Method, for instance. It was a Meditation Method that resonated with Wood Element and Undead Pet Beasts.
Firstly, the speed of meditation would definitely increase slightly; this was without a doubt.
Secondly, through Soul Resonance, one’s spiritual power could simulate some Wood Element and Necromancy Series energies. Of course, the effect would definitely not be as potent as that of one’s own Pet Beasts. However, it could still alter the spiritual power’s effect, preventing it from being merely a hindrance or a prime target on the battlefield.
These two functions were the main effects of this All-Encompassing Meditation Method!
Besides these, there were also some secondary effects. For example, the one Su Ping valued most was the ability to maintain some meditative effects even during sleep. And there were many more.
No doubt about it. When Qin Xiaoxue had spoken of it previously, even with her status as Miss Qin, she had been so cautious about this Meditation Method; indeed, there was a reason for that.
The preciousness of this item was hard to imagine!
Leaping across this world’s social strata wasn’t something achievable merely by encountering a talented Pet Beast or having a decent stroke of luck. Any little boost, accumulated over countless years, would result in a vast difference.
Su Ping now somewhat understood how the Beast Taming Gate Families, which had existed for thousands, or perhaps several thousand years, had passed down their legacies. The Meditation Method definitely played a significant role in this heritage.
And anyone capable of creating any Meditation Method was certainly no ordinary person.
As for whether this All-Encompassing Meditation Method was created by Lord Sang Sheng, Su Ping didn’t know.
His eyes were already closed.
Inside the Beast Taming Space, the Little Paper Figure, which until yesterday hadn’t left the space, seemed to sense something. While Xiao Qing was leisurely basking in the sun above, the Little Paper Figure suddenly let out a WAH!
Xiao Qing looked at the creature discontentedly.
This fellow that’s always muttering and drawing its sword, what’s it up to now?
Damn, it’s so annoying! But I can’t beat it!
But soon, Xiao Qing also sensed something. Its two ears perked up straight.
They sensed that their master’s spirit seemed to connect with them. This feeling was extremely special. It was as if their master’s palms were simultaneously caressing their bodies.
At the same time, their faint spiritual connection seemed to link with their master through the Soul Contract.
Then, the next second, the connection broke.
Su Ping opened his eyes. He had failed.
But Su Ping wasn’t discouraged. He continued to attempt.
Inside the Beast Taming Space, the two little creatures immediately drooped. The Little Paper Figure continued to draw its Thunder Sword, practicing within its small, designated territory. Then suddenly, it let out another WAH!
Xiao Qing did the same; its ears had just drooped but then shot straight up again.
Five seconds later, the two little creatures returned to normal. And then it started again...
This process repeated over and over, lasting for more than half an hour. It happened every ten seconds, making the two little creatures in the Beast Taming Space somewhat psychically hypersensitive. They always felt that in the next second, their master was about to initiate Soul Resonance with them via the Soul Contract. Yet, this resonance, no matter what, just couldn’t establish a complete connection.
Finally, this resonance, which had nearly induced a stress response in the two little creatures, stopped. It gave the two little creatures a short respite!
「In reality.」
Sitting in the study, Su Ping at this moment had fallen into self-doubt.
Did Lord Sang Sheng know that practicing this Meditation Method was so difficult?
Over half an hour! Although this duration wasn’t excessive, for meditation, it wasn’t a significant amount of time. But the problem was, during this entire half-hour, he had been constantly trying to resonate with Xiao Qing and Qian Yi, attempting to practice the Meditation Method. Yet, in all this half-hour, not once did the resonance last more than five seconds!
Moreover, most of the time, the attempts weren’t even as effective as the first successful resonance!
What the hell is this?
Su Ping scratched his head. He didn’t try again. Throughout this half-hour, he had already tried countless times, refusing to give up. However, forget about completing the resonance and beginning meditation together; he couldn’t even maintain the resonance for a longer duration.
Therefore, Su Ping sat on the chair, his face etched with existential doubt, murmuring in shock,
Could it be that I have no Talent for cultivation?
No Talent!
This term, Su Ping had never before imagined it could be applied to himself. His Talent, not to mention in breeding research, was quite remarkable even in meditation. At No. 6 Middle School, his meditation score was the best in the school. And now, with this Meditation Method, Su Ping couldn’t even reach the beginner level in half an hour.
Is it my problem?
Su Ping found it somewhat inconceivable.
"Master, you’re the best! Don’t be discouraged!"
Just then, Feifei, on the desk, uttered consoling words. It provided a tiny bit of comfort to Su Ping, who was mired in self-doubt. But of course, it was just that—a tiny bit.
If it wasn’t a problem with my own Talent, then what was the reason?
Was it because these two Pet Beasts, strictly speaking, couldn’t be considered pure Wood Element or Undead Pet Beasts?
Seriously, that’s a real possibility.
These two mutated little ones, no one could say they were like normal Pet Beasts.
Damn it!
Mutated Pet Beasts are my downfall!
Frustration bubbled within Su Ping!
After this contract with Feifei is complete, if I continue to advance, my fourth Pet Beast must absolutely not be another Mutated Pet Beast!
This is such a pain!
Yes, the fault lies with the Pet Beasts!
It’s definitely not an issue with his, Su the Great Genius’s, Talent.
Su Ping was certain.
So, he decided to stop agonizing over this Meditation Method.
So what if it just increases meditation speed a little?
So what if it just improves meditation efficiency a bit?
So what if it just allows one’s spiritual power to undergo some Energy changes?
What’s so great about that?
He, Su the Great Genius, doesn’t need it! Maybe I can even create my own Meditation Method in the future!
"Mhm!" Su Ping nodded, already fantasizing how future biographers might write about him:
’The great Breeder and Beast Tamer, Master X (X the Legend), possessing unparalleled Talent, adapted a Meditation Method to his own Pet Beasts, astonishing the world...’
With this thought, Su Ping’s mood improved significantly. Clearly, this self-deception was working wonders.
And so, Su Ping stepped out of his study once again.
Meditation Methods and whatnot, best not to mention them for now, nor practice them!
Comparatively, Pet Beast cultivation was more of a concern for him.
New Year’s Day was just over a month away. And on New Year’s Day, the Breeder Competition would begin in Magic Capital. At the Breeder Competition, he had to earn some face for Jianghai and for Old Liu. It was also the time to officially start building his reputation and winning awards.
Therefore, Old Sha’s cultivation was even more important now. Unfortunately, the Heart of Woods’ skill level still hadn’t improved. Su Ping also needed to devise some special tactics.
He hadn’t tried them before. This was partly because he didn’t know if they would be effective, and partly because it was too troublesome. But now, he had to make time to try.
If I continue to feed it the Heart of Woods Magic Potion, will there be an improvement?
Furthermore, if I use relatively Advanced Level materials and resources to enhance the Heart of Woods Magic Potion’s effects, could it accelerate the skill level improvement of Heart of Woods?
After a brief planning session, Su Ping headed to the laboratory area.
However, what Su Ping absolutely hadn’t anticipated was that just as he left the study, Feifei, on the desk, rotated its body slightly, swaying.
Then, a very faint spiritual power spread out. Feifei’s only innate Skill, ’Psychic Perception,’ allowed it to ’look’ at The All-Encompassing Meditation Method book Su Ping had tossed onto the desk.
It wanted to help its master!
Let’s see if there’s any way to help Master compensate for his ’lack of Talent.’
Mhm!
RUSTLE, RUSTLE. The pages of the book flipped from beginning to end.
After scanning all the content of The All-Encompassing Meditation Method, Feifei ’nodded,’ then secretly created a hidden file in its Mechanical Core. The file was named:
"About the Inability of the Master to Practice the Meditation Method Due to Lack of Talent..."

chapters.title: Chapter 285 - 169: Grand Opening of Heart of Water! The Secret Realm Distribution Map of Qintian Monitor!
chapters.content:
Chapter 285: Chapter 169: Grand Opening of Heart of Water! The Secret Realm Distribution Map of Qintian Monitor!
"Got one, got one!"
At the rear of the Heart of Woods Pet Beast Comprehensive Cultivation Base, adjacent to the Lingxi River, an area was now connected to the river, forming a large lake approximately twenty miles in diameter.
The large lake was connected to the Lingxi River, which flowed through it. On the lake’s surface, besides a large bridge linking to the Lingxi River, there were also two pavilions in the lake’s center and several walkways built with special structures. These allowed people to walk freely over the surface of the Heart of Water Lake on either side.
It was also possible to fish and enjoy the scenery.
Indeed, that was what was happening right now.
On this fishing platform, many excited anglers standing behind a lone figure shouted out.
Seated in a pavilion in the lake’s center, Su Ping fiercely lifted his specially made mechanical fishing rod.
In the next moment, amid the exclamations of the onlookers, a big fish over a meter long was hoisted straight up by him!
Instantly, some of the nearby anglers let out bursts of amazement:
"An Elite Level red-spotted silver carp! What a fine Pet Beast indeed! And the red-spotted scales it produces are quite pricey Water Element materials."
"Sure enough, the ads didn’t lie; you really can catch Pet Beasts here!"
"Heh, this isn’t a place just anyone can afford. This is the best spot on Heart of Water Lake. Just to fish here for an hour, not to mention additional expenses, costs a whopping fifty thousand yuan!"
"Fifty thousand for just an hour of fishing? Even if you don’t catch anything?"
A bystander exclaimed, obviously stunned by the high cost.
Immediately, some people looked at the one who had exclaimed with disdain, with one person showing off, "Fifty thousand is expensive? Let me tell you straight, that’s just the base price! To fish here, you have to purchase the accompanying services! A single piece of bait costs ten to twenty thousand! Want to use their fishing rods? Renting one also costs money!"
Clearly, some people had been there for quite a while and knew a great deal about the place.
"What bait? So expensive, just for one piece? If you don’t catch anything, isn’t that a huge loss?"
Someone was perplexed.
Indeed, such terrifying expenses for a fishing venue left many in disbelief.
Yet some responded with disdain, "Bait made by blending Water Spirit Grass with the flesh of Water Element Pet Beasts—do you think it’s worth the price or not!?"
"Ah? Using such things for bait? What are you trying to catch, a Dragon?"
Some people were puzzled, while others continued to show off their knowledge with pride.
"The most important thing is, even if you do manage to catch a fish, you have to pay two more fees!"
"Ah? Pay two more fees? I’ve heard that if you catch a fish here and want to take it with you, you must pay a fee based on the value of the fish. Is there another expense?"
"Of course, there is. If you catch an Elite Level mature Pet Beast, or even a Commander Level one, do you think you can handle or even kill it on your own?"
With that said, the novice seemed to understand something and nodded before widening his eyes in shock. "You can catch Commander Level Pet Beasts here? How is that possible?"
Someone responded with disdain, "How is it not possible? Two days ago, I saw with my own eyes someone catch a Purple Thunder Eel! Even with the mechanical fishing rod reducing its strength right away, that lightning was terrifying. It was the staff member, who, after receiving the order from the angler to kill the fish, used a mechanical energy gun to finally put it down."
"Purple Thunder Eel? Damn!"
The person was clearly no longer contemplating why a Pet Beast service base in the suburbs had access to Mechanical Weapons.
After all, it was well-known that this Pet Beast base had connections that reached the heavens.
"So, if you land that kind of catch, and you can take it away or kill it on the spot without needing the staff here to use their Low-level Mechanical Weapons, such as guns and crossbows, then naturally you don’t have to spend that money."
"Heh, as if it’s that easy to catch. If you do hook one of those, you’d have to fish even if it meant taking out a loan. Catching one is a hugely profitable venture, no losses. The Thunder Gland of a Purple Thunder Eel is a high-grade resource, even among Commander Level ones!"
Some shook their heads, while others, confident in their fishing skills, were excited to try their luck.
Some were resigned, steering clear of this fishing activity that was akin to gambling. "Forget it, it’s too expensive here. Over by the outer perimeter of the Heart of Water Lake, it’s only a thousand yuan for an hour of fishing. It’s not far from here, so it should be about the same, right?"
"Indeed, this place isn’t for people like us."
"Do you know why this place became so popular across Linzhou in such a short amount of time? Do you know who comes here to fish?"
"See that person over there? That’s the old manager of Linzhou’s White Wind Snow Wolf Cultivation Base, Old Zhao, the Intermediate Level Breeder from the Jianghai Breeder Association!"
"And that one over there, they say he’s a director of the Fire King Company..."
"And that one..."
"And that one..."
Someone spoke quietly, their words all pointing to one fact:
’This place really doesn’t lack for customers!’
Especially those willing to spend money on fishing!
In Linzhou, where else could you find a fishing ground where you might catch Commander Level, or even Advanced Commander Level Pet Beasts?

chapters.title: Chapter 286 - 169: Grand Opening of Heart of Water! Secret Realm Distribution Map of Qintian Monitor!_2
chapters.content:
Chapter 286: Chapter 169: Grand Opening of Heart of Water! Secret Realm Distribution Map of Qintian Monitor!_2
Such an exciting fishing experience, along with the excellent service—where else could it compare? For some, the money spent wasn’t even a concern. Besides, sometimes, if luck was on your side, what you caught wouldn’t just save you from losing money; you could even profit!
What kind of concept was that?
Wealthy people aren’t fools. If it were just a scam to take their money, so many wouldn’t spend the entire day here. Some even combined their visit with a stay at the resort complex out front and decided not to leave at all.
It was precisely this kind of engaging entertainment, with excellent service and experiences worth bragging about, that drew people in. It wasn’t simply about scamming money; if you were lucky or skilled, you could even make money, and it was damn exciting. Such leisure spots were what truly attracted people.
That was why the Heart of Water at the Heart of Woods Pet Beast Service Base had become so bustling in just a few days since its official completion.
"Nice one, Little Su! You’re quite lucky today!" someone nearby called out.
It was none other than Old Zhao, fishing on the platform closest to Su Ping.
"Haha, Old Zhao, you’d better step it up! Otherwise, I might win the price of a Snow Wolf from you today!"
"Hey, you little rascal! So that’s why you insisted on betting with me this morning! You had this planned all along, eh? Just you watch what Old Zhao can do!"
Unfortunately, Old Zhao’s luck clearly wasn’t very good. All morning, apart from catching an Ordinary Level Black Whisker Grass Carp, he hadn’t made any other notable catches.
Su Ping didn’t mind. He smiled faintly and flicked his fishing rod. "Xiao Qing!"
Xiao Qing let out a howl! It suddenly leaped from behind Su Ping and, in one bite, snatched the exhausted Red-Spotted Silver Carp being dragged by the mechanical fishing rod. Then, without waiting for Su Ping’s command, it bit the fish to death and took a large, satisfying bite, as if to show it off.
The onlookers couldn’t help but feel a pang of pity; after all, it was too extravagant.
Feeding Elite Level fish meat so casually to Pet Beasts?
Su Ping, however, obviously didn’t care much. The value of forming a Soul Contract with these mature, wild Pet Beasts wasn’t significant. Moreover, without a contract, their wildness was extreme.
It’s important to understand that in the classification by Beast Tamers, such Pet Beasts found in the wild weren’t truly considered Pet Beasts. In the Legion, these highly aggressive Pet Beasts were referred to as Ferocious Beasts. The materials from these Ferocious Beasts, even their flesh, were quite valuable resources. This was also why, at the Heart of Water fishing grounds, some powerful staff members were extremely well-prepared with Mechanical Weapons. Because in this world of Beast Tamers, fishing—especially wild fishing of this nature—could be called an ’extreme sport’! After all, who the hell knew what kind of creature might leap out from beneath the fishing rod.
Meanwhile, Su Ping also found some satisfaction in this.
Serves them right!
Freaking fish.
Su Ping now understood which type of Pet Beast was the hardest to build a bond with.
That’s right—these aquatic creatures, like fish and shrimp.
Their seven-second memory was truly no exaggeration.
Previously, he had fished and casually raised some, hoping to reach the required intimacy level to activate the Catalog of the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas. Although he didn’t plan on cultivating them, activating the Catalog would grant additional Beast Tamer Talents through the Origin feedback from the Myriad Spirit Beast Atlas. No one would complain about having too many Abilities, even though many Talents were actually quite useless.
It was just too bad that after all this time, he’d gotten nothing for his efforts. Instead, it had caused him a lot of trouble. Whenever he got slightly close, these ungrateful fish he’d raised for days would try to bite him or use their Skills, leading Su Ping to suffer some minor injuries over the past couple of days. In the end, all these various fish, which hadn’t warmed up to him despite being raised for so long, were given to his employees as extra meals.
People are so much better,
he thought.
Even an extra meal can build camaraderie, unlike with fish.
The uniqueness of the Heart of Water was naturally due to the Rainbow Coral Worms underwater. The Water Element Barrier sent by the Tianyun Group had been set up underwater, protecting the Rainbow Coral Worms yet still managing to attract countless aquatic Pet Beasts. The Lingxi River, being close to West Dragon Lake, saw large numbers of wild aquatic Pet Beasts coming and going, making it a perfect, natural hunting ground for them!
Although, in Dong Muyun’s view, using Rainbow Coral Worms—such a precious resource Pet Beast—for such a seemingly trivial business was like using a butcher’s cleaver to kill a chicken: complete overkill and a waste.
Su Ping, however, didn’t mind.
This kind of thing was truly comfortable.
By creating such an excellent fishing spot here, even the Advanced Level individuals around Linzhou who enjoyed fishing would have to thank him.
Of course, when the place first opened, it attracted some unsavory types. However, there was no need for words; after a few discreet inquiries about the situation, no one dared to cause any trouble.
A joke! The collaborator of Queen Dong of Linzhou, with partnerships with the Legion and various associations, and a young Intermediate Breeder highly valued by two chairmen—such connections truly made him untouchable in Linzhou.
During this period, aside from the Meditation Method and the rather troublesome matter of raising fish, everything else left Su Ping quite satisfied. Especially Old Sha’s Cultivation. Although bringing the Heart of Woods to Perfection Level still seemed a ways off, Su Ping’s guess had indeed been correct.

chapters.title: Chapter 287 - 169: Grand Opening of Heart of Water! Secret Realm Distribution Map of Qintian Monitor!_3
chapters.content:
Chapter 287: Chapter 169: Grand Opening of Heart of Water! Secret Realm Distribution Map of Qintian Monitor!_3
The Heart of Woods Magic Potion still had room for development.
Replacing it with a similarly medicinal, yet more potent and powerful resource material could indeed accelerate Old Sha’s progress with the Heart of Woods.
It had even raised Old Sha’s Level by one.
Two days ago, he had reached the Commander Tenth Rank.
He was just a single step away from reaching the Monarch Level.
Once he had a Monarch Level Pet Beast to secure his position, he would truly have something to rely on.
This left Su Ping extremely satisfied, and his heart surged with anticipation.
Only now did he realize just how precious and rare Old Sha’s Solar Formula truly was, and what it meant to produce a Super-Rank Skill through such a method.
Su Ping treasured this opportunity all the more and eagerly awaited the day the Solar Formula would undergo a qualitative transformation.
Moreover, Xiao Qing’s evolution path and the Elf Wolf’s cultivation were proceeding smoothly, so Su Ping didn’t need to rush.
"HAHA, got a bite!"
A surprised voice broke Su Ping’s contemplation.
Lao Zhao’s voice, full of delight, came from not too far away.
Indeed, something special was dangling from the fishing rod. Its head sported two horns, but its body was quite bulky, and its front had a spike-like form. If not for these features, it might have somewhat resembled a flood dragon.
It was an Elite Peak Pet Beast: the Twin-horned Spearfish.
Its flesh was delicious, and its two horns were an especially rare resource.
Lao Zhao’s face flushed with excitement. For him, a mere Elite Peak Level fish wasn’t much. But that was clearly the joy of fishing.
The evolved Snow Wolf beside him, unlike Xiao Qing, simply blew a breath, instantly freezing the Twin-horned Spearfish solid.
Then, as if Lao Zhao had been prepared all along, he waved someone over. A waiter promptly brought a dish of dipping sauce.
Lao Zhao immediately had it sliced into sashimi and began to savor it with relish.
Su Ping found the scene rather comical.
However, rumor had it that this Twin-horned Spearfish tasted quite good, didn’t it?
Lao Zhao, clearly being generous, called out, "Come on, Su, try some!"
Su Ping didn’t stand on ceremony. He put down his fishing rod, quickly walked over, and picked up a piece of the flash-frozen tuna that had already been sliced. He dipped it into the sauce—a mix of wasabi, soy sauce, and lemon juice—and swallowed it.
The initial spiciness gave way to the fresh, tender taste of the fish, complemented by an amazingly chewy texture and a subtle fragrance. It was truly a delightful surprise for Su Ping.
Most importantly, after he swallowed, it seemed to transform into a faint coolness that coursed through his body, feeling incredibly comfortable.
"HAHAHAHA, how’s the taste? You little rascal, you’re either meditating or researching Pet Beast cultivation every day. When you have time, you need to learn to enjoy life too!" Lao Zhao said with a smile.
Su Ping didn’t hold back. He picked up two more slices; one he put into his own mouth, and the other he tossed to Xiao Qing, who was watching eagerly.
Once Xiao Qing caught it in her mouth, she let out an AWOO.
Clearly, the taste of the wasabi was too much for the little one.
"HAHAHA." Su Ping laughed heartily, picked up another piece, and said, "Lao Zhao, this fish is my treat. Please put it on my tab with the staff."
The nearby waiter nodded in acknowledgment.
Lao Zhao wasn’t bothered. For the two of them, such a small matter wasn’t worth mentioning.
Unfortunately, just as Su Ping was about to continue savoring the rare delicacy, his phone suddenly chimed.
It wasn’t a call, just a message notification.
However, the sender was rather special, compelling Su Ping to check it immediately.
That’s right, the sender was none other than Leng Ye, who had departed that day and had been silent for the past few days!
When Su Ping saw the sender’s name, his heart skipped a beat, and he eagerly looked at the message on his phone.
Sure enough, the content of the message made Su Ping’s eyes light up!
[Leng Ye: Kid, I’ve sorted out that business of yours. Your certificate should arrive in a couple of days. From today on, you’re officially a ’Special Secret Realm Inspector,’ registered with the Dragon Nation’s special department, the Qintian Monitor.]
A Special Secret Realm Inspector?
Su Ping scratched his head.
The title and position sound a bit odd. And it’s under the Qintian Monitor?
He continued to read:
[Leng Ye: From now on, you have the right to enter all Secret Realms for inspection. Also, Qintian Monitor inspectors have no authority to command or deploy you! However, as a trade-off, you are not eligible for some of the Qintian Monitor’s internal resource exchanges.]
[Su Ping: Deal!]
He currently had access to internal resources from the Breeder Association and the Legion. What did he need the Qintian Monitor’s resources for? Unnecessary. For Su Ping, the most important thing was the Secret Realm itself!
At this thought, Su Ping’s eyes lit up. Just then, Leng Ye sent another message:
